Sub-issue: Account opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative: Wells Fargo claims to have " thoroughly addressed " their repeated mailing of mediation request forms, in which case, there is no mention of these forms in prior replies via CFPB complaints. I've reviewed prior replies from Wells Fargo reps, there is absolutely no mention of their runaround mediation forms ... Reps at mediation program hang up call, refuse to provide mediation, numerous calls made and am hung up on. These forms are sent in reply to unauthorized accounts opened by Wells Fargo reps including account ending XXXX, account ending in XXXX, a XXXXy account, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX to accounts opened, my credit has been impacted, XXXX XXXX dropped, denied credit. Wells Fargo extent to addressing fraudulent credit accounts includes closing accounts and removing from credit file, no reimbursement for damages to credit. It appears Wells Fargo refuses to address issue pertaining to runaround with their mediation request forms, a total of XXXX or more of these forms have been filled out, returned, acknowledgement letters received..Please note, last XXXX forms filled out were in good faith, additional forms will be refused... The last tracking ID provided by mediation program is XXXX. When the number on letter is called, XXXX, I am told mediation efforts exhausted or am hung up on as per usual.. With regard to any efforts made, I believe this refers to a prior mediation from XXXX, in which case, this mediation refers to older deposit accounts from around XXXX, also unauthorized. I can assure the CFPB no such efforts made with regard to accounts unauthorized including checking account ending in XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ending in XXXX. Further, no reimbursement for purchase made under account ending XXXX, an item from XXXX in amount of {$290.00}, item never received. Previously, a payment in amount of {$3700.00} was offered to me by XXXX XXXX in XXXX of XXXX, sent to my old address after moving, never received. I requested proof of address verification, was provided with a letter from a XXXX XXXX agreeing to a remediation payment in amount of XXXX, nothing at all to do with payment in amount of {$3700.00}, does not show address verification .... No proof of address verification. When runaround with mediation forms is brought to Wells Fargo attention, they refer to prior replies and or ignore issue, as stated before, there is no mention of their runarounds. I've reviewed last replies from Wells Fargo, rep implies I am " dissatisfied ", with mediation program, does not address repeated runaround with mediation. Most recently, I've received calls from Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX as well as Wellls Fargo XXXX mortgage line, told they have removed XXXX XXXX XXXX as a merchant under their retail program, nothing at all to do with damage to my credit. There is mention of " mediation payments " in amounts of {$17.00}, {$50.00}, {$400.00} none of which received.. It appears Wells Fargo reps are attempting to offer these payments in leiu of their runaround with mediation forms... .They claim these payments stem from charges for products /services charged on prior deposit accounts... I can assure the CFPB this is a lie. The payments appear to be sent each time additional CFPB complaint filed, possibly in leiu of their mediation request forms which are a mere runaround. These payments were not mediated or agreed to, do not cover damages, will not be accepted. XXXX WellsFargo rep claims checks in amounts of {$400.00}, {$50.00} cashed, in which case, not by myself. As stated before, payments do not cover damages, not received. Wells Fargo has been fined by CFPB in amount of {$3.00} XXXX for their handling of accounts such as ones named in this complaint, has little to no credibility, which goes to show in their runarounds.. Further, XXXX lawsuits have been filed recently against Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX unauthorized accounts/products and services including XXXX VS Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX Wells Fargo is willing to offer a reasonable settlement offer to cover damages, I request CFPB fine Wells Fargo for handling of issues above, including their numerous runarounds. Any additional mediation request forms will be refused, I refer back to last tracking XXXX XXXX, in which case, Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX hang up call as per usual.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges Wells Fargo repeatedly sent mediation request forms, despite claiming to have "thoroughly addressed" the issue. The forms were sent in response to unauthorized accounts, and the consumer claims to have filled out numerous forms, only to be hung up on or told mediation efforts were exhausted, with no reimbursement for credit damages.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative: This is either an operational error or an internal fraud. I have contacted Citi on XX/XX/year> with regard to fraudulent transactions/withdrawals in my account, totaling {$2200.00}. The processing of my request was extremely confusing, with Citi initially provisionally crediting my account " in double '' ( every single transaction was duplicated ), then withdrawing the dupes a few days later, and then rejecting my request, and withdrawing the full amount. I contacted Citi a second time to re-open the investigation, and I received a new provisional credit, but when I reconciled the transactions one by one, I identified that XXXX transactions were missing in the provisional credit ( there were XXXX transactions when it should have been XXXX ). Every time I contact Citi to have this clarified and fixed, I am transferred to the dispute department after a long wait, and my call always gets disconnected before the issue is resolved.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Citi customer reported fraudulent transactions totaling $2,200. After multiple contacts, Citi provisionally credited the account, but errors occurred, including duplicated and missing transactions. The customer experienced long wait times, disconnections, and unresolved issues with the dispute department.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding an unauthorized charge that occurred on XX/XX/2024, involving my Credit Karma Money checking account. On this date, an unauthorized charge of {$400.00} was debited from my account by XXXX. Upon contacting XXXX, they confirmed that the transaction did not originate from my personal account and suggested that my debit card may have been compromised and linked to another individual 's XXXX account for fraudulent purposes. 

Following XXXX 's acknowledgment of the unauthorized transaction, I immediately reached out to Credit Karma Money to dispute the charge. Despite providing detailed documentation and evidence to support the fraudulent nature of the transaction, including communication with XXXX confirming the unauthorized activity, my dispute was denied. 

I appealed the decision twice, investing significant time and effort into collecting and presenting additional evidence. However, both appeals were denied without proper consideration or review of the provided documentation. Notably, the final denial was issued less than XXXX minutes after submitting my appeal, indicating a lack of thorough examination. 

As a longtime user and customer of Credit Karma Money, I am deeply disappointed by their handling of this matter. Their failure to adequately investigate and address the unauthorized charge has left me financially vulnerable and feeling disregarded as a customer. 

I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter thoroughly and intervene to ensure that Credit Karma Money upholds its responsibility to protect consumers from fraudulent activity and provides fair and transparent dispute resolution processes.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's Credit Karma Money checking account was debited $400 by an unauthorized party. Despite documentation from the merchant confirming the transaction was not from the consumer's account, Credit Karma Money denied the dispute and two subsequent appeals, prompting a complaint to the CFPB.

Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative: Our business has been locked out of our business checking account for about 10 days and after such days a new password in the mail was mailed out to us. After receiving the new password, We placed the new password in and we were able to regain access to our online banking account..we were then prompted to input new security answers in which we completed. Phone number and site were connected..account completed. Great We logged back into our account with the same password to change it to our own password and after sending a code to our phone the code was accepted and the password was changed to our own password.. we next log out and then back in with our newly established password and again our account was locked out and all online services suspended due to too many attempts on password but speaking with the rep we were told the security questions were cleared not something we have the ability to do..and that we have to wait for yet another password to be sent to us in the mail..
Narrative Summary: A business's checking account was locked out for 10 days. After receiving a new password, they regained access, set up new security answers, and changed the password. However, upon logging back in, the account was locked again due to "too many attempts" on the password, despite correct credentials.

Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been trying several years to close my CD from XXXX  with XXXX XXXX Morgan Stanley I have mailed the documents they have requested several times. 


I would like to the deposit amount mailed to my residence in XXXX XXXX as requested previously. 

My current state ID with current address is attached. 

Thank you, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer is having trouble closing a CD with Morgan Stanley, despite mailing requested documents multiple times over several years. They want the deposit amount mailed to their current address, which is verified by their attached state ID.

Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX my granddaughter XXXX XXXX XXXX and i applied for a loan to pay for her medical expenses. I received a loan for {$390.00}. I didn't know the loan provider was a fraud and I withdrew {$380.00} to help my grandbaby. Because I was taken advantage of ... USAA has docked my account twice for {$390.00}, froze my ssdi deposit and froze my federal income tax return which is scheduled to hit the account on XX/XX/year>. I am a XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX veteran with no other income. My utilities are off and I have no food and no gas to go to my doctors appointments. I need my money. I need help. The fraudster deposited a forged check into my account and USAA confirmed it was fraud scam. Im about to lose everything I worked for because they are violating my federally protected money by freezing it and only allowing my account to be a " credit only '' account. Please help me. Please help my family. I need to go to the doctor desperately.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: A USAA account holder claims their account was frozen after a loan provider deposited a forged check, and despite confirming the scam, USAA docked their account twice for $390, froze their SSDI deposit and tax return, leaving them without access to funds for necessities.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally complain about a significant issue I have experienced with Chase Bank, concerning the freezing and subsequent closure of my bank account, and the prolonged delay in the return of my funds. 

In XXXX of last year, during a high volume of personal transactions due to relocating and preparing for the new school year like renting house, getting deposit from previous landlord, and purchasing second hand used furnitures from individuals, which caused many transactions. Chase Bank froze my account without providing a specific reason. They informed me that an investigation would be conducted and that it might take up to three months. Furthermore, they stated that following the investigation, the account would be closed and any funds would be returned to me via check. 

It has now been over six months since the closure of my account, and I have yet to receive the check for my balance, which exceeds {$5800.00}. This situation has severely impacted my financial stability, affecting my ability to manage daily expenses and academic commitments. 

Despite repeated attempts to resolve this issue with Chase Bank, there has been minimal communication and no satisfactory explanation or evidence provided as to why my account was subject to such action. The delay in returning my funds and the lack of transparency are not only inconvenient but also distressing. 

Given these circumstances, I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to intervene on my behalf to expedite the investigation and the return of my funds. I am seeking your assistance to hold Chase Bank accountable and to ensure such practices are scrutinized to prevent undue hardship on others.
Narrative Summary: Chase Bank froze the complainant's account without explanation during a period of high transactions, then closed it after an investigation. Six months later, the complainant has yet to receive a check for their balance of over $5,800, causing financial hardship and distress.

Sub-issue: Problem making or receiving payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
I submitted a claim for an authorized transaction in my SoFi account of {$390.00} on XX/XX/2023. As stated in my initial claim to SoFi, I don't know who XXXX XXXX is and would not send a large amount of money to a random person. I only use that payment function to send rent to my brother, and pay my mother or partner- XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX. All of these names are listed in my transaction history. Ive included screenshots of my past Pay a friend transactions to SoFi to show this history. 

I tried to cancel this transaction as suggested by SoFi, however - SoFi did not allow it. I tried to dispute the transaction, but SoFi said the transaction must be posted. I clearly did not want this posted on my account, that is why I am disputing it. 

I read that the report says this is rejected due to a geolocation being used and therefore rejected- all that confirms is that someone accessed my account without my awareness or authorization. That does not make me responsible for a transaction I did not send or authorize. I am speaking to my awareness of the situation and the impact it has caused with my finances and trust using SOFI. 

That is not a transaction I authorized or a recipient I know. I even locked my debit card as soon as I noticed this {$390.00} posted to my account. This is the only transaction I have ever asked to dispute. 

SoFi refuses to let me speak to someone over the phone and continue to close my case without reviewing the details or circumstances.
Narrative Summary: A SoFi account holder disputes a $390 transaction to an unknown recipient, claiming it was unauthorized. Despite providing transaction history and attempting to cancel/dispute, SoFi rejected the claim citing geolocation, and refuses to review the case or allow a phone call.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Sub-issue: Overdrafts and overdraft fees
Consumer complaint narrative: I have submitted 3 or more complaints regarding unauthorized transactions on my debit account with U. S. BANK, which did not have sufficient funds to complete transactions. Although it was my understanding that DEBIT meant " only successful in transactions for money in account '' that if there wasn't enough money to completed payment, then transaction HAD TO BE DENIED FOR NON SUFFICIENT FUNDS. But USBANK 's response to my issue was, " on mobile app ONLY, the permission to allow overdrafts is defaulted TO ALLOW... on debit account. I FEEL THAT IS INTENTIONAL FRAUD FOR FEES INCURRED BY THESE NON SUFFICIENT FUNDS TRANSACTIONS. So I immediately opened mobile app and after digging extremely deep into account permissions, I finally found and deactivated the allowance of INSUFFICIENT FUNDS transactions being processed. Us Bank reversed the transactions from XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AND XXXX, removed penaltly fees and put my account bank into positive balance. BUT THEN US BANK IMMEDIATELY ALLOWED SAME COMPANIES, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, to process SAME TRANSACTIONS. My denial of overdraft permission WAS COMPLETELY IGNORED. This was 2nd complaint w CFPB I filed in USBANK. CFPB kicked it out as a duplicate. UsBank was misunderstanding my complaint. The overdraft default edit to NOT ALLOW, should have been enough defense. And the fact that CFPB closed my cases claiming duplicate and now I read on CFPB website that USBANK is on the list of banks WHO DO NOT CHARGE OVERDRAFT OR NSF FEES. I HAVE A REPORT OF ABUSE ON MY CONSUMER REPORT FROM THE {$130.00} IN FEES CHARGED WHEN US BANK ALLOWED UNAUTHORIZED TRANSACTIONS AFTER I EDITED THE DEFAULT PERMISSION, AFTER MY COMPLAINT TO CFPB, AND AFTER I REPORTED XXXX AND THE NUMEROUS ADVERSE DECISIONS SOLELY BECAUSE OF THIS FRAUDULENT CHARGE SENT TO DEBT COLLECTION AND SEVERELY AFFECTS MY ABILITY TO OPEN BANK ACCOUNT
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges U.S. Bank allowed unauthorized debit transactions despite insufficient funds, incurring fees. Although they deactivated overdraft permissions, the bank ignored this and processed the same transactions again, resulting in $130 in fees and a negative credit report.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative: I filed so many dispute with this company ( PNC ) but they all got denied thank you to this complaint I was able to recover some of my money back but there 1 transactions that I was not authorized by me please help me send this complaint to pnc for their terrible customer service. lost my phone at the nail salon and came back to the nail salon owner saying that can not find my phone thats when I drove home use one of my family members phone to tracked the item see that its moving and on the way to another city ( XXXX XXXX nc ) then it powered off 20 min later couldnt track it so I filed a police report and now its been days I gotten my phone back and the thief been using my cash card!! And there are multiple unauthorized charges I keep all my cards on the back in my case!! And I tried and tried to dispute this charge over and over again but they keep denying me over {$150.00} I tried 2 times already they keep turning me down OVER MY OWN MONEY This happened of XX/XX/2023
Narrative Summary: The consumer's phone was stolen, and the thief used their PNC cash card for unauthorized transactions. Despite filing a police report and disputing the charges twice, PNC denied the claims, totaling over $150.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative: My account was charged {$53.00} for a XXXX  transaction I didn't make and the date on the transaction states XX/XX/XXXX so how is that possible I spoke to my bank they first said my account would be credited {$53.00} and they failed to do so I called back and then they informed me that they couldn't do that I was given the wrong information by they're coworker so nothing was resolved my money was taken this is the 3rd time I have this problem
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer's account was charged $53 for an unauthorized transaction dated in the past. The bank initially agreed to credit the amount, but later denied the request, citing incorrect information from a coworker, leaving the issue unresolved for the third time.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX ( operated by XXXX XXXX XXXX closed my checking account without prior notice on XX/XX/year>. They will not tell me why. I have been told that a check with the closing balance of {$9900.00} was mailed on XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX. I have been given both dates by bank representatives. I was told it would arrive in 5-7 business days. Accounting for the XXXX XXXX holiday, today is day XXXX if it was mailed on XX/XX/XXXX. I have called multiple times to get more information on the whereabouts of the check and to ask to have the check overnighted to the address on file ( I even told them I would pay for the shipping costs ). Each time I am told to " wait another day or two '' or that they can issue a new check after a " 1-2 business day review to see if the check has been cashed '' but that it will take " another 5-7 business days '' for a new check to arrive. I am not interested in going through this process again. I am traveling abroad and this checking account is the only access to funds that I have. To say this has been an inconvenience is a gross understatement. I have begun to question if the check was ever mailed at all. Given that the amount of the check is a significant amount of money I feel I should be offered a better option to receive it. I would like to be able to track the envelope and, at this point, want the check overnighted to me. I have attached a screenshot to show that I have reached out to the bank multiple times to get this resolved. 

In addition to the account closure, I disputed two transactions that I made on the beach in XXXX on XX/XX/year> ( posted XX/XX/year> ) that resulted in be being charged {$280.00} and {$960.00}. These transactions were for XXXX drinks from a roaming beach vendor. The bank denied these disputes and I requested a report showing what steps were taken to come to this conclusion as well as proof that I authorized the transactions. I never received this information. All I received was the original message that the claim had been denied. That message said that the merchant was contacted by phone and provided proof that I authorized this transaction. I want to know what that proof is because in XXXX all XXXX debit cards are ran as " XXXX '' so no pin is required. I also did not sign any receipt for this purchase. Since the purchase was made from a beach vendor without a storefront ( that I know of ) I am very curious how the bank contacted this person and what proof was given to show these amounts are correct.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A bank closed a customer's checking account without notice and mailed a check with the balance ($9,900). However, the customer hasn't received the check after multiple promised delivery dates and is now requesting it be overnighted due to travel abroad and lack of access to funds.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX, my check was declined at XXXXXXXX XXXX  by Telecheck. I spoke to a supervisor at TeleCheck and was told that the reason was for the decline was that I usually dont write checks for over XXXX dollars. The supervisor XXXX, refused to help me and told me I should wait for 24 hours. I gave a lot of personal information to TeleCheck, and they still would not honor the check. I really need my medicine and am very concerned that TeleCheck has the power to hold your money hostage. Someone should investigate Telecheck for this unfair and biased business practice.

This has happened too often and for too long to me. There should be some intervention whereas consumers checks can be honored without being embarrassed and discriminated against. Telecheck should not continue to be allowed to have consumers checks declined for no good reason due to the check amount patterns.

My medicine costs hundreds of dollars and I was denied access to it due to TeleCheck and not due to insufficient funds. Telecheck already has too much personal information, and it is the consumer like me who is suffering.

Please investigate TeleCheck for this practice. I want to be treated like any other consumer that is allowed to buy products with the means they have.

Thank you for helping me with this.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's check was declined by Telecheck due to an unusual amount, despite sufficient funds. The consumer provided personal info, but Telecheck refused to honor the check, citing a 24-hour wait. The consumer claims this is a recurring issue and seeks investigation into Telecheck's practices.

Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative: I changed my address to my online citibank checking account than XXXX days later I deposited my state refund check the next day XX/XX/year> it was frozen was sent to a security center all of a sudden my phone number couldn't be verified although it was when I opened the account said had to wait for a letter with a code sent in XXXX in XXXX I called again said no letter came in old or new address so they sent another I've been calling everyday nobody can help account was locked cause I changed my address that doesn't make sense I called everyday it always ended the same me in tears it's now middle of XXXX and they still won't unlock my account I tried to close the account and was told I was denied there is no branch near me the closest is XXXX miles they only say they can send another letter but I never received the first XXXX I just want my money and to close this account they won't help me they resorted to hanging up on me I need help they check is in me and my husband 's name was in process of adding him when they locked it they shouldn't of even deposited it
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer's Citibank checking account was locked after changing their address, and a deposited state refund check was frozen. Despite multiple calls, the issue remains unresolved, with the bank repeatedly sending verification letters that never arrive, and the consumer is unable to access their funds.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Sub-issue: Late or other fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
American Express reported several time. Still thousand of fraud transaction XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Several others. 
Day by day increase frauds activity I am so much tired they not responding well to resolve my issue and deny my fraudulent activity I need to consumer fraud department to help This fraudulent transaction back 3 to 4 months history of fraud transaction
Narrative Summary: American Express reported thousands of fraudulent transactions on the consumer's account, with activity increasing daily over 3-4 months. Despite reporting, the issue remains unresolved, and the consumer is seeking help from the consumer fraud department to address the issue and reverse the transactions.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX {$25.00} payments were taken out of my savings account via ACH by XXXX, listed as " ACH Withdrawal XXXX XXXX RETURN FEE. '' These transactions were subsequently returned on XX/XX/XXXX due to insufficient funds. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called XXXX to inquire about these charges and spoke with an agent named XXXX XXXX. She stated that she could not see any such transactions on my account. It has been several months since I returned anything to XXXX, and there was no prior policy indicating I would be charged any type of return fee. This situation is fraudulent, and XXXX is effectively stealing from me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported unauthorized ACH withdrawals of $25, labeled as "return fees," from their savings account despite no recent returns or prior notice of such fees. The transactions were returned due to insufficient funds, and the company's agent claimed to have no record of the transactions.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Approx XX/XX/24 I called BofA since my CD matures XX/XX/24 and I wanted to be sure they moved the funds into my checking account since their program automatically rolls funds into new CDs. 

XX/XX/24 ( today XXXX PST ) I ask BofA to move the matured CD to my checking account. They said they can not since I called in XXXX, they set it up to send me a check, which will take 7-10 business days, which they said nothing about on my previous call. I told them to put a stop payment on the check and move funds into my checking account. They said the stop payment will take over 7 business days so I am better off waiting for the check. I know they can do a stop payment immediately so they are holding my money interest free for over a week when I desperately need these funds, as I let them know. Just spoke to a manager who called my back, but was not able to resolve the situation in any way. 

It is not that hard for Bank of American to move funds into my checking account, which leads me to conclude they are for sure playing games to keep my money interest-free a little longer.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Bank of America customer's CD matured, and they requested the funds be moved to their checking account. However, the bank claimed a check was already set up and a stop payment would take 7 business days, despite the customer's insistence they can do it immediately.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Sub-issue: Overdrafts and overdraft fees
Consumer complaint narrative: PNC has suspended my access to my bank statements. As a result, I can not identify the considerable and unwarranted bank charges levied on my account by PNC. These charges levied by PNC are directly responsible for negative balances.
Narrative Summary: PNC suspended the consumer's access to bank statements, preventing them from identifying and disputing excessive, unwarranted charges that led to negative account balances.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative: Hi, i bank with Robinhood and keep most of my money in my checking account with them and recently Ive just gotten paid from work via direct deposit only to wake up the next day to see my whole check has been taken and transfer to a betting app called XXXX. I did not approve this transaction and i dont know it happened but when trying to file a dispute Robinhood is not allowing me and i dont know to contact them everything Ive tried doesnt work. Please help i really need my money its the beginning of the month and i do have bills to pay so please help.
Narrative Summary: A Robinhood checking account holder's direct deposit was unexpectedly transferred to a betting app without their approval. They're unable to dispute the transaction through Robinhood and are having trouble contacting the company for assistance, leaving them without funds to pay bills.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: I am currently in XXXX and applied for a TD Bank savings account during XXXX XXXX. My family moved from XXXX to XXXX in XXXX  and there are no TD Banks here. I visited XXXX and attempted to go to TD Bank to withdraw my savings. Contacting their agent, they said the account did not exist when we had the actual card. We provided our SSN, but they said there were no records. Now they are saying there's nothing they can do and the card was the old version so there is no record.
Narrative Summary: A customer opened a TD Bank savings account, but after moving, they found no local branches. When attempting to withdraw funds at a different location, the bank claimed the account didn't exist despite having the actual card and providing their SSN, citing it was an old version with no records.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I responded to an advertisement to open a new " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' account with Capital One. The terms of this offer included a {$XXXX} bonus for depositing, and maintaining, {$XXXX} in the account. 

I completed the terms of this offer, opening the account on XX/XX/2023 with the promotional code " XXXX ''. I was able to deposit just over {$XXXX} to the account within the timeframe indicated ( approximately XXXX weeks ), and held those monies in the account for the duration indicated ( in fact, all of these monies remain in this account, as I write ). 

I became concerned, earlier this week, that the {$XXXX} bonus hadn't posted, per the terms of the agreement. I contacted Capital One ( by phone ) on XXXX, and spoke with a Customer Service Representative named " XXXX, '' who informed me that I had failed to complete one particular component of the bonus requirements, which I will explain below. 

This particular account opening bonus was for individuals without an open XXXX XXXX Savings Account. I was able to successfully open the account ( online ), and have the promotional code applied. In the next day or two, when I was initiating online access for my ( new ) account, I noticed that there were two existing accounts ( XXXXne for each of my ( now ) adult children ), with a penny in each. These accounts had been opened, and essentially abandoned, approximately 12 years prior. Realizing I had these abandoned accounts still " hanging around, '' I immediately closed them. 

I guess my concern is how could I have possibly known that there were two ( decade old ) savings accounts " on my record '' with Capital One, if I had received no communication regarding these accounts in 10+ years? Furthermore, I think it unfair ( and perhaps predatory, I'm not sure ) that Capital One would allow me to open my new account, accept the bonus code ( as one of my attached photos will show ), and not inform me that there was this technicality that would prevent me from receiving my bonus until months later, when *I* initiated a phone call. Frankly, it appears that Capital One would have had to have known that I would ( ultimately ) be ineligible for this bonus from the start, and let this whole affair play out for months on end. It seems rather inappropriate and unfair to me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer opened a Capital One account with a promotional code for a bonus, meeting the deposit and maintenance requirements. However, the bonus wasn't posted due to two abandoned savings accounts from 12 years prior, which the consumer didn't know existed and immediately closed upon discovery.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative: I had account with chime 4 years ago and it got colsed I had closed it bcouse I never got my card in the mail and they still have yet send me my check and they tell me 10 business days and mouthing coming
Narrative Summary: A consumer had a Chime account 4 years ago that was closed due to a missing debit card. Chime still owes the consumer a check, which was promised within 10 business days, but has yet to be received.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative: I have multiple accounts with US Bank ( checking, money market, credit card ) and noticed I have been charged a monthly maintenance fee over the past year and a half on my checking account even though my account meets the requirements to have the fee waived ( monthly direct deposit of XXXX XXXXXXXX, combined account balance of XXXX XXXXXXXX ). When I spoke with a representative on XX/XX/24, they confirmed that I meet the requirements and that my account is being charged in error. They were able to re-fund the fees from the past 90 days but said they can not prevent my account from continuing to be charged in error and I will continue to be charged the fee. As a customer that meets the requirements to have the fee waived, they are granting a false promise that I will not be charged and are stealing from me each month.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

A representative confirmed the error, refunded 90 days of fees, but couldn't prevent future incorrect charges, leaving the customer vulnerable to ongoing incorrect fees.

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/24 at XXXX XXXX  EST, I received an email from SoFi Bank, which stated ; We take the safety and security of your account very seriously. In reviewing your SoFi Bank account, there appears to have been activity which indicates that the account may have been used in violation of the authorized activity guidelines described in your SoFi Bank Deposit Agreement. 
For your protection your account has been temporarily restricted. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience, but during this time you will not be able to deposit or withdraw from the account, transfer funds, or make purchases with your debit card. 

As soon as I became aware of the email at XXXX XXXX  the following day, I made multiple calls to SoFis customer service and security team, who withheld any and all information regarding the sudden account restriction. I was told that any information regarding my finances, including even a simple timeframe of when I could expect to receive information on any reasoning or decision regarding whether or not my account would remain closed. 

I fill none of the criteria laid out in SoFis terms to of been affected by such an account closure. I have no overdrafts on either my checking or savings account, there have been no unauthorized or suspicious transactions or activity, no breaches of my personal SoFi account, no mobile check deposits, and my recurring direct deposit transactions are all managed by the NYS Comptrollers Office and XXXX, as I am a military servicemember XXXX  on XXXX XXXX XXXX.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's SoFi Bank account was temporarily restricted due to suspected unauthorized activity, despite the consumer claiming no suspicious transactions or account breaches. SoFi's customer service and security team withheld information on the restriction, leaving the consumer without a resolution or timeframe for account reinstatement.

on XX/XX/year>, i deposited a LEGIT company check of {$850.00} into my checkings account from a new job i started ( i did not realize a portion of the checks rounting / account number was unreadable ) I still have the exact check. On XX/XX/year> my checkings account was closed, and my savings account was locked having {$1400.00} in it still. On the XXXX  day after calling they ended up charging me anyway. I looked on the statements for that month I still have pending charges. XX/XX/year> for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX AND XXXX and the main reason for complaint is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX AND WHY IS MY XXXX XXXX NEGATIVE XXXX

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> my Bank of America account was hacked and the hacker tried to send a debut card to their address. Once I found out I immediately closed down that account, opened a new account with increased security and new username and passwords, and I transfered half my money to my Merrill XXXX XXXX account. After my Bank of America account was secured, on XX/XX/XXXX I called XXXX XXXX to withdraw my money, but I was told my account was " blocked '' and I had to wait for the " outbound team '' to call me. On XX/XX/XXXX they never called when they said they would. I called and requested the reason for the denial of funds as required by Electronic Funds Transfer Act but they failed to provide that information. I noticed others had made this same complaint on the CFPB website so I decided to file my complaint. When I went into Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX, I was told this issue would have to be resolved with XXXX XXXX, but whenever you call XXXX XXXX they tell you that the account is being investigated and you have to wait for the outbound team to call you, but they won't give you a date when you will have access to your funds. I feel as if XXXX XXXX took my money and will not give me access even though I was a victim of a criminal trying to do the same thing. As of today, XX/XX/XXXX, I have still not been given access to my money despite requesting it for 4 days now. I just want access to the money that I moved into my XXXX XXXX account because I thought I was protecting my money, but I didn't know that XXXX XXXX would deny my ability to withdrawal or transfer funds. I verified my identity many times in person in Bank of America, and since Bank of America is the only reason I opened the XXXX XXXX  account and their accounts are tied together, I feel they both need to respond to denying me access to transferring my money or withdrawal. I hope the CFPB helps me get my money back from XXXX XXXX. Just because I'm a victim of a crime does not mean I should be denied banking services.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Bank of America customer's account was hacked, prompting them to transfer funds to a Merrill account for security. However, the Merrill account was "blocked" and the customer was denied access to their funds, despite verifying their identity, with no clear resolution timeline provided by the bank.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed a banking error on Wells Fargo with my checking account. I called the online banking customer service line and spoke with them about the matter about XXXX EST. 

The issue was that 7 days prior, I had only one transaction and that was to pay my {$96.00} XXXX  bill. I received the confirmation email from XXXX. Then I received an email from Wells Fargo confirming my " new '' avaialable balance that was approximately {$97.00} less ( than before the XXXX payment. ) So, on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX contacted me that the payment could not go through ans advised me to contact my banking institution. I did ( as mentioned before. ) Wells Fargo rep. 's spinned me around in circles around the issue stating there was no XXXX transaction that day. She also at one point denied Wells Fargo sending me the account balance updates ( via email ). I asked well how do you explain the missing amount from the account? And multiple days of the balance calculations being off on my posted available balance? 
I had previous concerns with my available balances being off at Wells Fargo, so I asked for an official investigation of the matter. The rep. explained the process and stated once submitted, that department would send an email to me. They did- the next day, XXXX. 
The WF Line of Business/ Concerns email stating they'd look into the matter and would get in touch in 10 business days. I never heard back, so I called Wells Fargo on Tuesday, XX/XX/2024 about XXXX : XXXX. 
The rep. named XXXX stated there was no record of my calling, no case posted as I'd described and no claim listed that correspond with the emails I received. He gave no explanation for theor lack of interest in my report nor apologized for their error and refused to transfer me to whom could help me better with my important financial concerns. He stated he was in Claims and I was speaking to whom I needed to ( him. ) With no help, no investigation and no expalnation where our money was... 
I concluded that a higher up, corporate level need to be informed of these errors, dismissals and lack of interests to a long time customer. I decided to report this also to CFPB.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Wells Fargo customer reported a banking error where a $96 payment was deducted from their account, but the payment was later denied. The customer contacted Wells Fargo multiple times, but the issue was not resolved, and they were met with conflicting information and a lack of investigation.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: I tried to use PNC mobile deposit to deposit a check for {$14.00} and the app crashed four times making it look like the deposit was not accepted. It was not showing in my current or available balance and there was no record of the deposit being credited So I cashed the check at XXXX. Turns out PNC did accept the deposit without any notification on my end and the check was returned. PNC froze my account for {$14.00} and held my direct deposit and a XXXX  payment totaling over {$670.00} for 4 days refusing me access to my payroll for a mistake that was caused by their app. The level of service I received was disgusting. They treated me like a criminal for a mistake.
Narrative Summary: A PNC mobile deposit app crash led to a user cashing a check elsewhere, unaware PNC had accepted the deposit. The bank froze the account, holding over $670, due to the duplicate deposit, causing the user significant inconvenience and distress.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
account XXXX on XX/XX/2023 there was a charge to my account for XXXX. I did the charge at the restaurant. the restaurant offered me a full refund on the charge the next day because our entire party was extremely XXXX  and XXXX XXXX. 
I even submitted a note to the capital one from the manager or employee. 
apparently months later after capital one investigated the claim the manager/employee did not work their anymore. 

after speaking with capital one they did not investigate the complaint property and refuse to. 
they said they investigated the complaint and the restaurant said they had authorization to charge the card. Yes of course they did because we used the card - THE RESTAURANT PROMISED A REFUND- I never said the initial charge was not valid - capital one for several times I put a dispute in investigated the claim the wrong way I have been a customer for 15 years and I refuse to bank with them again until this is fixed and I get the worst treatment
Narrative Summary: A customer disputes a charge from a restaurant, claiming they were offered a full refund due to poor service. Capital One investigated, but allegedly misinterpreted the issue, focusing on authorization rather than the promised refund, and refused to resolve the matter despite the customer's 15-year loyalty.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative: My husband and I have banked with Citizens for 6 years. XXXX Title loans for {$990.00} were deposited into our account and then withdrawn, which were not requested by us and had my name spelled wrong. At the same time XXXX XXXX XXXX transactions were fraudulently applied to our account, XXXX for {$5.00} and XXXX for approx. {$1400.00}. We do not use XXXX XXXX and never have. There is no history of XXXX XXXX in our whole time with Citizens. I can not give the exact dollar amount because we have been locked out of our online banking so we can not even see our own claim. In addition, we filed a claim against a fraudulent {$970.00} XXXX purchase, even though the most we spend at XXXX is a few XXXX at the holidays. Our account is now - {$3200.00}. All within days of each other, yet Citizens keeps refusing our claim. They have also closed down our other accounts and absorbed that money into the account that was supposed to be investigated without our knowledge before telling us their decision. Now they are threatening us with collections. In addition, they consistently reordered the dates of events/purchases throughout this whole process which hindered us from being able to respond to the crisis in a faster manner.
Narrative Summary: A Citizens bank customer claims their account was compromised with unauthorized transactions, including a $990 title loan and multiple transactions totaling over $1,400. The bank has refused their claim, closed other accounts, and is threatening collections, despite the customer having no history of such transactions.

Consumer complaint narrative: I opened a Robinhood Invest account on XX/XX/year> and a Robinhood Spend on XX/XX/year>. Over the course of a couple weeks I deposited over {$9000.00} into the accounts. On XX/XX/year>, I had tried to make a payment to my credit card from the XXXX account, but Robinhood rejected the transfer and subsequently restricted my account. They asked for statements of the bank I used to make deposits and I provided those, but they still decided to close my account and haven't unlocked my funds to be available to withdraw yet. I asked for a reason and they just gave me a generic XXXX XXXX response that basically said " our terms say we can do whatever we want whenever we want and not tell you '' I was looking forward to using the account, but now I just want my money back.
Narrative Summary: The consumer opened Robinhood Invest and Spend accounts, depositing over $9,000. After a rejected transfer and account restriction, they provided requested bank statements, but Robinhood closed the account without explanation and has not released the funds for withdrawal.

Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
After having an issue with my XXXX account ( locked out of account due to phone number verification issues ) I opened and transferred {$160000.00} to a new Marcus by Goldman Sachs online savings account on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX. After an initial XXXX  day hold on these funds, my online account listed the full {$160000.00} as available funds. 
After a XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  interest payment the current balance of my Marcus account on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  was {$160000.00}. These funds are also marked as 'available ' on my account. I needed to transfer a small amount to my local credit union on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  so I initiated an XXXX transfer of {$6900.00} to my personal checking account at my credit union. The following day I logged into my Marcus account and saw that the transfer had been reversed with no explanation. I tried to transfer the same amount to another personal checking account and was given a message stating that Marcus was experiencing technical issues and to try again in a few hours. 
After chatting with a Marcus agent I learned that there were no 'technical issues ' ; I was locked out of my account and needed to call for more information. I called and was told by a representative that my account was locked due to incomplete phone # verification via a third-party company ( I have had the same phone number since XXXX and it is the only phone number I have ever listed on any financial information ). After being told that phone # verification could take XXXX business days I waited to contact Marcus again XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I called Marcus on XX/XX/XXXX and after a series of unusual questions about any recent marriages, alternate names etc. I was told that my phone number was confirmed but that I was still unable to make transfers to my credit union, only transfers to my funding account ( the closed XXXX account ). The Marcus representative ( XXXX ) stated that this was due to 'fast money transfer ' and that she could not tell me how long my account would be restricted or any additional information. I thought this was ridiculous, as attempting XXXX transfer of approx XXXX % of the total balance in XXXX  weeks does not seem unusual or " fast. '' At this point ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I requested to close my account with Marcus if I would be unable to make XXXX transfers out of the account to my credit union. I spoke with a representative ( XXXX ) whom I authorized to close my account and who stated I would be mailed a check for the full balance in XXXX business days and that I could call back for a tracking number on the certified mail. 
On XX/XX/XXXX a Marcus representative ( XXXX ) called for another phone number verification and to confirm my account closure. 
On XX/XX/XXXX a XXXX representative XXXX XXXX ) called from an alternate phone number and area code and left a message for a return call. I immediately called Marcus back and spoke with XXXX who stated that I needed to confirm that my XXXX account was closed. I participated in a 3 way call with XXXX, myself, and a XXXX representative ( XXXX ) who confirmed my XXXX account was already closed and that all of the information I had already provided to XXXX was accurate. 
At this point ( XXXX XXXX  EST XX/XX/XXXX ) I asked if it would be possible to just receive my funds via wire transfer to my credit union as no check had still been issued 8 business days from closure request. I spoke with Marcus savings specialist XXXX  ( sp? ) who confirmed the wire information for my credit union checking account and whom I authorized to complete a wire transfer in the amount of {$160000.00} plus accrued interest. She stated this transfer would be completed within 1 business day. 
As of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I saw that my transfer still had not been sent. I called and spoke with XXXX and XXXX. XXXX said my transfer was still in review and it could take 1-3 business days even though I was told one business day when I authorized the wire transfer. I asked for email or mail confirmation of my closure request and pending wire transfer confirmation and was told, " We don't do that. '' As of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I still have not seen a wire transfer out of my Marcus account. I requested account closure XX/XX/XXXX. I have complied with all requests for additional information and all of my information has been verified. I have not been able to access any funds in my Marcus account since I initially attempted my transfer of {$6900.00} on XX/XX/XXXX ( 19 days total ).
Narrative Summary: The consumer opened a Marcus by Goldman Sachs online savings account with $160,000 and after an initial hold, the funds were marked as available. However, when attempting to transfer $6,900, the transfer was reversed due to incomplete phone verification. Despite resolving the issue, the account was restricted, and the consumer was unable to make transfers to their credit union, leading to a request for account closure and a wire transfer of the funds, which has been delayed.

Sub-issue: Confusing or missing disclosures
Consumer complaint narrative:
Not an actual account opening, but rather advertising for RobinHood Gold product. Television ads for this product indicate 'up to XXXX XXXX in FDIC insurance ' in the voice over. IF you can read the disclosure at the bottom of the screen, the fine print indicates funds will be spread across ten banks in order to qualify for the maximum amount of insurance. 
This is exceptionally misleading as the general public has knowledge that FDIC insurance is limited to XXXX per account ( I know this is not wholly correct, but this figure is what the general public associates with FDIC insurance ), and this advertisement offers XXXX XXXX in FDIC insurance! 
I think this is deceiving and misleading under UDAAP!
Narrative Summary: A consumer complaint alleges that RobinHood's TV ads for its Gold product misleadingly advertise "up to XXXX XXXX in FDIC insurance." The fine print reveals funds are spread across 10 banks to achieve this, contradicting the common understanding of FDIC insurance limits, potentially violating UDAAP.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Sub-issue: Late or other fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Truist regarding their unauthorized maintenance fees charged to my account despite assurances that I would be exempt from such charges, since I was being ported to a another account type that does not have these fees. 

On numerous occasions, Truist has levied a maintenance fee of {$12.00} against my account, despite consistently maintaining a sufficient balance in my savings account to waive these fees. My combined savings and checking balance was significantly in excess of the {$1500.00} they claim I needed to maintain, again, despite being told that my new account type does not carry these restrictions. Despite repeated attempts to rectify this issue, the problem persists, causing undue financial strain and frustration. This blatant disregard for their own commitments is both unacceptable and unethical. 

Moreover, Truist agreed to refund XXXX late fees erroneously charged to my account. While they have refunded XXXX of the fees as promised, the second refund is yet to be issued. Surprisingly, their customer service rep stated that she could not see XXXX maintenance fee charges on my account, when in reality, there were XXXX. Despite assurances that they would promptly investigate and rectify the situation, I have not received any updates or communication regarding the status of this refund. When I contact Truist, I am told that they will have a " supervisor '' look into it and that is that. 

This ongoing pattern of incompetence and negligence on the part of Truist has not only resulted in unwarranted financial losses but has also eroded my trust and confidence in their ability to manage my accounts effectively and responsibly. 

I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter thoroughly and ensure that Truist is held accountable for their actions. I seek a full refund of all unauthorized maintenance fees charged to my account, as well as immediate resolution regarding the outstanding late fee refund. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift and satisfactory resolution. 

Sincerely,
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Truist charged unauthorized maintenance fees to the consumer's account despite assurances of exemption due to a new account type. The fees were levied despite sufficient balances, and despite repeated attempts to rectify the issue, the problem persists, causing financial strain and frustration.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: I discovered on XX/XX/24 that my checking account was drained of approximately {$9000.00}. I immediately froze the account, requested a new debit card and filed a dispute with Key Bank in XXXX, NY. The representative at the local branch was able to pull the transactions on this account and I identified that transactions that I did not make. He submitted the dispute to claims department. Even though some of the disputed transactions occurred in XXXX, NY while I was on vacation in both XXXX, NY on XX/XX/24 and XXXX, Va from XX/XX/24 and XX/XX/24, this claim was denied. I requested a second look at this dispute because the initial denial was predicated on the fact that I was " always in possession of my debit card. '' I never let anyone use my debit card, and most of the fraudulent transactions are at locations that I have never visited, let alone made transactions at. I requested a second dispute and this was also denied, even though my local representation brought the fact that I was not in XXXX when a number of transactions posted to my account.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's checking account was drained of $9,000. Key Bank denied the dispute, citing the consumer was always in possession of their debit card. The consumer disputes this, stating they never shared their card and many transactions occurred at unfamiliar locations while they were on vacation.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: I discovered multiple fraudulent charges on my account from XXXX, after doing my taxes. I thought the money leaving my account was for arrears in XXXX XXXXt payments. When I did my taxes and found out that the entirety of my return went to XXXX XXXX it prompted me to look through my account. This is when I discovered multiple fraudulent charges, from an array of different venders. I filed a claim with Wells Fargo, which they denied, and refused to let me appeal the decision. I contacted the cfpb and they let the appeal process happen. They then denied that as well, telling me I needed to show more proof the charges werent made by myself. I subsequently filed a police report after that, as I dont really understand what other proof I can provide for them other than me telling them what charges were not made, or authorized by me.

Narrative Summary: A consumer discovered multiple unauthorized charges on their account from various vendors after reviewing their account during tax season. They filed a claim with Wells Fargo, which was denied, and subsequent appeals to Wells Fargo and the CFPB were also denied, citing insufficient proof.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
Check deposited : XX/XX/2024 Check amount : {$29000.00} * What happened : What occurred was the deposit of a certified check at Chase bank for the specified amount, after which the funds became available following clearance of the check. Shortly after, notification was received stating that the Chase Business Checking account would be closed due to Chase 's inability to contact the issuer of the check, which was from XXXX, an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that serves as a protected series cell within XXXX XXXX XXXX. This is not a public company and is not searchable on the internet. 

* Actions taken : In an attempt to verify the issuer, a point of contact was provided to Chase, which is the holding company responsible for managing both XXXX and XXXX, XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. The response given was that XXXX acts as the manager on record for both entities, and if Chase was attempting to locate XXXX via internet search, they would not find it as it is not a public company. Additionally, notarized documents from the issuer and all accessible corporate documentation were submitted to Chase via the NJ Department of Treasury. The issuer even provided a direct phone number for contact. 

Despite these efforts, Chase declined to accept any of the information provided, including acknowledging the issuer 's attempt to reach out, and stated that only the company present within their internal directory would be considered. This is an obviously a deceptive practice, where they disregard Notarized letters as a source of verification. 

* Results : As a result, Chase has refused to return the funds and has decided to hold the funds for a period of 24 months / 2 years to " verify '' the issuer while closing the Chase account within 5 business days.

We have email correspondence with the check issuer to confirm all details, however, Chase refuses to acknowledge this and continues to hold my rightful funds.
Narrative Summary: A consumer deposited a $29,000 certified check from a private company into their Chase Business Checking account. Chase closed the account and froze the funds, citing inability to contact the issuer, despite the consumer providing notarized documents and a direct phone number for verification.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative: I used the promo code XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to receive {$300.00} when opening a new checking account. Went into a Chase branch on XX/XX/year> and completed a payroll ACH deposit of $ XXXX on XXXX XXXX, 2024 and still haven't received bonus. Called Chase on XXXX XXXX, 2024 @ XXXX PST to follow up and spoke with manager, XXXX  XXXX who opened the Case Number : XXXX and said someone will call back in 1-3 business days. Chase failed to call back and I had to call again on XXXX XXXX, 2024 at XXXX PST. Escalated to XXXX, XXXX- who looked into the previous Case Number, and said she couldn't even find it. Asked to escalate to another Senior Manager with another Case Number : XXXX. She advised a Sr Mgr will c/b in 3-5 business days. A very unclear message was left on XX/XX/year> with incorrect instructions to call the XXXX where the Chase agent had no idea why they left that. I then was told to call a different number for the check claims. Spoke with XXXX, Senior Manager on XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX. The case was then again transferred to another specialist, XXXX XXXX XXXX, who said she would investigate and get back to me. I sent a follow up secured message on XX/XX/XXXX. A request to provide additional documents was received on XX/XX/XXXX, and responded to with the information on XX/XX/XXXX. I missed a call from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, which I called back immediately and the Chase agent was able to reach her, but left her a message. On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent another follow up secured message was sent to XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, another secured message was sent to XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, yet another secured message was sent to XXXX. A final message was sent again on XX/XX/XXXX. After more than 10 attempts over 2 months to resolve the matter, Chase has failed to respond to my messages and calls.
Narrative Summary: The consumer opened a new Chase checking account using a promo code for a $300 bonus, but after completing the required payroll ACH deposit, the bonus was not received. Despite multiple calls and follow-ups over two months, Chase failed to resolve the issue or provide the bonus.

Sub-issue: Cashing a check
Consumer complaint narrative: I deposited one payroll check from my new employer on Saturday XX/XX/2024 at a Wells Fargo atm and another payroll check from the same employer at a Wells Fargo bank on Monday XX/XX/2024. At first they told me the checks would be held until today XX/XX/2024. This morning I got a notification stating they are holding my checks for another week. Both my husband and I have called and have been told different things. Wells Fargo told my husband because the funds have been flagged for fraud and they told me they have not received the funds from the XXXX I work at. When I asked for documentation on the hold reason they said they could not provide that to me. The XXXX I work for is XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, South Carolina.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer deposited two payroll checks at Wells Fargo on Saturday and Monday. Initially, they were told the checks would be held until a certain date, but the hold was extended another week. The bank provided conflicting reasons for the hold and refused to provide documentation.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
Citi Bank is offering a cash bonus for opening a checking account between XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. The terms require you to fund your account within 20 days of account opening, make a qualifying deposit of {$5000.00} or more in New-to-Citibank funds to eligible accounts and maintain your balance XXXX consecutive calendar days after the funding period. 

Following the account opening on XX/XX/year>, with a substantial deposit made on XX/XX/XXXX, I promptly reached out to Citibank representative XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX after not receiving the bonus. Despite assurances from XXXX, the promised bonus remained elusive. 

Subsequent attempts to resolve the issue included a voicemail left on XX/XX/XXXX and further correspondence on XX/XX/XXXX, where XXXX promised to submit a request to address the matter. However, subsequent follow-ups on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX revealed that no such request had been made, contrary to XXXXXXXX XXXX assurances. 

Disheartened by the lack of progress, I escalated the matter by contacting Citibank 's toll-free number on XX/XX/XXXX, only to discover that no dispute had been initiated by XXXX, despite his claims to the contrary. This disconnect between XXXX 's promises and the bank 's records only added to the frustration. 

Despite continued attempts to seek updates and resolution, including text messages and voicemails on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX has remained unresponsive. 

This ongoing issue not only highlights the breakdown in communication between Citibank representatives and their customers but also underscores the importance of timely and accurate follow-up in resolving customer concerns. 

Based on the terms of Citi Bank 's promotional offer and the amount deposited into the account, a cash bonus of {$750.00} is due.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A customer opened a Citi Bank checking account with a substantial deposit, meeting the terms for a $750 cash bonus. Despite repeated assurances from a representative, the bonus was not received, and subsequent attempts to resolve the issue were met with unfulfilled promises and lack of follow-up.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, in XXXX XXXX Florida. I deposited {$500.00} into the Citizens Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ATM. I deposited cash into atm and the machine took my deposit and did not deposit it into my account. The machine also did not return my money. I called customer service and they told me they would start a claim and to wait 2 days. I went to the branch the next day and they told me because I already started the claim they could not help me. I called again XX/XX/XXXX and was told I would Be credited for the cash deposit and that was also not true .i was also told my claim would be looked at in 10 days. My account is still missing my deposit that their machine stole from me. I would like my money. I gave them cash and they just stole it and told me to wait 10 days to decide if I'm allowed to have my money. I put cash into their machine and they just took it. It's ridiculous! My account has been overdrawn now because the funds I deposited into my account didn't make it to my account and were taken from me by the financial institution. I have bills that are due. This is unacceptable!
Narrative Summary: A customer deposited $500 cash into a Citizens Bank ATM in Florida, but the machine didn't deposit the funds into their account or return the money. Despite multiple calls and visits to the branch, the issue remains unresolved, causing the customer's account to become overdrawn.

Sub-issue: Unable to open an account
Consumer complaint narrative: My current ChexSystems status is negative because a fraudster had access to my XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX account when I lost my wallet and all of my personal sensitive information was in my wallet.This gave the fraudster a lot of access and opportunities to make a lot a fraudulent charges with my personal information which they did.Now I'm unable to open any bank accounts because I have this company my police report previously in the past and they took this negative information off now Im assuming they placed back on and I can't open any accounts.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer's ChexSystems status is negative due to a past identity theft incident where a fraudster accessed their account after stealing their wallet. The issue was previously resolved, but now the negative information has reappeared, preventing them from opening new bank accounts.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX received mailer for XXXX Ahead Savings account via email to receive XXXX bonus miles if XXXX was deposited. 
XX/XX/XXXX signed up and received confirmation that I was enrolled and if deposited funds that I would receive miles within 90 days. 
XX/XX/XXXX chatted and was told that I successfully qualified for offer as of XX/XX/XXXX and to wait until end of month for miles to be credited. 
XX/XX/XXXX chatted and was told they would open an investigation into the miles XX/XX/XXXX received a denial of miles to be credited as I wasn't part of the promo XX/XX/XXXX called and they stated I did qualify and would submit another review as the original one did not have all the information added. 
XX/XX/XXXX received a denial of miles to be credited as I wasn't part of the promo XX/XX/XXXX called and spoke with a supervisor who read off the letter and stated that even if I received an email of the promo and received confirmation email from the company that I did not qualify because I must not have clicked the right link to set it up. 

Their denial letter states to send them information of the promo code but doesn't tell you how to do that - there are no directions to provide. I had to get on X and chat with a representative to get the email address. I set up a conference with a banker for XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX am and received confirmation of the appointment but they never called.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer signed up for a savings account after receiving an email offer for bonus miles with a deposit. Despite initial confirmations of qualification, they received multiple denials, with the company claiming they didn't click the correct link to set up the promotion, and poor customer service follow-up.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase is withholding funds from my account from a check that has already cleared. I deposited a check from XXXX XXXX XXXX, into my Chase XXXX account on XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX paid the funds to Chase. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX days after the check cleared, Chase still has not deposited those funds into my savings account.
Narrative Summary: Chase is withholding funds from a check that cleared XXXX days ago. The check from XXXX XXXX was deposited on XX/XX/year, paid by XXXX on XX/XX/year, but as of XX/XX/XXXX, the funds remain unavailable in the consumer's savings account.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: I mobile deposited a check signed over to me by a relative. The deposit was accepted and placed on a 10 day hold. On the day before the hold was to be lifted I received an alert to contact Chase becausetheyrestrictedmyaccount.. I called and verified the information needed. The check cleared and was made available in my account. I scheduled a withdrawal and when I went to the ATM my card didn't work. I went inside to the teller and was advised to call and have the restrictions lifted. Chase then proceeded to change the terms of the agreement and falsified information about the phone call between the fraud department and myself. I am XXXX and have bills due immediately. The check cleared and now they are saying that they need to contact the issuing company. Which I was told would be done yesterday so I could access the funds today. Now they are saying that the company number registered with their internal system is not responsive and I can't access my funds until they reach the company. I already waited for the 10 day authorization hold and received authorization yet chase won't release my funds to me or unlock my account
Narrative Summary: A consumer deposited a check via mobile deposit, which cleared after a 10-day hold. However, Chase restricted the account and now claims they need to verify with the issuing company, despite the consumer already receiving authorization, leaving them unable to access their funds.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Sub-issue: Overdrafts and overdraft fees
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a WellsFargo Account ending in XXXX ( prime checking ) In the past 45 days, I have received over 25 overdraft fees assessed and many of them were engineered ovedrafts created with debit cards ( - {$1.00} or - {$9.00} ) or some online merchants like XXXX, XXXX and XXXX which came in without notice, etc and I have lost over {$1000.00} in overdraft fees in my account since XXXX XXXX I will attach my WFaccount and print screen of these drafts on this complaint to get your support to resolve this issue.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Wells Fargo customer claims to have incurred over 25 overdraft fees in 45 days, resulting in a loss of over $1,000. Many fees were allegedly caused by small debit card transactions or online merchant charges that triggered overdrafts without notice.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative: My Chase checking account is closed on XX/XX/2024. I called several times with chase customer service, trying to get why this happened, but the answer is my account is under investigation and being closed. Right now, all I want is getting my XXXX XXXX back.
Narrative Summary: A Chase checking account was closed on XX/XX/2024 without explanation. Despite multiple calls to customer service, the account holder was only told it's under investigation and being closed, and now they want their funds returned.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: chase bank made XXXX debits from my checking account in XXXX of {$1900.00} total of {$7700.00} without authorization, my bank has tried to get those funds back but they have not been able to recover this money claim # XXXX
Narrative Summary: Chase Bank made unauthorized debits of $7,700 from the consumer's checking account in multiple transactions totaling $1,900 each. The consumer's bank attempted to recover the funds but was unsuccessful, resulting in a loss of $7,700.
