Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased an engagement ring from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on XX/XX/year>. I returned the engagement ring to XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX refunded the full amount to my debit card in the amount of {$11000.00}. I received a notification from Chime stating that the refund was expected to be processed by XX/XX/year>. The funds were never deposited into my account from Chime. They claim to have no record of the refund. I followed up with XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX and they assure me that the refund was processed and that the funds were sent to my account. They provided me transaction information proving that the {$11000.00} was refunded to my debit card. I started a dispute with Chime bank, and provided such information as the receipt and the transaction information provided by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Chime denies that any mistake has been made, and they are refusing to issue the funds into my checking account.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased an engagement ring and returned it, receiving a refund of $11,000 from the seller. However, the refund was never deposited into their Chime account, despite the seller providing transaction information as proof of the refund, leading to a dispute with Chime bank.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I received a successful XXXX deposit of {$1200.00}. 
On XX/XX/year> I received a successful XXXX deposit of {$300.00}. 
Both from the same person. 

On XX/XX/year> I received an email from my bank Navy Federal, stating that a review of my account indicated potential suspicious activity. I called the number provided by Navy Federal and I was informed that my account was closed. 
I went to the branch the same day and received the funds in my account minus the XXXX XXXX deposits. 
I have been in contact with the sender of those deposits for the last XXXX days, and the funds have not been returned to him or myself. 

The sender did not report fraud and nor did I. Navy Federal refuses to release the funds to either party.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: Navy Federal closed the complainant's account due to suspected suspicious activity, withholding $1500 in deposits from the same sender. Despite no reported fraud, the bank refuses to release the funds to either the sender or the complainant, who have been in contact for an extended period.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative: Opened and funded new account with bonus promo code for Tradestation on XX/XX/year>. Met and exceeded all requirements for a {$150.00} bonus. Tradestation has failed to post my {$150.00} bonus. I have contacted them numerous times and haven't received the bonus I earned.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions
Narrative Summary: The consumer opened a new account with Tradestation using a bonus promo code and met the requirements for a $150 bonus. Despite multiple contacts, Tradestation failed to post the earned bonus, prompting the complaint.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I use a company called Square to charge my clients. I was paid {$290.00} for a service and paid the extra fee to have it directly deposited into my account. I never received the money. Square says they sent it, my bank shows they didn't. They gave me a number to give to the bank to look it up and they said there is no deposit for that day. It's been XXXX months and I have yet to get my money. It can't just be in limbo like this. This has been happening to so many people in the country. It's unacceptable. I need my money. I've been back and forth with both my bank and square and they just point fingers but I know something fishy is going on on Squares end. They say I need a letter from the bank showing that there was no deposit. My bank doesn't issue these letters for security purposes. The law says that the invoices should be enough. And I already sent those invoices months ago.
Narrative Summary: The complainant paid Square an extra fee for direct deposit of a $290 payment, but never received the funds. Square claims they sent the money, but the bank has no record of the deposit. The issue remains unresolved after multiple months, with both parties pointing fingers.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: I opened an account less than 30 days ago through Citizens Bank. I had one direct deposit, which I used to pay bills. This Monday ( XX/XX/20 ), they randomly closed my account. Today was my payday and my money was deposited into my account but I can't access it because my account was frozen and closed. They are giving me the runaround and telling me to call all these different numbers and contact the fraud line because my account was somehow marked as fraud, apparently. They want me to provide my account number so they can give me info but I can't even access my account number because I am LOCKED OUT OF MY ACCOUNT. AND now I won't get my money until they send me a check on XX/XX/XXXX, which is AFTER my bills are due from this paycheck period.
Narrative Summary: Citizens Bank closed the complainant's account less than 30 days after opening, citing potential fraud, and froze their funds. The account was closed on the day of a scheduled direct deposit, leaving the complainant unable to access their money and pay bills on time.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I went into the Cadence Bank location at : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX to open a 'Budget Smart Checking Account. ' Upon being assisted by the Loan Officer who so graciously assisted me with this transaction, I was informed that " I was denied for the checking account, due to an unpaid balance to another institution. '' This was not the decision of that person ( Loan Officer ) but rather that of other staff at that location. 

Per the information that is listed on their website : " https : //cadencebank.com/personal/checking/budget-smart, '' this is the exact reason why this account is offered, with only two exceptions : " Available to everyone with no incidence of conducting fraudulent activity or outstanding money owed to XXXX. '' Neither of the aforementioned conditions applies to myself, that I am aware of.
Narrative Summary: A consumer was denied a Cadence Bank "Budget Smart Checking Account" due to an unpaid balance at another institution, despite the bank's website stating the account is available to everyone except those with fraudulent activity or outstanding money owed to the bank, neither of which applies to the consumer.

Sub-issue: Fee problem
Consumer complaint narrative: Wells Fargo has refused to provide personal checks to consumers.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Wells Fargo has stopped providing personal checks to consumers, sparking a complaint. The bank's decision has left customers without a traditional means of payment, forcing them to rely on alternative methods such as digital payments or checks from third-party providers.

Sub-issue: Problem making or receiving payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a complaint against US Bank ( routing number XXXX ) regarding online account number XXXX in XXXX, Arizona. 

Supporting Information : A. I have tried to contact US Bank and it is virtually impossible to get someone to talk to because of their VRU ( Voice Response Unit ) and even when you do, the representative hangs up on you after 15 minutes of discussion after wasting much of my valuable time. The call was XXXX minutes in length on XX/XX/XXXX beginning at XXXX XXXX  MST to phone number XXXX. 

B. US Bank also does not have a secure message facility so the only way to communicate is via a voice call which is difficult when the US Bank representative hangs-up after many minutes of discussion without offering any help whatsoever. 

C. The only other way is to visit a US Bank brick and mortar location miles away which is difficult for me because I XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ergo, this is the reason I opened the account online in the first place.

The numbered paragraphs are the requirements to receive the bonus incentive : 1. You must not have a current consumer checking account or a consumer checking account in the past XXXX years and you must be the owner on the new checking account. 

I am the only owner of this account and I have never had a US Bank consumer checking account or received any kind of prior bonus from US Bank at any time. 

2. You must use the promo code when opening the checking account. 

I did use the promo code XXXX when I opened the account in XXXX. 

3. You must deposit a minimum of {$25.00} when opening the Account. 

I did deposit {$25.00} when I opened the account online see attachment 1 US Bank transaction list.

4. Additionally, you must enroll in the U.S. Bank Mobile App or online banking within XXXX days of opening your account. 

I created an online account immediately after opening the account in XX/XX/XXXX and have been actively using Online Banking since XXXX, XXXX. 




5. You must also complete XXXX or more direct deposits within 90 days of opening your account that total : {$5000.00} to {$9900.00} to earn the {$300.00} bonus or {$10000.00} or more to earn the {$500.00} bonus. 

Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX I made XXXX qualifying deposits from ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ( XXXX ) via benefits ( other XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) and ( XXXX ) federal benefit credit XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX ). these deposit totaled {$10000.00} which qualifies me for the {$500.00} cash bonus. 

6. Your checking bonus ( " adjusted interest " ) will be credited to your new checking account within 60 days following the end of the calendar month during which you completed all of the offer requirements All requirements for the {$500.00} cash bonus were met by XX/XX/XXXX and the end of that month is XX/XX/XXXX and the XXXX days from XX/XX/XXXX 60 days expired on XX/XX/XXXX. Today is XX/XX/XXXX so US Bank is delinquent in paying me my {$500.00} cash bonus promised. 

7. Account must be open and have a positive balance to receive the bonus.

As of this date, the account is open and in good standing with a current balance of {$15000.00}.

8. This offer may not be combined with any other Checking account bonus offers.

This bonus offer is not being combined with any other bonus offer. 

In conclusion, I have met all requirements for the cash bonus payment to my smartly checking account and US Bank has not yet paid me my bonus. Banks should not offer incentive bonuses and then renege on the payment of said bonus. 

Respectfully submitted, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer complaint is against US Bank for failing to pay a $500 bonus for opening a Smartly Checking Account and meeting all requirements. The account holder fulfilled the conditions by July and the 60-day payment window expired, but the bonus remains unpaid.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
Back on Monday ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I was checking the total deposits with my recent paystub from my job and I noticed that I was missing money so I dug through all of my transactions and subtracted it from all of my deposits and it gave me XXXX XXXXXXXX dollars lost so I contacted Bank of America and dispute some transactions but also asking what happened to the XXXXXXXX XXXX, they decided to dispute over 50+ transactions that totaled over XXXX dollars but I knew something was wrong so I asked them again what they're disputing and they haven't really responded to it so I decided to contact them the next day. 

In middle of that night, I got an email from them saying someone tried to use my card even though it was locked and it says it's location was " BOFA XXXX XXXX '' and so I called their credit card fraud department and they don't even know either and said that I have to call again in the morning ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and cut that card so I did, later when I used the chat feature, they said it was from XXXX and I was like " XXXX? '' because I don't know that I was paying for XXXX directly because I was using the XXXX and XXXX XXXX bundle so I guess it was nothing and then I ended the chat. A few minutes later, I got a call from them because I was complaining to them on XXXX and asked them about the disputes and we went through each of them and removed them, but I asked her what's going on with the missing XXXX dollars and they said that they don't know and I was like " You don't know? '' and they told me to check the transactions and they said it should be listed and it wasn't so I said it wasn't there and it was just ridiculous and I decided to switch to XXXX on Thursday. 

Friday comes around and I already opened a new savings account and linked my BofA accounts to them and checked the budgeting tool and yep, I was right and they were indeed missing my money, specifically {$1000.00} dollars. I haven't decided to call them again because I knew I would run into the same thing so I decided to submit this claim.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer reported missing $1000 from their Bank of America account. They contacted the bank, disputing transactions, but received unclear responses. After investigating, they found the missing amount was not listed in their transactions, leading them to switch banks and verify the discrepancy with the new bank's budgeting tool.

Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I received a debit card from Cash APP. This is the second time in 30 days an account was fraudulently opened in my name. I have never used CASH APP NOR WILL I EVER use their banking services. We spoke to XXXX to have the account closed and once again they refused to do this over the phone, they will only send an email. We provided my email multiple times and still have not received an email to close this account. My credit is frozen, my SSN locked, and I have a security freeze in place with XXXX yet someone is still able to open an account in my name with CASH APP for a second time. Please see complaint XXXX. Cash APP refuses to block my information to be used to open a new account. XXXX also hung up on us at business closing time so now we are unable to resolve this timely.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a debit card from Cash App, despite never using their services, due to a second fraudulent account opened in their name within 30 days. Cash App refused to close the account over the phone and failed to send a closure email, despite multiple requests.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative: There was {$810.00} deposited to my checking and I transfer that to my savings account which brought it up to XXXX the next Chase took the money from account and is advising that it was my fault due to transferring the money and now they would not give me the money they took from my savings I did give them any authorization to withdraw the money
Narrative Summary: A consumer deposited $810 into their checking account, transferred it to savings, but Chase withdrew the funds, claiming the transfer was the cause. The consumer disputes this, stating they gave no authorization for the withdrawal and Chase refuses to return the money.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my frustration with Truist bank. I have been banking with this company for a while & have been treated unfairly. I contacted Truist on about fraudulent charge on my account dated XXXX in the amount of {$240.00}. The charge is associated with parking boot removal fee. 

I would like to provide context for this dispute. On XXXX I parked my vehicle in a valid parking lot, which I believed to be a legitimate parking lot associated with XXXX XXXX. However, upon returning to my vehicle, I discovered that it had been booted, and I was required to pay a fee of {$240.00} to have the boot removed. 

Upon further investigation, I discovered that the company responsible for booting my vehicle is not a legitimate business operating within the city of XXXX. There were no no parking signs or subject to tow or boot notices in the parking lot, leading me to believe that my vehicle was parked legally. 

I did not receive any documentation or receipt from the company responsible for booting my vehicle, making it impossible for me to contact them to dispute the charge directly. I am unable to contact this company due to no information, I have expressed that to many different representatives that I have spoke with over the phone and have not gotten a resolution. I have been told oh well, you need to contact the merchant which I have advise they are not a real company. I even tried to dispute the charge on XXXX my account via the app. 

Once the dispute result were completed, I called to get an explanation why my account was not credited and spoke with a supervisor by the name of XXXX, who advised me this is fact was fraud and was going to be re opening my case. 

I attempted to call again on XXXX spoke with a supervisor who was very transactional & would not assist. 

I am requesting that the fraudulent charge of {$240.00} to be reversed and credited back to my account. 


Truist has been NO HELP with me getting my refund back. I have been giving the boot and pretty much an oh well, sorry not sorry
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A customer disputes a $240 parking boot removal fee on their Truist bank account, claiming the company responsible for booting their vehicle is illegitimate and didn't provide documentation or receipts. Despite multiple attempts to dispute the charge, Truist has not reversed the transaction.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. After XXXX years, I was finally approved for ss XXXX and received back pay of approximately XXXX XXXX. XXXX check I received and deposited into new chase account didn't clear the following day as expected, the branch manager explained it was odd as federal checks clear in XXXXday and there might be a problem with the check. 

XXXX. Approx XXXX days later I received a second check for the same amount with a memo in the right corner stating " replacement for XXXX check '' XXXX. Branch manager stated this is why XXXX check didn't clear, there is a problem with it, let 's get this XXXX check deposited and it should clear by morning. 

XXXX. XXXX check cleared and I began using funds I had waited for, for XXXX years. 

XXXX. Approx XXXX  days later my accounts were frozen, when I went to branch they stated the original check cleared and now my account is frozen until straightened out. 

XXXX. XXXX weeks later, chase sent me a cashiers check for the remaining amount from the check I began using. And they placed the overpayment of XXXX into a suspense account which I assumed would be returned to social security. 

XXXX. XXXX-months later, I was contacted by ss with a request to repay the overpayment of XXXX. I contacted chase who instructed me that ss needed to do a reclamation of funds. 
Ss claimed reclamations are for deceased beneficiaries, so the reclamation process couldn't be applied. However, the ss representative faxed a request as well as sent a letter to the Chase executive department recalling the funds. 
-Chase responded : they must receive an electronic request to reclaim the funds. 
-ss explained because these were paper checks an electronic request can not be made, only a manual request to reclaim funds can be sent, which is what they sent. 

XXXX. XXXX months later after hundreds of phone calls between myself, chase and ss, emails, contact with my senators office, and visits to ss offices, the department of ss has decided to withhold my only income ; my monthly social security benefits which will be applied to this overpayment that Chase Bank still has on hold in a suspense account. 
-ss claims the funds were paid to me and this is now between me and chase bank, since chase wasn't returning the money to ss. So, because the money was paid to me, they will collect it from me. 
-I can not possibly live without my monthly benefits, yet the Chase Bank Executive Department has stated they will no longer respond to me regarding this matter. 

I have requested this be escalated to the highest ranking person for immediate resolution as in XXXXdays I will not be able to pay my rent, or buy food because I will not be getting my monthly ss benefit. All my requests have fallen upon deaf ears at chase. 

No-one seems to care enough to prevent what will ultimately result in my being unable to have the basic necessities such as a roof over my head and food to live in XXXXdays. As a XXXX senior citizen, I am frantic and riddled with anxiety as I write this. 

I have all emails and letters that I can submit if necessary. I have attached XXXX document showing SS will be withholding my monthly XXXX benefit effective XX/XX/24
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a Social Security back pay check that didn't clear due to an issue. A replacement check was issued, cleared, and used. However, the original check later cleared, causing an overpayment. Chase placed the excess in a suspense account, but refuses to return it to Social Security.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I close my checking and saving accounts. At XXXXXXXX XXXX The Citi bank customer service representative told me will mail the check of {$7100.00} to my address in XXXX. XXXX. But I never got the check, at XXXX XXXX I called them again, the customer service representative told me the check was returned. And she will mail the check to my address list in XXXXXXXX XXXX.in 3-5 days, but I did not receive the check till now. 

The citi bank just cheated me, and get my money in the accounts and didnt want to return to me.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A customer closed their Citi bank accounts and was supposed to receive a $7,100 check, but it never arrived. After multiple calls, the bank claimed the check was returned and would be re-mailed, but the customer still hasn't received it, suspecting the bank of withholding their funds.

Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I logged online to move money around and noticed that 2 of my accounts showed a XXXX balance. I spent the next few hours on the phone with fraud and then the estate department. I was told that they received information that I was deceased and therefore froze my assets. They instructed me to call the SSA to confirm what they reported. The SSA did not have me reported as deceased. I was instructed by BOfA that I would need to get a letter from SSA and go into the branch to get this cleared up. After several visits, they were able to unfreeze the assets. I still have one account that I need to have fixed and have to make a third trip into the branch. I since found out that this entire situation was because someone within Bank of America mid keyed my SSN as deceased in error. I understand human error but the amount of time and energy I had to go through because of this should not have fallen on my shoulders. I want to know what they are going to do to compensate me for the time and anguish this has caused. 
They need to own their mistake and need to put safeguards in place so this doesnt happen to others.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Bank of America customer's accounts were frozen due to an error where an employee mistakenly marked their SSN as deceased. The customer spent hours on the phone and multiple branch visits to resolve the issue, seeking compensation for the time and anguish caused by the bank's mistake.

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a phone call yesterday ( XX/XX/2024 ) from the Chase XXXX office, XXXX XXXX XXXX, informing me that my Chase relationship, including personal and business relationships, has ended due to what he called potential excessive and illicit transactions. 

XXXX XXXX said the decision was final, no explanation was necessary, and there was no means of appealing. XXXX XXXX mentioned that the bank could do this because I signed a clause in the legal agreement upon opening my account with Chase. 

I then called my Chase Bank branch. I have multiple accounts there and know the staff there by first name. They called XXXX XXXX and confirmed that the action was legitimate. 

The bank then informed me that there was nothing I could do, and they suggested that I go to a competitor bank and set up an account. 

I find this excessive, unreasonable, and a complete disruption of my life. My financial life is so wrapped up in your bank that it will take me days to find suitable alternatives. 

I have not engaged in any illicit activities. However, my wife accidentally sent {$10.00} to the wrong phone number via XXXX. Could this be the reason? 

I also dont know what permanent damage this will cause to my financial reputation in the future. XXXX XXXX also didnt mention how my credit cards are managed. My wife and I have five different Chase credit cards, all managed through our checking accounts.
Narrative Summary: A Chase customer received a call stating their account was closed due to "potential excessive and illicit transactions." The customer was given no explanation or appeal option. They suspect a mistaken $10 transaction via Zelle may be the cause, and are concerned about damage to their financial reputation.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account was closed on XX/XX/XXXX. We were notified via email and said a check would be sent to our Registered Agent in 8-10 business days. 
It is now XX/XX/XXXX and no check has arrived. 
I tried multiple times to call customer service and there is no answer. I am placed into a queue and then no one ever answers and I am eventually auto-disconnected. 
I sent an additional email demanding to know where our money is and there has been no reply.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's account was closed, and they were notified a check would be sent within 8-10 business days. However, the check has not arrived, and multiple attempts to contact customer service via phone and email have been unsuccessful, with no response or resolution provided.

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: Wells Fargo closed my saving account saying it was overdrawn XXXX I deposited 2 checks in that Wells Fargo sent me for falsely opening credit monitoring account in my name then they took the funds out of my account saying that those checks were paid which they had not been.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Wells Fargo closed a savings account due to an overdraft, despite the customer depositing two checks the bank had issued for a falsely opened credit monitoring account. The bank then withdrew the funds, claiming the checks were paid, although they had not been.

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: Date : XX/XX/year> - XXXX XXXX  Amount : {$170.00} Action taken by me : Called Wells Fargo to inquire about unauthorized transaction from ATM Action taken by Wells Fargo : None
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer reported an unauthorized $170 ATM transaction and called Wells Fargo to inquire about it. However, Wells Fargo took no action to address the issue.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative: I have had my Chime account for some time and I was not able to access my account in XXXX they closed my account with over {$30000.00} ( XXXX for my business ) leaving me and my children destitute and eventually homeless. We were forced to live in my car. I had to use other emergency credit cards for food and necessities. I was unable to repay my credit cards. I was going to relocate my business to XXXX from NY and I was unable to do so ; I then had to shut down XXXX XXXX XXXX  and put everything into storage. I became unable to pay my storage unit and lost everything. I'm still trying to rebuild myself after all of this devastation. Worst of all I had to give my mother partial custody of my children because I lost the vehicle that we were living in as well.
Narrative Summary: Chime closed the complainant's account with over $30,000, causing financial devastation, homelessness, and loss of business. The sudden account closure left the complainant unable to access funds, forcing them to rely on emergency credit cards and ultimately leading to significant personal and financial losses.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I signed up for a Citi Bank promotional offer for the checking account. I completed the requirements and this has been confirmed by the bank multiple times. I was supposed to be paid {$300.00} 30 days after completion. It has been almost 3 months since and still no pay out. I have contacted the bank 3 times and I was told it was to be paid in the system no later than today. Its not in my account and in sick of this. 
Contacted Citi and received a ticket number : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX via phone was told 5 business days for payout. 
XX/XX/XXXX by chat since I wasnt paid yet and was told by the end of the month I would be paid. 
Called near the XXXX  of XXXX was told would be paid no later than XXXX of XXXX. 
It is currently XX/XX/XXXX and no pay. 
In this time I was also send a letter from Citi CONFIRMING I hit the requirements for the bonus.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer signed up for a Citi Bank checking account promotional offer, completing requirements confirmed by the bank. Despite multiple assurances, the promised $300 payout has not been received nearly 3 months after the expected 30-day payout period, despite repeated contact and a confirming letter from Citi.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: My cell phone was stolen and as a result someone used my XXXX  information to send themselves close to XXXX dollars. Chase Bank won't do anything about it because it's through a third party and XXXX won't do anything about it either. I submitted a dispute claim on Chase and they denied it the same day.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's cell phone was stolen, and the thief used their Chase card info to send nearly $XXXX to themselves. Chase denied the dispute claim, citing it was through a third party, and the third party also refused to take action.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX The claim according to your records is still being worked on ; however, Bank of America or a fraud keeps calling me, they have never called me in the past. I receive a letter by mail at my home address or you notify me by email. According to your email they ( Bank of America ) are working on the issue. 
I do not understand why they keep contacting me and leaving phony extensions because nothing is resolved until Justice is done. 
These individuals hacked my computer and used a scam to take {$950.00} from my account and are still trying to gain access to my finances. I am no longer distraught like I was on XX/XX/2022. Now I can recall everything the individual I saw that night ( my neighbor down the street XXXX who resides at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). XXXX who works with my nephew ( XXXX XXXX @ XXXX ) and the constant harassing noise in the background of the callers. Plus, the two ladies who supposedly represented XXXX XXXX XXXX ( sent to my house as a joke ). Then XXXX. XXXX XXXX telling me I am not the only one who has been scammed and some foreigner could have done it. However, the scammer followed me to XXXX and fully controlled my cell phone, house phone, and computers. They answered the questions for Bank of America because I was helpless. Then, when I tried to leave my battery was disconnected. And I had to use XXXX XXXX. The police department did not even try to verify anything because it was a foreigner. Later, every time I looked around, I was told I had money in the bank ( I wonder how the foreigner knew that? ) Also, I need to be careful of the websites I visit even if they are legit. Now, Bank of America is calling me about an issue they are still working on. Nothing is resolved until " Justice ' is served on these people when the time is right. Bank of America will never refund me because of the red tape involved A. I just want them to know I am not distraught anymore but I remember everything now and who was physically in my presence and the background voices. Also, the motive behind everything to be proven?
Narrative Summary: A Bank of America customer reports receiving calls from individuals claiming to be from the bank about an ongoing issue, despite being told the issue is still being worked on. The customer believes these calls are scams and is frustrated that their $950 loss due to hacking has not been resolved.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had my tax return direct deposited into Credit Karma Money Account. I had a trip I was taking where I was going out of the country for about a Month maybe a little over a Month. I already had my trip and everything financially covered and so I planned to leave my tax return in my account and of course if ever needed Im able to use, but fortunately and unfortunately I never needed to go into my account and use any of the funds. The day before my trip I went to a local site seeing spot where you could see the whole city, I took a short walk down a small path, and I returned back to my vehicle and the mountain was getting ready to be closed so I went ahead and started leaving off the mountain when I got to the bottom and discovered my phone and wallet were missing so when I went on that small walk on the path, someone went into my vehicle and stole my wallet and phone out of my car. I drove back up the mountain but it was already closed. I had to get a new phone the next morning and had to cancel all my cards etc. The person who stole my phone had at that point already gained access into my phone and then had access to my accounts and everything else I had on my phone, this is where they got the virtual card number to use it on XXXX XXXX to send to themselves and drain it completely. I didnt know my account was being used or anything until I got back from my trip, When I returned back from my trip, I at this point was in need to use my funds from my tax return due to over spending on my trip, the only funds I had was my tax return so I was glad to have that still, so I returned and needed to use some money and went to check my account and all of my tax return was drained from my account in only XXXX transactions my whole tax return was wiped out of my account, all XXXX transactions were from Cash App. 
My total return was {$5900.00}, All XXXX Transactions are XXXX XXXX - {$500.00} XXXX XXXX - {$500.00} XXXX XXXX - {$50.00} XXXX XXXX - {$500.00} XXXX XXXX - {$450.00} XXXX XXXX - {$110.00} XXXX XXXX - {$880.00} XXXX XXXX - {$10.00} XXXX XXXX - {$2900.00} Shown on Statement as : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX US All the Transactions show the date, the amount and then the description. 
They all say the same thing and to the same XXXX XXXX. 
Ive disputed these transactions with XXXX Credit Karma Money, they told me that this will be resolved, that if they needed to investigate more then XXXX business days then I would receive a provisional credit, they resolved it by denying every transaction saying this in a letter, We have completed our research regarding your dispute and have determined that no error occurred, Regulation E only covers unauthorized transactions. Since these are charges that you did authorize it is not considered to be fraudulent activity. 

I called them and told them that those transactions were NOT authorized and that I need them to reopen my disputes because not a single one of those are authorized, they clearly state Regulation E only covers unauthorized transactions, well those transactions are UNAUTHORIZED FRAUDULENTLY. 
They said they would send it to a team for a second review and get back to me. 
They sent me an email stating that they again found those transactions to be authorized. If Im telling them they were not authorized and they are supposed to be FDIC insured, but yet they dont want to give me back all the XXXX they are going against what Im telling them. 
I have looked up this same situation online to see if anyone has had a similar issue and its a very common issue a lot of consumers have had with their XXXX Credit Karma Money account. They never want to give anyone back their money, they deny everyones disputes and this is just unacceptable, its extremely upsetting that after discovering your account has been completely drained and as for me it was the only money I had and then to not have it and then hoping that Credit Karma would take care of it, give me back my money, and make it an easy going process, but instead they going against what we are telling them, they deny our disputes and just make it almost impossible to ever even get any of your money back. Something has to be done to stop this because Ive read a lot of reviews about the same or similar situation and they do this to everyone. 
I hope that filing this complaint helps get this to be a step for XXXX Credit Kama as a company to do right by the people that use their products.
Narrative Summary: A consumer had their tax return ($5,900) direct deposited into a Credit Karma Money Account. While traveling, their phone and wallet were stolen, allowing the thief to access their account and drain it through 9 unauthorized Cash App transactions. Credit Karma denied the consumer's dispute, claiming the transactions were authorized.

Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative: I had XXXX fraudulent charges on my XXXX account in XXXX and I notified the bank to report them. After they researched the charges they said I was on my own and that there was nothing that they could do. I even sent them emails showing that the charges were not authorized and they still would not help me or reverse the charges. One if the charges actually resulted in a {$36.00} overdraft fee which I w they held me responsible for even after I provided proof that the {$120.00} charge was unauthorized. I contacted the companies that charged my account and was promised a refund but now XXXX  months later they havent refunded the charges either. Now Truist is charging me {$10.00} a month for a blocked account that they wont unblock unless I physically step into one of their banks. I work fir a XXXX XXXX through XXXX from XXXX and on XXXX from XXXX. I do not have the ability to get into a bank branch and they are very much aware of that. At this point I just want my money from the account to be sent to my new bank account at a different bank. I have spoken with a supervisor twice today and they refuse to help me. They are basically stealing my money {$10.00} at a time. This is theft and I am not going to stand for it. I have never had such poor customer service in my whole life.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer reported unauthorized charges on their account, but the bank (Truist) refused to reverse the charges despite provided proof. The bank also charged a $10 monthly fee for a blocked account, which the consumer cannot unblock due to work constraints.

Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative: I think they trying to close my account but I owe them money but I can't sign in to my banking to pay or add money to my account
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims their bank is attempting to close their account due to an outstanding balance, but they're unable to access their online banking to make a payment or add funds, effectively blocking their ability to settle the debt.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a promotion to open a checking account at BMO bank ( Exhibit 1 ). To receive {$600.00}, the terms stated : 1. On Day 120 after account opening, your Average Collected Balance over the 120 days must be at least {$10000.00}. 
2. Have at least ten ( 10 ) electronic transactions post to the account within 120 days of account opening. 

I did not understand the meaning of Average Collected Balance and the branch manager at the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, explained that it simply means money deposited and not later returned. XXXX XXXX confirmed that I may deposit a check and that the first day of the 120 days would be on the day that the check is deposited. 

I opened the account on XX/XX/XXXX at the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and XXXX XXXX again confirmed that the check deposit would be day one of the 120 days period. I deposited a check for {$10000.00} at account opening. 

There was an issue with a charge on the account that was corrected on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX confirmed that the average collected balance would be above the required {$10000.00} [ for the {$600.00} bonus ] if the current balance was held until the end of the 120 days ( Exhibit 2 ). 

My statements ( Exhibit 3 ) show the {$10000.00} deposit on XX/XX/XXXX, eleven electronic transactions ( XXXX ) and an average balance above {$10000.00} until XX/XX/XXXX ( 123 days ). However, the bonus payout on XX/XX/XXXX was only {$400.00} instead of the expected {$600.00}. 

XXXX XXXX investigated the issue of the reduced payout and found out that he himself had received incorrect information from the bank, and that the information that he had provided in turn was incorrect. Apparently, BMO did not start the 120 days clock on the day that the check was deposited but at some later date. I assume when BMO lifted the check hold? This is not even shown on the statement! The calculated average balance was therefore somewhere between $ XXXX {$10000.00} and this only qualified for the {$400.00} bonus ( See Exhibit 1 ). 

XXXX XXXX was very sorry for the incorrect information he had provided, and he and his manager requested that I receive the missing {$200.00} for the full {$600.00} bonus ( Exhibit 4 ). 

Unfortunately, the bank refused to pay the {$200.00} despite the incorrect information that I had received ( Exhibit 5 ).
Narrative Summary: A consumer opened a BMO checking account with a promotion offering $600 for meeting certain conditions. Despite meeting the requirements, the consumer received only $400 due to BMO's incorrect calculation of the 120-day period, which started after the check hold was lifted, not on the deposit date.

Sub-issue: Unable to open an account
Consumer complaint narrative: In 2020, my debit card and cellphone were stolen and the suspect attempted to make fraudulent transactions and perform an account takeover which prompted NFCU to close my account. I realized I was not able to log in the app one morning and when I called into customer care, the representative asked me what my last transaction was. When I confirmed the last one I remember, she said that it was incorrect and that my account will be closed and Ill never be able to join NFCU again. I never got a chance to even see what the suspect had done to my account.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: A consumer's debit card and phone were stolen, prompting Navy Federal Credit Union (NFCU) to close their account due to attempted fraudulent transactions. The consumer was not allowed to access their account or see the suspicious activity before it was closed, and was also banned from rejoining NFCU.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, I went to login to my Marcus account and got the message- " your account is temporarily locked, call customer support ''. I called the number provided, thinking maybe I just needed to verify some information for security purposes. When I finally got connected, they said my account had been closed! I have a large portion of both my personal and business savings in the account, so was very alarmed at the news. I repeatedly asked why my account was closed and how I would receive my funds? They would not give me a shred of information of why the account had been closed, simply repeating that it was within their right. I asked how I would receive my funds. They said I would receive a check within 7-10 business days and would provide no further details. Despite multiple questions, all I got was " If you don't receive your money within 10 business days, give us a call. '' I asked " within 10 business day of the account closing or 10 business day of my call? '' They stated that it's within 10 business days of my call. So who knows how long my account had been closed. I never received warning or even a notification that it was closed. So apparently they just decided to close a multi-year account and hold my money until I happened to attempt a login and noticed. I can't even check my balances to make sure the amount they send me is correct. Since the the initial encounter, I have called several times and they keep changing the timeline on when I will receive my funds. I also requested my funds to be ACH transferred back to the accounts I initially deposited them to. I emphasized that I didn't want them to mail the majority of my savings in a check format, but they refused and said a check was the only option. I want my money back from this dishonest company! Since it happened to me, I have done research and read many similar scenarios of Marcus holding people 's funds recently.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's Marcus account was closed without notice or explanation, and they were told to wait 7-10 business days for a check refund. Despite multiple calls, the company refused to provide details on the account closure or offer alternative refund methods, such as ACH transfer.

After digging info and finding out what I just explained to you I emailed them with concerns of why the wait until the XXXX and technically that same day I did have sufficient funds. I cant control the timing of the day when you request payment. Because in the contract they are responsible for error with only exception if insufficient funds it will not go thru. And showed them a copy of my account and the dates with sufficient funds. No reply from them. Instead I get a call, text, email every single day how I missed a payment and to call to speak to represenitive. 
I have not done so

Consumer complaint narrative:
On Thursday XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited a check into NAVY FCU at the branch located XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The check is my XXXX XXXX from the XXXX XXXX XXXX and reflects that it is from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' I called and informed them the check is a XXXX XXXX check and reminded them that per their Funds Availability Schedule they are required to release XXXX XXXX  check XXXX after the deposit date. 
Next-Day Availability. 
BELOW IS THE FUNDS AVAILABILITY SCHEDULE : Funds from the following deposits are available on ( or before ) the first Business Day after the day we are considered to have received your deposit : U.S. Treasury Checks that are payable to you Received electronic payments, such as wire transfers, and Automated Clearing House ( ACH ) credits Checks drawn on any bank, {$220.00} or less On-us checks deposited at a Navy Federal branch office or at a Navy Federal ATM located inside or within XXXX feet of a Navy Federal branch office. 
If you make a deposit in person to a MSR at a branch, funds from the following deposits are also available on the first Business Day after the day we are considered to have received your deposit : State and local government checks that are payable to you Cashiers, certified, and tellers checks that are payable to you Federal Reserve Bank checks, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX checks, and postal money orders, if these items are payable to you Cash Other on-us checks

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a registered letter from an Attorney dated XX/XX/XXXX, ( see item A ). Please keep in mind I usually only get magazines and my Fifth Third statements to the Business address, and since our loan was on auto pay I usually picked up the mail every 1 to 2 months, ( see item XXXX ). I immediately called the number and asked for the ( Name Removed ) I was told to ask for and asked her what this was all about. All she said was that I HAD to speak with another person ( Name Removed ). I called asked him what this was all about and he said it was my Commercial loan and that the Commercial Loan Dept. decided to demand payment on this loan. I asked what loan, he just said it was my commercial loan for {$10000.00}. I asked if it was the one that they only take the interest payment of {$85.00} per month and he said no not that one. I told him that we had no other loans and I was very confused and that we needed more information, but he did not provide anything further. 

( Name Removed ) was very rude, condescending, would not listen or answer any questions. I started to feel like this was a SCAM since no real banker would speak to a customer that way. ( Name Removed ) went on to say not to call him via phone, best way contact him would be by email. I immediately called my XXXX branch to verify his status with XXXX. I was passed from person to person no one could verify who he was. I was transferred to commercial loan dept and spoke with a nice woman, ( Name Removed ) she said she would look into it and let me know. I did not get a response back from her so a few days later I called her back and was told she was able to locate this man and that he was a real VP of XXXX in Florida Commercial Loan Dept. This woman ( Name Removed ) also emailed me a copy of what she found regarding the loan, ( see item B ). 

I, again, asked ( Name Removed ) for more information and a copy of the loan. In the beginning ( Name Removed ) stated the loan was for {$10000.00}. ( Name Removed ) finally sent us a copy of the loan agreement, ( see item C ) and it WAS the loan we thought it was. We tried to explain that we had never been late or missed a payment so why was this happening? All he would say is ( Name Removed, can I expect payoff this week? ( see item D ). Unfortunately, I was shocked to see he wanted this paid this week. After receiving that request I sat down and tried to figure out about what I could comfortably pay. ( see item XXXX ) which says : Just a quick email to let you know, I have assessed my finances and we are able to pay {$150.00} to {$200.00} per month with no issues. Please let us, if acceptable, know how we can get this started. You are welcome to check our accounts to verify our income and payments. As you can see my property tax went from {$500.00} + to now over {$800.00} a month. 

( Name Removed ) came back with ( see item F ). which says, ( Name Removed ), that's not going to work. We need paid with next 60 days at the most I can give you. The companies out of business. This is not a consumer debt, its commercial and there are rules and guidelines we have to follow especially when the company is out of business. You need to talk to family and friends finance companies etc. Let me know y XX/XX/XXXX. Thanks ( see item G ) for my response, which says Unfortunately, as I stated previously, I have no funds available the only way possible to pay this off is to make payments. Fifth Third is and has been my financial Institution. Production Turning, being closed since Covid still made the payments on the loan and when the payments stopped I assumed it was paid off. I need to get more details regarding that loan.

After this message from ( Name Removed ), I started to feel he was catching on to what I was saying. ( see item H ) which says Can you pay a couple thousand down and pay roughly {$600.00} over 12 months?

At this point we were going in 10 different directions trying to do what he was telling us to do trying to find out WHY this was happening. Then I received out of office responses saying he would be out of the office but would be checking his emails. ( see item I ). 

Now here is the kicker, ( Name Removed ) asked us what we could pay, since I am on limited income I told him about {$200.00} per month, he came back and said that isn't going to work and he could allow up to 60 day to pay it off and said we should contact friends, family and our financial institution for help. Well XXXX is our financial institution, but that will probably be changing very soon. WHAT, he doesn't have a very long attention span. He also said later that we could pay {$2000.00} down and then {$600.00} per month for a year. Which would equal {$9200.00}. We figured we could some how make that happen. But still wanting to know WHY. Then ( Name Removed ) completely ruined us!!! Caused us sever embarrassment. On XX/XX/XXXX I opened my personal checking account online to see that over {$7000.00} had been transferred out of my personal checking account. I am XXXX years old and really thought I was headed to the hospital. We have most of our bills on auto pay because we really trusted XXXX. They are all being kicked back to my creditors, my electric, cell phone, gas, XXXX XXXX XXXX and my loyal, wonderful bank is charging me overdrafts and late fees and when the money ran out of my checking they emptied my savings All of this happened so fast, changed constantly, and I didn't know what was going on then to loose over {$9000.00} on a loan that was not in default nor did it mature until XXXX of XXXX. But it just gets better from there. We had about {$1800.00} left in ( Name Removed ) business account and guess what poof it was taken also. 


This is NO WAY to show loyalty to your loyal customers. Now, you have caused me to look like a loser to my monthly payees. I am totally embarrassed and humiliated. Why did this happen Here is something else that XXXX did not do their job. On this loan when the first payment was mad via auto pay, I noticed the payment was only {$85.00} and went back to the branch spoke with XXXX, manager at the time at the ( Name Removed ) Branch. I explained that we would never get it paid off at that rate and was told she would take care of it I asked for an additional {$200.00} to come out. XXXX said ok. Next month noticed another {$80.00} was taken out nothing more. So I called and explained to the girl on the phone what had happened she said ( Name Removed ) no longer works there and she couldn't do it because it is a commercial loan and referred me to ( Name Removed ) the new manager. Spoke with him said he would check into it and get back to me. Next month same thing, I let it go a few months no change called again, was told ( Name Removed ) no longer worked there and I needed to speak to ( Name Removed ). what a mess. Oh and ( Name Removed ) was only there a very short time too. 


I was not allowed to transfer money into it because it had to be auto paid. I tried several times to add money to this loan ... ..no one would help. So that is why it is such a low amount. 

In summarizing this experience : ( Name Removed ), I do not know what to do! I am totally shocked over all of this. I am reaching out to you to find out why and how this came about and how it can be fixed. I certainly do not know how I can ever trust Fifth Third Bank again. 

This is what has happened to my bank accounts ; I had {$7000.00} taken. Once that was emptied, I see my savings account was transferred out to pay for overdrafts. WHAT that was {$910.00} and wasn't my doing. So far lost {$7900.00}. Someone must have noticed there was money in my XXXX account {$1700.00} and decided to grab that too. They did however credit back some interest and I have {$32.00} left. Making the total taken from me me {$9600.00}. So far. 

Some of my questions are : How was I given 60 days and then 13 days later I was broke? 
I was even offered {$2000.00} down and {$600.00} a month for over 12 months??? 
Don't your offices work together? One says one thing and the other does something completely different. Someone needs a lot more training!! 
Why was I not notified of the pending disaster? 
Why was a lawyer involved? 
Why did a man from Florida, ( Name Removed ) deal with my account? 
Why was my local branch not aware of this? 

FACTS : Loan was on auto pay Options offered by ( Name Removed ) kept changing.

Loan not in default Never a late payment! 
Loan to be paid off by XX/XX/XXXX I appreciate the time you have spent on the above issues. I feel I am one of your more loyal customers and look forward to your response regarding this problem. 

UPDATE : After I sent this information to the President of the Bank, I received a notice that the money would be put back in my account, which it was. BUT IT WOULD BE FROZEN until this is worked out ... ... NOW WHAT?
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a registered letter from an attorney demanding payment on a commercial loan with Fifth Third Bank. The consumer was confused as they had been making interest-only payments of $85/month and had never missed a payment. The bank's representative offered varying payment options, but ultimately withdrew over $9,000 from the consumer's accounts without warning, causing overdrafts and late fees.

Their call center said that they will issue a check. After XXXX  days, XX/XX/XXXX, we did a follow up. We were told that it wasn't processed. We accepted our fate and were told to wait XXXX. So I asked the assigned XXXX named XXXX XXXX badge # XXXX ) what about XX/XX/XXXX? I didn't call just to say Hi? He couldn't tell me the history on that conversation for that date. But confirmed that a call was processed. It also clearly stated that it's a recorded conversation. Now he's telling me to wait another 10 days. It's not fair for that company to hold on to that money for this long while the other account is accumulating daily APR. We're retirees and money is tight for us. Their incompetence cost us great deal, financially and emotionally. Everyday waiting for that check to arrive. He even refused to expedite our request and insisted nothing he could do for " their '' mistake. I'm extremely disappointed.

Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: My last payment of a ) 5 interest purchase was sent on Wednesday XX/XX/year>, marked as received on Thursday XX/XX/year> through my bank. Due date of the payment was Saturday XX/XX/year>. The payment was posted to the card when they processed their transactions on Monday XX/XX/year>. I have used this timing for payments in the past with this credit card and have had no issues. A late fee was assessed to my account. I contacted them and they waived it as a " courtesy ''. A few days later I see a {$2.00} interest charge due to the late processing of my last payment for the 0 % interest term. I contacted them again to waive the {$2.00} which should not have been charged as the payment was submitted and received by the due date otherwise it would not have been applied to my account on that Monday. The CC company told me I needed to make my payments at least 10 days prior to the due date. In the world of immediate payments that we now have, this is ridiculous. I instructed them to close my account. I asked them to log a formal complaint which they told me I needed to do in writing only. I feel that they should have to log a complaint in any format that it is received. XXXX  XXXX, chat, email, or letter. They need to be held to a higher standard and they need to be accountable for their processes, especially when they negatively affect the consumer. I would like an investigation into their practices and fees, including late fees and interest on the late fees and balances which should not have been considered past due. I would expect this to be a pervasive issue which has been going on for a long time.

The credit card company refused to waive the charge, advising payments be made 10 days prior to the due date. The consumer disputes this policy and requests an investigation into the company's practices.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I noticed a reoccurring charge of {$150.00} for a XXXX subscription that occurs in XX/XX/2023, the same time as many other charges that happen during holiday shopping. I knew this should not be since I already pay for a XXXX subscription that occurs as a monthly charge and is a legacy bundle, so the price should be cheaper than the yearly price I am charged. 

Speaking to XXXX, the company that was used for online shopping, XXXX, the merchant in question, and Chase XXXX the bank that holds my credit card, we eventually came to the conclusion that the payments have been made in the past and are using my XXXX account for this account. I do not access to it, nor do I know who would, but is not set to my current home address or previous home address and the account is using my funds to pay that unknown subscription. So both Chase and XXXX have concluded that the account must be fraudulent. In this case, XXXX immediately cancelled the questionable subscription and cancelled the payment as well. 

These talks, however, did not include so much of XXXX help. In the time from XXXX to early XXXX, XXXX has not helped in gathering any sort of information to reach said conclusion. In fact, they were not able to provide any information except stating that the reoccurring annual charges have been present for at least 2 years and each time, the amount had been paid. They were unhelpful with any forms of communication with me and my bank, giving conflicting and misleading information that dragged investigations on much longer than needed. 

For example, they would continually not give any information to myself stating only my bank ( Chase ) was allowed to contact them to get sensitive information. However, when Chase would contact them, they stated they could not talk to them because the information pertaining to me was sensitive information and they could not disclose this to anyone except myself. And when I would contact XXXX again stating everything they have told myself and Chase, they would repeat what they said earlier : they can not talk to me and will only disclose information with my card holder Chase. And this circling of information would continue over and over again. 

Another example, when I had called Chase enough times stating the contradicting information from above, Chase would conference me into a call with XXXX. The first phone number Chase was left with from XXXX was actually to another bank that had no affiliation to my XXXX account or my payment history. The second time, the XXXX agent then tried to hang up and tell me to call back without the Chase agent because they could not disclose my bank information with another party present, even though it was the bank in question. And when they reluctantly agreed to have a conversation with the two of us present, they said they could not look into the payment information of the charge in question because I/we needed to speak with the merchant who is demanding the payment and would not look into the matter themselves. When trying to ask why they would not or why they have not, they would shut down the conversation and proceed to hang up. A future call to them with a different agent had the line immediately disconnect as soon as they picked up, which would happen if the XXXX agent consciously hung up on us. All Chase agents who were helping me with the case all noted how unhelpful XXXX was being during the investigation. 

But even in the very end with speaking with all parties, XXXX would not disclose any helpful information in a possibility of a fraudulent purchase. And with XXXX not disclosing any information, Chase refused to move forward, even with their own evidence showing XXXX stonewalling, avoiding conversations, and even lying about forms of communication. What makes the investigation between both parties even more frustrating is that, without my intervention, neither institution would speak to the merchant that was supposedly asking for money XXXX. 

Through the investigation, I spoke with XXXX agents over and over again over the same unknown account. Although they have a policy where they can not disclose the information about the account ( except that they are using my payment method for their account ), and they have another policy that they can not disclose any written information and therefore must contact XXXX for their own notes on the case, they did say they were open for communication for the case and provided me with case numbers that could be used to refer back to their notes taken on the case. And each time I tried to speak to XXXX and Chase to provide the information I gathered from XXXX and even provide the case numbers for our conversation ( and even took screenshots of an online text conversation with a XXXX agent before the chat was closed and deleted on my end ), neither XXXX or Chase would take my information and contact XXXX to learn more from the company rather than myself, a biased 3rd party that could potentially provide skewed information that would need to be looked into anyway which would ultimately lead to the opening talks with XXXX if they actually followed through in their investigations. But XXXX  said, again, they would only speak with the bank. And Chase would not take the information I provided, stating it was not enough to go off of and would only accept information from XXXX and that XXXX should contact them. 

In the end, in the very end of all this at the early part of XXXX, I tried to appeal to say that at the very least, I should not be charged for the one annual charge in XXXX because XXXX is no longer asking for that money. The moment the investigation opened up on a fraud account, the fee was cancelled ( and the account was closed ). When I tried to tell this information to XXXX, they stated that this was a matter then between myself and my bank as XXXX is a 3rd party that does not handle money directly and only sends payment requests to banks. Chase, however, states that the request has been made by XXXX who is acting on behalf of XXXX and XXXX has demanded the money and with the current way these transactions are handled, Chase has already paid XXXX and therefore XXXX is responsible for cancelling the payment and/or returning the money. And just like before, when trying to relay what one says about the other, both parties refuse to move forward in the investigation until one opens communication with the other. And from there, neither of them have tried to contact the other and I have been left with a fraud case against my credit. 

After 4 tiring months of investigation with neither Chase nor XXXX offering proper help for a charge that has obvious signs of fraud tied to it, I could not get either side to help me with my financial crisis. To protect my credit, I dropped communication with both sides, paid the amount due on my card, and removed my card information from the XXXX account ( it is still alive to continue to have access to payment history with that account ) and have locked away the card to no longer be used in the future ( I do not have a bank account with Chase, so I am cutting ties with them as much as I can without harming my credit ). When the reports with CFPB are submitted, reviewed and closed, I will close the XXXX account officially and will let the credit line with Chase run dry until the account is deemed dormant and closes.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported a recurring $150 charge for a subscription they already pay for at a lower rate. After investigation, Chase and the merchant concluded the account was fraudulent. However, XXXX (the online shopping platform) was unhelpful, providing conflicting information and refusing to disclose details, hindering the investigation.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a dispute for XXXX x fraudulent charges of {$200.00} each which were made on XX/XX/XXXX. This was on my Citi Bank XXXX XXXX. 

The charges have showed up as " disputed amounts '' and " unsettled ' on every credit card statement since then, and since they are disputed, no payment was required. I never received any information on the investigation from the bank despite numerous calls to follow up on the progress. 

In XXXX of XXXX, over a year later, the charges on my statement switched from " unsettled '' to " settled '' in the cardholder 's favor. However, my credit card balance also changed from {$0.00} to {$400.00}. I was not made aware of this, and only discovered this when I was emailed in XXXX of XXXX that I was late on a payment. Please note this is a corporate credit card, so I hardly use it and was shocked I owed money on it. 

I called the bank to ask why the charges were settled in my favor yet are now showing up as " past due amounts ''. They stated that perhaps a credit was given in the past for the charges and they would look into it. I've looked through every statement since XXXX of XXXX and at no point was a credit added to my account. 

Now, I have an outstanding balance of {$400.00} since XXXX of XXXX, and an additional late payment charge of {$10.00} on my account. Every time I've called the bank, they tell me it will be resolved within the week but the issue still persists, and I'm worried it will impact my credit.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputed $400 in fraudulent charges on their Citi Bank credit card. Despite the charges being marked as "settled in the cardholder's favor," the balance was later changed to $400, and the consumer was charged a late fee without notification or a credited refund.

Sub-issue: Overcharged for something you did purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX has been wrongfully charging my credit card after multiple attempts with emails to get them to stop. 
This has been going on for 4 - 6 months and continues every month even after repeatedly requesting they refund the amount and stop charging me and they have done neither. 
-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - Here are the bot emails I have received from billing but I am still getting charged. 
I have been charged again this month. 
Inbox XXXX  Support XXXX Thu, XXXX XXXX, XXXX to me Hi there, This is our friendly XXXX  confirming we received the following message via our Contact Form : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX UTC  I keep being charged every month even after it's been canceled months ago. Can you please fix this. My email is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX current response time is around 24 hours, though we will get back to you faster when possible! 

In the meantime you might find what you're looking for in the XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Have a great day! 

- Your friendly neighborhood XXXX! 

P.S. Normally we shy away from automated messaging like this because it feels impersonal. However, we've heard from many customers that they like confirmation that we received the request. Dont worry, a human will be in touch with you soon! 

[ XXXX ] XXXX  Support XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX to me Hi XXXX, Thanks for reaching out. My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I understand that you were charged on your account despite canceling your paid plan. I'm here to help you out. 

Upon checking the XXXX account under your email address, I didn't find any recent charge on your billing page. 
Link XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( view larger ) It could be possible that another XXXX account is currently on a paid subscription using your payment method, I can track down the email address on file by your card payment details. 

Please share the following details about the card you used to pay for Zapier : Last four digits of the long card number Expiry date on the card Full name on the card Date and amount of the last payment you made to us If you used your XXXX account, please provide the following : XXXX Invoice ID XXXX email address Date and amount of last Zapier charge To locate the Invoice ID in XXXX : Log into your XXXX account Click Activity ( near the top of the page to see your most recent account activities ) Search for the transaction Click the transaction to bring up payment details including the Invoice ID ( its a XXXX string made up of both letters and numbers ). If youre on the mobile app, it might be down at the very bottom of a transaction. 

I'll be looking forward to your reply. Please let me know if you have any other concerns. 

Kind regards, -- XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX Need help or inspiration? Check out our Help Center and XXXX XXXX! 

[ XXXX ] XXXX  Support XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX to me Hi there XXXX, This is our friendly Zapbot again, checking-in on your latest support request : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX UTC I keep being charged every month even after it's been canceled months ago. Can you please fix this. My email is XXXX XXXX XXXX It looks like XXXX sent a reply, and we wanted to check-in to see if you needed any extra support. 

If you do, please reply back here when you get chance. If we dont hear back from you in a few days, well mark your request as solved. 

Have a great day! 
- Your friendly neighborhood XXXX!
Narrative Summary: The consumer is being wrongfully charged by XXXX every month despite multiple email requests to stop and refund. This issue has persisted for 4-6 months, with automated and human support responses failing to resolve the issue.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

Consumer complaint narrative:
Apple Card company purposly refuses to provide me a monthly bill. Apple Card purposly refuses to change my contact information. Apple Card purposly refuses to provide me a way to monitor my account unless I own an iPhone, which I do not. I believe this company is doing this in an attempt to charge interest to uneducated customers. I have never missed a month payment, but I am unaware and uninformed by the company of when my payments are even due, charges on my card and or any information pertaining to the card. 

Apple Card refused to change my phone number and instead insisted on giving a quiz that did not have any correct answers. Apple Card representative called my phone number and asked me if I have ever went by any other name which I have never.

Key issues include: refusal to change contact info, no alternative to iPhone for account monitoring, and inability to access payment due dates and charges despite a perfect payment history.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: Since XX/XX/2020 I have been fighting with US Bank ReliaCard my pua which was put on a US Bank ReliaCard was compromise from XX/XX/2020 to XX/XX/2020 for 4 years now I've tried to get my money it was compromised for over {$18000.00} all of the transactions were done over the internet and out of the country they have ruled it not fraudulent but the problem is I called all the vendors and the vendors told me that they had to receive paperwork from US Bank ReliaCard saying that I had filed fraud on the transaction and that they could not reimburse my money because I could double dip and get money from them and US Bank ReliaCard I have written letters I have submitted paperwork I have done everything that I need to do on my end and I am getting absolutely nowhere I just talked to them the other day and they told me someone was supposed to call me back within 3 days no one has called me they have my correct phone number they have my correct address I made sure that I need my money it almost bankrupt me I received pua but I never got to spend any of the money I ordered new cards every time I got a transaction but the problem was the hackers had my routing and my accounting number so getting a new card did not do me any good because my account was still being hacked when I had a new card in the mail will you please help me get my money I really need it the email that is touched to my account is XXXX, the phone number attached to it is XXXX and the address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ohio XXXX thank you I hope you can get my money back for me cuz I truly need it
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims their US Bank ReliaCard was compromised from 2020, resulting in over $18,000 in unauthorized transactions. Despite contacting vendors, who require US Bank's confirmation of a filed fraud claim to reimburse, the bank has not assisted, leaving the consumer without their PUA funds.
