Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative: I made a purchase on my Citibank credit card XX/XX/XXXX regarding an on going service issue I had with the retailer Sears since XXXX of XXXX. The total amount charged in XXXX was {$410.00} and was to cover the cost of parts and service for an in home repair to be made by Sears. It has now been 5 months since my purchase and 7 months since my initial agreement with Sears. I have reached out to sears numerous times to schedule appointments and they just keep cancelling and rescheduling. No one ever shows up. They are taking full advantage of the elderly and it is wrong. I finally filed a dispute with Citibank to not pay this charge as the part has still not been installed and there is no way to return the part. Citibank originally said they could not continue with my dispute because sears provided proof that the part was installed. I responded saying the only proof they showed was that the part was delivered to my house, no proof of install and no proof of a technician coming to my home. Citibank is now saying it is XXXX terms and conditions to not reverse the charge because the merchant is choosing not to return the money. Citibank then gave me a number for a different department at sears and said this is how you can contact them for return. Ive reached out to sears again and they want their part returned but will not refund the money. So I asked Citibank to refund my card should I return the part and sears not refund the money and Citibank said this dispute is closed and there is nothing they can do because of the terms and conditions XXXX has in place.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer paid $410 on their Citibank credit card for Sears in-home repair services in XXXX. Despite multiple attempts, Sears failed to complete the repair, and Citibank initially denied the dispute, citing Sears' proof of delivery. The consumer argues that delivery does not equal installation.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Citibank made an unauthorized debit from my bank account in the amount of over {$9000.00}. Records show that I make payments of amounts under {$20.00} per day, and have never authorized a payment that exceeds the amount in my bank account. Citibank reps said their records showed that I had authorized it via my mobile app. Turns out, Citibank has access to my account and can make activity logs look like I authorized the payments ( most centralized banks do ). 

Citibank decided to abuse these privileges of being a centralized bank and debit money from my bank account such that it went down to XXXX dollars and went into thousands of dollars of overdraft. Thankfully my bank XXXX XXXX did not immediately release the payment to Citibank, and I was able to request a stop payment in time. XXXX XXXX also approved of my claim that the amount was not authorized by me because they saw the consistent daily payments to Citibank in the amounts of under {$20.00} per day, which didn't match the behavior of authorizing a payment of $ XXXX that would set my account to XXXX dollars and into overdraft. 

Per XXXX XXXX, Citibank 's actions constitute fraudulent unauthorized access and payment request, and the public should know about it. No bank is perfect, but at least XXXX XXXX was more organized and quick in its handling of the situation and restored my bank account by returning the funds back to my account. Citibank 's representatives are also badly trained to not care about the customer. Some of them do not transfer to the correct department and are very lazy and unethical, which is reflective of high up management. 

Even with AI, the organization, security and ethics will get worse, and I can how Citibank and other banks too might become lazier and more despondent as the people who work there depend more and more on AI, thereby getting XXXX XXXX XXXX adding to the increased entropy of disorganization, dysfunction, and corruption -- all AI assisted. 

Dependence on technology and AI without considering security and access controls from the inside of the bank may very well be the cause of the downfall of Citibank. Citibank deserves their fate and its impending doom, as NY attorney general XXXX XXXX and the hundreds of thousands of customers who lost money ( and have not been made whole ) through Citibank 's data breach ( probably from lack of insider access control ) and people like myself who have experienced unauthorized activity from Citibank itself are all aware that Citibank is the most unethical big bank of them all. Citibank is set to blame itself and they are now receiving tenfold of payback of the amount of nastiness, corruption, greed, and abuse they have committed against customers.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Citibank made an unauthorized debit of over $9,000 from the complainant's account, despite a history of daily payments under $20. Citibank claimed the complainant authorized the payment via their mobile app, but the complainant's bank disputed this, citing the unusual transaction amount and approving a stop payment.

Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a promotional balance on on Overstock credit card that was due on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX I called into make my payment and choose the option to pay my balance in full. I did this and was provided a confirmation number # XXXX that my balance of {$610.00} was paid in full. I have now been issued a late fee of {$37.00}. I have called 3 times to ask for this to be removed and they say they can't do this as the account is closed. I spoke to Bread Financial, the parent company and they also refused to help. I am asking for a refund of the late fees and for my account to be looked at, as they didn't provide options for auto pay and made it difficult for me to make payments, so I also had other fees due to this. Thank you for your help.
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid their Overstock credit card balance in full on time, receiving a confirmation number, but was still charged a $37 late fee. Despite multiple calls, the company and its parent, Bread Financial, refused to remove the fee, citing the account is closed.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Unexpected increase in interest rate
Consumer complaint narrative: With Chase bank, I am enrolled into their " My Chase Plan '' program, where a payment plan can be set up for certain payments, with a monthly fee incurred. That monthly fee is wrapped up into the monthly payment and is not charged separately. Currently, I have 2 payments, one that charges XXXX XXXXXXXX and one that charges XXXX XXXX  Under the plan and that specified payment amount, it says " This includes the monthly fee ''. However, for the first time since I've had this card open, Chase charged me an additional fee for each of those plans. For reference, the fee for those plans are {$36.00} and {$2.00}. My monthly payment total should be {$180.00} with the fees included ; however, this month they double charged me these fees and now my total amount due is {$220.00}. They are claiming to have opened a case to look into this further and have not offered any solutions. This is a company that is looking to make a profit, so I'm not sure why their " we look into our wrong-doing and found nothing wrong '' approach thinks would work.
Narrative Summary: Chase Bank's "My Chase Plan" program double-charged a customer $38 ($36 + $2) in monthly fees, increasing their total due from $180 to $220, despite the fees being included in the original payment plan. Chase claims to be investigating but has not offered a solution.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Other problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
For two weeks now, I have been unable to access my account information on Chase 's partner environment ( Amazon ). 

I attempted to reach out to both Chase and Amazon. Neither side understands the problem nor is willing to solve this issue. Chase customer service response to this problem misses the key problem. I will reiterate the problem statement here. 

The problem statement is " We're unable to verify your account with Chase right now. Please try again. If issues persist, contact Chase for assistance. '' I have been encountering this issue every day for two weeks.
Narrative Summary: A consumer is unable to access their Chase account information on Amazon's partner environment, receiving an error message saying "We're unable to verify your account with Chase." Despite contacting both Chase and Amazon, the issue persists, and neither company is willing to resolve it after two weeks.

Ive been trying since XXXX to get this all straighten out and everyone keeps pointing there blame for it on someone else chime says its the bureau reporting at blame and the credit bureau says chime needs to report the correct information and Im stuck in a merry go round of very bad customer service with chime.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's Chime credit card builder account was closed in 2024, but Chime continues to report it as open to the credit bureaus, despite the consumer's repeated requests for correction and disputes filed through the credit bureau.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I submitted online for a Capital One XXXX XXXXXXXX card due to the advertised cash bonus of {$200.00} for spending a minimum of {$500.00} in the first 90 days of card issuance. Along with this offer by Capital One was a free XXXX XXXX account on the card up to XX/XX/2024. 

I was approved instantly online. About a week later, I received the physical card in the mail. Upon setting up the card, I signed up for XXXX XXXX and have been routinely receiving the membership fee reimbursement in the form of a statement credit from Capital One XXXX XXXXXXXX. So that left the other {$200.00} cash bonus which I had spent {$500.00} within the first month, and paid it off in full. I was supposed to receive this {$200.00} cash bonus by meeting that {$500.00} threshold within the first 90 days, but when I called into XXXX to inquire why I did not receive the {$200.00} cash bonus they said that I didn't " qualify ''. I then had asked to speak to a supervisor. Then the phone customer service rep told me the supervisor or higher-up would contact me via email in 2 weeks by XX/XX/2024 explaining why. Today, XX/XX/2024 I just received that return phone call by someone from Capital One leaving a voicemail to call the back at the general automated customer service number XXXX. I also just received an email today stating : << '' Thank you for contacting us regarding your rewards! 

We have reviewed your request to be awarded a bonus and found that your account does not qualify based on the terms of the product for which you applied. 

Remember, you still earn 1 % cash back ( more in select categories ) for every dollar you spend on purchases! " XXXX I am certain and sure I had signed up for the {$200.00} cash bonus offer through XXXX. See here : XXXX XXXX XXXX I also XXXX the XXXX XXXXXXXX offer and everywhere it states there is a {$200.00} cash bonus for spending {$500.00} in the first 90 days. It is universally everywhere. So for Capital One to renege on what is false promotion if they don't honor the advertised {$200.00} cash bonus is just plain deceptive and wrong. 

Please assist me on this matter in getting this right and holding Capital One to their honor and advertised words. 

Thank You, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer applied for a Capital One card with a $200 cash bonus for spending $500 in the first 90 days. Despite meeting the requirement, they were denied the bonus, with Capital One stating their account "does not qualify" without explanation.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Old information reappears or never goes away
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a JPMCB credit card that was closed 2 years ago on XX/XX/2022. JPMCB is still reporting it as if it is still open and it is affecting my credit score. I thought after 2yrs this would no longer be the case. My understanding is that this is illegal.
Narrative Summary: JPMCB credit card was closed in 2022, but 2 years later, the company still reports it as open, negatively impacting the consumer's credit score, which the consumer believes is illegal.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Company Chase Card Services Charge : Credit Card Charge XXXX for {$1100.00} on XX/XX/2023 Charge Reinstated during month of XXXX Description of the event : During a recent trip to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2023 I visited a XXXX called XXXX XXXX address : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX At this XXXX I ordered a couple of drinks and XXXX for a while. While I was XXXX I was approached by someone who falsely claimed to work at that XXXX They proceeded to ask if I would like to close out XXXX XXXX tab. As it was later in the night, and I was not feeling great because of some stomach trouble I decided it was a good time to close my tab. 


They had a card reader with them and I paid via XXXX XXXX. They Left the XXXX  ; I proceeded to pack my things and was then asked while leaving by the XXXX XXXX to close out my tab. I explained that I had already paid. The bartender informed me that the person who I paid does not work at that XXXX and had to close my tab. I looked around for the person who pretended to work there but was unable to find him. The next couple of days I was stuck at my hotel with very bad XXXX XXXX 

My chase card is my most used card, since the payment was via XXXX XXXX, I knew they did not have my credit card information to steal additional funds. 

A police report was not filed in XXXX as I had to leave in a couple of days and most of the rest of my trip was spent stuck in my hotel room fighting XXXX XXXX 

On the XXXX of XX/XX/2023 I called Chase card services to report the fraudulent charge. After speaking with the fraud agent, it sounded like a clear-cut case and no further action was needed on my behalf. Had the chase agent notified me that I needed to provide more information I would have gladly but the charge was removed and I assumed all was well. 

Post Event DetailsXXXX XXXXChase Card services failed to notify me that the charge was being reinstated on my credit card. 
-The charge was reinstated over the 60-day limit within the first billing error and report XXXXCredit Card was put over limit due to this charge impacting my credit score. 
-First Call to Chase Card Services notified me that I would receive a call back within a business day. 
-Second phone call notified me that it could take up to 5 business days and that I should have filed a police report in XXXX even though that was not prompted by the original call made on the XXXX of XX/XX/2023. 
-Third phone call I was told again that I should have filed a police report in XXXX even though this was never prompted before on the first call. 
-A formal complaint was later mailed to Chase Card Services notifying them that the charge was fraudulent and for any supporting evidence of the charge to be sent to me. 
-A letter was mailed by chase notifying me that they will not notify the credit bureaus with a correction to the charge. 
-A phone voice message was received telling me that they are not going to resolve the fraudulent charge.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported a $1,100 credit card charge to Chase Card Services after being scammed by an individual claiming to work at a bar. The charge was initially removed but reinstated without notification, putting the account over limit and impacting the credit score.

Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have several store credit cards that are serviced through this one bank. Recently the bank stated that they would be charging for the monthly paper statements. I called them to change to an electronic statement, and they said I had to go online myself to do it.

I feel that they should be able to handle this change over the phone without me going online. I depend upon the mailed statement to show all account activity.in one glance. They are charging a fee for the paper statement. I feel that they are making it harder for the consumer to see their accounts. They are also creating a problem with the payments process. It makes it easier for the consumer to be late with the payment, and when they are, they will be charged a late fee. This whole situation could be eliminated by providing the previously free paper statement. These banks are great at coming up with ways to charge the consumer new fees. Thanks for your time and your help. Respectfully, XXXX
Narrative Summary: A bank began charging for monthly paper statements and requires customers to opt-out online for electronic statements. The complainant feels this process is inconvenient and intentionally designed to generate late fees, as they rely on paper statements to track account activity and make timely payments.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Add-on products and services
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been trying for over a year to cancel a product service called XXXX XXXX. They span you to enroll then make it impossible to unenroll from denying all 2 step verification with the exception of email verification that's not even an option. They have links that say that you can use 2 step verification by authorizing s new phone number, that doesn't work either. They won't let you change phone numbers! There are numerous system errors occurring presently and the reps on the phone c9uld neither update my phone number and VERBALLY CLAIM to have canceled the XXXX XXXX enrollment yet refused to send any type of confirmation via any method. She did however provide her employee ID supposedly at XXXX XXXX pm today XX/XX/XXXX. However she said the enrollment is slated for deletion and it takes 3-5 business days however, no confirmation is sent by the company that a consumer has Ben unenrolled XXXX I fell that they have not done so and will continue to have access to my credit file. Furthermore, their verification system is down and they had me send a copy of my front and back image of my drivers license prior to my speaking with that supervisor who claims to have accomplished the enrollment. I do not feel that this company is handling consumers personal information properly and it may lead to identify theft.
Narrative Summary: A consumer tried to cancel a product service called XXXX XXXX for over a year, but the company made it impossible by denying 2-step verification methods and refusing to update phone numbers. Despite a rep claiming to have canceled the enrollment, no confirmation was sent, raising identity theft concerns.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: I noticed a charge of {$86.00} from the XXXX XXXX XXXX " XXXX XXXX '' on Wednesday XX/XX/year>. I have not been to that establishment in over three months so it's impossible for this charge to have occurred. I called them the same day and asked for more information regarding this charge because I suspected fraud. They told me there was a glitch in their billing system and several other people had been impacted by this glitch. I disputed the charge with AMEX. AMEX reached out to XXXX XXXX who sent them over a receipt of the transaction so they denied my dispute. However, since there was a glitch in their billing system, and I had already visited this location in the past, they would no doubt have my information handy and can easily produce a receipt. You can check my phone information, or other data, I was nowhere near that establishment at the time the transaction occurred.
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputed an $86 charge from a business they hadn't visited in over three months. The business attributed the charge to a billing system glitch, but provided a receipt to AMEX, which denied the dispute. The consumer claims they were not at the location at the time of the transaction.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of XXXX a payment was made for my Synchrony bank Amazon store card for the full amount of charges due, Leaving the account with a XXXX balance. Unfortunately, Due to fraud on a XXXX XXXX  account, completely separate from this one, I was forced to file for bankruptcy in XXXX of XXXX, however luckily With the help of loans from family and friends was able to re establish my affairs and dismiss the bankruptcy case. To my surprise and dismay, Synchrony bank had added itself as a creditor seeking relief in my bankruptcy case, seeking full relief for the bill that had already been paid since XX/XX/XXXX in full. Via a recorded conversation by me in XX/XX/XXXX With synchrony bank, in which I did advise them I was recording the call, they did acknowledge and confirm receipt of the payment made in full XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX for over {$4500.00} The Synchrony bank Representative was as confused as I was However, told me she could not see anything further on my account. I sent a letter requesting verification of payment And questioning why they had closed my account and why They were requesting full payment again When payment was already made. In return I received a letter from Synchrony Amazon store card asking If I was satisfied with the representatives assistance and nothing more. Approximately a month later I was phoned by a collection agency and also told by the collection agency attempting to collect on this account they also were very confused because they did see the payment was made in full, thus prompting the collection agency to initiate a dispute for me as well in regard to this account and this matter. My account was unjustly closed, Synchrony attempted to fraudulently collect on a debt that had already been paid, and at this point I can not even log into my account.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid their Synchrony Bank Amazon store card balance in full ($4,500) in XXXX. Despite this, Synchrony Bank added itself as a creditor in the consumer's bankruptcy case, seeking full payment. The bank acknowledged the payment in a recorded call, but still attempted to collect the debt.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative: I've always made sure payments on this account are timely, never allowing them to become overdue. I'm unsure about the reasons behind reports of late payment remarks on my accounts. As per 15 USC 1666b, billing errors should be corrected.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes late payment remarks on their account despite making timely payments. They request correction under 15 USC 1666b, citing billing error laws, and seek explanation for the reported errors.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
They offer no interest if you pay off your purchase within 6 months with there promotional purchases on XXXX. Then recently I noticed that after my last several weekly payments the balances for my promotional purchase balances were not going down. I called them about it and they told me they are applying my payments to my non promotional purchases to lower my interest fees ( but by doing that, it is ensuring that I don't get the promotional purchases paid off in time so they can then add those interest fees on to the bill. ) This wasn't their practice before. I'm not 100 % sure when I noticed this occurring but it has not been for very long. When I called them about it, they keep acting like they are doing me a favor by applying my money to non promotional purchases instead when their real intent is to make it where you don't pay the promotional purchase off in time so they make that interest fee also. 

They told me the only way I can directly apply my payment to the promotional purchase is by calling into them every time I make a payment. Which is a big hassle if I'm doing online payments. Again, I told them that I never had to do this call in thing in the past so why is it all of a sudden now you have to? It's a scam they pulling so they have a better chance that the consumer doesn't pay their promo purchase off in time to earn no-interest on the purchase. PayPal is using " Synchrony '' to facilitate the credit accounts, but the payments and policies are made through PayPal. 

One customer service rep even suggested I just pay the whole promotional payment off in one payment and I wouldn't have this problem! How more unprofessional reasoning is that?
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: PayPal's payment application policy changed, directing payments to non-promotional balances first, potentially preventing timely payoff of promotional purchases and triggering interest fees. The consumer must now call in each payment to apply it to promotional balances, a new requirement that seems designed to increase interest earnings.

Sub-issue: Other problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Synchrony bank, the issuer of the Care Credit card, fraudulently, without my knowledge or consent, initiated chargeback disputes on transactions totaling {$21000.00}. Not only was this done without my knowledge, they did so at my protest. Also, as you can hear in the attached recording of my XX/XX/year> phone conversation with a representative from Synchrony, I explicitly advised them I did not initiate these chargeback disputes and the representative agreed to have them canceled. ( Note at the time of this phone conversation I was in New York State visiting family and New York is a one-party consent state. ) Further, I provided each of the merchants who's transactions were chargeback, with the attached letter, they could in turn provide to Synchrony ( and most did ), which explicitly states : 1. At no time have I ever requested or consented to the initiation of any chargeback or dispute of any transaction in which my Care Credit account had been used to tender payment to any merchant including the providers referenced above ( herein, the Providers ). 

2. Synchrony Bank initiated the current chargebacks disputes without my knowledge, request for, or consent. 

3. I have reviewed all transactions on my Care Credit account and can confirm with absolute certainty that the principle amounts of each transaction is correct and undisputed. ( This does not include fees and other costs assessed by and paid to the card issuer, Synchrony Bank ). 

4. I confirm that I am either in possession of and/ or benefited from the services and/ or goods rendered by the Providers in which my Care Credit account was used to tender payment for. 

5. I have no current or prior concerns regarding the quality of the goods and/or services obtained from each of the Providers, which could entitle me to initiate a billing dispute through my card issuer. 

6. If Synchrony Bank continues to pursue the chargeback disputes theyve initiated, they do so with out my cooperation or support.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Synchrony Bank initiated chargeback disputes on $21,000 in transactions without the cardholder's knowledge or consent. Despite the cardholder's explicit denial and request to cancel the disputes, Synchrony Bank proceeded, contradicting the cardholder's written confirmation of the transactions' accuracy.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a CapitalOne Quicksilver credit card. 
I first used it in XX/XX/XXXX. 
The payment due date is the XXXX of the month. 
I usually pay early on the XXXX of the month, see attachments. 

Payments made : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$500.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$500.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$300.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$300.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$500.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$300.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$200.00} ( I setup auto pay this month ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$500.00} extra payment XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$200.00} ( autopay ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$200.00} ( turned off auto pay this month ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$300.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$300.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$100.00} ( I made an extra payment to access the payment summary for the screenshot ). 

I was charged a {$40.00} late fee for XXXX and again for XX/XX/XXXX ... for paying early. 
I made 11 payments in 8 months, most of which were before the due date, not one late. 
I can't be the only person this is happening to.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims CapitalOne Quicksilver credit card incorrectly charged them a $40 late fee twice, despite making 11 on-time payments in 8 months, with most payments made before the due date. The consumer questions how this error could occur and suspects others may be affected.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to dispute unauthorized charges totaling {$4300.00} on my XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX account between XXXX XXXX XXXX. These transactions occurred while I was XXXX XXXX between XXXX and XXXX, during which time I was a victim of identity theft and SIM swap fraud. I demand an immediate investigation into these fraudulent activities and request a prompt resolution to rectify this matter. Any associated fees or charges related to these fraudulent transactions must be waived without delay. I expect regular updates on the progress of the investigation and swift action to restore the integrity of my account. Failure to address this dispute satisfactorily will result in further legal action. I am the victim of identity theft. I am writing to dispute a fraudulent charge/debit on my account in the amount of {$4300.00} I am a victim of identity theft, and I did not make this charge/debit. I am requesting that the charge be removed/the debit reinstated, that any finance and other charges related to the fraudulent amount be credited, as well, and that I receive an accurate statement. Pursuant to federal law, I am requesting that you provide me and/or the listed Law Enforcement Designee, at no charge, copies of the transaction details and business records in your control relating to the fraudulent transactions. A copy of the relevant federal law is enclosed.
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes $4300 in unauthorized charges on their account, claiming they were a victim of identity theft and SIM swap fraud while traveling. They demand an investigation, removal of the charges, and reimbursement of associated fees, citing federal law and threatening further action if unresolved.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

Consumer complaint narrative: There was a Capital One account that was opened XXXX of XXXX on my credit report that Im not familiar with. It shows that the account was closed in XXXX of XXXX and XXXX months have occurred charges. Theres an {$1100.00} out of {$750.00} credit limit. I would need for them to send me additional documents to show my signature and date from when the agreement was signed and removed from my credit report.
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a Capital One account on their credit report, claiming it's unfamiliar. The account shows a $1,100 balance, $750 credit limit, and multiple late charges. The consumer requests documentation, including their signature and agreement date, to verify the account's legitimacy and have it removed.

Sub-issue: Privacy issues
Consumer complaint narrative: In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act this creditor violated my rights under 15 USC 1681 section 602 states that I have the right to privacy ( 15 USC 1681 section 604a section 2 ). It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions under 15 USCS 1666b a creditor may treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges a creditor violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act by furnishing their account information without written consent, citing 15 USC 1681 sections 602 and 604a, and also improperly reporting a late payment under 15 USCS 1666b.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a dispute with CapitalOne in regards to my car rental. Car rental company charged me {$1100.00} in fees for extra mileage and a traffic violation. The original contract I agreed to at the time of the booking had unlimited mileage. The rental company failed to provide a traffic violation citation. I was never stopped by the police while I had the rental car. 

CapitalOne refused to accept the documents I submitted to support the claim.
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a $1100 charge from a car rental company for extra mileage and a traffic violation. The original contract had unlimited mileage, and no traffic citation was provided. CapitalOne refused to accept supporting documents, despite the consumer's claim of no police stop during the rental.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been a user of BILT credit card which has been issued by Wells Fargo. 
I have paid my bills on time and in full.

Wells Fargo is blatantly denying the increase of my credit limit on one of the cards.

I have held the card for more than six months now but Wells Fargo always declines my request to increase the credit limit.

The reasons given are very vague and are inconclusive. One of the reasons they state is that I havent used the card for a long time. 
But, I have been using the card for more than a year now.

I have been a loyal customer of WF since 2019 but It is very frustrating to do business with WF The small credit limit restricts my purchasing power thereby tying my hands to make purchases.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer is disputing Wells Fargo's denial of a credit limit increase on their BILT credit card, citing vague reasons, including inactivity, despite using the card for over a year and being a loyal customer since 2019.

Therefore, I urgently request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to handle this matter directly, as the bank 's actions have resulted in significant harm to my financial well-being. The account is : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: I close my chime credit card account thinking they can transfer the XXXX i had left into my account I closed it because they wouldn't give me access to my account to withdraw so they said there gon na Mail it to me and it's been six months now and still waiting they keep telling me the same thing over and over again i had to borrow money from family and friends just to keep up with my bill i was supposed to pay and its with chime account
Narrative Summary: A consumer closed their Chime credit card account, expecting a balance transfer of $XXXX. However, after six months, the funds have not been received, despite repeated assurances that a check would be mailed, causing financial hardship and reliance on borrowed money to pay bills.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I looked up a telephone number for XXXX XXXX  customer service to get tech support to fix my XXXX XXXX  watch. I called the phone number that I found for this company. I had no idea that the people that I reached on the phone were not XXXX XXXX but scammers and they were generating a video call on their end without my knowledge. I later found this out by calling the phone number back and saw myself on video. I never made a video call to this number. I never gave them passwords, credit card numbers or gift card numbers. They stole them from my phone which they had unauthorized access to. I was scammed out of over {$1500.00}. in gift cards which they charged on my Target.XXXX credit card. When I realized that what they were doing was not helping me fix my watch I hung up the phone and did some investigating and realized that it was a video call on their end and that I had been scammed. I later wiped my phone clean and changed all my passwords and checked all my credit cards for purchases. I called Target XXXX XXXX. XXXX ext. XXXX and reported the fraud. They closed my account and sent me a fraud questionnaire which I faxed back to them on XX/XX/XXXX. I received a bill from Target on XX/XX/XXXX for {$1500.00} so I called the XXXX XXXX. and they told me that I was responsible for the paying the bill and they claimed that a letter of resolution was sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX. I never received this letter and I asked that another letter of resolution be re-mailed to me. I still have not received that letter 6 months later. I was told by the supervisor to send another letter of appeal and the claim would be re-opened. I sent another letter to the fraud dept. on XX/XX/XXXX and have not received a letter of resolution as of XX/XX/XXXX, 90 days later. Every month when I received another bill from them I call the fraud dept. asking to speak to a supervisor and each time I was told that the letter of resolution on XX/XX/XXXX would be resent and they would have someone call me back in XXXX hours. No one has ever called me from Target fraud dept. I have documented XXXX phone calls where each supervisor I spoke with would only share their first name with me and every time I called they told me the same thing, someone would call me back in XXXX hours and they would resend that first letter of resolution that they claimed was mailed to me on XX/XX/XXXX. Upon checking my credit report I could see that I now have an unpaid balance of {$1800.00} for Target. I have always had excellent credit and this is not right that they reported this unpaid balance and have never given me a letter of resolution about why I am responsible for this bill. I faxed them another letter on XX/XX/XXXX that they need to make a decision and send me a letter of resolution.
Narrative Summary: A consumer was scammed out of $1,500 in gift cards by fake tech support who gained unauthorized access to their phone. The scam was charged to their Target credit card. Despite reporting the fraud, Target has not resolved the issue, instead claiming the consumer is responsible for the bill.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am missing XXXX XXXX points earned with my new JP Morgan Chase XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. 

The XXXX points earned were transferred to the wrong XXXX account number. Chase transferred it to the secondary card holder ( my husband ) instead of me, the primary card holder. 

XXXX, Supervisor at Chase told me XXXX XXXX XXXX told them on XX/XX/2024 that I need to call their Customer Service and request a merge of our accounts. 

XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX said that this is not a " merge '' request. It's a correction request that only Chase can make.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's JP Morgan Chase points were transferred to the wrong account, the secondary cardholder's, instead of the primary cardholder's. Chase incorrectly advised the primary cardholder to request a merge, when it's actually a correction that only Chase can make.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
hello, on XX/XX/XXXX I went to XXXX XXXX, part of ABC FITNESS at : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX Fl. XXXX. STORE # XXXX, gym phone # XXXX, XXXX phone # XXXX, to sign up for a gym membership, as I am new to working out, at that time I also purchased XXXX personal training sessions to learn the ins and outs of the machines. I was quoted a price of $ XXXX for the XXXX sessions, which I agreed to. 
The receipt for the purchase clearly states that only XXXX sessions were purchased which had to be used by XX/XX/XXXX. 

payment was made thru XXXX XXXX card ending in XXXX, the agent 's name was XXXX XXXX. 

during the signing process, he had me initial my name on a small machine where only the area where I had to initial was visible. when I asked what I am signing, he said it was the gym policies and rules. He did not provide any physical papers. 

he handed me the receipt for the transaction, and I proceeded to exercise. 

on XX/XX/XXXX, my card was charged another {$200.00} XXXX because XXXX XXXX had noted that I wanted the training to be a month-to-month contract. this is false, I am a XXXX woman on a very limited income ; had I been presented with a physical document where I would have been able to read thru it, I might have caught this agent deceit. 

On XX/XX/XXXX when the second draft of {$200.00} XXXX  was placed on my account ; I immediately spoke with the XXXX the gym 's manager. she wrote an email to corporate and several more since. each time I enquire on the status, she says there has been no response. Please also note that on XX/XX/XXXX I asked XXXX that I wanted to speak to XXXX XXXX, she answered. " he had to be let go '' I feel I was deceived by this agent, perhaps he did so because I am elderly, and he thought he could take advantage of this fact. which in my view is deplorable. 

ABC FITNESS ( XXXXXXXX XXXX  ) must take responsibility for this agent and refund my {$200.00} dollar. 

attentively,
Narrative Summary: A consumer signed up for a gym membership and 8 personal training sessions for $XXX at ABC Fitness. However, the agent allegedly deceived her into a month-to-month contract, resulting in an unauthorized $200 charge. The consumer claims she was misled due to lack of physical documentation.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024, I sent a letter to Experian regarding a request to investigate things that I believe to be inaccurate and/or incomplete in my credit report. Experian responded back with a stall letter on XX/XX/2024 stating that it was not me but a third party trying to fix my credit. However, I mailed this from my own house. I was never notified in writing, per 15 U.S.C 1692g before an account was on my credit report, within 5 days. Moreover, these accounts violate debt collections, and abusive and unfair practices per section 1692f ( 1 ) adding additional amounts.

15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) the procurement of the report by that person. ) Privacy Act considerations.

A delinquent debt may not be reported under this section unless a notice issued under the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. 552a ( e ) ( 4 ), authorizes the disclosure of information about the debtor to a credit bureau.

The Privacy Act of 1974 is a federal law that governs the collection and use of records we maintain on you in a system of records. A system of records is any grouping of information about an individual under the control of a federal agency from which information is retrievable by personal identifiers, such as name, social security number, or other identifying number or symbol. Under the Privacy Act, Federal agencies may not disclose information without consent unless certain exceptions apply to the disclosure.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address several concerning issues regarding the handling of my personal information as governed by various sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related statutes.

Firstly, according to 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) of the FCRA, it is imperative that consumer reporting agencies such as Equifax and XXXX conduct their operations with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumers ' privacy rights. As a consumer, I am entitled to ensure that my private information remains secure, as reinforced by 15 USC 6801, which mandates financial institutions to uphold the privacy and confidentiality of customers ' nonpublic personal information.

Under 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), it is explicitly stated that consumer reporting agencies may only furnish consumer reports under circumstances outlined in written instructions from the consumer. I have not provided consent, neither written nor implied, for Equifax, or any furnisher of information to credit agencies to share my personal information.

Furthermore, according to 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ), financial institutions are prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to third parties without informing consumers of their right to opt out of such disclosure. I have not been properly informed of this right by the relevant financial institution.

Additionally, the reporting of adverse items of information, such as the account in question, without my consent violates 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ), which restricts consumer reporting agencies from including such information in consumer reports.

Moreover, 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) ( 1 ) prohibits the furnishing of inaccurate information to consumer reporting agencies, and Equifax and XXXX are failing to uphold reasonable procedures to prevent violations of the FCRA, as mandated by 15 U.S. Code 1681e.

Finally, under 12 CFR 1016.7, I am exercising my right to opt out of your reporting services effective immediately. 

In light of these violations and discrepancies, I expect immediate action to rectify the situation and ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges Equifax and another agency mishandled their personal info, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). Key issues include unauthorized sharing of info, failure to inform of opt-out rights, and reporting of adverse items without consent, all without proper procedures in place.

Please send all correspondence related to this matter to the address listed above.

They demand a settlement, threatening arbitration with significant costs if not resolved amicably within 15 days, and warn against potential Fair Debt Collection Practices Act violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am sending this letter to you in response to a notice sent to me regarding the above referenced account. Be advised that I am not refusing to pay, but I am sending you this NOTICE ; a. ) You are in receipt of this NOTICE sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act regarding the above referenced account and in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 b. ) I hereby DISPUTE the validity of the alleged debt claimed that was last verified on XX/XX/year>. 
This is NOT a request for verification, proof of my past payments, statements, or my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have a legal obligation to pay you.

Under the FDCPA, I have the right to request validation of the alleged debt you say may be owed to you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are aski
ng to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation which is binding on me to pay this debt to you.

You should be aware that reporting such invalidated information to any major credit bureau may constitute defamation of character, as the negative marks on my credit report harm my credit and prevent me from enjoying all the benefits of good credit. In addition, until you can provide me with proper validation of this debt, you are not allowed to pursue any collection activities, including reporting this information on my credit report. I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC for fraud and other state or federal agencies. 
DEMAND : I hereby DEMAND that you provide me with the following verified ( sworn to by affidavit ) documentary evidence in substantiation of your alleged debt claim.

1. CERTIFICATION OF AUTHORITY : Please provide ( a ) : verified certificate of authority, or fictitious/assumed name certificate from the State of New Mexico authorizing your firm, AWA Collections , to transact business in the State of New Mexico XXXX 
( b ) : your license number ( s ) and Registered Agent.

2. AUTHORIZATION CONTRACT : Please send me a verified ( sworn to by Affidavit ) copy of the contract your firm has with the original creditor authorizing your firm to engage in collection activities on their behalf against the above alleged account, and naming you as an authorized collection agent/claims adjuster.

3. AFFIDAVIT OF CLAIM : Please send me a commercial affidavit, sworn to be true, correct, and complete, upon the commercial liability of a properly identified officer employee, or agent, hereinafter XXXX, stating that : a. ) said creditor is the HOLDER IN DUE COURSE of the above referenced account. 
b. ) XXXX is authorized to ASSERT A CLAIM on behalf of the alleged original Creditor. 
XXXX ) XXXX has PERSONAL FIRST HAND KNOWLEDGE regarding the fact of the alleged account and is the original XXXX of the books of entry, or directly supervises said original XXXX of the records. 
XXXX. ORIGINAL CONTRACT : Please send me a verified copy both FRONT and BACK of the alleged ORIGINAL contract/agreement/promissory note in its entirety, including any application, accompanied by a commercial affidavit, sworn to be true, correct, and complete, upon the commercial liability of a properly identified and authorized officer, employee, or agent of the alleged original creditor who states that he/she has PERSONAL FIRST HAND KNOWLEDGE that said front and back verified copy is that of the original alleged contract/agreement/promissory note. 
XXXX. COMPLETE BOOKEEPING ENTRIES : Please provide the original account and general ledger statement showing the full accounting of the alleged obligation you are attempting to collect has not been paid, accompanied by a commercial affidavit by the original XXXX of the books and records sworn to be true, correct, and complete, upon his or her commercial liability. 
XXXX. Please verify under penalty of perjury, that as a debt collector, you have not purchased evidence of debt and are proceeding with collection activity in the name of the original alleged creditor. 
XXXX. Please verify under penalty of perjury that you know and understand that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion, such as a so-called forum selection clause, are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have rejected the clause without impunity. 
XXXX. Please verify under penalty of perjury that you know and understand that auto insurance polices are a series of continuing offers to contract and as such are nontransferable. 
XXXX. Please verify that you know and understand that contacting me again after receipt of this notice without providing procedurally proper validation of the alleged debt may constitute MAIL FRAUD and a complaint will be filed with the U.S. Postal Inspection Service and the F.T.C. pursuant to applicable law and any litigation that ensues will name you in your personal capacity as defendant. 
At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the XXXX major Credit Bureaus XXXX XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX ) this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you, Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Defamation of Character If your office can provide the proper documentation as requested in this Declaration, I will require at least 30 days from receipt, to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated or verifying an account as accurate when in fact there is no provided proof that it is. Until this account is validated, please remove this alleged account from the credit reporting agencies. 
As an act of good faith, I am extending to you thirty ( 30 ) days from the receipt of this notice to perform in compliance with the requested demands. If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. Your failure to perform will involve the legal concepts of acquiescence and admission whereby the alleged debt is admittedly invalid and thereby repudiated in its entirety. In the interim you are prohibited from any contact with the undersigned except in writing and only in regards to the matter herein expressed. 
I would also like to request, in writing, that no telephone contact be made by your offices to my home or to my place of employment. If your office ( XXXX ) attempt telephone communication with me, including but not limited to computer generated calls and calls or correspondence sent to or with any third parties, it will be considered harassment and I will have no choice but to file suit. All future communications with me MUST be done in writing and sent to the address noted in this letter by USPS.

It would be advisable that you assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. This is an attempt to correct your records, any information obtained shall be used for that purpose. 
XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes the validity of an alleged debt and demands validation from the debt collector, AWA Collections, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. The consumer requests specific documentation, including proof of authority, contract, and affidavit, to verify the debt and the collector's authority to collect it.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 
So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 


This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for each account listed without my expressed written consent. 
I looked at my consumer reports and noticed accounts I never gave anyone permission to report. Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role and have a responsibility to report consumer information to the best of their ability with maximum possible accuracy like the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly states. I did not provide written consent to report them.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

They claim the credit reporting agency listed accounts without their written consent, violating 15 U.S. Code 1681b(2) and 1681c-2, and potentially leading to civil liability and $1000 per violation.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Please be minded that if you send a computer generated letter not to open the dispute request I am going to file a complaint. There is not a single item in my letter that could possibly lead one to believe it was not written by me. Failure to do so must be penalized according to 616. [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] that states any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement under this law concerning a consumer is accountable to that consumer for a sum comprising : 1. A : The actual damages suffered by the consumer due to the failure, or damages ranging from not less than {$100.00} to not more that {$1000.00}. 

Since I know that this letter will be sent through an automatic system you have, I will make it brief. You informed me that my disputes were " verified as accurate '' after I provided evidence of discrepancies in the form of FACTS that I directly obtained from my credit report. Given that I'm using the information from my credit record, how is this possible? I believe that after you receive my letters and enter them into the computer, the computer forwards them to the XXXX, and the creditor simply compares what you have. 

It will, of course, be confirmed when you compare your information to theirs! I am aware that you are required to conduct a separate inquiry to verify the accuracy of this information, but I need to see the actual process to make sure you have complied with FCRA laws. Both the paperwork utilized for this independent investigation and a fresh one based on the factual information provided below should be sent to me. 



Below are the following accounts that needs to be deleted or removed as it is being falsely reported on my credit report. 



XXXX XXXX : Account number : XXXX, Each bureau reports a different date of last activity and Repetitive XXXX marks on this report, remove this account for violation. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Account number : XXXX, Once again I had stated in my previous dispute letter that I do not recall having this account. I've also asked your agency to provide the monthly payment, credit limit, terms, high balance, last payment, past due amount, date of first delinquency and date closed as they are missing from the report. I am demanding the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. 

XXXX : Account number : XXXX, Please clarify the payment status, comments, balance and account number as they might be erroneous. Delete them from my credit report altogether. 



I ask that you take urgent action to comply with Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, which requires you to " ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. '' I want all of the aforementioned accounts deleted right away. Send me a copy of your most recent, revised credit report indicating the deletion of these items. 


Yours Truly, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I wish to contest a derogatory item present on my credit report that I believe to be inaccurate, untrue, incomplete, untimely, and potentially not even associated with my responsibility. Upon thorough examination of my report, I have identified numerous errors and inaccuracies being reported. I kindly request that you carefully review and rectify any and all of these discrepancies, ensuring they adhere to the standards of truthfulness, accuracy, completeness, timeliness, ownership responsibility, FCRA compliance, Metro 2 Format compliance, and any other relevant regulatory requirements governing reporting obligations. 

The following disputed information represents allegations that lack sufficient proof of validity and compliance. I insist that you promptly remove these entries from my report. I expect this action to be taken without delay. Below is a list of the contested information : Listed below are the Personal Information that are being challenged Incorrect Name : - XXXX XXXX XXXX Incorrect Previous Address : - XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX, FL, XXXX Incorrect Previous Address : - XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX, FL, XXXX Incorrect Name : - XXXX XXXX Incorrect Name : - XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Employer - XXXX  Incorrect DOB : - XXXX  Employer - XXXX  XXXX XXXX Listed below are the Accounts that are being challenged XXXX XXXX  XXXX - XXXX Listed below are the Inquiries that are being challenged XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NOTICE FOR REMOVAL OF INQUIRY REQUEST : According to Section 604 of US CODE 15 USC 1681 et seq., it is clearly stated that any entity requesting access to a consumer 's credit report must have a lawfully acquired and permissible purpose as outlined by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). We demand to know if you and/or any other reporting party have provable and demonstrated lawful permissible purpose ( s ) for obtaining my credit report profile or any portion thereof. You must provide physically verifiable proof of this lawful permissible purpose, even if I have not authorized the inquiry or have no knowledge of it. Failure to provide such proof means that you must remove any inquiry reporting related to the event ( s ) in question. I am challenging you to demonstrate your mandatorily submitted permissible purpose proofs, and I hereby demand that you delete any such alleged inquiry reporting upon your failure to do so in a timely manner, whether willfully or due to your reckless ignorance.

Your agency is in breach of the law! According to 15 U.S.C. 1681 section 602 A, I am entitled to privacy. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 specifies that a consumer reporting agency may not provide an account without my explicit written permission. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency is permitted to include any adverse information in a consumer report if the event occurred more than seven years ago, except for criminal convictions. Lastly, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) mandates that no person should provide information about a consumer to a consumer reporting agency if they know or suspect the information to be inaccurate.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes numerous errors on their credit report, including incorrect personal info, accounts, and inquiries, citing FCRA non-compliance. They demand removal of disputed items, proof of permissible purpose for inquiries, and adherence to regulatory requirements, alleging the agency is in breach of the law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the presence of a collections account on my credit report, as reported by your agency. I believe that this account is inaccurately associated with my credit profile, and I am invoking my rights under federal law, specifically 18 USC 894, to request verification of this debt. Pursuant to 18 USC 894, I assert that I neither own nor have knowledge of the existence of the account listed under the name : XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I AM NOT LIABLE FOR THIS DEBTS. 
I DO NOT HAVE A CONTRACT WITH ANY OF THIS COLLECTION AGENCY. 

Furthermore, pursuant to 18 USC 8, I affirm that I owe no debt associated with this accounts. As a consumer, I am entitled to request verification of any disputed debt under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Therefore, I kindly request that your agency conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and provide me with the following information : Documentation verifying the debt, including any contracts or agreements bearing my WET SIGNATURE. Proof of ownership of the debt by the reporting creditor or collection agency.

Verification of the accuracy of the reported information, including the amount owed and the dates of the alleged transactions. I understand that the FCRA requires credit bureaus to investigate disputed items within 30 days of receipt of a consumer dispute.

Therefore, I request that you provide me with a written response detailing the results of your investigation within this timeframe. Furthermore, I assert that the reporting of this disputed account violates my consumer rights to privacy pursuant to 15 USC 168b.

The company in question has no permission to report any information using my personal information pursuant to 15 USC 1681 4. I insist that any communication regarding this matter be conducted in writing to ensure clarity and documentation.

Please note that failure to provide the requested verification within the prescribed time frame may result in further action to protect my rights under federal law.

Please note that pursuant to the FCRA, if you are unable to verify the accuracy of this account within 15 days of receipt of this dispute, you must promptly delete it from my credit report. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift resolution.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a collections account on their credit report, claiming it's inaccurately associated with their profile. They request verification of the debt under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including documentation and proof of ownership, and demand its deletion if not verified within 15 days.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing issue
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I contacted TransUnion rental screening solutions to dispute an eviction showing on my rental screening file that never occurred. I requested the source of the information after I went to the city court where the alleged filing occurred only to be told by the clerk there was no record of the filings. I provided my name and the case number provided by TransUnion rental screening solutions and there were no records found. I also looked up the cases myself via XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and no records for the alleged cases are found. The records on the courts site date back to XXXX which means the case allegedly filed between XXXX and XXXX should appear. 

TransUnion contacted me via email on XX/XX/XXXX to state the information was verified as accurate however ; the source of this information was not provided. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX, & Equifax continue to report incorrect information listed on the account XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX. There are several late payments listed that are different from each consumer agency. Neither consumer agency provided evidence that supports their claim and I do not care who is right and who is wrong I do know reasonable efforts must be made to investigate the accuracy of all information. 

XXXX is reporting late payments for XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX + XX/XX/XXXX XXXX is reporting late payment for XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX to XXXX of XXXX Equifax is reporting late payments for XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX + XX/XX/XXXX. 

This account can not report this way and each consumer agency failed to provide accuracy which has caused me harm. I would like the evidence that they obtained to prove this information is correct. 

( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without incurring an additional finance charge, such additional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.
Narrative Summary: The consumer reports that XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax are listing incorrect late payments on their account, with varying dates across agencies. The consumer requests evidence to support these claims, citing the Credit Card Accountability Responsibility and Disclosure (CARD) Act, which requires creditors to mail statements at least 21 days before the due date.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against JPMCB ( Chase Bank ) for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I have identified several inaccuracies and improper reporting practices on my credit report that I believe contravene the FCRAs requirements for accuracy and completeness. 

Unauthorized Change of Account XXXX : JPMCB changed the name of the fraud account that I have already complained about and reported this change to the credit bureaus without notifying me. Seems as if they are trying to find a way too continue reporting this fraudulent account. This action has resulted in confusion and potential inaccuracies on my credit report. According to Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) of the FCRA, furnishers of information are required to report accurate and complete information. Changing the name of the account without my knowledge could lead to inaccuracies and misrepresentation of my credit information. 

Duplicate Account Reporting : JPMCB has reported the exact same account twice on my credit report. This duplicate reporting is a clear violation of Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) of the FCRA, which mandates the accuracy and integrity of the information provided to credit bureaus. The presence of duplicate accounts on my credit report inaccurately reflects my credit history and can negatively impact my credit score. 

Specific Violations Violation of Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) : By changing the name of my account without informing me, JPMCB has potentially reported inaccurate information. 
Violation of Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) : By reporting the same account twice, JPMCB has compromised the integrity and accuracy of my credit report. 
Failure to Notify : JPMCB did not notify me of the change in the account name, which can be argued as a failure to ensure transparency and fairness. 

I request that the CFPB investigate these issues and take appropriate action to ensure that JPMCB corrects these inaccuracies. Specifically, I request that : JPMCB removes these accounts from all credit bureaus, and also hrequest the cfpb, the XXXX and the occ to help me with a civil lawsuit against them to ensure similar issues from occurring. 

I have attached copies of my credit reports with the accounts showing multiple times as well as the name change.
Narrative Summary: The consumer filed a complaint against JPMCB (Chase Bank) for violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). The issues include: an unauthorized name change to a previously reported fraudulent account, and duplicate account reporting on their credit report, resulting in potential inaccuracies and negatively impacting their credit score.

Therefore, I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to launch a thorough investigation into XXXXXXXX XXXX  inaccurate reporting practices and take appropriate enforcement actions to rectify the situation. Additionally, I request compensation for the damages incurred as a result of XXXXXXXX XXXX failure to comply with federal regulations. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I anticipate a swift resolution to this issue and look forward to your response.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is my XXXX time reaching out to yall about these unverified accounts that are still hanging around on my credit report. Im talking about accounts that shouldnt even be there, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681. This is unacceptable, and we need to get it sorted out ASAP.

Now, according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), you are required by federal law to provide me with a detailed description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information on my report. This includes the business name, address, and telephone number of any furnisher of information you contacted. And youve got 15 days to get this information to me thats the law! 

Last time, yall told me in writing that you " verified '' these items. Alright, but who exactly in your company did this verification? How did they verify it? I need the name, business address, and telephone number of the person or business you contacted during your reinvestigation. Plus, I need to see the documentation you used to verify this dispute. Show me the evidence! 

As of now, you have NOT provided me with any hard copy documentation showing that these accounts have been properly verified. Under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ) of the FCRA, you are required to promptly DELETE all information that can not be verified. The law is crystal clear on this point. 

If you fail to comply, the Civil liability and remedies for " negligent noncompliance '' under Section 617 will be enforced. I am fully prepared to pursue litigation to protect my rights under the FCRA. 

I demand that the following accounts be deleted immediately : Name of Account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX  Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX Status : Unverified Account Name of Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Status : Unverified Account Im expecting this matter to be resolved quickly. Lets get it deleted this time
