Cease and Desist Harassment and Dispute of Account Dear Aldous & Associates, P.L.L.C., I am writing to dispute the validity of the account referenced below and to demand an immediate cessation of all harassment related to this matter. 

Account Number : XXXX Agreement with : XXXXXXXX XXXX  Current Balance : {$300.00} I refute the validity of this debt for the following reasons : 1. Lack of Notification : I have not received any prior notification regarding the overdue amount owed to XXXX XXXX. As per legal requirements, creditors are obligated to provide written notice to the debtor prior to escalating the matter to a third-party collection agency. Failure to provide such notice constitutes a violation of my rights. 

2. Harassment : I have been subjected to continuous and harassing communications from your agency regarding this debt. Despite my requests for validation of the debt and verification of your authority to collect, these communications have persisted, causing undue stress and harassment. 

3. Request for Removal : I hereby demand the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. Given the lack of proper notification and the harassing nature of the communications, I assert my right to have this account deleted from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

In light of the above, I demand that all communications regarding this debt cease immediately. Furthermore, I request that Aldous & Associates, P.L.L.C. take immediate action to investigate and rectify the violations outlined herein, including but not limited to the removal of the account from my credit report. 

Please be advised that any further attempts to collect on this disputed debt or any continuation of harassing communications will be met with appropriate legal action. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes a $300 debt with Aldous & Associates, P.L.L.C., citing lack of prior notification and harassment through persistent communications. They demand the account's removal from their credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act and an immediate cessation of all collection activities.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I signed promissory note ( loan number XXXX ) promising to pay to the offer of Navy Federal Credit Union XXXX XXXX XXXX {$17000.00} with the finance charge {$6200.00} total of payments {$24000.00} @ Annual percentage rate 10.34 %. 
On XXXX XXXX as a federally protected consumer I registered mailed ( XXXX XXXX numbers XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX a Negotiable instrument to Navy Federal Credit Union in accordance with Title 31 USC 5118 et.al. to satisfy the promise to pay as agreed. It is the duty of BANKS/CREDITORS to honor this instrument for payment, to know, to abide by and operate under the law. 18 USC 8 applies. Commercial instruments are legal tender for payment of debt in accordance with 31 USC 5118 and other statues/ codes. See also, XXXX XXXX XXXX vs XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) and Article XXXX of Uniform Commercial Code. 
Navy Federal Credit Union failed to respond. 
Again, on XX/XX/XXXX I obtained the services of a NOTARY PUBLIC to perform a notary protest process on Navy Federal Credit Union. See, XXXX XXXX # XXXX ; XXXX ; XXXX ; and XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX Navy Federal Credit Union sent response ( XXXX ) in reply stating " The document you provided do not release you from your obligation to Navy Federal and you remain responsible for the repayment of your debt ( s ), '' and threatened to report any late payments, missed payments or other defaults on my account to the credit reporting agencies to be reflected in my credit report. 
Therefore, Navy Federal credit union refusal to honor the negotiable instrument by failing to process and credit my account after receiving said negotiable instrument as tender of payment renders said obligation Discharged. See, UCC 3-603 AND OCGA 11-3-603.Otherwise, failure to do so is " INTERFERENCE WITH COMMERCE ", a Felony under the RICO ACT, 18 USC 1951.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: Complainant claims Navy Federal Credit Union failed to honor a negotiable instrument (promissory note) as payment for a $17,000 loan, despite being a federally protected consumer. The credit union refused to process and credit the account, stating the document didn't release the obligation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The negative impact of this reporting became evident to me following a denial for credit at XXXX XXXX with the reason explicitly cited as the negative marks originating from your reporting. This incident has raised serious concerns about my future ability to obtain credit. 

In accordance with the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ), which stipulates that consumers have the right to request and obtain information about their accounts that have been reported, I am hereby requesting all pertinent information that your company has used as the basis for reporting my account as late. This includes, but is not limited to, payment histories, dates of alleged late payments, and any correspondence or notices sent to me regarding late payments. 

I am writing to you today regarding the above account and vigorously contesting the manner in which it is reported on my credit bureau reports. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) has given me the right to request an immediate removal of this account from my credit report as per Section 611 because the account as reported does not accurately reflect my credit liability. 

I have exhaustively reviewed my credit report prepared by all three primary credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) and have observed that the accuracy of this particular account, CAP ONE AUTO with the furnished account number, is in grave contention. Please consider this communication as my official notice of dispute. 

In accordance with FCRA provisions, specifically sections 611 and 623, your firm is bound by law to investigate my grievance without delay. While the investigation is ongoing, you are obliged to mark the disputed information as such on my credit report. 

Moreover, the dispute process demands transparency, and I would appreciate receiving a detailed record of your investigation. The FCRA grants me the right to view the method of verification you employed, entitling me to the aforementioned information.

It is imperative to note, under FCRA section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), there's a requirement that stipulates you supply accurate information about me to various reporting agencies. Misrepresenting information about my account indicates egregious violations in both letter and spirit. Therefore, an immediate remedial action is fundamental. 

Should you fail to address the inconsistencies reported with immediate effect, understand you open yourselves up to potential litigation and punitive damages, as detailed by FCRA Section 616 and 617. My right as a consumer, when infringed upon, carries a cost that your institution would be held liable for, this includes attorney fees. 

Please understand that I am acting in utmost good faith to rectify discrepancies in my credit report that have occurred through no fault of my own, rather as a result of inaccuracies reported by your firm. I look for nothing more than the legal requirement for accurate credit reporting, as stipulated by the FCRA, and hope your immediate investigation into this matter will correct these inaccuracies and so mitigate any damage done to my credit standing and personal reputation. 

I hereby request immediate removal of the account in question from my credit report, to reflect the actual state of my financial dealings accurately. Furthermore, you are required to provide a summary of your investigation and the steps taken for rectification. 

Please note that a copy of this letter is being sent to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and my attorney to maintain a record of my dispute. A definitive response to this dispute is expected within 30 days from the receipt of this letter, as required by the law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes a negative mark on their credit report from CAP ONE AUTO, citing inaccuracies in payment history. They request immediate removal, investigation, and transparency under the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), threatening potential litigation if issues aren't addressed within 30 days.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, Tennessee XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Midland Credit Management , Inc . 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Subject : Debt Validation Request for XXXX XXXX XXXX - Account # XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally request validation of the debt that you have contacted me about, which is referenced under the account number XXXX. According to my records, and verified by a debt validation certification from the state of Tennessee, there is XXXX  debt in my name. I have attached a certificate of verification from the TN Secretary of State of 0 records of debt owed by XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, TN. 


Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request that you provide me with the following information : XXXX. **Validation of the debt** : Please provide the original signed contract or other instrument bearing my signature that substantiates the alleged debt. 
XXXX. **Amount of the debt** : Please provide a complete breakdown of the amount you claim I owe. 
XXXX. **Name and address of the original creditor** : Identify the original creditor to whom this debt is owed, along with their contact information. 
XXXX. **Proof of assignment** : Provide proof that Midland Credit Management , Inc. has the legal right to collect this debt on behalf of the original creditor. 
XXXX. **Verification of my liability** : Show evidence that I have a legal obligation to pay this debt. 
XXXX. Please provide all but not limited to any contracts signed with XXXX XXXX XXXX wet ink signature to do business with your company. 

Until these items are provided, I dispute the validity of this debt in its entirety and request that you cease all collection efforts. I also request that you immediately remove any negative information related to this alleged debt from my credit report, as reporting inaccurate information is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Furthermore, please be advised that I am aware of my rights under the FDCPA and FCRA, and I am prepared to take legal action if necessary to protect those rights. I expect a timely response to this request, as failure to provide the requested documentation within 30 days will result in the presumption that the debt is invalid and no further collection activities are warranted. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and your intention to comply with my validation request at your earliest convenience. 

Sincerely, By : XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a debt with Midland Credit Management, requesting validation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. They claim no records of debt exist in their name, as verified by the TN Secretary of State, and demand documentation to prove the debt's validity.

Your bureau is unable to provide any documentation and I will continue pointing out violations. Consumer complaint narrative:
The undersigned Beneficiary, XXXX XXXX, herein after, Beneficiary does solemnly swear, declare and state as follows : Pursuant to XXXX XXXX 1026.13 - Billing Error Resolution I, XXXX XXXX Beneficiary, dispute account number New Vehicle Loan - XXXX, XXXX XXXX - XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$35000.00} {$15000.00}, {$25000.00}, and {$13000.00}, have submitted correspondence to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to rectify this matter and it has yet to be resolved. Sent via Certified mail XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Please furnish documentary evidence in accord with 15 U.S. Code 44 of record of accounts where XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX awarded me, XXXX XXXX Beneficiary with any payment pertaining to this alleged debt. 
Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1666b ( a ) Notice, it is fact Beneficiary is aware 15 U.S. Code 1637 ( b ) ( 2 ) ( a ) refers to a request to resolve a billing error by providing all documentary evidence for clarification of who funded this account and whose obligation it is to pay this alleged debt on this account. New Vehicle Loan - XXXX, XXXX XXXX - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Until then XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX can not report late payments in accordance with the regulations of the Bureau 12 CFR 1026.13 ( d ) ( 3 ). 
Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( e ) If the creditor does not provide all documentary evidence as defined under 15 U.S. Code 44 this will result in a billing error and the creditor forfeits all rights to collection on the amount that has been identified in dispute. 

Notice, it is fact Beneficiary is aware that without resolving this billing error the creditor has legally agreed to forfeit all rights to collect on the amount in dispute pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( e ). 
Pursuant to 12 U.S. Code 5562 ( c ) ( 10 ) - Production of Document Material Notice, it is fact Beneficiary is aware the consumer has the right to request the money audit trail. Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : XXXX To Whom It May Concern : This will serve as your legal notice under the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), to cease all communications with me in regard to the alleged debt, referenced above. Do not contact me or any third parties via telephone, email, or mail regarding collection of this alleged debt.

I formally dispute the validity of this alleged debt. My dispute of this debt will be sent to Consumer Adjustment Co electronically, via CFPBs portal, and to the address referenced above, via certified mail, for record keeping purposes. 

In violation of both FCRA and FDCPA, I never received any notice of this alleged debt, with all of the required components, or of my right to dispute. However, as of XX/XX/2024, this alleged and fraudulent collection account was reported to my credit report. I do not owe this debt or any debt to Consumer Adjustment Co. or to any third party Consumer Adjustment Co. is stating to represent. I was a victim of identity theft and had a plethora of accounts fraudulently opened in my name. I have, again, enclosed a copy of FTCs id theft report to this letter.

As it is apparent that this alleged account was opened fraudulently, it is unconscionable that Consumer Adjustment Co. chose to initiate credit reporting and collection efforts, without giving me my legal right to dispute.

Per FCRA and FDCPA, all reportable information has to be true and accurate prior to reporting. Consumer Adjustment Co. has failed to follow the law and has taken adverse action against me and my credit report, by placing a collection account on my credit report, which was opened by way of fraud, without giving me proper notification and my right to dispute. 

As such, I formally request that all adverse information placed against my credit report is removed immediately upon receipt of my documentation, and that further collection activities are ceased. You are also notified that should adverse information remain on my credit reports, and if collection activities continue, appropriate legal action will be taken. 

Thank you for your attention in this matter. 

V/R, XXXX XXXX

They never received proper notice or a chance to dispute, yet the debt was reported to their credit report, violating FCRA and FDCPA. They demand removal and cessation of collection activities.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the 4th Amendment. I believe that my personal information has been mishandled, leading to a breach of privacy and potential harm to my financial well-being.

Firstly, I have reason to believe that my FCRA rights have been violated due to inaccurate information reported by a credit reporting agency. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate and up-to-date information about consumers, and that consumers have the right to dispute any inaccuracies. I have discovered several errors in my credit report, including incorrect account balances and outdated information, which have adversely affected my creditworthiness. Despite my repeated attempts to rectify these errors, the credit reporting agency has failed to take appropriate action, thereby violating my FCRA rights.

Furthermore, I suspect a violation of my 4th Amendment rights in relation to unauthorized access and use of my personal information. I have reason to believe that certain entities have obtained and utilized my personal data without my knowledge or consent. This unauthorized access to my information not only infringes upon my right to privacy but also exposes me to potential identity theft and financial harm. I am deeply concerned about the potential consequences of this violation and the lack of safeguards in place to protect consumers ' sensitive information. 

I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau thoroughly investigate this matter to ensure that my rights under the FCRA and the 4th Amendment are upheld. I urge you to take appropriate action against the credit reporting agency responsible for the inaccurate reporting and the entities involved in the unauthorized access and use of my personal information. 

Additionally, I would appreciate any guidance or assistance you can provide in rectifying the inaccuracies in my credit report and safeguarding my personal information from further misuse. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will diligently work towards resolving this violation and protecting consumers ' rights. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges FCRA and 4th Amendment rights violations due to inaccurate credit reporting and unauthorized access to their personal information. The credit reporting agency failed to correct errors despite repeated attempts, and the consumer suspects entities accessed their data without consent, posing identity theft and financial harm risks.

Narrative Summary: The consumer is requesting the removal of inaccurate information from their credit report, citing the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681e(b), which holds consumer reporting agencies responsible for ensuring report accuracy.

I continue to be harassed by different debt collectors on a monthly basis for a debt that is not mine which is extremely illegal according to the following laws 15 U.S. Code 1692b - Acquisition of location information 15 U.S. Code 1692c - Communication in connection with debt collection 15 U.S. Code 1692d - Harassment or abuse. My information continues to be sold & shared illegally which is a violation of my right.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Fair Collections and Outsourcing INC. incorrectly linked a $9700 debt to their name, despite never doing business with the original creditor. They're being harassed by multiple collectors, violating laws 15 U.S. Code 1692b, 1692c, and 1692d, and their info is being shared illegally.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: I have sent this company a cease and desist. This company has refused to adhere to the federal guidelines by ignoring my request in my attempts to resolve this matter. This company has also been found to impose as a collection agency when it is listed that this company is not legally bonded and or insured to collect in the state of Alabama. Please have this company cease all collection activities, this is my last attempt to complain outside of court.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges a company is violating federal guidelines by ignoring their cease and desist request. The company, not bonded or insured in Alabama, is also improperly posing as a collection agency, prompting the consumer to seek external intervention before pursuing court action.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative: I never receivd any communication that you were collecting a debt. Excessive interest is being charged. Please be advised that I hereby dispute the validity of the alleged debt listed above in its entirety. Further, I request verification of the alleged debt, specifically, I request : ( 1 ) a copy of every contract and/or agreement, including, but not limited to, ( a ) an informed consent for medical treatment and ( b ) financial responsibility agreement, signed by the listed medical provider and XXXX XXXX XXXX 2 ) a copy of all actual bills sent from Medical provider to XXXX XXXX with tracking numbers ( e.g., certified mail return receipt number ) or other proof of mailing ( e.g., affidavit of mailing by the individual who mailed it ), ( 3 ) a copy of all pre-certifications and billings sent to insurance companies and a copy of all payments received from insurances companies for the alleged debt, ( 4 ) a copy of the record ( i.e., the amount paid and date of payment ) for any co-payment made by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX medical provider, and ( 5 ) a detailed itemization of the amount that you are attempting to collect, including but not limited to, procedure type or medicines or other items and their respective costs. Said contract or agreement must be with the original creditor and signed by all parties involved. You are illegally attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt and money that I do not owe. Cease and desist all collection activity, including all reporting to consumer reporting agencies. Promptly request deletion of any and all prior reporting made to any consumer reporting agencies. If you comply with my deletion request within 14 days, then you are excused from verification. Send me a letter confirming your requests to CRAs to delete your reporting of the alleged debt. This letter and evidence may be provided to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). The CFPB is authorized to investigate this fully matter and receive any related information herein. Be advised, if you fail to comply with this demand letter, I may turn the matter over to an attorney and sue you.
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes the validity of a medical debt and claims they never received communication about the debt collection. They request verification of the debt, including contracts, bills, and payment records, and demand the collector cease and desist all collection activity and delete any prior reporting to credit agencies.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX was contacted to install solar panels on our roof, initiating a credit check with Mosaic XXXXXXXX for loan pre-approval. By early XXXX, our project was disqualified due to insufficient roof space, and XXXX XXXX promised to notify Mosaic XXXX of the cancellation. However, Mosaic XXXX was not informed and disbursed {$15000.00} to XXXX XXXX without our knowledge. We discovered the outstanding loan in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Upon learning about the loan, we contacted XXXX XXXX, who confirmed the project 's cancellation and re-notified Mosaic XXXX. They suggested a salesperson 's error might have caused the oversight. Despite our efforts, Mosaic XXXX continues to harass us about the loan, claiming they haven't received responses from XXXX XXXX. 

We seek the CFPB assistance to : 1. Stop harassment by Mosaic XXXX. 
2. Fully cancel the loan.

3. Confirm resolution from both companies.

4. Receive a formal apology for the distress caused. 

We request prompt resolution due to the mismanagement and communication failures of XXXX XXXX and Mosaic XXXX. 

I also draw your attention to a recent XXXX XXXX expose on the same topic ( same XXXX companies ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims that after a solar panel project was cancelled due to insufficient roof space, the installer (XXXX XXXX) failed to notify the lender (Mosaic XXXX), resulting in a $15,000 loan being disbursed without their knowledge. They seek CFPB assistance to stop harassment and cancel the loan.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was sold a pest control service from a company named XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, Oregon. They sold me a service saying they would come to my home, locate and plug up holes where pests were getting into my house and set traps for the rodents. They came to my home and set two traps outside with no poison or bait in the traps. They sprayed some sort of chemical around my house. This did not stop the rodents. I used mouse traps to catch and kill the rodents. I had to go into my crawlspace and locate where the rodents were getting in and plugged up the hole. I had to go and buy the poison to put in the traps they left. 

The company did not provide me with the service they promised and I cancelled my service. Now the company is trying to collect for services not provided. They turned me into ARM Solutions for debt collection. I am getting harassing calls, texts, and letters from ARM Solutions. I have told them to stop contacting me and I do not owe XXXX XXXX XXXX any money. They will not leave me alone.
Narrative Summary: A consumer hired a pest control service, XXXX XXXX XXXX, to seal entry points and set traps for rodents. The company set empty traps and sprayed chemicals, but didn't seal entry points, leading the consumer to take matters into their own hands. The company now seeks payment despite not providing the promised service.

Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative: I HAVE NOTIFIED THE COMPANY TO CEASE ALL COMMUNICATION WITH ME AND THAT I REFUSE TO PAY THE DEBT 15 US CODE 1692 ( C ) ALSO NOTING THAT CEASING ALL COMMUNCATION WITH ME INCLUDING THIRD PARTY COMMUNICATION VIA CONSUMER REPORTING AGENICES AND THAT THEY DELETE ALL INFORMATION.
Narrative Summary: A consumer notified a debt collection company to cease communication, citing 15 USC 1692(c), and refused to pay the debt. They also demanded deletion of information from consumer reporting agencies and an end to third-party communications.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: My original mortgage lender was XXXX Mortgage XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). I signed my Note and gave it to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX went out of business on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX did not indorse the Note to any party and XXXX did not assign the Note to any party. Chase Home XXXX XXXX ( Chase ) took over the mortgage servicing while it was a stranger to my Note and while not paying the XXXX its share because XXXX did not exist. I made monthly mortgage payments to Chase until XX/XX/XXXX. Due to the XXXX of XXXX, I lost my job in XX/XX/XXXX I was not able to pay Chase. On XX/XX/XXXX Chase forged a mortgage assignment from XXXX to Chase. and based on that filed a Foreclosure Complaint on XX/XX/XXXX in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NJ, On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX from the NJ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX suspended the Complaint of XX/XX/XXXX and ordered Chase to remove the forged mortgage assignment of XX/XX/XXXX to cure the deficiencies and re-file. Chase violated that XXXX of XX/XX/XXXX, and instead forged XXXX more mortgage documents and sold it to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) sometime before XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX hired a local notary public to forge my signature on a so-called HAM Agreement of XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX the Note was already time barred based on NJSA XXXX ( b ). On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX filed the second foreclosure complaint based on the time-barred Note and the recycled forged mortgage assignment of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX was a debt collector by filed the foreclosure complaint as a mortgage lender and servicer. without being a secured creditor. I sent FDCPA XXXX XXXX letter to XXXX in XXXX of XXXX they ignored it. XXXX sold the alleged debt to XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) in XXXX of XXXX. XXXX sent me a FDCPA XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and I denied it and asked for validation. XXXX replied that they would validate the debt and get back to me and I am still waiting. XXXX was a debt collector and was trying to collect on a time-barred debt. In XXXX of XXXX, XXXX sold the alleged debt to XXXX XXXX Mortgage Servicing ( XXXX point ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank ). On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX sent them FDCPA XXXX XXXX Letters, and they replied that my case was complex and they would get back to me. I never heard from them, On XX/XX/XXXX I sent them both FDCPA Cease and Desist Letter. XXXX point continued sending my mortgage statements on a time-barred Note. XXXX point is a debt collector not my mortgage servicer. XXXX Bank is a debt collector, not the owner of my mortgage. The owner of my mortgage was XXXX and now the Note is time-barred. I request that both leave me alone and stop harassing me.
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges that Chase Home and subsequent debt collectors (XXXX, XXXX point, and XXXX Bank) forged mortgage documents and attempted to collect on a time-barred debt, violating the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA).

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

Collection account is reporting unpaid with {$0.00} balance. Company refuses to remove collection from my credit reports even after verifying that my address is not the correct address that they have on file.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted the collection agency after discovering a debt collection on my credit report. The collection was related to an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account. I have never had an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I asked what address was associated with the account and it was an address that my daughter had previously lived at XXXX XXXX. My daughter and her roommates indicated that the account was paid on a regular monthly basis while they lived at the apartment. The account was in the name of one of my daughter 's roommates, so I am confused how the account would be associated with me if there is any dispute with the company.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a debt collection on their credit report, claiming they never had an account with the company. The associated address belonged to their daughter's former apartment, where a roommate had an account that was paid regularly, and the consumer is unclear why it's linked to them.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative: A vehicle was reported for collections on my credit for XXXX fromXX/XX/XXXXXX/XX/XXXXafter multiple disputes they closed it at XXXX balance. 2 weeks later this company Jefferson capital puts on my credit the same information I will not allow me to dispute. They have not mailed or notified me regarding this collection before reporting I also did not agree for this information to be provided to this company

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
My credit report says " LAUNCH SERVICING LLC '' reported a new account with late payments of {$10000.00} that I don't believe I have. They reported that on XX/XX/year>, and didn't say how much total is owed in the account, just that I'm late on {$10000.00}. It honestly all sounds pretty fishy. I will also note that I had my wallet stolen with a copy of my social security number in it and all my credit cards back in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. I called the police and knew who did it, a XXXX XXXX, but no one could help me recover it. They used my credit cards and I canceled and disputed those charges. 

I've already made this consumer statement with XXXX XXXX XXXX I HAVE NO KNOWLEDGE OF THIS ACCOUNT. '' but they didn't remove it from my credit report.
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a credit report entry from "LAUNCH SERVICING LLC" showing a new account with $10,000 in late payments, claiming no knowledge of the account. This issue arose after their wallet was stolen in the past, containing their social security number and credit cards.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a collection account labeled TRUIST XXXX that has been inaccurately reported on my credit report. The presence of this unverified collection is causing severe harm to my credit score and is taking a considerable toll on my overall well-being, leading to significant stress and XXXX To the best of my knowledge, the creditor responsible for this collection account has failed to provide proper verification of its legitimacy and accuracy. This lack of verification has led to an erroneous credit report entry that is negatively affecting my financial standing. The unjustly reported collection account has resulted in a substantial and undeserved negative impact on my credit score. Additionally, the stress and XXXX that have arisen from this situation are affecting my overall quality of life. I firmly believe in the importance of accurate credit reporting and the duty of creditors to verify the legitimacy of their claims before reporting them.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
Was not aware of this debt. Source management sent a letter to inform me of this. I talked to them and got nowhere. I have yet to see any proof that I owe this debt. When I asked for proof they said I had to write them a letter to ask for it.bif they have documentation they should provide it. Also this XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Has not provided any documentation that shows I have any knowledge of this. One would think that source receivable would not just take XXXXXXXX XXXX request without confirmation. The nay thing I got from source management that XXXXXXXX XXXX sent them something that said it was a write off. I have no knowledge of that either. 

I have no documents to attach
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a letter from Source Management about an unknown debt. They requested proof but were told to write a letter to obtain it. The consumer disputes the debt, claiming no prior knowledge or documentation, and questions why Source Management accepted the claim without confirmation.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was paid
Consumer complaint narrative:
Professional Credit Management of XXXX, AR has listed a debt on my credit bureaus for {$520.00}. This debt was paid directly to the original creditor. 

I had a connversation on XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX XXXX MST and requested they remove this listing : Here is a copy of the conversation. 

You are reporting a collection on my bureaus that was paid directly to the creditor XXXX XXXX  XXXX has joined the XXXX XXXX  Thank you for contacting us. Your privacy, all consumer / patient privacy is very important to us. In order to ensure I am speaking to the right person, please verify your home address. 
XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NM XXXX XXXX  XXXX  As we begin, I'm required to say : This is an attempt to collect a debt, and any information obtained will be used for that purpose. I've successfully identified your accounts and am reviewing. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX  I'm showing multiple accounts in our office, which account are you referring to? 
XXXX XXXX  I understand. I am only looking for the account that is directly related to me not to the XXXX XXXX XXXX  The NEXT accout ( Personal ) was already paid. I am referring to the XXXX in the amount of XXXX per the credit bureaus XXXX XXXX  XXXX  Did you make the payment directly to XXXX? 
XXXX XXXX  Yes, Payment was made directly to XXXX, which means Professional Credit does not have the right under my FDCPA to report on my bureaus XXXX XXXX  XXXX  When did you make the payment? 
XXXX XXXX If you have a share link I would be happy to share the PDF or screenshot XXXX XXXX  XXXX  I'm not sure if the chat feature will allow that. However, you can email it to me if you would like. XXXX XXXX XXXX  I have just sent you an email. 
XXXX XXXX  As Professional Credit does not own this account, and the original creditor was paid directly ; I would like to request you immediately update my credit bureaus and remove this account from the bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX  XXXX  The payment was made on XX/XX/XXXX, they have up to 30 days to report the payment to us. They have not reported the payment at this time. Once the payment is reported, we will update the credit bureaus that the account has been paid and will reflect a {$0.00} balance. 
XXXX XXXX  Again, I request Professional Credit remove this listing from my bureau. As you are not the owner of this account, and payment made to the original creditor, You have no right to continue to report XXXX XXXX  XXXX  You are correct in that we are not the owner of the debt, we are collecting on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the payment being made directly to the provider has nothing to do with the provider. Non-medical collection debt does not get removed from the credit report once paid in full, regardless of whether the bill was paid to the original creditor or to PCM. The balance will be updated to a {$0.00} balance once the payment is reported. 
XXXX XXXX  You are not collecting on their behalf they are paid XXXX XXXX XXXX Once XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX reports the payment, we will update that the account has been paid. 
XXXX XXXX  Ok, I am currently filing a complaint with the FDCPA. I will let them work on my behalf. 
XXXX XXXX  XXXX  Thank you for contacting us today. Is there anything further I can assist you with?
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Professional Credit Management is reporting a $520 debt on their credit bureaus, despite being paid directly to the original creditor. The consumer requested removal, citing FDCPA, but the company refused, stating they'll update to a $0 balance once payment is reported.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: I believe this could be a collection scam. They company name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, phone number XXXX. The address is XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX, which is for an office building in XXXX XXXX, and there is no listing of that company there. I XXXX got a phone call from someone who claimed to be a process server from phone number XXXX - this has no matches on the web. The person on this call said I was about to be served and wanted to make sure I was home to receive the summons. He refused to tell me what it was about but gave me another phone number to call and a case number. I called that number, XXXX, and a very rude person who took my call said I had a loan I took out in XXXX  from HSBC bank, for over XXXX, but I don't recall taking out a loan like this. I also believe that if this was a legitimate debt, it is past the statute of limitations for collections. They refused to provide proof of the debt when i asked for it. They threatened to have my wages garnished by XXXX XXXX, which is not legal in my state. They sent me a generic collection letter via email with a company name that I can not locate on the web, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I also looked up their phone number online, XXXX, and nothing matched. I believe they are trying to scam me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a suspicious call claiming to be a process server, stating they'd be served a summons. The caller refused to disclose details but provided a case number and another phone number. The subsequent call revealed an alleged debt from HSBC, which the consumer disputes and believes is past the statute of limitations.

Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative:
In regards to company XXXX XXXX XXXX for unprofessional and emotionally abusive practices : Mountain Land Collections, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX We would like to report this company for the unprofessional and abusive way that they dealt with us. We felt that the communication was not professional or straightforward enough, and then they behaved in an emotionally abusive manner. 

We received multiple phone calls from the service that were vague claiming they wanted to collect a debt. Over the phone, we were immediately asked sensitive information because they said we had overdue medical bills. We did not feel comfortable giving them our information and as far as we knew it was a phishing scam. Someone randomly calling you and asking where you work and what your social security number and birthday is without knowing who they are is not the best way to tell someone that there is actually a reputable dispute and you are not a scammer. We were not referred to an online account where the charges were listed we were given. There was no email outlining what was wrong. We did not receive letters in red from the company listing the overdue charges with dates. We were not properly informed. Nothing but vague harassing phone calls, but no evidence of what was actually going on. We assumed it was a scam. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX a man not in uniform showed up in person to our home from the company to deliver notice that they were filing a lawsuit. We were having dinner with our kids. It was not an official legal summons. They could have delivered it on any day and they could have delivered it through mail. But no, a man showed up at my door on SUNDAY, XXXX 's Day to tell us we were being sued. It upset us very much and ruined our holiday. I personally felt like it was abusive, unnecessary, that they did not communicate well. And the way that they are conducting their business is absolutely terrible. They knew what they were doing and it was completely unnecessary.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reports Mountain Land Collections for unprofessional and emotionally abusive debt collection practices. The company made vague phone calls requesting sensitive info, then sent an ununiformed representative to deliver a lawsuit notice on a Sunday, causing distress and ruining a family holiday.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX RADIUS GLOBAL SOLUTIONS LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to dispute owing any and all debts to RADIUS GLOBAL SOLUTIONS LLC. I am requesting debt validation. I am requesting the purchase agreement between RADIUS GLOBAL SOLUTIONS LLC and the original creditor XXXX XXXX ( Cable/Cellular ). I am requesting proof that RADIUS GLOBAL SOLUTIONS LLC Is licensed and bonded. 

I dispute this debt for the following reasons : 1. Collection agency has not provided validation information under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) but yet you placed a collection on my consumer report. 
2. I have not been given a chance to dispute account according to 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) 3. Collection agency is violating my consumer rights by using false misleading, misrepresentation and deceptive means. 
4. Collection agency has no authority to furnish any account to a consumer reporting agencies without any and all disclosures required by law and you are in clear violation of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) and 15 USC 1681-S2 ( 7 ) ( A ) I am revoking all rights of RADIUS GLOBAL SOLUTIONS LLC communicating with me through email/text/calls. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a debt with RADIUS GLOBAL SOLUTIONS LLC, requesting validation and proof of licensure. They claim the agency failed to provide required disclosures, placed a collection on their report without validation, and used deceptive means, violating consumer rights under 12 CFR 1006.34 and 15 USC 1681-S2.

Further, the alleged account was transferred in good faith and with the consent of all parties involved. If they are unable to provide under oath the previously listed item then I require the account to be removed from my credit & their records. CREDIT COLL XX/XX/XXXXand CREDIT COLLXX/XX/XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Credence Resource Management regarding their actions concerning account number XXXX. The collection agency has egregiously violated my rights as a consumer under the regulations outlined in 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) ; 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) ; 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ), and 15 USC 1681-S2 ( 7 ) ( A ).

According to my understanding of the aforementioned regulations, Credence Resource Management has failed to adhere to the following : 1. **12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) ** : This section stipulates the requirements for providing notice to consumers. Credence Resource Management has not provided me with proper notification regarding the collection activities related to account XXXX. 

2. **12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) ** : This regulation outlines the specific information that should be included in the notice provided to consumers. Credence Resource Management has not furnished me with the required information in the notification, depriving me of essential details regarding the debt in question.

3. **12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) ** : This section emphasizes the need for accuracy and integrity in debt collection practices. Credence Resource Management 's actions have lacked transparency and accuracy, which is a clear violation of this regulation. 

XXXX. XXXX15 USC 1681-S2 ( 7 ) ( A ) ** : This provision safeguards consumers ' rights by ensuring that collection agencies provide proper notification before initiating collection efforts. Credence Resource Management has failed to uphold this fundamental requirement. 

I am hereby requesting that this account is deleted from my credit report. 

Furthermore, if Credence Resource Management believe that they have provided me with proper notification, I demand that they provide evidence in the form of a certified receipt with my signature acknowledging receipt of the notification. 

I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will address this matter promptly and ensure that my consumer rights are upheld. Please keep me informed of any developments regarding this complaint. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges Credence Resource Management violated debt collection regulations by failing to provide proper notification, omitting required information, and lacking transparency and accuracy. The consumer requests account deletion from their credit report and evidence of notification receipt.

Consumer complaint narrative: Since XX/XX/year> Global Holdings has been receiving twice a month payment from me to settle/negotiate credit card debt. As of today 's date, I have given them {$6900.00}. They have not settled any of my debt to date. In fact, they have put me off two months in a row, telling me it will be the next month and thank you for being patient. I have watched my credit score crash with no results from them. They have been taking administrative fees and other processing fees on the front end with no evidence of any work or effort. Recently they have attempted to get me to sign a document that they are changing their process to collect fees after the settlement. I did not sign the document. Now I have received an email through XXXX XXXX XXXX with a Supplemental notice telling me there is a class action law suit which issued a temporary restraining order restricting them from collecting any advance fees or settling any debts. The case is in New York and it is being filed by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the case number is XXXX. ( XXXXY ) : Case No. 1:24-cv-00040-EAW-MJR. I want to be a part of the " XXXX '' group and need help doing this or who to contact. I understand the debt is still mine, but need to be whole again to fix this. I have stopped payment from my account.
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid Global Holdings $6,900 to settle credit card debt, but the company failed to settle any debt, instead taking administrative fees. A class-action lawsuit has been filed, and the consumer wants to join the lawsuit and seek help to recover their losses.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX of 2023, I signed up for a credit repair/ consideration company 1 month after completing the paperwork with agreement 's, payments would be dispatched every two weeks to debt companies. my accounts were transferred to another company, without any knowledge and payments were only dispatched once a month. Second disconnection within the two companies cause change of withdrawing for payment to credit repair/ consolidation company cause payment for 2 consecutive months missed. Reported negligence for debt companies..

However, their account was transferred to another company without notice, and payments were made monthly instead. This led to missed payments for two consecutive months, causing reported negligence to debt companies.

Consumer complaint narrative: Posit that taxpayer got rid of guesswork, and remains confident filing with Americas assumed leader in taxes.
Narrative Summary: The complaint narrative is not provided, but rather an advertisement slogan. There is no specific issue or key facts to summarize.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank Of America breach the HAMP agreement with FNMA and they filed false proofs of claim in bankruptcy without applying the payments received from FNMA to the borrower account.

Bank Of America does not comply with their HAMP agreement and did not credit the payments received from FannieMae to the borrower account, and on top of that they double-dipping filed false FCA proofs of claim in bankruptcy without applying these payments to debtor account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2024 I have been contacted by a collection receivable company and informed that I have to pay {$1300.00} for breaking the lease with the gym. I explained that I have already contacted the fitness company to provide them with a medical report advising that my wife and I have XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. However, they refused and insisted that I am bound by the contract and must pay. Additionally, this fitness company has not been honest. When I first visited them and mentioned that I might need to cancel anytime due to my back issues, they assured me that there would be no extra fees and that I could cancel anytime, as confirmed by a staff member named [ I can proved her name if needed ]. Finally, they charged me an additional {$39.00} after XXXX months from my contract as annual maintenance fees. 

They began contacting me on both my personal and work phones, which could negatively impact my reputation at my workplace. This behavior is not ethical, as this matter is personal and should not interfere with my professional responsibilities.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a collection notice for $1,300 from a gym for breaking a lease. They claim the gym refused to accept a medical report as grounds for cancellation, despite initial assurances that they could cancel anytime without extra fees.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Fay Servicing regarding their management of my mortgage account and the unacceptable customer service I have experienced. 

Despite my repeated requests, Fay Servicing has refused to adjust the due date of my mortgage payment to align with the timing of my rental income, which I receive mid-month. As a result, I am consistently unable to make my mortgage payment by the XXXX of each month, causing unnecessary stress and financial strain. I believe this rigid policy is designed to collect interest on my account until the payment is made, which is unfair and predatory. 

Additionally, Fay Servicing has made several errors in the past, including inputting incorrect payment information, which caused checks to be returned. Although these errors were confirmed and the default interest was removed, I am now being unfairly penalized. For example, while I was able to make my XXXX payment over the phone, I am now being forced to submit certified funds due to an incident that was not my fault. This requirement appears to be another attempt to delay my payments and penalize me further. 

These issues have caused significant distress and financial hardship, and Fay Servicing 's lack of flexibility and repeated errors demonstrate a disregard for fair customer service practices. 

I am requesting the assistance of the CFPB to investigate this matter and to ensure that Fay Servicing : XXXX. Adjusts my mortgage payment due date to align with the timing of my rental income. 
XXXX. Allows me to make payments through standard methods without the unnecessary requirement for certified funds. 
XXXX. Improves their customer service practices to prevent further errors and delays. 

Please acknowledge receipt of this complaint and inform me of the steps being taken to address my concerns. Attached is record of their error. I need to make my payment before default interest kicks in. I dont have enough time to send certified funds over an issue that wasnt my fault. I need my ability to make payments restored immediately. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Narrative Summary: The consumer is complaining about Fay Servicing's refusal to adjust their mortgage payment due date to align with their mid-month rental income, causing financial strain. They also cite errors, such as incorrect payment information, and unfair penalties, including a requirement for certified funds.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I signed up with Clear One Advantage in XXXX for a debt settlement. A settlement agreement with the lender was reached and I have been paying bi-weekly to Clear One ever since including Clear One 's fees which were never expressly stated. I increased my bi-weekly drafts to finish the program and based on what my assigned specialist told me in XX/XX/XXXX, my last draft was submitted in XX/XX/XXXX. Prior to this, phone representatives could never give me an accurate payoff amount ( this includes the " specialist '' ) and it would go up and down based on the representative. At one point I was told the company was due to return {$12000.00} to me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX a draft was withdrawn. I had been expressly told that these would cease after XX/XX/XXXX. In sum, the company provides inaccurate information if not commits outright fraud. It is unclear when ( if ever ) I will get out of this and at what cost. Please provide assistance.
Narrative Summary: The consumer signed up with Clear One Advantage for debt settlement and paid bi-weekly, including unclear fees. Despite being told the final draft would be in XX/XX/XXXX, another draft was withdrawn, contradicting previous statements and raising concerns about inaccurate information and potential fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the validity of an account that appears on my credit report. The accounts in questions, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX has been reported as opened without my authorization and contains charges that I did not make. 

I became aware of potential identity theft and fraud concerning my personal information back in XXXX. As a precautionary measure, I contacted the appropriate authorities and was advised to freeze my credit until the issue was resolved. Despite taking this action, it appears that my concerns were not adequately addressed, and unauthorized activity has still occurred on my credit report. 

Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, Section 1692c ( e ), I am entitled to dispute the validity of any debt claimed by a debt collector. I am exercising this right and requesting immediate removal of the aforementioned account from my credit report.

I urge you to conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and provide me with written confirmation of the actions taken to rectify this situation. Additionally, I request that any charges associated with this unauthorized account be removed promptly to prevent further damage to my credit standing. 

Please consider this letter as a formal request for resolution under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I expect a timely response and resolution to this matter. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes an unauthorized account on their credit report, claiming it was opened and charged without their permission. They had previously reported potential identity theft and frozen their credit, but the issue persists. They request removal of the account and associated charges under the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative: Capital one put a restriction on my account. I send a remittance coupon with a restrictive endorsement. ( 12 CFR 1005.30 - REMITTANCE TRANSFER DEFINITIONS. ) ( 18 U.S. Code 655 - Theft by bank examiner ) ( 31 CFR 328.8- LOSS, THEFT, OR DESTRUCTION OF SECURITIES BEARING RESTRICTIVE ENDORSEMENTS. ) On XX/XX/year>. Tracking number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XXXX XXXX another letter was send tracking number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I never give Captial One permission to put restriction on my account. Capital one is a foreign company to CAPITAL ONE FINANCIAL CORPORATION. ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX reporting XXXX, XXXX, XXXX will show that ). Serveral payment have been made, as shown on my statement. They never acredit my account for the ach payment. ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX same day transactions/Payment ) I paid with an closed account that carries {$250000.00} from the FDIC - ( Federal despository insurance company ). My Transaction are private with this closed account. Captial One unlink my bank accouunt information that payments was made with. Captial one is the account holder. XXXX XXXX is the account owner. A copyright notices has been sent along with the power attorney over the account. Captial One can not lend credit. No bank can lend credit nor money. ( 12 USC 615 - POWERS OF CORPORATION ) ( 12 U.S. Code 1431 - Powers and duties of banks. ) ( 12 USC 91 - TRANSFERS BY BANK AND OTHER ACTS IN CONTEMPLATION OF INSOLVENCY- All transfers of the notes, bonds, bills of exchange, or other evidences of debt owing to any national banking association , or of deposits to its credit ; all assignments of mortgages, sureties on real estate, or of judgments or decrees in its favor ; all deposits of money, bullion, or other valuable thing for its use, or for the use of any of its shareholders or creditors ; and all payments of money to either, made after the commission of an act of insolvency, or in contemplation thereof, made with a view to prevent the application of its assets in the manner prescribed by chapter 4 of title 62 of the Revised Statutes, or with a view to the preference of one creditor to another, except in payment of its circulating notes, shall be utterly null and void ; and no attachment, injunction, or execution, shall be issued against such association or its property before final judgment in any suit, action, or proceeding, in any State , county, or municipal court. ) 12 USC 95 A ( 2 ) ) - ) Any payment, conveyance, transfer, assign-ment, or delivery of property or interest there-in, made to or for the account of the United States, or as otherwise directed, pursuant to this section or any rule, regulation, instruction, or direction issued hereunder shall to the extent thereof be a full acquittance and discharge for all purposes of the obligation of the person mak-ing the same ; and no person shall be held liable in any court for or in respect to anything done or omitted in good faith in connection with the administration of, or in pursuance of and in reli-ance on, this section, or any rule, regulation, instruction, or direction issued here under.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's Capital One account was restricted without permission. Consumer complaint narrative:
I was approved for two loans through XXXX XXXX  - Upstart. I had been making payments regularly and then got into a hardship program. I have not been able to make ends meet since. So they took me off of the hardship program and sent me to collections. I have tried everything possible to make payment offers before they charged off my account, but each representative, kept promising that they could help me. So, two different occasions I made payments, only to find out that they would not be able to help with hardship. So they would send a link, it wouldn't take my response, and then they would still take partial payment and say the hardship department can work something out with me. 

Basically, empty promises and I believe this is a good faith issue where this loan company is not practicing it. There is a promissory note, but how can I work out payment plans when they will not allow me to.
Narrative Summary: The consumer was removed from a hardship program by Upstart and sent to collections despite making payment offers. Multiple representatives made empty promises to help with hardship, accepting partial payments while failing to provide assistance, leading to a charge-off and alleged lack of good faith.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I signed on with National Debt Relief to reduce the amount of credit card debt I owed. I was told they could negotiate with the credit card companies to reduce the amount due ( {$22000.00} ) to ( {$17000.00} ) reducing my total debt. My total debt owed was used to calculate a monthly payment ( {$360.00} ) that was to be held in an account while they negotiated with creditors. By XXXX of XXXX National Debt Relief had only negotiated on XXXX of the XXXX accounts enrolled in the program and I had paid a total of {$2800.00} into the account when I decided to un-enroll from the program realizing I was still paying on the total debt not negotiated debt which was my goal. In XXXX of XXXX XXXX of the creditors decided to file a case management trial with the XXXX XXXX demanding I pay the debt they claim was owed of {$4600.00}. This was XXXX of the creditors enrolled in the XXXX XXXX program that I later learned was not contacted to begin negotiations during the time I was enrolled in the program. As the consumer I was not aware that creditors would be contacted and negotiated with as other credit accounts in the program were resolved. As of today I am still attempting to clear these accounts from my credit.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
Narrative Summary: The consumer enrolled in National Debt Relief's program to reduce $22,000 in credit card debt. After paying $2,800, they discovered only a few accounts were negotiated, and creditors not contacted by the company filed a lawsuit for $4,600. The consumer felt misled about the negotiation process.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The service is Tomo Credit, specifically Tomo Boost. 

Here is my issue, with screenshots/emails to back this up. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I emailed Tomo to cancel my subscription of their " XXXX XXXX '' for {$34.00}. 

They didn't reply until XX/XX/XXXX ( charging me another month ), and assured me it would be cancelled. 

It is XX/XX/XXXX, and the subscription is still not cancelled. Not only that, but this service reports to the credit breaus with an account on my credit as TOMO. 

This account was closed in XXXX of XXXX, yet they are still charging me {$34.00} every month. 

When I emailed them again to cancel this, and put in a chargeback for the month of XXXX, their customer service is actively refusing to cancel it, for no reason other than " we want to secure your financial future ''. 

Their website also does not have a cancellation feature. You can not remove cards for the subscription. You can not remove bank accounts. You can not cancel your membership. The only way to cancel is through their support at XXXX, and they do not cancel it. Instead, they gaslight. 

Highly un-professional and borderline a scam. The whole point of the boost service is to 1 ) make an account on your credit 2 ) report on-time payments 3 ) this is a monthly service cost of {$34.00}.

Tomo has removed my account on my credit, and is not reporting on-time payments, but they are still charging my account! This is fraud! 

Since XX/XX/XXXX, {$34.00} has been taken unwillingly despite multiple emails to cancel the service. 
That is {$310.00} of my money taken, while also hurting my credit by 10 points. All thanks to this " service ''
Narrative Summary: The consumer complains about Tomo Credit's Tomo Boost service, alleging they were charged $34/month despite multiple requests to cancel, with the company refusing to cancel and instead providing unhelpful responses. This resulted in $310 in unauthorized charges and 10-point credit score damage.

Issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a threatening letter in the mail. on XXXX, 2024 This letter had no return address or company name. Just an XXXX number. The letter said that I must respond " within 10 days '' regarding my account. " Failure to respond '' was highlighted in the letter. With threats that I would accrue " unreasonable '' interest and " penalties '' if I didn't respond. The final paragraph reads, " In order to determine the feasibility of an adjustment to your outstanding balances it is important for you to contact our firm at XXXX within 10 days of receiving this notice to avoid unnecessary delays in processing your request. '' I thought I owed {$25000.00} to this company after reading this letter. 

I contacted the company at the number given. Only to find out this is a debt relief company, Debt Busters, designed to help people pay down debt. I had no previous contact with this company. I did not owe this company any money. I did not contact this company at any time in the past. 

This is a violation of the FTC act in this letter was deceptive and misleading. Nothing in this letter identifies it as a advertisement.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a threatening letter with no return address or company name, demanding a response within 10 days regarding an alleged account. Upon calling the provided number, the consumer discovered it was a debt relief company, Debt Busters, with no prior contact or debt owed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My identiy was stolen and I am writing to dispute fraudulent charge ( s ) I am a victim of identity theft, and I did not make [ this/these ] charge ( s ). I request that you remove the fraudulent charge ( s ) and any related finance charge and other charges from my account, send me an updated and accurate statement, and close the account ( if applicable ). I also request that you cease reporting the inaccurate information to all of the nationwide credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ) to which you provided it.

Enclosed is a copy of my Identity Theft Report supporting my position, and a copy of my credit report showing the fraudulent items related to your company that are the result of identity theft. Also enclosed is a copy of the Notice to Furnishers issued by the Federal Trade Commission, which details your responsibilities under the Fair Credit Reporting Act as an information furnisher to CRAs. The Notice also specifies your responsibilities when you receive notice from a CRA, under section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, that information you provided to the CRA may be the result of identity theft. Those responsibilities include ceasing to provide the inaccurate information to any CRAs, and ensuring that you do not attempt to sell or transfer the fraudulent debts to another party for collection.

Please investigate this matter and send me a written explanation of your findings and actions.

my Rights are being violated I don't not agree with the items listed below which still appear on my credit report, even after your Investigation. I would like these items immediately re-moved. These inaccuracies are highly injurious to my credit rating. I have been turned down for job opportunities and I am looking to purchase a home soon. Please help me remove these inaccurate items, -re-investigate and verify all data for this account is reporting accurately accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 


I told XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX to reinvestigate these accounts and inquiry are Fraud : XXXXXXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  # XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX. Inquiry : XXXX XXXX of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXX XXXX of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXX XXXX of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXX of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXX of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXX XXXX of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXXDate of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available Credit Agents stated everything was complete and accurate. But how is that possible if the open date, date of last activity and much more is incorrect. According to 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ), they are supposed to modify accounts that aren't reporting correctly.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I closed on a XXXX bedroom unit in a low income XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX co-op building in XXXX. Around XXXX, when interest rates dropped to their lowest, XXXX invited me to apply for an Interest Rate Reduction and represented they'd lower my interest rate which would have significantly lowered my monthly payments. I relied on that and submitted the application and paperwork. XXXX reneged and wrongfully denied the interest rate reduction which would have avoided all the horror that has come since. 

About XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX told me they transferred my loan to Shellpoint/New Rez , a debt collector who violates banking laws and engages in illegal, unethical practices. Neither XXXX or Shellpoint would reply to questions about my loan : was my loan sold, and, if so, to whom and for how much? Was my loan sold at a discount to be packaged as mortgage backed securities to investors as a type of collateralized loan? To date, neither of these institutions have replied to these questions. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, my young beloved mother, who I cared for, died as a result of inconsolable XXXX XXXX from burying my sister. My family was dead. My world collapsed. I underwent XXXX major surgeries. Then, XXXX  and the pandemic finished running me over. 

Shellpoint/New Rez has been illegally charging me unnecessary, expensive lender placed insurance fees- a practice which has lead to successful lawsuits against them. I've asked them to return all my money with interest and penalties but, they haven't. Shellpoint has not provided the items requested in formal Written Interrogatories - specifically, copies of files, notes, call logs, etc. Shellpoint has been trying to take my home from day XXXX with foreclosure threats and foreclosure actions. 

Please stop this financial terrorism. 

I'm a XXXX XXXX XXXX woman with severe limitations and health issues. I'm on food stamps, medicaid, and scheduled for in home help and XXXX through XXXX. My body is broken from life threatening injuries and XXXX surgeries and I need more surgery. I have no children, no spouse. All I have is my small apartment in XXXX. But, the multi billionaires at XXXX XXXX and Shellpoint, ( corporations worth {$4.00} XXXX and {$250.00} XXXX, respectively ), still terrorize me with foreclosure threats and foreclosure actions despite the fact that for XXXX long years, I've paid XXXX Bank and Shellpoint a total of about {$250000.00} on a $ XXXX loan. 

I have nothing else in life but my XXXX home of XXXX years. This constant distress of Shellpoint threatening to take it, is torture and it must end - it puts my fragile health in jeopardy of a XXXX or XXXX XXXX. They've already caused me to have a nervous breakdown. 

I beg you to please have Shellpoint, XXXX or any other institution that may be involved here, to close this matter and deem this loan satisfied, XXXX, cancelled or forgiven. Please help me get released from this bondage. 

Thank you for your help, intervention and human decency.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer complaint is about a denied interest rate reduction on a co-op loan and subsequent issues with loan servicing. The borrower claims they were misled into applying for an interest rate reduction, which was then denied. The loan was transferred to Shellpoint/New Rez, who allegedly engaged in unfair practices, including charging unnecessary insurance fees and threatening foreclosure.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX I filed for XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, Due to XXXX  XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and XXXX XXXX Bankruptcy in XXXXDuring the XXXX process, all my credit debt had to be listed. My partner and myself had leased a XXXX XXXX XXXX using Ally Financial Bank. We had 6 months til end of lease. The amount we owed was {$2000.00}. the payment schedule for my XXXX didn't begin until XXXX because of an oversight by my attorney. My Partner didn't want to have his credit harmed by my XXXX so he paid all payments due and we returned the XXXX  to the dealership XXXX XXXX, XXXX and paid a closing fee of {$410.00}. In XXXX he received another statement from Ally stating he owed another $ XXXX paid Ally and thought that was the termination of what was due. However, when I accessed my XXXX on the XXXX website ( XXXX ) I found that Ally Bank was one of the creditors receiving monies from my payment schedule. I notified my Attorney that my partner had paid all funds required by Ally, but he did not reply or give any advice. 
A similar process occurred with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX has a cross collateral contract that states that a car loan from XXXX must be attached to the credit card amount we owed. Again, since the XXXX payment was later than the XXXX  payment date, my partner to pay what ever interest accrued each month before the payment date of my XXXX. XXXX payment stayed the same.However, when the car amount ( though it was triple of what we owed ) was completely, paid XXXX would not give my partner the title for the car. This caused monetary stress and XXXX for myself and partner.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint involves two issues with Ally Financial Bank and XXXX. The consumer's partner paid off a leased vehicle's debt and a car loan, but Ally and XXXX continued to receive payments through the consumer's bankruptcy plan, causing unnecessary stress and financial burden.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX XXXX : My address is XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX VA My XXXX is XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to bring a serious matter to your attention concerning erroneous collections that is appearing on my credit report. I recently discovered the presence of these collections, and to my utmost surprise, I have no knowledge or information about the debts in question. I firmly believe that these collections have been inaccurately reported and are negatively impacting my creditworthiness. 

I am invoking my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 609, which grants me the right to request validation of any debt that is being reported on my credit file. Section 609 of the FCRA stipulates that upon my request for debt validation, the credit reporting agency and the collection agency must provide me with specific information to verify the legitimacy and accuracy of the debt. 

The erroneous collections I am disputing are listed as follows : Jefferson Capital Systems Inc, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX AL XXXX JCS Reference Number - XXXX Amount of Debt - XXXX Date of Deliquency - Unknown I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter thoroughly and intervene to ensure that these erroneous collections are removed from my credit report promptly. I kindly ask that you initiate the validation process under Section 609 of the FCRA on my behalf and require the collection agency to provide the necessary documentation to substantiate the validity of the debt.

I am concerned about the potential harm to my creditworthiness and financial stability due to these inaccuracies. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and request that you keep me informed of the progress of your investigation. Please feel free to contact me at XXXX or via email at XXXX if you require any further information from my end. 

Thank you for your assistance in resolving this issue. I trust that your intervention will help rectify this situation and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer reports unknown collections on their credit report from Jefferson Capital Systems Inc, with no knowledge of the debt. They're invoking the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) Section 609, requesting validation of the debt and asking the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate and remove the erroneous collections.

They call every week, sometimes twice a week, about credit management. 
I have no outstanding debt, nothing in collections, nor any debt for that matter other than my monthly mortgage which has a flawless record of being paid on time.
