Consumer complaint narrative:
All credit bureaus have me as excellent!! they all took off my bankruptcy that was from XXXX last year. Trans Union also took it off last year!! but last week they put it back on and deducted XXXX points from my credit score with no explanation. 
total misinformation about my years of credit cards, the amount of credit that I even had and why they put the bankruptcy back on after a year when no other credit bureau has done that. They did not give me any points for having XXXX XXXX years of XXXX XXXX on time payments and having a much higher credit limit than they originally thought. 
They acted unprofessional because I have worked so hard to build my credit and all the other of the bureaus had me as excellent so instead of giving me more points for correct information they put the bankruptcy back on and took away those XXXX points
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

This contradicts other credit bureaus' reports, which show the consumer as having excellent credit due to years of on-time payments and higher credit limits.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of last year, my wife and I decided to consolidate credit card debt. Right around that time, we received a flyer in the mail from a company named XXXX XXXX, promising interest rates as low as XXXX XXXX on a consolidation loans. 

We talked about it and gave them a call. Unfortunately, it didnt connect us with XXXX XXXX, which I questioned numerous times, it connected us with Level One Law, who said we didnt qualify for the low interest loan and they were willing to lend us money to consolidate the debt for XXXX % points below what the credit cards were charging. At hearing that, my XXXX  and both declined the offer. The smooth-talking gentleman explained they could settle our debt down and it would take XXXX months for the entire process and everything would be finished At the time ( approximately XX/XX/XXXX ) when we signed with Level One Law, we were not behind or late on any of our debt and only sought to consolidate credit card debt in anticipation of my possible retirement in XX/XX/XXXX. At the time, our credit ratings hovered at or near the mid-upper XXXX. Today is it at of hovering around the XXXX range. 

We began making monthly payments or {$1100.00} monthly in XX/XX/XXXX. Since the day we signed with Level One Law, they have not been provided ANY debt relief actions on or behalf what-so-ever. No communication, no calls, no court appearances and no documents filed on our behalf, until after XXXX XXXX XXXX was placed into receivership by the courts on or about XX/XX/XXXX. Every time contacted Level One Law, we were told you dont have enough in your account to settle your debt. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, I called Level One Law and was insistent on speaking to a supervisor or XXXX. After over XXXX hours on the phone with Level One Law, I was told we only had approximately {$5000.00} in our account. Up until that time, we had deposited over {$13000.00} into our account. This includes payments we made in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, totaling just under {$2400.00}, which was after the courts had stopped/restricted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX transaction from taking place until all legal matters were settled. 

On the evening of XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, I received an email notice from Level One Law explaining fraud that was committed by a company called XXXX XXXX XXXX. This company was ultimately determined to be the company the payments were going to. This email was received a full XXXX months after the courts placed them in receivership, and not being notified until we had made XXXX additional payments to Level One Law. 

My understanding of the situation is, indicates the monthly payments were drawn out or our local bank account and transferred to an account at XXXX XXXX ( a legal company ), in XXXX Oklahoma. Once the funds were received by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX withdrew the money out and transferred it to XXXX companies. Once the money was received into the XXXX XXXXompanies, XXXX XXXX XXXX took the funds for services that had not yet been provided to the clients of Level One Law, thus creating the circumstances and legal actions by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Ultimately, the courts to placed XXXX XXXX XXXX into receivership on or about XX/XX/XXXX, resulting in restricting or stopping further business until the courts could settle all legal matters. 

By our best estimate, XXXX XXXX XXXX, over the course of the first XXXX  months, took approximately XXXX % of the funds we had sent to settle debt without ever providing the service of Level One Law, even though we had a locally assigned Level One Law attorney appointed. 

This has caused our debt go into default and it was sold to XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, a local debt collection firm, who now seeks that we make monthly payments to settle the debt amount. 

I believe Level One Law is a conspirator in the fraud that occurred with XXXX XXXX XXXX, due to then lack of legal representation from Level One Law over the course of a year. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX  and I decided to address the debt ourselves and contacted XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. 
I was told by the representative of XXXX, XXXX and XXXX that they couldnt speak to me because I had a local assigned attorney ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, who filed the paperwork on or about XX/XX/XXXX ( almost 3 months to the day after they XXXX XXXX XXXX was implicated in the fraud ), indicating he was my attorney of record. This action was taken approximately XXXX months after being appointed as our attorney by Level One Law and after the legal actions had been taken against XXXX XXXX XXXX. Due to lack of legal representation by Level One Law, I believe it indicates they may be coconspirators with XXXX XXXX XXXX in the fraud that occurred. 

Unfortunately, it appears XXXX XXXX was in such a hurry to file the court documents, he failed to put my XXXX XXXX name on the document/s he filed with the courts ( according to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ). 

When my XXXX called XXXX, XXXX and XXXX, they told her they called the Level One Law attorney, XXXX XXXX, numerous times and he never returned any of their calls. They also told her that there is no attorney assigned on her behalf from Level One Law. 

Over the entire time we signed with Level One Law, we never received any correspondence, calls, emails or any other type of correspondence from XXXX XXXX. On XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX I received the first and only communication ever received from XXXX XXXX, who admitted he filed the court documents after finding out about the XXXX XXXX XXXX notice of receivership, which makes me believe Level One Law may be a coconspirator in the fraud. 

During my conversation with XXXX XXXX, he stated other attorneys quit working for Level One Law and he felt a duty as the only attorney representing Level XXXX clients in the state of XXXX XXXX He also said he felt so bad he would represent my XXXX and myself for free, which I did not accept. 

I believe his late filing of court documents is an attempt to stave off any legal actions against Level One Law because, theres no reason why he hadnt filed court documents on our behalf within the previous year. 

I personally uploaded the court documents we were served with onto the Level One Laws website, which the website will show the documents were received and are stored and in their possession. 

Before the fraud was discovered and addressed by the courts and, before being notified by Level One Law over XXXX months after all business transactions on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX, were limited and/or stopped by the federal courts. 


I can provide any documents to show that the fraud that was committed has severely damaged our credit and put my XXXX and my job in jeopardy, and put us in a situation that will most likely force us to pay debt until the day we die, which was NEVER our intention to start with. 

Please do a business license search in XXXX XXXX for Level One Law and/or the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX " supposed owner '' of Level One Law. My search produced no results for a business license for either the name or business to indicate they are allowed to conduct business in the state of XXXX XXXX. A further search shows they are out of the state of XXXX yet, there is no business license for Level One Law in that state either.
Company: Michel Law, LLC d/b/a Level One Law
Narrative Summary: A couple consolidated credit card debt with Level One Law, making $1,100 monthly payments. However, Level One Law allegedly failed to provide any debt relief actions, and the couple's payments were diverted to another company, which took a significant portion of the funds without providing services.

Consumer complaint narrative: I disputed an unknown account charge back in XXXX and was told the dispute would be completed by XX/XX/year> and its still in limbo. I reached out to credit karma in regards to the dispute not being processed who directed me to XXXX XXXX re-directed me back to credit karma and provided their phone number the number XXXX gave me was the XXXX  phone number.. dispute is still pending 2 months later

Consumer complaint narrative:
Between XXXX to the beginning of XXXX, I was part of a promotional program where you complete deals to get credit. The more deals/offers you sign up form the bigger the prize you can cashout on. The XXXX came from XXXX XXXX I had completed XXXX deals/offers, XXXX of them was for Self, a crediting monitoring and repair site. Most deals are you signing up for a week long trial for the company 's limited services. You sign-up with basic information, name, address, phone #, and your card to pay the {$1.00} fee for the trial. Self known as a credit builder online tool with XXXX feature being that you take out a virtual loan where you pay on a set balance to help your credit profile statistics. 
I began to fill out the application and input my payment information for the {$1.00} charge for the free trial for the week, I pressed submit and it load uptop in red that there was an error ( XXXX Required, no process ). I went in to see if it created a account, tried logging in on their front landing page and it reloaded the same page I was when first signing up for the offer. Indicating that there was not an account since it took me back to the sign up page. I went on to the next. I did come back time to time and tried again with it being the same result. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from Self about an approaching Payment date coming due. Within stating that my due date for a {$19.00} payment for this loan. I went and checked their site and there it was a full account with all my details and information, even a builder loan for {$710.00} dollars. Shocked, I emailed them about the signup/trial error I received when signing up and that to my understanding that the account never was finished being set up or open/active, let alone a full on XXXX XXXX XXXX. I told them I never signed a terms and conditions to open the account, I did not sign up for the loan and requested that they deactivate the loan and close the account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX they replied, ignoring what I had wrote to them about the problem and they ignored my requests ; they went on with their basic sign-up support verbiage. How to sign-up, log-in, and touting their services, not even a mention about my requests. Furious I left it alone, thinking they don't have my payment details so it will clear up. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was getting emails from my credit report apps that a new account has been reported to the credit bureau. I checked XXXX and Self was showing up on my Credit Report as functioning with the {$710.00} loan. Enraged, I emailed Self same day describing the situation and that this was hands down and Unauthorized account and that I requested that they shut down the loan, deactivate the account, and to report the closure of both to XXXX. I went on to submitted a dispute with XXXX about the account saying it was an unauthorized account. I XX/XX/XXXX I received more emails from the same credit watch apps I have that a new account has been reported to XXXX, logged in and sure enough it was Self. I went ahead and submitted a dispute with them. 

I did not finish signing up to set the account up, I was not verified as they informed me that had to do, I did not sign a terms and conditions for the activation of the account or the loan. I did not sign my name to this {$710.00}. 

With this becoming a larger problem then I thought it would be with Self now affecting my credit profile with an unauthorized, illegal account/loan, an XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from Self, I am now having to submit this report to the CFPB.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Self, a credit monitoring and repair site, created an unauthorized account and loan after they attempted to sign up for a free trial but received an error message, never completing the application or agreeing to terms and conditions. The account was reported to credit bureaus, affecting their credit profile.

Consumer complaint narrative: I paid {$120.00} per month for credit repair services. Before I joined the XXXX, during covid, I had a {$6.00} maintenance fee for a credit card bounce- which in my mind would cause a negative item to appear on my credit report even though it is small. A few months later I enlisted in the XXXX, and due to my recruiter not completely conveying accurate information regarding the pay schedule, I was unable to make a payment for my vehicle while also not being permitted any extra phone time to figure it out. I was in an area with unreliable cell service, and furthermore was not permitted to use the office phone. While at XXXX at basic training from a XXXX  injury awaiting XXXX, I utilized the services of the financial advisor. I know we called my bank, and got my car loan APR dropped to 6 % from 17 % utilizing the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act. I believe we also addressed the issue with not making a payment on time- and I believe the bank either did not report the negative item or retroactively altered the report. After I XXXX  XXXX and arrived at my duty station I began paying for credit repair services with Lexington Law XXXX. In my mind there was one, and potentially two negative items that should be on my report history. I did not check my credit report. I paid Lexington Law for a bit over a year. They advised me that there were XXXX negative items on my report and they were working to remove them. It took them over a year to remove 6 of them, which was when I had canceled my subscription because I only took home {$19000.00} dollars after taxes that year and I could not afford anything beyond the minimum, with mounting credit card debt, and vehicle repairs that cost me thousands of dollars. I then checked my credit report with the XXXX bureau 's and found that there were in fact XXXX negative items on any of my report histories. I downloaded Lexington 's " version '' of my report which lists negative items, while also printing my XXXX reports with no items. I paid them apx. {$2000.00}. Today I tried to log in to get my account information, but they have eliminated my email from their system and it does not recognize my email. It may not seem like much but I really need the money since I make very little and I live in one of the highest cost-of-living areas in the nation, outside XXXX. The XXXX Lawyer advised me to submit this report. I legally changed my name from my fathers given name to my mother 's family name and grandfather 's name. It previously was XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX it is currently XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX . My social security card has been updated, as well as my birth certificate and drivers license.
Company: John C. Heath, Attorney at Law, PLLC
Narrative Summary: The consumer paid Lexington Law $120/month for credit repair services, paying around $2000 total. After canceling, they found that Lexington Law's reports showed multiple negative items, but actual credit reports showed none. The consumer seeks a refund, citing financial hardship.

Consumer complaint narrative: Pursuit to 18 USC 8, I owe no debt. This company is Violating my consumer right to privacy pursuant to 15 USC 1681b 2. Company also has NO permission to report ANYTHING using my information pursuant to 15USC 1681 4
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges a company is violating their rights by reporting debt information without permission, claiming they owe no debt. They cite 15 USC 1681b(2) and 15 USC 1681(4), asserting the company has no authority to report their information, and is also violating their consumer right to privacy.

They are always telling me to go back to the merchant even though the merchant is no longer responsive. They need to take matters into their own hands
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported a fraudulent loan to Affirm, but the company has been unhelpful, repeatedly directing them to contact the unresponsive merchant instead of taking action themselves to resolve the issue.

Consumer complaint narrative: I enrolled in national debt settlement program in XX/XX/XXXX with a total of XXXX debts. I was advised within XXXX XXXX XXXX months there will be a settlement. One of my debtors contacted them in XX/XX/XXXX and made a settlement. I was not aware once a settlement is made there is 25 % upfront fee of the balance. National Debt has paid a total of {$100.00} to XXXX creditor and have taken a few of {$1500.00}. I was stunned. I have spoken to numerous people including management however they are not willing to do anything. No other action at all has been taken on the other XXXX creditors because now I am told I have to build up funds because it was all taken by XXXX XXXX. National Debt has not fulfilled their obligation not are they willing to refund any of my money as requested. This has really created a hardship for me. Why can't fees be collected throughout the XXXX month term. I have not been able to reach anyone at the highest level although they tell me they are supervisors. This has been a ongoing battle and I truly feel that I have been taken advantage of. No One is willing to help. So disappointed. This should be illegal. I have been lied to on so many levels and I feel hopeless. National Debt has created another hardship for me. They are making no attempts to reach any other settlements not will they refund any of my funds.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
Narrative Summary: A consumer enrolled in National Debt Settlement's program, but was unaware of a 25% upfront fee on settled debts. After one settlement, the company took $1500, leaving the consumer with a hardship and no progress on other debts, despite repeated requests for refunds or assistance.

Issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:

XXXX of these settlements was taken back without my knowledge. I had money in XXXX of the accounts, but they sent it to a creditor for a large amount. I instantly contacted national debt relief, and all they said was i shouldn't have had the money in there. I have attempted to have them negotiate on my behalf for more than XXXX  months, to no avail. They completely dodge me, and just tell me to keep putting in more money. They absolutely do not do anything to assist with negotiating this last account that was supposed to be settled a year ago. I can't even speak to the negotiations team myself to understand what national debt relief needs from me to expedite this. 

I am so deep into the program that I cant quit now but this has completely changed my life and how I view finances. 


XXXX  company

Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges National Debt Relief mishandled their settlements, taking back funds without consent and failing to negotiate with creditors despite ongoing payments. The company dodges the consumer's inquiries, and they're unable to speak with the negotiations team to resolve the issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My original mortgage lender was XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). 
I signed my Note and gave it to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX went out of business on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX did not indorse the Note to any party and XXXX did not assign the Note to any party. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) took over the mortgage servicing while it was a stranger to my Note and while not paying the XXXX its share because XXXX did not exist. 
I made monthly mortgage payments to XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. Due to the XXXX of XXXX, I lost my job in XX/XX/XXXX I was not able to pay XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX forged a mortgage assignment from XXXX to XXXX. and based on that filed a Foreclosure Complaint on XX/XX/XXXX in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NJ, On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX from the NJ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX suspended the Complaint of XX/XX/XXXX and ordered XXXX to remove the forged mortgage assignment of XX/XX/XXXX to cure the deficiencies and re-file. XXXX violated that Order of XX/XX/XXXX, and instead forged two more mortgage documents and sold it to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) sometime before XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX hired a local notary public to forge my signature on a so-called XXXX  Agreement of XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX the Note was already time barred based on XXXX  XXXX ( b ). On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX filed the second foreclosure complaint based on the time-barred Note and the recycled forged mortgage assignment of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX was a debt collector by filed the foreclosure complaint as a mortgage lender and servicer. without being a secured creditor. I sent FDCPA Debt Validation letter to XXXX in XXXX of XXXX they ignored it. 
XXXX sold the alleged debt to XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) in XXXX of XXXX. XXXX sent me a FDCPA Debt Validation Letter on XX/XX/XXXX and I denied it and asked for validation. XXXX replied that they would validate the debt and get back to me and I am still waiting. XXXX was a debt collector and was trying to collect on a time-barred debt. In XXXX of XXXX, XXXX sold the alleged debt to Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing ( Shellpoint ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ). On XX/XX/XXXX I sent them FDCPA Debt Validation Letters, and they replied that my case was complex and they would get back to me. I never heard from them, On XX/XX/XXXX I sent them both FDCPA Cease and Desist Letter. Shellpoint continued sending my mortgage statements on a time-barred Note. Shellpoint is a debt collector not my mortgage servicer. XXXX XXXX  is a debt collector, not the owner of my mortgage. The owner of my mortgage was XXXX and now the Note is time-barred. I request that both leave me alone and stop harassing me.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims that multiple mortgage servicers and debt collectors, including XXXX, XXXX, and Shellpoint, have forged documents and attempted to collect on a time-barred mortgage note, despite the original lender's failure to endorse or assign the note before going out of business.

I called XXXX on XX/XX/2024 and they confirmed to me that this is true, I still owe them money and that Sunrise Credit Services Inc has not reported any payments to them.

Consumer complaint narrative: I signed up for a Bright Money Account which is advertised to help pay down debt and improve credit through savings every month. Several months ago I was advertised for a XXXX credit line to pay down my high interest credit cards through the Bright App which I applied for and was accepted but then they kept citing " technical difficulties '' that I couldn't actually access this line of credit. After months of trying to contact customer service and countless emails, they said there was an issue with the third party creditor and asked me to provide the card number I wanted to apply the debt to. I finally received confirmation email on XX/XX/XXXX that {$5000.00} was used to pay down my XXXX XXXX XXXX  ending in XXXX and then another email XX/XX/XXXX that {$4000.00} was paid down to the same card. I received no such payments. I sent them notification immediately I lost that credit card halfway through the month and it was replaced with card ending in XXXX. This should not have been a problems as all of my other transactions and payments processed over to my new card INCLUDING a bright savings payment I personally made. I contacted Bright immediately with now hundreds of exchanges via email, chat, and phone calls saying I never received these payments. Yet it showed I now owed bright credit {$9000.00} for payments I never received. I can barely get anyone to respond to my emails or phone calls with their only response is the payment was made. I contacted XXXX  XXXX who had no such payment and requested the Bright Fax them a formal " proof of payment '' with my information and credit number they applied to so they could fax it. Bright has not contacted XXXX and said they can not do this because they dont have a fax. They said they opened their own investigation and all ive received since is an email that they sent the payment and I need to provide a credit card statement of my old card that was replaced which no bank does. I provided them the month credit card statement with the new card number on it and asked them to contact XXXX bank and they wont. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a payment unmarked to my credit card of {$5000.00}, not labeled from Bright so I have no confirmation and proof this came from them. Additionally I still am missing a {$4000.00} payment if that is the case. Again they wont respond to my emails and wont contact my bank with proof of payments. Now it is XX/XX/XXXX and they have sent me a statement with a minimum payment due for the outstanding {$9000.00} when I am still missing a {$4000.00} payment to my credit card and have not received proof that they are the ones who sent the unmarked {$5000.00}. It is now XX/XX/XXXX and without such payments, my rotating debt has now increased significantly because of this mistake and they will lower my credit score versus their promise of raising it. I can get no one to give me a straight answer on what they are doing to investigate this and when I will get a solution and they are not actually providing my bank a proof of payment to launch an investigation. Their customer service is not existent, they tell you they will call and they wont. I am afraid I have been scammed out of money and they have permanently made damage to my credit. I have only shared a fraction of our communications but please let me know what else you'll need.
Narrative Summary: A consumer signed up for a Bright Money Account to pay down debt. Bright approved a $9,000 credit line, but claimed technical issues prevented access. They then sent confirmation emails stating $9,000 was paid to the consumer's credit card, but the consumer never received the payments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased some items from XXXX through the XXXX bank regularly, and paid my regular monthly payments and more, and occasionally a lump sum of money to clear my debt and close my account, and didnt purchase any items for at least 7 months.After a while they increased my debt to about {$1200.00} which wasnt right, I sent them letters and emailed them to provide me with a statement of breakdown of my purchases against my payments, which they never did.

I need that to be fixed please. 

Appreciate your time and patience with me and my XXXX as my second language.

Consumer complaint narrative:
No Credit Score Improvement and Refund Denied by Credit Wellness.

I'm writing because I'm really upset with fraud company Credit Wellness!

I did not even want to talk with credit repair agency. I was looking to settle my account debt with collection agency, and somehow called Credit Wellness.

I feel used. The agent on the phone convinced me that paying them will help me increase my Credit Score, so I started a plan, but it did nothing. All it did was taking my money, and my debt is still there. 
I was checking XXXX XXXX all the time, and after a month there hasn't been any improvement at all. This is exceptionally concerning. 
I want a full refund! 

They had told me that when I signed up that I could get a refund if their service didn't work. I asked them to get my refund.I tried calling them back, but there was no answer. 
This has been very stressful and unfair. I trusted them to help me, and not only is my credit score the same, but I am also out the money I paid them upfront. 

SCAM!!!
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Credit Wellness, a credit repair agency, failed to improve their credit score despite promises. They paid for a plan, but after a month, their score remained unchanged. The company allegedly denied a refund, despite initially offering one if their service didn't work.

Consumer complaint narrative: In 2021 I had 3 negatives as of today I have dealt with 17 plus negatives I on a weekly woukd call in explaining the negatives were again placed back on my credit that was taken off just gave the run a rounds of promises to repair my credit score had went down XXXX plus points since dealing with Lexington Law and foreign collections were placed on my account I did everything to help them understand to fix they always acted like they were gon na help but just telling me more money woukd help better results I refused to upgrade my monthly fee I was never given information of the whys or anyone to help me upon suggestions so I did a review with XXXX and on today I called in to push my help to help my repair from XXXX only to be told because if my review my case was canceled I have the screenshots if that conversation I was told I could only chat to someone not speak over the phone so I do to find out because of my review with XXXX Lexington canceled me as a customer I want all monies back
Company: John C. Heath, Attorney at Law, PLLC

The company allegedly made promises but demanded more money for better results, and ultimately canceled the consumer's case after a negative review.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, My ex-husband and I were contacted by an attorney from XXXX XXXX XXXX telling us that we were coming to the end of our consolidation process and our last payment would be coming out in XX/XX/XXXX, which is about 6-7 months earlier than I expected. We have been with this company since XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX was our first contact and then we began talking to XXXX because they were the attorney group handling everything. 

I have been handling this mess of XXXX debt since then. I was surprised and I was skeptical as the website shows our paid debt still shows three of our debt pieces in presettlement. All from the same vendor. I got this individuals personal phone number and name and have had several conversations with him. The attorney chatted with me 3 times as I wanted confirmation of this completion in writing and I can not get anyone on the phone at canyon. 

Then my ex-husband received something in email that we needed to sign that said we would get our fees back because of this lawsuit happening and that we should sign it. I called the attorney again and he explained what it was and that he was supposed to get all of these signed and answer questions. We are at the end of our program and the payment changes won't affect us as we are done. I told my ex to sign it and unfortunately he did not download a copy of what he signed. 

I talked with the attorney again as he said that someone should be calling to tell us what happens now that we are finished and, that if no one has called as of XX/XX/XXXX, that we should call him back. I have called XXXX and no one answers. So I just called him back todayhe just answered me. 

This attorney is the only one I can get a hold of. During that call last month, he suggested we call Global Holdings ( XXXX acct ) and tell them they do not have authority to take any more draws out of our acct monthly. He said that should take care of the remaining debt as we are done paying and the rest of the draws to the vendor are enough to pay everything off by XXXX. 

I am nervous about this as we were trying to do the right thing by taking care of the debt issue with a consolidation company to help us with the credit debt we had. 

What do I do if they are lying? I need some help. The last vendor we are dealing with is XXXX XXXX. Payments scheduled to them go until XX/XX/XXXX. Global shows draft payments continuing to be drawn out until XX/XX/XXXX. 

We have paid {$89000.00} since XX/XX/XXXX Below is correspondence info and statements. I also have emails showing we have been sending debt info to XXXX for years. I have tried to contact someone at the company multiple times since this lawsuit popped upand no one answers. I have copies of documents and screenshots of website portals if needed. 

Thanks in advance for your support. XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims their debt consolidation company, XXXX, misled them about the end of their program, stating it would end 6-7 months earlier than expected. Despite multiple attempts to contact the company, only an attorney was reachable, and the consumer is concerned about potential deception.

Issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
This company misled their debt settlement processes when I signed up in XXXX of XXXX and led me to believe that any accounts that were delinquent due to discussions with their specialty departments would be made current and that payments being drafted from my account were going to pay the debts for the accounts I had included in the program. Late last year I was contacted by XXXX XXXX XXXX stating I was a perfect candidate for their debt consolidation program and that my credit would be pulled to qualify. I was denied from that program because of a system error made by XXXX XXXX XXXX due to a system glitch that did not draft XXXX of my program payments in a timely manner. I called XXXX times to discuss the issue with them and they were unable to tell me why the payment wasn't drafted or why they believed I would be a candidate for debt consolidation, requiring a hard credit check, if they knew I would not qualify. At the inception of my enrollment in the program, several representatives tried to get me to electronically sign a document for someone else who was co-signed on a loan that I was trying to get enrolled in the program until I pointed out that was illegal, I was transferred to a XXXX who advised me " they would take care of it ''. when I asked if I could remove the creditor from the program I was advised that they were unable to do that and contacted the co-signer, who was also mislead, to sign program documents. Emails to them by both my co-signer and myself went unanswered and resolution to any issues were either ignored or not provided after asking numerous times. 

I was not advised that my accounts would remain in a delinquent status ( until XX/XX/XXXX ), effectively tanking my credit score for over a year, when I was advised in numerous recorded telephone conversations with various representatives that my credit score would only be effected for a couple of months while they worked out details with my creditors and that my debts would be paid from the money being drafted from my account every month. There were times that I asked questions about e-signing documents were representatives stayed on the phone with me to " walk me through the process '' and I was told exactly what to say on the form or to the next party in the enrollment process. I even advised them that I worked in a field that required a background check, as XXXX of their questions was " Does your job require a security clearance '' and I was told to tell the department that I was being transferred to that I did not have a clearance. I had questions about the initial enrollment forms and was told " that's okay if that box is checked/unchecked we know what your answers are, that is just a glitch in our system. '' I was even advised by representatives and in documents sent to me that I needed to update my phone number and email to their company 's email/phone number and to ignore all communication from my creditors. 

When I had an issue with them that I needed an answer for, I was either dropped from calls, told that the department wasn't available, a request would be put in with someone contacting me with more information ( I was not called back ), or that they were experiencing technical difficulties and were unable to transfer me to the correct department ( unless I threatening filing a complaint, then the department and technical difficulties disappeared ). I was given false hope countless times throughout my enrollment in the program and was told that " things would be taken care of. '' When I tried to cancel my enrollment XXXX days in a row, I was told that the representatives that I was speaking with were experiencing technical difficulties and could not transfer me to the correct department and that they would put in a request to have said department contact me. It was only when I wished to make a complaint during the third conversation that I was transferred to the right department. The person cancelling my enrollment even tried to threaten that I would be sued by creditors enrolled in their program if I left in an effort to get me to scare me into staying.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims that a debt settlement company misled them about their debt settlement process, stating that delinquent accounts would be made current, but instead remained delinquent, negatively impacting their credit score. The company allegedly made false promises, failed to address issues, and attempted to prevent cancellation.
