Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX ) lost job and was put on a plan by Flagstar Morgage XX/XX/XXXX, and was told it would not effect my credit score, nor would it be reported. This was to be through XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX ) called multiple times between XXXX to make sure I was still ok with the plan, and to make sure I was good through XX/XX/XXXX. Was told it would not affect my credit and that I needed to fill out another application on line, was told another time that was wrong information and I didnt need to fill out another application, and to resume payment in XXXX. Was told again this wont affect my credit. 
XXXX ) made payment to Flagstar for Morgage through my bill pay to resume payment for XXXX, and check was returned by Flagstar. 
XXXX ) called Flagstar shortly after realizing check was returned and was told they cant accept payment now and that this indeed does affect credit and they are not sure why I was told that. Asked to speak to XXXX named XXXX and she said thats not correct and told me shes sending in for a rushed review to be evaluated for forbearance, and she took my XXXX payment. 
XXXX ) My credit score dropped XXXX points because Flagstar reported delinquency. 
XXXX ) XXXX called and spoke to XXXX and she was in communication with XXXX who me agreed it was an accidental report to credit on there end, and that it says in fine print for the duration of that time XXXX me being on a loss mitigation plan would not be reported to credit. I was told by XXXX that they are going to fight this and it was accident. I was told I would receive a letter in the mail stating this in case I needed for proof. Was told XXXX would give me a call back, never did I hear from her. 
XXXX ) I called multiple times for my point of contact during this process and never heard a thing XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX was told by another XXXX XXXX that the credit report dispute was denied due to no payment in XXXX. My XXXX payment was denied.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer was placed on a loss mitigation plan by Flagstar Mortgage after losing their job, and was repeatedly told it wouldn't affect their credit score. However, Flagstar reported delinquency, causing a 70-point drop in the consumer's credit score, despite initially denying the report was an error.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Midland Credit Management : XXXX {$460.00} Under the provisions of XXXX XXXXXXXX of the United States Code, Section 1028, it is illegal to engage in fraud and related activities concerning identification documents and information. Regrettably, I have reason to suspect that my personal information has been compromised, leading to unauthorized transactions and account access. 

XXXX. Your business has purposely refused to correct this situation & continue to violate my consumer rights. 

I am deeply concerned about the security of my account and the potential impact of this fraudulent activity on my financial well-being. As per Section 1028 of the United States Code, I request that MIDLAND CREDIT MANAGEMENT undertake a thorough investigation into these matters and take appropriate measures to rectify the situation.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges Midland Credit Management has compromised their personal info, leading to unauthorized transactions and account access. Despite concerns, the company has refused to correct the issue, violating consumer rights. The consumer requests an investigation under Section 1028 of the US Code.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Mortgage and the Note have taken XXXX distinctly different paths. The Mortgage was never transferred. 

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 states " There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states It is the policy of the XXXX that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. All consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than XXXX years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer complains that their mortgage information is being reported inaccurately by credit agencies without their consent, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The consumer argues that the financial institution and credit agencies failed to obtain written consent and did not allow them to opt out of information sharing.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I went to a XXXX western ATM to withdraw {$60.00} from my XXXX XXXX account. The ATM took the money from my XXXX XXXX account, but it didn't give me my {$60.00}. It gave me an error message instead. I went to the bank during business hours and they told me they wouldn't give me my money back. I called XXXX XXXX, but my address has changed, so they're going to make me jump through a bunch of hoops, but can't just give me my money back. I didn't receive it even though XXXX XXXX removed the money from my account, stealing from me when I can't afford to loose any money as I live hand to mouth, with limited funds to pay my bills and survive the month.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's ATM transaction of $60 was deducted from their account, but the machine failed to dispense the cash. The bank and ATM company refused to refund the money, forcing the consumer to undergo additional verification steps despite the error.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Agreed to a 42 month plan with Americor to negotiate three accounts ( XXXX  XXXX XXXX {$22000.00} ), XXXX XXXXXXXX ( {$6800.00} ) and XXXX XXXX ( {$26000.00} ) ). I met the 42 month plan that started on XX/XX/XXXX and now Americor needs another 12 months due to failing to negotiate my last account with Payoff. This is consumer abuse and irresponsible on Americors part. I was told by the representative I spoke to that its common to see this on last account negotiations. Unbelievable. We are no longer able to meet this plan and the only option they gave me is to negotiate this with XXXX myself which is what I thought the plan with Americor was about. Americor is more concerned with them getting paid their {$7000.00} fee so they can be paid first versus fighting for their customers. 

I spoke to a previous agent XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX that mentioned that Americor can negotiate with at least 50 % of the debt owed which we have now so makes no sense that Americor is now pulling this.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Americor failed to negotiate their last account, requiring an additional 12 months to the agreed 42-month plan. This allegedly breaches the original agreement, and the consumer feels Americor prioritizes their $7,000 fee over the customer's interests.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Here we go again. In XX/XX/XXXX, I cancelled a debt consolidation service with Americor for, among other things, failure to pay my creditors from the funds I was providing them in their debt settlement program. This led to a complaint filed with your office, referenced as complaint number XXXX, from which Americor provided your office with an outlandishly false response suggesting they in fact were paying my creditors as agreed, and they went as far as to suggest they would offer {$500.00} to me as a good faith gesture to resolve the issue. 

Unsurprisingly, while your office considered the complaint 'closed ', I of course never received Americor 's 'good faith payment ' as they misled you they would send me. But even more troubling is since that complaint I have received confirmation from one of my creditors that, as I originally outlined in my first complaint, Americor did not in fact pay my creditors as they claimed they did. 

One of my creditors - XXXX - provided me with a breakdown of missed payments ; three of those four missed payments ( XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ) were payments that I made to Americor as part of their debt settlement program - however, XXXX - the actual creditor to whom Americor has falsely claimed they sent my payments- in fact did NOT receive those payments at all.

Americor reported to both myself and your office they made those payments, however evidence provided by one of the creditors themselves clearly shows Americor in fact did NOT make those payments, and instead pocketed the funds themselves.

This is yet another documented example that Americor failed to deliver the services they promised, then misled me about those services, then misled your office after I notified you in a complaint of their actions, and now further evidence supports Americor engages in willful fraudulent behavior and their direct and willful fraudulent misrepresentations to your office regarding same.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges Americor's debt consolidation service failed to pay creditors from provided funds. Americor previously denied this and falsely claimed to have made payments, offering a $500 'good faith' payment that was never received. Evidence from a creditor confirms Americor's claims were false and fraudulent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My identiy was stolen and I am writing to dispute fraudulent charge ( s ) I am a victim of identity theft, and I did not make [ this/these ] charge ( s ). I request that you remove the fraudulent charge ( s ) and any related finance charge and other charges from my account, send me an updated and accurate statement, and close the account ( if applicable ). I also request that you cease reporting the inaccurate information to all of the nationwide credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ) to which you provided it. 

Enclosed is a copy of my Identity Theft Report supporting my position, and a copy of my credit report showing the fraudulent items related to your company that are the result of identity theft. Also enclosed is a copy of the Notice to Furnishers issued by the Federal Trade Commission, which details your responsibilities under the Fair Credit Reporting Act as an information furnisher to CRAs. The Notice also specifies your responsibilities when you receive notice from a CRA, under section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, that information you provided to the CRA may be the result of identity theft. Those responsibilities include ceasing to provide the inaccurate information to any CRAs, and ensuring that you do not attempt to sell or transfer the fraudulent debts to another party for collection. 

Please investigate this matter and send me a written explanation of your findings and actions. 


my Rights are being violated I don't not agree with the items listed below which still appear on my credit report, even after your Investigation. I would like these items immediately re-moved. These inaccuracies are highly injurious to my credit rating. I have been turned down for job opportunities and I am looking to purchase a home soon. Please help me remove these inaccurate items, -re-investigate and verify all data for this account is reporting accurately accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 


I told Experian, XXXX, and XXXX to reinvestigate these accounts and inquiry are Fraud : XXXXXXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. # XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX. XXXX : XXXX XXXX of XXXX : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. XXXX : XXXX XXXX of XXXX : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. XXXX : XXXX XXXX of XXXX : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. XXXX : XXXX of XXXX : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. XXXX : XXXX of XXXX : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. XXXX : XXXX XXXX of XXXX : XXXX Contact : Not Available XXXX. Inquiry : XXXXDate of Inquiry : XXXX Contact : Not Available Credit Agents stated everything was complete and accurate. But how is that possible if the open date, date of last activity and much more is incorrect. According to 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ), they are supposed to modify accounts that aren't reporting correctly.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer's identity was stolen, resulting in fraudulent charges on their account. They dispute the charges, requesting removal and a corrected statement. They also request the company cease reporting the inaccurate information to credit reporting agencies, citing the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Today at XXXX check credit score through XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX using my Android phone. It appeared that I'm employed according to TransUnion. 
I don't know who, what when nor where. Please investigate.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported that their TransUnion credit report incorrectly stated they were employed, despite having no knowledge of the information's origin. The discovery was made while checking their credit score on their Android phone.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to complain about ACIMA DIGITAL FKA SIMPLE, According to the fair credit reporting act section 605B. It is illegal to report information on my credit report without my permission. I am not liable for this debt with ACIMA DIGITAL FKA SIMPLE, i do not have a contract with ACIMA DIGITAL FKA SIMPLE and they did not provide the original contract as i requested. 

The amount shown is XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer complains that Acima Digital FKA Simple reported a debt to their credit report without permission, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act. They claim no contract exists and the company failed to provide the original contract as requested, disputing liability for the debt of XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: Pretty much back in XXXX  or just before the beginning of XXXX  i signed up for this third party app ( Bright Money ) to help me pay off a credit line i have with XXXX XXXX XXXX in Alaska, i have {$890.00} dollars and some change tied into there app to help pay off my credit line i had with XXXX XXXX XXXX. But my credit line got XXXX  out and i cant access that card anymore so ive attempted many times to get my money back grom this third party app and still havent had any success as they keep telling me there is no money in the account yet it shows me that i do as it is tied into that credit line. Over the past 2 years ive yet to get any reimbursement of my money and keep getting thrown in the back burner per say as theyre saying theyve paid my bank this money i have tied in, i contact my bank and they say they havent received any money from this third party app, yet they tell me they paid them. I would like it if you guys could help me out as ive just been wasting time contacting them as well as reaching out to them for a solution to my problem i have with them. I tried getting my credit line back open with my bank to be able to access the money but my bank couldnt re-open the credit or give me the same card with the info needed to verify the card again. Ive explained this to bright money multiple times and still no resolve as they are saying that the acciunt doesnt have any money in it. Ive sent them screenshots of the money still in the account yet they say there is no money and that my bank has received the funds. Doesnt make sense as to it still showing me the money is in the third party app account yet there saying its not even in the account. If I could get some help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims that $890 is stuck in the Bright Money app, which was used to pay off a credit line. Despite the credit line being closed, the app shows the funds, but Bright Money claims the account is empty and that the bank has received the money, which the bank denies.

Consumer complaint narrative: I signed up with National Debt Relief in XX/XX/year>. As of this date, National Debt Relief has only settled two of my nine accounts. I was paying them {$180.00} every two weeks. My savings account with XXXX had reach well over {$2000.00}. National Debt Relief withdrew many fees from my account for themselves. One very large fee well over {$1400.00} that they claimed was a settlement fee. On XX/XX/XXXX, at the advice of a financial counselor not affiliated with National Debt Relief, I was advised to revoke the POA with National Debt Relief because they appeared to be just taking my savings ( that was supposed to settle accounts and pay creditors ) and keeping it for themselves. I revoked the POA and settled the accounts myself. When I asked National Debt Relief for a refund, they refused but told me that I owed them another {$340.00} which I refused to pay. Since they did not settle my accounts, I would like my money back.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
Narrative Summary: A consumer hired National Debt Relief to settle 9 accounts, paying $180 every 2 weeks. Despite accumulating over $2000 in savings, only 2 accounts were settled, with large fees withdrawn, including a $1400 "settlement fee." The consumer revoked POA and settled accounts themselves, seeking a refund.

Consumer complaint narrative: I spoke with transunion rep and she instructed me to file a complaint through the ftc.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A TransUnion representative advised a consumer to file a complaint with the FTC, but the specific issue prompting this advice is not mentioned in the provided narrative.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I cancelled my account with National Debt Relief. My next step was getting a refund of the fees that I had already paid up front since I would no longer require their services. I finally got a response on XX/XX/XXXX that I would be receiving a refund of {$2500.00}. However, when I called the company XXXX, the bank who control the funds that are deposited into the members dedicated savings account, they informed me that I had {$3000.00} in my account. They also assured me that this was indeed my money and I had full access to it. It seems like National Debt Relief is basically trying to help themselves to {$550.00} of my money with no explanation as to why. I have made calls to National Debt Relief to inquire about the status and amount of my refund on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. Each time I got a different answer as to the number I was owed back and the timeline for when i would receive it. Some employees were seeing that I was owed {$3000.00} and some were seeing that I was owed {$2500.00}. The vanishing {$550.00} is very disconcerting and is worth an investigation. I have also received XXXX dollars from them as of yet. The employees all claimed that the refund would be in my account between XXXX business days.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
Narrative Summary: A consumer cancelled their National Debt Relief account and was promised a $2500 refund. However, the bank confirmed they had $3000 in their account, suggesting National Debt Relief was withholding $550 without explanation. The consumer received conflicting refund amounts and timelines from company employees.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I was charged {$270.00} to enroll in the credit repair XXXX XXXX, rather than paying a bill in collections for {$650.00}. I was promised that the charge in collections would be very easy to dispute, and the dispute would be finalized within XXXX months. After almost an entire year later, the company has failed to fulfill their promised service. However, I have been paying {$99.00} months as a recurring charge since XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. The bank was able to retrieve a refund from the merchant for the previous XXXX charges within their XXXX statute of limitations. However, I have yet to receive the additional {$700.00} back from the charges incurred from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. 

In addition to that, the company coerced me to enroll in an identity protection programXXXX XXXX XXXX that is necessary to use with their credit repair services. This was a $ XXXX  monthly recurring charge as well which then increased to {$27.00} without my knowledge. I was being charged by this company as well from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid $270 to enroll in a credit repair service, expecting to dispute a $650 collections charge within a few months. However, the service failed to deliver after almost a year, despite the consumer paying $99 monthly. The consumer also disputes unauthorized charges for an identity protection program.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I noticed there was an inflated collections amount related to rent and moveout charges for an apartment I formerly had. The amount was inflated by over {$1000.00} and seemed to increase with each credit report by XXXX or XXXX or XXXX dollars without any explanation. I disputed this on each report and it came back as verified. 

On Thursday XX/XX/XXXX I spoke to XXXX XXXX XXXX of COLUMBIA DEBT RECOVERY LLC DBA GENESIS ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, WA XXXX XXXX XXXX. I discovered my account number XXXXAccount # XXXX. I informed him that the debt amount was incorrect and showed him the moveout ledger I had, that did not have the exorbitant reletting fee -- indicating I had broken my lease, when I actually extended it a few days with permission from the leasing office -- he then checked with his team and said he was authorized by the rental company reduce the amount to the number my records suggested and that it would be considered paid and full to the company and removed from credit reports. He then promised that I would receive a letter via email that stated as much and, if necessary, that letter could be presented to credit bureaus via a dispute to have the negative collective info removed faster than the initial XXXX day process. The email came. I made disputes with each credit union and I then on received several email from the collections company on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX stating that : ORIGINAL CREDITOR : XXXXXXXX XXXX  PLACED FOR COLLECTIONS ON : XX/XX/XXXX Original Balance : {$3100.00} Current Principal : {$1000.00} Interest Due : {$2.00} Total Due : {$1000.00} Note, this differs significantly from the proof of payment and promise to remove email sent by the company originally and cc 'd with the agent XXXX that stated quote : " ORIGINAL CREDITOR : XXXXXXXX XXXX  PLACED FOR COLLECTIONS ON : XX/XX/XXXX Original Balance : XXXX Current Principal : XXXX Interest Due : XXXX Total Due : XXXX XXXX XXXX We acknowledge receipt of your final payment shown below : Payment : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX This settles the account and releases you from any further liability regarding obligations to the original creditor. COLUMBIA DEBT RECOVERY LLC DBA GENESIS further agrees to request full deletion of any negative information supplied to any credit bureau regarding this account. This update may take 30-60 days to complete. 

If you have any questions, please contact the undersigned account representative. '' The second and third emails occurred after I had disputed the amount -- with copies of the letter above -- with XXXX and XXXX ; both collections agency first noted that the XXXX amount was valid and after a second dispute used the number in the second and third emails by the collections agency. 

After I received the final email on XX/XX/XXXX, I called the collections agency to see what was going on. They assured me that these were merely automated emails, the bill was not due in their system and it should be quickly removed with a dispute or in the routine 30 days or sooner. After that call, I received the results from my final dispute which again affirmed the XXXX balance, which essentially, the original erroneous balance, minus what I had pursuant to our agreement. This company has refused to honor our agreement and continues to communicate to credit companies that I have a balance, despite the letter promising the contrary.
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputed an inflated collections amount for a former apartment, which was verified despite providing proof. A representative agreed to reduce the amount and remove it from credit reports, but the company continued to send emails stating a different balance and refused to honor the agreement.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a marketplace insurance. I called my insurance and the dermatologist and both parties confirmed they accepted my insurance for a {$30.00} Co-pay. 

On XX/XX/2023 I had an appointment, paid a {$30.00} co-pay. 

In XX/XX/2023 I had a XXXX appointment. Paid a {$30.00} co-pay. 

In XXXX ( after my XXXX  appointment ), I was sent a letter saying I owed hundreds of dollars and no clear explanation. Deductible? Denial?? I moved, so I actually didn't get this letter, but I have an online record saying it was first sent XX/XX/2023. 

I would never have made a XXXX appointment with this provider had I known I'd get charged hundreds of dollars. I should've, at minimum, been informed after the first visit. I have been getting calls about these bills from Gulf Coast Collections. 

It was from XXXX XXXX in XXXX FL
Narrative Summary: A consumer with marketplace insurance was told by their insurance and dermatologist that they had a $30 copay. However, after two appointments, they received a letter stating they owed hundreds of dollars with no clear explanation, and are now being contacted by a collections agency.

Consumer complaint narrative: I entered an agreement with Clear One Advantage in 2020 for a consolidation loan. One of the creditors is now claiming they did not receive payment. I am currently being sued by the creditor for payment. I have been working with Clear One Advantage to try to get the information to prove payment was made, however, the only information they have provided are XXXX payments made to the creditor. I need more information on the settlement agreement itself or confirmation the account was paid in full according to the agreement. The account was written off and sold to another company who is now pursuing payment.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company
Narrative Summary: A consumer entered a consolidation loan agreement with Clear One Advantage in 2020, but a creditor claims not to have received payment and is now suing. The consumer needs more information from Clear One Advantage to prove payment was made, as the creditor's account was written off and sold.

Consumer complaint narrative: Midland management company. I didn't know .l gave car 4 to 5 years ago. I couldn't pay for it had XXXX XXXX on XXXX. Now they took my money and l didn't know till l went to buy some food and find out they took my money out the bank.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Midland Management Company took money from their bank account without notice, related to a debt from a car they gave up 4-5 years ago. The consumer was unaware of the debt and only discovered the withdrawal when they tried to buy food.

Consumer complaint narrative: I called to consult with them I was behind on credit cards, they made it sound like basic credit consolidation, however I had to sign contract while on the phone, make a payment that day, had no time to read contract, I did not know any of the details of the contract, that is straight manipulation. I made payments for a year and a half, they still had not paid off XXXX out of XXXX cards, so I called to pay a lump sum pant of $ XXXX, to hurry the process along, they told me it didn't work like that, and that I had to keep making them payments, and was like what for, I just paid you XXXX .... I was like no way you can pay yourself out of the money I have paid you this feels like a scam, you have tanked my credit, and we are no further than we were. My XXXX  had just died, I could not work for almost a year, I feel like I was preyed upon and manipulated, I don't even know if I can cancel. People need to know what they are entering into. I've included screen shots XXXX  years in and XXXX XXXX  does not make sense to me.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims they were misled by a credit consolidation company. They signed a contract over the phone without reading it and made payments for 1.5 years, but the company hadn't paid off most of their credit cards. They feel manipulated and scammed, with their credit now damaged.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX-year old female, retired, over-extended with debt due to medical issues, inflation, death in family resulting in increased responsibilities. Good credit, substantial credit line, but just making minimum payments. Little knowledge of resources/ options, randomly 'cold-called ' XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX for advice, & after dizzying series of transfers indicating no, no, no, ended up on line with JG Wentworth, which said yes, yes, yes, & painted a glowing picture of becoming debt-free in 6 months +/-. 

It was a great sales pitch, asked all? XXXX that came to mind such as the role of the Company, charges for services, wise to stop making Credit Card payments. All deflected - more information provided in future 'Welcome Call, ' Agreement sent, important to sign now, cursory review of headings, you can read the details later, and I signed, agreeing to pay $ XXXX month, from XX/XX/XXXX > XX/XX/XXXX - at which time I would be XXXX years old - to settle debt of about {$43000.00} +/-. 

This was presented as a US government program, created with creditors, and that JG Wentworth, would enter into direct negotiations to get me the best deal possible, as quickly as possible. I was not told in any coherent manner that the percentages of payments were basically stipulated in the governing authorization for the program, nor that payments to creditors would be sequential, based on the funds I deposited with JG Wentworth, nor that my credit rating would crater, that I would continue to be charged interest until an 'Agreement ' was in place, that monthly Credit Crd fees would also be added, and that I would ultimately lose the ability to use the Credit Cards enrolled in the program, and likely jeopardize remaining cards as well. I was also not told for months that JG Wentworth would take 25 % of the original amount of the debt as a fee for service. 

This last only became apparent when the first Credit Card debt was settled : Original balance - {$4.00}, balance at Settlement - {$4500.00} ( including {$440.00} additional interest ), Settlement- {$2200.00} ( 50 % ) + {$1000.00} JG Wentworth fee. This represents a payment of about 81 % of the original debt, an amount that I could easily have paid off without the 'assistance ' of JG Wentworth. 

Throughout this period many calls for clarification, all 'helpful ' and 'encouraging, prompting me to continue with the Wentworth program until I finally learned through a Wentworth Team member, on or about XX/XX/XXXX that yes, I could likely have obtained equivalent or better results by dealing directly with the Credit Card Company . I was encouraged to try with the next lowest balance Credit Card, and in one short call had reached an agreement to bring that account current, and to ultimately retain the use of the card. It was uplifting, but also horrifying to realize that I had trusted JG Wentworth to act on my behalf when it wasn't necessary, and that I had essentially been driven into humiliating Credit Card default by the JG Wentworth Program. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I wrote to JG Wentworth requesting cancellation of my participation in their Program, and requesting the return of the {$630.00} on deposit with them, and, in light of the overall experience with them, a refund of the XXXX fee they had taken to 'resolve ' the debt with the afore-mentioned Credit Card company . In response I received two Voice Message regarding re-initiating the Program, and have received nothing in writing, other than a Confirmation of Cancellation. 
I have not received a refund of the funds on deposit with them, although the balance in my account now appears as {$0.00}. 

Please help, and let this serve as a cautionary tale for others. I have now learned, through conversations with the CFPB that a more logical option might have been consolidation and full-repayment of my debt or time, something that it appears would have protected my credit, and my integrity. Thank you very much for your consideration and action on this very serious and stressful matter. I have e-mails to verify all my communication to JG Wentworth if they might be of use to you. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A retired woman with good credit and substantial credit line was struggling with debt due to medical issues and family responsibilities. She was cold-called by JG Wentworth, which promised to settle her $43,000 debt in 6 months through a US government program. However, she was not informed about the program's fees, sequential payments, and potential credit rating damage.

Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted XXXX in XXXX. I contacted you in XXXX. It is XXXX now and I just got a letter from XXXX. You guys said you resolve the issue you fixed it Im delusional theres nothing going on all up in my head thats kind of funny because this is dated XX/XX/2024 and its from concordXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX credit and its to XXXX XXXX but it says thank you for your recent application to concordXXXX credit account issued by XXXX XXXX XXXX. unfortunately, we were unable to approve your application at this time for the following reasons because I didnt know my name I didnt know my physical address I didnt know my birthday and I didnt know my Social Security number how odd is that that Ive been tracking my name since I am XXXX from the first time I purchased a television to my present life where are you guys say no one is using my name no one knew where it couldnt be one of these companies do in the ad XXXX you know who it is oh of course not your protection bureau you would never ever allow something like that to happen now I would share this is another figment of my imagination that I have a letter Ive got a copy for you a copy for me to approve this is an inside job I have a credit freeze on my can you go to dabble and someone elses life and leave mine alone you have destroyed it I know you guys get paid way too much money that you allow these companies to destroy us. Yall need to start paying taxes, so maybe thatll open up your eyes a little bit and you can see all the fraud thats happening before your eyes and to your consumers. Im going to keep on making these reports until you fix your mistakes and I dont know if you guys are doing your whatever I dont care. this is three times this year of 2024. This has happened. I dont know the company and it keeps happening. What are you guys doing?
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a letter from Concord Credit stating their application was denied due to unknown name, address, birthday, and Social Security number. The consumer claims to have a credit freeze and believes this is an inside job, accusing the company of allowing identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Me and my wife started the Debt Settlement program with the Law Firm of XXXX XXXX and our funds were being deposited into an account through Global Holdings in XXXX of XXXX. Since that time they only managed to settle one debt and have been paying them {$15.00} a month since XXXX of XXXX. No other debts have been settled. On XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX I received a notice that they had settled another debt with XXXX XXXX  and that they needed my signature to proceed with that process. I reached out to discuss that with them and was un  able to get ahold of anyone and so I signed on the XXXX of XXXX authorizing the settlement. I was never contacted on the matter again and am currently being sued by XXXX XXXX. The other 3 debts I have are also still unsettled and I have been Informed that XXXX XXXX can not settle anymore debts because they themselves are part of a big lawsuit. 

Despite this they are still taking {$290.00} a month from me and depositing into the Global  holdings account. I checked my statements from Global Holdings and was shocked to see the exorbitant fees they have been charging me each month. I checked my initial contract and these amounts were never disclosed to me. For example in XX/XX/XXXX our first draft was {$270.00}. Looking at my statement for that month they charged me for : {$10.00} monthly service charge {$100.00} retainer fee {$49.00} Admin fee {$97.00} Service fee Out of {$270.00} a month only {$12.00} remained to pay my creditors from that {$270.00} charge. That happened every month.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer enrolled in a debt settlement program with the Law Firm of XXXX XXXX, but only one debt was settled. Despite this, the firm continues to charge $290/month in fees, with most of it going to exorbitant charges not disclosed in the initial contract.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX A written report of identity theft that included victim affidavit, police report, and appropriate identity was submitted to PayPal via XXXX XXXX Mail. This report provided detail of XXXX transactions by PayPal that occurred between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX resulting a loss of funds from the victim 's banking demand deposit account. The transactions were committed through the use of identity theft/impersonation The written report of identity theft requested that PayPal reimburse/reverse the identified transactions. This request was not responded to. This request was subsequent to the bank requesting reversals of the transactions and the victim having multiple email interactions with PayPal attempting to report these fraudulent transactions and being refused.

PayPal in not honoring reports of identity theft/impersonation has created an environment where criminals thrive and PayPal makes money off the crimes committed by them. When it fails to assist victims it is re-victimizing them compounding the loss of funds.
Narrative Summary: A consumer submitted a written identity theft report to PayPal, detailing 4 transactions that occurred between two dates, resulting in a loss of funds. PayPal failed to respond to the report or reverse the transactions, despite the consumer's multiple email interactions and the bank's request for reversals.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

The expected date for the transfer to be available was XXXX XX/XX/year>. The funds are still not available today XXXX XX/XX/year>. My first step was to ask my mom to communicate with the receiver bank and they stated no funds are available from XXXX to honor this transaction. I contacted XXXX through various means but I was not successful in getting a case started until XXXX XX/XX/year>. I provided them the reference number of the transaction, amount, name of receiver, bank account number of receiver, and bank name. I received an update today ( XXXX XX/XX/year> ) with information that contradicts itself. The message stated they indeed found an error with my transfer. However the funds were deposited but I was also entitled to a refund of only the transfer fee of {$1.00}. I called and spoke to an agent who said as far as they are concerned, the funds are deposited and there is nothing they can do for me. The funds are indeed not deposited and I would like someone to help me get my money back.
Narrative Summary: The consumer made a $190 transfer with a $1 fee, but the funds never reached the recipient. After multiple attempts to contact the company, they were told an error was found, but the funds were supposedly deposited, and only the $1 fee was refunded.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

I received a confirmation message on XX/XX/year> that the money was in the recipient 's account. However, the recipient went to the bank and was told by the bank that the money was not in his account. I called XXXX and complained and they told me to send the recipient 's bank statement to verify he never received the money and to either refund the money to me or ensure it is available in the recipient 's account. I provided the bank statement to XXXX more than two weeks ago, and each time I called them they told me they had expedited my case and it would be resolved within 48 hours but it has taken more than two weeks and XXXX never got back to me, and I have suffered some financial loss because of their delay. I need the money either delivered to the recipient, or refunded to my account without further delay, and I need to be compensated for their delay.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello I initially deposited XXXX via XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX I could not use the funds in Coinbase to pay or move out so I initiated a dispute with XXXX. They reversed the payment upon dispute. On Saturday, I contacted XXXX to unreverse the charge and they confirmed it was sent back to you. See attached. The initial deposit of XXXX ( XXXX after fees ). This would cover the charge on my account of XXXX and leave the remaining XXXX in my account. 

At initial time of dispute and reversal, Coinbase charged XXXX out of my balance and left me a bill for XXXX XXXX 

Upon contacting XXXX and then confirming. This money in the initial deposit was resent to you on my behalf and the dispute closed. The initial XXXX $ and they emailed you XXXX times. 

Now Coinbase customer support has failed to understand or help me and claims Ive only paid XXXX and owe XXXX but I should have a XXXX balance in the account. XXXX returned the XX/XX/XXXX deposit as if the reversal never happened. 
I ask XXXX last time for you to not steal my money, update the account to where it was before with a XXXX $ usd balance and the remaining amount covers the charge initialed by you upon initial reversal that was since fixed and resent the funds to you. XXXX even emailed you theee times to confirm. 

Please give me my XXXX $ back to my account or refund it to my XXXX. This has been pure XXXX for XXXX days and the customer service reps have been no help and I am out XXXX XXXX because you havent updated my account with the deposit. They just claim I owe for it and my XXXX $ deposit sent back to them seems to cease to exist to Coinbase. They are trying to scam me of my funds
Narrative Summary: A consumer deposited funds into Coinbase, but due to an initial dispute, the payment was reversed. After resolving the dispute, the payment was resent, but Coinbase failed to update the account, claiming the consumer still owes the initial amount, resulting in a missing balance of $XXXX.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024 I authorized my Square payroll account to make a payment to one of my contractors. The payment was sent to the wrong account ( a closed account with XXXX XXXX  ) due to no fault of my/contractors own - the new account for payroll payment was verified Prior to the payroll payment. 

Square is claiming that XXXX still has the funds. XXXX is saying no, we don't hold funds, they go back immediately ( which has been true for 2 other transactions that went back to origin immediately ). I've contacted Square 's payroll and customer engagement departments multiple times requesting they provide the info from an ACH trace or the ref # provided by the bank ( XXXX ). I've also requested a manager call in which they said they would in 24-48 hours but have not at all. They refused to assist and even closed my case stating that the money is just lost and I will not be able to retrieve.
Narrative Summary: A Square payroll payment was sent to a closed account due to an error. Square claims the recipient bank still holds the funds, but the bank denies this. The complainant has requested an ACH trace and manager call, but Square has refused to assist and closed the case.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I transferred {$95.00} USD as {$140.00} AUD by PayPal to a XXXX  business XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX that offers virtual XXXX  language classes. On their site they advertise that classes are offered by XXXX  ( see attached ) and on their XXXX XXXX  they say that all can participate at any ability level. In fact, they required me to instal a Russian program called XXXX which does not work with my phone number. They do not use XXXX as promised. Also, their most intro level class is too advanced and required that students read in XXXX. I e-mailed on the very same day that they sent their first communication and offered to postpone until I taught myself the alphabet ; I also asked if there was a more intro-level class in the future. I next e-mailed to say that I could not instal XXXX. They gave me the run-around for a few days by asking me to take a test and buy a workbook, which I had already done, and then said that it was too late for me to ask for a refund as the class was underway ( See attached ). Services were NOT received. I never joined a chat or participated in a class. I paid for the workbook ( {$10.00} ) and classes ( {$95.00} ) and only want a refund for the classes. I paid XXXX through PayPal and received an e-mail with class info from XXXX ; I my PayPal is associated with XXXX and XXXX, and I registered for class with the latter e-mail. 

XXXX Paypal XXXX ID XXXX Paypal XXXX ID XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX? XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid $95 for virtual language classes, but the business didn't deliver as advertised. The classes required a Russian program that didn't work with the consumer's phone number, and the intro level class was too advanced. The consumer never participated in a class and seeks a refund.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: There is a bunch of weird transaction to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX and XXXX and all these people are taking money out of my bank.I dont even travel and work at my Resturant all day XXXX I found out I told the bank and they told me to go on app and dispute but they denied my claim and I file a police report but they told me to go to the fbi and XXXX fbi told XXXX they are backed up and everyone is sending to different section and different agencies.i just want to know who the seller are so I can sue them for damages that cant be undone.chase bank never even investigated and couldnt even give me there business name that took my money.and they shut my account down and told me to give them proof when XXXX locked out my account so all of this is weird to me and I want my money back that I worked hard for
Narrative Summary: A consumer's bank account was drained by multiple unauthorized transactions to unknown individuals. Despite filing a police report and disputing the claims, the bank (Chase) denied the claim and shut down the account, failing to provide the names of the sellers or investigate the issue.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I opened an account on Bitstamp in XXXX and submitted my drivers license and a selfie, as requested by Bitstamp in order to transact and withdraw or transfer assets. Bitstamp has become unresponsive to my requests for attention to the matter, and has now XXXX trading and deposit/withdrawal functionality. i have requested several times that Bitstamp allow me to close my account, and transfer assets elsewhere, given their unresponsiveness. Further, the disabling of trading has subjected my account to enormous market risk. And i am facing hardship by not being able to withdraw my own funds. Finally, on more than one occasion, I have offered to provide additional identification information, but Bitstamp remains unresponsive. I am concerned that Bitstamp may be engaging in fraudulent activity, given their actions pertaining to my account, and lack of response.
Narrative Summary: The consumer opened a Bitstamp account, submitting required ID and a selfie. However, Bitstamp has become unresponsive, disabling trading and withdrawals, and ignoring requests to close the account and transfer assets, leaving the consumer's funds at risk and inaccessible.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

It has now been more than 4 business days and neither my personal bank ( Wells Fargo ) nor my employer ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and their bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) seems to know where my funds are as they funds have still not yet reached my bank account. I have sent numerous emails to my employer explaining the situation and have contacted both Wells Fargo ( receiving bank ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( sending bank ) to no avail. In addition, I have emails stating the amount of money I am owed for my PTO and when it was claimed to have been sent. I also have a supposed receipt of the wire transfer from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX provided to me by my employer.

Narrative Summary: A former employee claims they haven't received a $2,600 wire transfer for unused PTO, despite being told it would be sent. The transfer was allegedly initiated over 4 business days ago, but both the sending and receiving banks are unaware of the funds' location.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised

They said I have to wait 60 days which is illegal I want my funds release I will not be using Coinbase anymore I will be opening a law suit too if my funds arent release I have already submitted all document for proof of funds like my ID and ssn

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON 1 ) XXXX I made the assignment to XXXX bank ( XXXX ) to transfer XXXX XXXX to XXXX Bank ( XXXX ) due to the fact that these banks weren't on sanction lists at the moment. XXXX XXXX was sanctioned only on XXXX. 
2 ) XXXX Freedom bank without my assignment decided to send the funds via XXXX bank 's correspondent account in BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON, I guess due to the fact that XXXX bank was sanctioned only on XXXX. 
3 ) But BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON blocked my funds with no reason till the moment.

4 ) The funds are not intended for government or other related activities. Please allow sending the funds to my account in Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX.
Company: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORPORATION, THE
Narrative Summary: A customer's funds were blocked by Bank of New York Mellon without reason. The customer had instructed Freedom Bank to transfer funds to another bank, but Freedom Bank instead sent them via a correspondent account at Bank of New York Mellon, despite the customer's original bank being sanctioned after the transfer.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Between XXXX and XX/XX/year>, Cash App authorized XXXX fraudulent charges, totalling {$1000.00}, to be paid from my account. There were also XXXX similar transactions that were either declined ( XXXX @ {$870.00} ), canceled ( XXXX @ {$58.00} ), refunded ( XXXX @ {$190.00} ), or NSF ( XXXX @ {$210.00} ). Not one of these transactions were mine. 

On XX/XX/year>, I attempted to pay my monthly XXXX XXXX subscription and was blocked from doing so on Cash App, even after I was asked if I was authorizing this payment. I had to purchase XXXX XXXX XXXX  for {$15.00} and use that to pay it. I was going to call Cash App in the morning to address the problem. Before calling, I checked my Cash App account and found that almost {$700.00} of my money was gone, leaving a little more than a dollar in my account. Checking over the transactions since the previous night, I found that between XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX, there were XXXX transactions for {$2.00} or {$5.00} to XXXX and XXXX amounting to {$680.00}. 

I called Cash App. The rep, after putting me on hold for about XXXX min while he researched it, eventually told me to cancel my card and order another, but there wasn't anything else he could do. I did cancel the card. I called again and this rep told me to file a dispute ( why wasn't I told that ), and that it would be quicker and easier for me to do it through the app. Not true. It took me XXXX min to dispute just XXXX transaction. Another call had the woman telling me the same, but she couldn't help me without the exact date, time, amount, and vendor for each charge. She wouldn't put me through to a supervisor. The final rep I spoke to said none of these things and took about XXXX min to file the dispute for me. 

My claim was dismissed because I had in app authorization for the merchant. '' I was told it was due to my subscription. I called them again and was put through to a supervisor, XXXX ( but spelled differently ). He listened and seemed understanding and sympathetic. Once again my claim was dismissed for the same reason.

I then attempted to file a complaint against Cash App through their portal but was denied, told to file a police report, and virtually hung up on. I also contacted XXXX and they had no information to give me, but told me how to check all of my accounts through XXXX. None of them show any of these charges on my accounts.

Eventually, I decided to file a complaint with the FDIC, and went through my whole Cash App account to verify facts, etc. That's when I found out the extent of these XXXX scam payments. They started in XXXX XXXX XXXX. I hadn't noticed ant discrepancies in my balance, so never had a need to check my transactions. You'll note that most of these charges were declined, or in some cases, refunded immidiately. I don't know why, and no one will tell me. 

At that time, I did in fact, file a complaint against Cash App with the XXXX Police Department, case number XXXX. Again I called Cash App with this new information and was shut down.

Throughout this time, none of my actual purchases were affected, except one. I find it absolutely absurd that the only one of my authorized purchases that Cash App blocked was for my monthly subscription charge to XXXX XXXX, the basis of them dismissing my dispute!

As I said, none of these payments went to any of my accounts. Cash App paid them, so they should have the account info that got the money, as well as XXXX, especially since they refunded some. But then suddenly {$680.00}, in less than an hour and a half, in the middle of the night, was paid out. I also have no history of these types of payments in my Cash App account, or XXXX or XXXX. 

And as I explained to all of the reps I spoke to, my husband died on XX/XX/year>, and some of the money that was taken were donations to pay for my husband 's cremation. I'll be attaching documentation of everything that I've claimed in this complaint, including a spreadsheet I compiled to calculate all of the numbers. Let me reiterate, none of those charges were mine, nor were they authorized by me. And no one had access to my Cash App card, at any time.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims that Cash App authorized numerous fraudulent transactions totaling over $1,000, including $680 withdrawn in a single night. Despite multiple calls and disputes, Cash App dismissed the claims due to "in-app authorization" for a subscription, which the consumer disputes.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I need cash app to send me all of my statements from the year XXXX and XXXX. I want the statements to show my remaining balance after each transaction On XXXX XXXX I sent a payment via cash app to XXXX XXXX. He declined the payment and Cash app claims to have refunded me my {$170.00} to my card ending In XXXX I have uploaded my bank statements from my card XXXX CASH APP HAS NEVER REFUNDED ME MY MONEY. 


I will contact the news media and escalate this. I suspect Cash app continually steals from people
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Cash App failed to refund $170 to their card after a declined payment, despite the company's claim of a refund. The consumer has uploaded bank statements as proof and is requesting statements from Cash App to resolve the issue.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024 funds in the amount of {$4800.00} that the State of NJ put on a money Network card in compensation for XXXX insurance was fraudulently stolen from account. There was a transfer to personal banking account for the entire amount, transferred to an unknown account. This service can obviously be hacked. The card was never used, never taken from my home and never even activated. The day after downloading the app and viewing the balance the funds were fraudulently transferred from my account without explanation. I Followed all the appropriate procedures directed by money network, filed an ACH claim, gave all required information. They determined that no error occurred in a form letter denying my claim. Have tried several times to contact Money Network to dispute their check dispute operations determination. They offer only a fax number. Their Customer Service representatives have information regarding my claim filed but offer no assistance in the matter. When I try to call anyone in claims department the call gets routed to an automated service and hangs up. This is obvious ACH fraud. I want my stolen funds back in the amount of {$4800.00}. 
Case Id # XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer's Money Network card, loaded with $4,800 in NJ insurance compensation, was hacked, and the entire amount was transferred to an unknown account without explanation. Despite following procedures and filing a claim, Money Network denied the claim, and customer service has been unhelpful.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative: I've already had a lot of transactions in my account without any problems like this. There's this XXXX transaction ( XXXX XX/XX/2024 at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Amount : {$64.00} USD ) where the purchaser asked for a refund so I submitted the information asked on my side ( Sat, XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX ). The company then emailed me ( Sun, XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX ) that I needed to provide more business information, which I did and submitted the documents to their platform. NOW, unexpectedly and unjustly, the company permanently limited my account and provided incorrect information in the email, saying that my account is linked to another account with unresolved cases. I called their customer service a lot of times, and they just said that they couldn't do anything about it. Even XXXX of their customer service agents said that it might sound unfair on my side, which it is. Now, what I think here is a misunderstanding on the part of the part of the person who put the limit on my account or just triggered the automated system. I have emailed the company in their different emails and explained all of it without any response received from them for the past 5 days now.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's account was permanently limited after they submitted refund information and business documents, despite no prior issues. The company claimed the account was linked to another with unresolved cases, which the consumer disputes. Repeated customer service calls and emails went unanswered.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Sub-product: Money order, traveler's check or cashier's check
Consumer complaint narrative: My name is XXXX XXXX. My husband is a XXXX XXXX. He sent me a XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$3500.00} back in XX/XX/year>. He ask me to give the money to his friend XXXX XXXX. I signed my check over to XXXX XXXX. He deposited the check into his bank account at Bank of America ( BofA ). They called me to make sure the check was not stolen. I spoke to the representative at BofA and assured them that the check was not stolen and that I endorsed it and gave it to XXXX XXXX. I thought everything was fine. But days later, XXXX XXXX called me to let me know that they put a hold on the check and his bank account. The bank told him that they were investigating the matter. They later told him after I believe they found out the check was good that they were going to close his account and send the check back to the XXXX XXXX  They further told him that I would have to contact the XXXX XXXX to make a claim to get the money back. He received his money from his closed out account by his bank. I contacted the XXXXXXXX XXXX  but I was told they I could not file a claim because the bank did not send them the {$3500.00}. I asked XXXX XXXX to contact his bank again and have them return the funds so I can place my claim. He tried calling them again after making numerous attempts to resolve the matter only to be told that they can not discuss it with him because his name is not on the check! I am so frustrated and upset that Bank of America is completely giving the run around for money that DOES NOT belong to them!!! Can someone from your agency please help me with this matter and get The funds returned to me? I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer's $3500 check was deposited into a Bank of America account, but after an investigation, the bank closed the account, returned the check, and told the consumer to file a claim with the check's originator. However, the originator claims it never received the returned check.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

And I still have not received the money. I have exhausted all my resource. I have provided them with every single documents showing its me showing its my sister. I would like to get someone to help me to get my money back. My email is XXXX. My phone number is XXXX.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I made a purchase with my Venmo card to XXXX for {$95.00}, which was immediately taken out of my Venmo account. Two days later on XX/XX/XXXX, they ( Venmo ) charged me another {$95.00} and called it " account recovery payment. '' I can show that the money came out on the XXXX when I authorized it to. I can show that I did not make another purchase for {$95.00}. Venmo stole my money for no reason. Then I started looking online and I found that they have done this to a lot of people for no reason and with no explanation. People are furious including myself, and this is not okay. They are supposed to be a " bank. ''

The consumer alleges Venmo has done this to others without explanation, and they're seeking resolution for the allegedly stolen funds.

Today is XX/XX/XXXX and its has passsed XXXX  days and they still cant tell me why I cant access my funds or why my account was frozen in the XXXX  place I received a message in XXXX saying that some investigation was over and that I can tracer my funds but that was a lie
