Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I normally send money to my family through XXXX XXXX. The money is normally deducted from my bank account. 
On XX/XX/year>, I sent {$XXXX} from my XXXX XXXX  XXXX bank account to XXXX XXXX for onward transfer to XXXX. The transaction went well as before, with a transaction ref. # XXXX given to me by XXXX XXXX. 
On XX/XX/year>, I sent another {$XXXX} through XXXX bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX bank ) to XXXX XXXX  to be transferred to recipient. This was never transferred to the recipient. despite the fact that the amount was debited to my account, meaning XXXX XXXX XXXX paid XXXX XXXX. 
When I waited for them to send me the reference number as usual, I did not receive anything. So, I contacted them to ask what was going on. They started transferring my phone call from table to table and eventually hung up on me. 
I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX bank to lodge a complaint and they said they will look into it. I also wrote to XXXX revolution about my money and a couple of emails were exchanged and later they told me that I have to pay another $ XXXXfor them to execute the transfer. I asked what happened to the one I paid ; nobody was able to give me any credible explanation. This is what brings me to this complaint. I have copies of the emails I sent to Both institutions regarding this matter. 
I plead that you use your good offices to investigate this issue and my money refunded to me. 
Both XXXX XXXX XXXX bank and XXXX XXXX have refused to respond to my mails. 
I need your help as this is a large sum of money to me. 
Thanks.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
Narrative Summary: A consumer sent {$XXXX} through XXXX XXXX for transfer to a recipient, but the money was debited from their account without being transferred. Despite contacting XXXX XXXX and the bank, no credible explanation was given, and they were asked to pay an additional fee to execute the transfer.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Good morning, My name is XXXX XXXX and I have been a XXXX customer for a while. I was last year a victim of Zelle scam. I moved to a new location for university and attempted to find an apartment. I was shown an apartment which turned out to be a scam. The " leasing agent '' requested to make the payments over Zelle, I made multiple payments over a few days. I wanted to see the apartment before and they " showed '' me an apartment which turned out not to actually be a real unit that was available. I made a payment in total of {$2300.00}. I attempted to use the normal police, and zelle channels to get the money back. Then I turned to XXXX. However their XXXX " investigations '' just said that " I paid the money '' therefore I am liable. However there has been much coverage, new rules, and laws zelle scams. 
Zelle is refusing to talk to me and says they can not do anything for scams. XXXX relies on Zelle 's policy and says there is nothing they can do
Narrative Summary: A customer lost $2300 to a Zelle scam after making multiple payments to a fake leasing agent for an apartment. Despite reporting the scam to the police, Zelle, and their bank (XXXX), they were told they are liable as they initiated the payments.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Its been over XXXX months of nightmare. In XX/XX/XXXX we received XXXX emails from XXXX about some XXXX transactions. Since this account has never been used for any type of online transactions, we knew it had to be a hacker, and we immediately called the bank. The lady on the phone discovered that there were several more transactions, all within a couple of days, for a total of over {$2000.00}. Some of the recipients were just letters, F, XXXX, etc., which should have triggered some suspicion at the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, but it did not. We closed the account and opened a new one. There were XXXX checks that had to be honored, XXXX  and XXXX, and we gave them the amount and the check numbers. The new account got hacked again immediately, and XXXX more XXXX transfers were made ( {$1000.00}, {$1000.00}, {$500.00} ). Not even now did the Banks XXXX XXXX. catch the scam. They failed to see that neither the old account nor the new one were ever used for any other online transactions before or at the present time, and the debit cards were never put in use. We changed all user names and passwords for anything we had - bank account, XXXX ID, emails, etc., all I could remember of, twice. We went to the bank in person in XXXX and opened XXXX cases on the issue. Since XXXX till now I have wasted days, going to the bank, calling them on the phone, sending faxes from the bank to different departments, etc. They never got back to me on the promised and required time. It was always us that had to call them again and chase after them. They never ever told us what to do,. Each bank XXXX told us a different story. The bank clerk in XXXX, XXXX, he himself spent hours on the phone with his superiors. There was never an advice of some logical plan of actions that we supposed to take. Actually, they kept hiding info at all times. After accusing me, or someone in the family, for the fraud, it took them XXXX months until they finally said that it was my cell phone that was used for the transactions, WHICH WAS AN IMPOSSIBLITY. It took them XXXX months to advise me to file a police report, which I did, report that I provided the bank with. 

Since they said that it was my IP internet for the transactions, I contacted the internet provider and I was instructed how to go into my computer and find out all the users. I did, I make photocopies, and faxed them to the bank, via bank branch in XXXX. They had to be sent a couple of times because they claimed they did not get them. We were specifically told that departments are independent of each other and something sent to one does not automatically reach others. That, again, led to nothing. Then we were told by a XXXX representative that we should contact the XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ask for help, and to go to XXXX and subpoena them for info on our account to help us with the issue. We went to the XXXX in XXXX. We were given a blue sheet and were advised to call online XXXX XXXX for advice and support. We called, and were told that they had no idea what we should do. We called a lawyer number from those they had listed. Nothing. I was told to hire a lawyer, but hiring a lawyer was to cost us way more than the aprox. {$5000.00} that we were to recover from the bank. We obtained a phone number of a lawyer from a friend, but it wasnt his specialty or area. However, he told us that the investigating police XXXX had the right and the authority to subpoena XXXX  for XXXX. It followed weeks of back and forth calls to XXXX Police XXXX, including the XXXX station. We spent hours on the phone with XXXX XXXX even went twice to XXXX XXXX XXXX It was total wasting of time. 

At the advice of a lawyer, we contacted, twice, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. He said he will consider. I am still to hear from him. I filed a complaint with the XXXX, an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department XXXX XXXX Treasury. I am still waiting to hear from them, months later. 

At about the time of the hacking, our XXXX account was hacked and there was an attempt to transfer {$1200.00} to a receiver in XXXX XXXX, whose name was recorded by the XXXX. I got that info and gave it to the bank and the Police XXXX Some time in XXXX, XXXX months after the beginning of this mess, an attempt was made to charge my new debit card, online, for the amount of {$100.00}, somewhere in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX How he got that new card info, when it had never been used, remains a mystery. I really began to suspect someone within the bank system itself. I gave that info to the bank too, but they dismissed that as useless, since the transaction did not go through. After some XXXX months, they finally told us that they believed it was an inside job ( done by me or with my knowledge ) and closed the case, as they sent us the documentation on the bases of which they came to that conclusion. That info never contained the phone numbers of the hackers, which would be connected to a bank account that they should have investigated. 

Remember the XXXX checks that were to be honored by the bank, to XXXX and to XXXX? We kept receiving late fees and penalties from XXXX. We contacted XXXX by phone, and we were told that these were for not paying our taxes to the XXXX of California. We went to the bank, and they gave me a copy showing that the check was paid and when it was paid. We fax them to XXXX, and for the next few weeks those people were getting crazy, without being able to locate the check. We went back to the bank again asking how come they gave us a copy saying that it was paid, but it does not show up in my statement as being paid, and after another week of investigations the bank concluded that it was not paid, and tried to blame me for not giving instructions, for there were no such notes in the system, as if we had any control over what they wrote down. Fortunately for us, the fact that they paid the other check, to XXXX, was a proof that yes there were such instructions. And the fact that they gave us a copy of the supposed paid check, wrongly claiming that is was paid, is also a strong proof of their mistake. On XX/XX/XXXX, they acknowledge that it was their mistake, and all they offered was to give a letter of apology to XXXX, but they were to return no money to us. Wow!?!. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, we went in person to a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for XXXX. The XXXX and I called the bank - again, a wasting of timeXXXX XXXX  and XXXX police need the phone numbers that were used for the XXXX transactions XXXX for those phone numbers should be connected to a bank account. But the bank will not release them. So, on XX/XX/XXXX, we contacted the XXXX XXXX XXXX and asked them to subpoena the bank for that info. No help We received some papers from the bank to go for arbitration. We did, but got nowhere, yet. On XX/XX/XXXX we received a call from the bank, XXXX XXXX, who was in the case before, saying they decided to take a new look at the case. On XX/XX/XXXX he called and said he needed more time, till next Friday. XXXX XX/XX/XXXX we heard nothing from him. 

There are XXXX situations with Wells Fargo Bank. First, there was a fraud in which XXXX was used multiple times, in XX/XX/XXXX, to get close to {$5000.00} out of my account. Second, they did not pay my XXXX taxes and I was penalized close to {$400.00}. We have been stressed out more than half a year, lost weeks of work, and spent, not days, but weeks, between the bankXXXX XXXX, Police XXXX ( in person, on the phone, emails ). They refuse to take the responsibility for any of these things. We need to see what it can be done to recover our money and to receive payment for all the damage they have caused, physical, psychological, etc., and also help others prevent such a situation with this bank.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer's bank account was hacked, resulting in over $5,000 in unauthorized transactions. Despite multiple reports to the bank, the issue was not resolved, and the bank failed to provide a logical plan of action, instead accusing the consumer of being involved in the fraud.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative: I created a Venmo account back in XXXX. I only used it once to send {$10.00} to my girlfriend. There is no other activity on that account from me. On XX/XX/XXXX I transferred {$20.00} - transfer fee to my linked Venmo account. When I tried to use the money it was declined. I called Venmo support to figure out the issue. I was informed my account had been frozen for almost a month prior. I had no idea because again this acc for me is only a back up. So I sent my ID and pay stub as requested. I was assured it will only take a few days. Now I have been told it will take 180 days after I sent another transfer of {$100.00} to my venmo acc. Now I get an email saying I violated the the terms and my account is permanently deactivated with no way to get my money that I transferred only because the reps I spoke to said it will all be resolved in days. So now Im out of all my money. Lost my job because I couldnt buy gas with money that was supposed to be available to me. I am totally XXXX with Venmo for upending my life like this.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's Venmo account was frozen without notification, and despite providing requested documents, they were told it would take 180 days to resolve. After a new transfer, the account was permanently deactivated due to a terms violation, leaving the user unable to access their funds.

Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX is the PayPal transaction ID. On XX/XX/year> I attempted a purchase and sent XXXX in error because I misspelled the recipient name. I immediately opened a dispute with PayPal. They didn't read the issue. Below is the text I sent. 


Issue with remittance The money was sent to the wrong recipient Case status : Closed We've closed this case as our review showed that this transaction was processed correctly and an amount of {$800.00} XXXX was successfully transfered to the XXXX on XX/XX/year> at XXXXXXXX XXXX PDT. 
Your responses XX/XX/year> at XXXXXXXX XXXX PDT You provided additional info. 
Please refund the full transaction fee as well. You can see that I did pay the correct XXXX XXXX so do not send him the incorrect payment, please return to my account. 
XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX PDT You provided additional info. 
I have asked the wrong payee to return the money and this person has not responded. Please reverse the transaction.

Should be sent to XXXX Case details Case ID : XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$800.00} XXXX Receiver info : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Transaction reported XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, Money XXXX XXXX ID : XXXX - {$800.00} XXXX Additional Info Your note : Mistaken payment... entered the incorrect name spelling
Narrative Summary: The consumer sent $800 via PayPal to the wrong recipient due to a misspelled name. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Managing, opening, or closing your mobile wallet account
Consumer complaint narrative: Unable to be verified by Wells Fargo system for mobile wallet.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer is unable to verify their identity through Wells Fargo's system for mobile wallet setup, preventing them from using the service.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, sent via U.S. Postal Service check # XXXX, written to the United States Treasury for {$3900.00}, to pay my XX/XX/XXXX estimated individual quarterly income tax payment to the IRS. This check # XXXX cleared my Wells Fargo Bank through my primary checking account on XX/XX/XXXX. 


Five months later, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ) from the IRS stating I owed them {$4000.00} ( {$3900.00} + penalties + interest ). I called the IRS to inform them that my Wells Fargo Bank statement had a transaction record showing that WF Bank compensated my check to the IRS on XX/XX/XXXX. The IRS told me if they had cashed the check, the back would be stamped with a barcode for tracking purposes. I double-checked my Wells Fargo online portal for a visual copy ( front & back ) of check # XXXX. The only check that was not visually accessible. I then called Wells Fargo, seeking further assistance, but they could not furnish me with a copy of the front and back of check # XXXX. The bank phone representative stated there was a potential glitch with their check imaging software system, informing me that the bank statement would be enough for the IRS to resolve my issue. I contacted the IRS to explain the information Wells Fargo Bank provided. The IRS told me the issue would likely be resolved as human error, and they would put my account on hold ( to avoid accruing additional penalties & interest ) to provide time for a resolution to be concluded. 



On XX/XX/XXXX, I received another letter from the IRS requesting a {$4200.00} payment. I immediately called the IRS, followed by a phone call to Wells Fargo, and the same scenario occurred. The IRS requires a copy of the front and back of the check to validate the deposit, and Wells Fargo could not provide me with a copy of the check to present to the IRS for their records and reference. 


On XX/XX/XXXX, I visited a physical Wells Fargo branch near my house to request a copy of check # XXXX in person, which they gave me a print copy of. Upon review, check # XXXX was physically signed on the back by someone other than the IRS, presenting potential fraud. I proceeded to file a claim with Wells Fargo Bank at that time ; due to various missteps on Wells Fargo 's behalf, including a delay in initiating the claim process and a lack of clear communication, claim # XXXX took place officially on XX/XX/XXXX. 


I requested Well Fargo escalate my inquiry/claim on XX/XX/XXXX. A new claim, # XXXX, was filed in place of the original one ( noted above ), with a new follow-up date of XX/XX/XXXX. 


On XX/XX/XXXX, Wells Fargo sent me a formal letter noting that their research on my claim # XXXX was complete, and the case was closed. They disclosed that XXXX XXXX XXXX, which cashed the check, was not liable to refund {$3900.00} for check # XXXX. XXXX  XXXX XXXX stated to Wells Fargo that due to internal policies and procedures ( information Im not privy to ) requiring prompt reporting, they are not liable for reimbursement of the fraudulent deposit. It was necessary through XXXX XXXX representation of my claim to handle and disclose this information before an anticipated due date. 


On XX/XX/XXXX, I received another letter from the IRS with a new balance of {$450000.00} due by XX/XX/XXXX. 


After a year of conducting my due diligence on this matter, I have been taken advantage of and run around in circles by Wells Fargo and XXXX  XXXX XXXX. I can not trust the banking institutions to protect me against fraud. XXXX  XXXX XXXX failed their fiduciary responsibility to ensure the accuracy of their customer 's deposits and validate their identity, as they released funds from my check # XXXX to the IRS to one of their account holders. I am now at a loss of ( {$3900.00} + XXXX ) = {$8500.00}. 


I thank you for your time and attention to this matter and appreciate any assistance you can provide. 


Thank you, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer sent a $3,900 check to the IRS for quarterly taxes, which cleared their Wells Fargo account. However, the IRS claimed the check was never received, and the consumer was unable to obtain a copy of the check from Wells Fargo due to a software glitch.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: Paypal without proper reasons and evidence, debited XXXX $ from my account XXXX even after submitting all the required detais and providing XXXX.. They debited XXXX $ from my account.. I think they are XXXX
Narrative Summary: PayPal debited $XXXX from the complainant's account without providing a valid reason or evidence, despite the complainant submitting required details. The complainant is disputing the unauthorized debit.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I located XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on XXXX. I booked, via direct messages on XXXX and phone call, a tour. I was asked to pay the deposit to hold the requested dates, via Western Union, to XXXX XXXX. I sent the cash via Western Union and it was picked up. I did not receive a confirmation and the company profile is no longer on XXXX and they are not answering any of my calls.
Narrative Summary: A consumer booked a tour with a company after direct messaging and a phone call, paid a deposit via Western Union, but never received confirmation and can't contact the company, which has since deleted its profile.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had two fraudulent transactions charged through Paypal for apple giftcards which used my card through my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX bank for the amounts of {$10.00} and {$21.00}. 

There are several exploits which is why I imagine so many scammers are openly doing it, but my main issue is with the fact Paypal provides absolutely no way to get into your account to report the fraud or contact anyone in the company while the scammer is actively submitting more transactions on an individuals card. 

Attached are images of me attempting to log on via computer ( 2 different browsers ) and via the phone application, I tried 2 working phone numbers and even did their photo ID verification, all of which led to an error message " we are having trouble verifying your account ''. 

It should be illegal to have any kind of financial service that can not allow you to report fraud that is actively being done. I ended up having to cancel my debit card through my bank, which took hours to do. 

There are an overwhelming amount of disputes similar to mine yet PayPal has done nothing to fix the issue. A company like this should not be allowed to operate and expose consumers to such preventable and exploitative practice.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's issue is with PayPal's lack of accessible reporting for active fraudulent transactions. They experienced two unauthorized Apple gift card purchases and were unable to report the issue due to repeated error messages across multiple login attempts, forcing them to cancel their debit card through their bank.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Sub-product: Money order, traveler's check or cashier's check
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2024 I called Bank of America customer to inquire mobile deposit cashier check of {$18000.00}. 
the customer service rep said must go to a branch, I can not go to the branch because hours were reduced to XXXX XXXX XXXX I work during those hours. I asked if the branch atm ok he said yes. no mention they would put a 10-day hold on the cashier 's check. 
XX/XX/2024 called the bank and spoke to supervisor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) Bank of America states the policy is 7-10 days to hold any deposits over {$5200.00} no exceptions. She could not answer the question of what determines a 7-day hold vs a 10-day hold. I told her If I knew the bank would put a 10-day hold on the cashier check I would have deposited the cashier check into my credit union account I would have had access to the funds within 48 hours.

Can the bank do this by putting a 10-day hold on a Cashiers Check?
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Bank of America customer deposited a $18,000 cashier's check via ATM, but the bank placed a 10-day hold on it. The customer was not informed of the hold when they inquired about depositing the check, and was only told about the bank's policy after the fact.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Managing, opening, or closing your mobile wallet account
Consumer complaint narrative:
There is no legitimate reason to say that my website sells infringing products! 

Reference ID : XXXX My PayPal account was suddenly and permanently restricted without any valid reason and the funds in my account have been frozen for 180 days. 
I tried asking the PayPal customer service team for help but they said they couldn't help me recover my account. I have been using this account for some time and have always worked in good faith and adhered to all policies and user agreements stated and agreed to when I signed up for the account. 

I have taken every step to minimize the risk associated with my account, but PayPal has still permanently restricted my account and says there are potential risks associated with it. 
I would request any information as to why PayPal feels they must restrict this account. There is no reason to permanently close my account as I believe I did nothing wrong to cause the account to be closed. Therefore, I am asking PayPal to re-investigate the issue and help resolve it. I'm willing to provide any information needed to investigate and help recover the account. I am willing to work with PayPal to minimize perceived risk. I'm asking you to help me recover my account. 

Reference ID : XXXX
Narrative Summary: A PayPal user's account was permanently restricted and funds frozen for 180 days, allegedly due to potential risks, despite the user claiming to have followed all policies and agreements. The user is seeking a re-investigation and resolution, offering to provide information to resolve the issue.

Narrative Summary: Venmo froze a new account after a user tried to transfer received funds to a bank account, requesting ID verification. Despite providing ID, the account remains frozen, with the user claiming no wrongdoing and only having made the account.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is to update my statement for XXXX After reading my statement for XXXX I realized that I was highly upset when i wrote it and that it was Incomprehensible. I couldnt even understand it. Lol On XX/XX/2024 I Used Remitly to make a transfer to pay for a service in the XXXX XXXX At XXXX XXXX  XXXX I requested to transfer {$200.00} to her bank account in XXXX. We saw the notice that it could take XXXX days to deposit to her account. We both realized that was unacceptable. I read on the receipt You can cancel for a full refund anytime unless the funds have been picked up or deposited, but i couldnt find a cancel button. 
So around XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX after making the transfer request, I called the XXXX number to cancel. The agent put me on hold while he checked to see if he could cancel it. 
When he returned on the phone he said that he could cancel the transaction, & told me to allow up to XXXX XXXX for funds to be back in my account. 
I still needed to pay her & not until I thought the bank deposit transaction was canceled, I submitted a new transfer request at XXXX for {$200.00}. Only this time it was to be sent through XXXX XXXX for cash pick up. The receipt said it would be ready for pick up at XXXX ( That transaction is correct and not in dispute. 

Then on XXXX XXXX I noticed the bank transfer didnt look like it was canceled. I called and was told it had not been canceled because at the time I tried to cancel, the money was on its way and it could not be canceled at that point. That the agent was wrong for telling me he could cancel the transaction. When I spoke to the manager I was told the same. Because the money was on its way, it couldnt be canceled. I showed them the consumer rights statement on my receipt that reads You can cancel for a full refund anytime unless the funds have been picked up or deposited. Neither of these things had happened at the time I called to cancel. 
The receipt shows I made the transaction at XXXX and the money wasnt deposited in her account until XXXX. XXXX hours after I called to cancel it. 
Ive circled in red the highlights of time and the consumer rights statement.
Narrative Summary: The consumer used Remitly to transfer $200, but after realizing the long deposit time, they called to cancel. The agent claimed the transaction was canceled, but it wasn't. The consumer was told the money was already on its way and couldn't be canceled, contradicting the receipt's consumer rights statement.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: From XXXX XXXX, I was in a different country traveling for vacation and visiting friends. On XX/XX/XXXX, I got drugged and taken to a different part of town where my phone was stolen. After hours of finding my way back into my airbnb, to find out my emails and bank accounts have been compromised. Next day I reported the fraud to Wells Fargo to stop the bleeding. I didnt get a chance to look at my bank account to verify what they took. Until I got back this week, got a new phone and went into the bank to regain online access again. The provisional credit I was given was smaller than what I had originally before the incident. I am short {$3300.00} because the XXXX amounts they assumed it wasnt fraud and thought it was me doing it but it wasnt. All transactions on XX/XX/11 I did not authorize those. Im a little disappointed especially being a long time customer with Wells Fargo. XXXX to XXXX is somebody else trying to XXXX money to themselves. I will email them more documentation for proof. Also Ill attach documents here to prove my case on Saturday morning XX/XX/11 my phone was stolen and everything was compromised. When I got a new phone and used my old number, I see XXXX XXXX payments being sent out and XXXX. XXXX is also linked into this but is currently under investigation still.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims their bank account was compromised after their phone was stolen while traveling abroad. Upon reporting the fraud to Wells Fargo, they were given a provisional credit, but it was $3,300 short due to unauthorized transactions assumed to be legitimate, which the customer disputes.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

The recipient never received the parcel via mail, and on XX/XX/XXXX, I immediately reported the gift card as missing to Vanilla Visa Gift Card customer services. Per their automated message, website and FAQs, if a gift card is lost or stolen they will void the lost card in order to preserve the funds and provide a replacement to ensure the funds are not stolen. I've had about 7 phone calls with the team, where I've sent my receipts, license and proof of address to the client services email ( and received confirmation of receipt of email ) at least 5 times, however, each time I call Vanilla Visa, their team claims that they haven't received the documents, can not access the email that I send the docs too ( as it is managed by a middle office team that they claim to not have contact with ) and keep closing my case. I was also told that the case would be resolved in no more than 30 days, and it is now over a month since I reported my card missing and the team has not addressed my case, nor have they followed up with me once to provide a status update.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased a $400 Vanilla Visa Gift Card that was lost in mail. Despite reporting the issue and providing required documents multiple times, the customer service team claims not to have received them, failing to resolve the case within the promised 30-day timeframe.

Ill never bank with they again and I advise everyone never bank with them they suppose to be your bank but didnt even have my back

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Date of Incident XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Description of the Incident : Dear Consumer Finance, I am writing to report of Paypal an urgent issue that occurred on XXXX XXXX XXXX. I attempted to transfer {$100.00} from my XXXX account, which is linked and verified with my PayPal account, to my PayPal balance. Actions Taken : I confirmed that my XXXX account had sufficient funds for the transfer.

I attempted the transfer multiple times, receiving a refusal each time.

I am reaching out to you for immediate assistance as this situation is causing significant inconvenience and I need the funds to be available in my PayPal account as soon as possible.

Please investigate this matter urgently and provide a resolution. Your prompt attention to this issue would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative: My bank is Citibank. On XX/XX/2024, I had {$39000.00} on my checking account. My first payment, on that day, was a Direct Debit ( ACH ) to the IRS for {$14000.00}. Then, a payment to my credit card for {$21000.00} - which my bank called a " transfer '' because they issued my credit card. My 3rd payment was actually a transfer to my saving account for {$10000.00}. At that point, I didn't pay attention that I was overdraft because I have the overdraft protection between my checking and my savings. Finally, my XXXX payment was done thru XXXX for {$3000.00}. During the whole day, no where on the application it showed the overdraft, all my payments looked that they were processed. The day after, the payment for the IRS was rejected but all other payments were processed. I got penalties, interests and fees to pay to the IRS. I filed a complaint to my bank for not processing my payments in the order that I sent them. I was told that the payments that go first are the transfers from account to account and then the biggest amounts. I asked also when these rules where communicated to me because I was not aware of these. They didn't reply. I asked in which documentation these rules are shown but they told me that they did not have the documentation.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Citibank customer claims the bank processed payments in an order that led to an overdraft, resulting in penalties and fees. The customer argues the bank should have processed payments in the order they were sent, rather than prioritizing transfers and larger amounts.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Commencing on or about XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, I fell victim to a multi-layered scam operation run by XXXX XXXX XXXX which involved me making deposits for a total amount of XXXX USD from my Navy Federal Credit Union account to fraudulent firm ( XXXX ). 
It all started rather innocently on XXXX when the scammer claimed to be the prince of XXXX and swooped into my life promising romance and adventure. Being a XXXX XXXX skepticism was a frequent companion, but his words created a compelling story that suited his situation well. Because the story was so captivating, I relaxed and allowed the seeds of trust to grow. As our virtual bond grew, he showed me a package that had been mailed to me from XXXX. I had no idea that this was only the start of a very sophisticated strategy. When he told me there was a seemingly harmless commission fee standing between me and the product, the net got tighter. 
I felt like I was getting closer to a love story with every payment. Being a XXXX XXXX every dollar was carefully thought out. 
A growing doubt crept in as the last money left my hands. Instead of the box arriving, I started to feel uneasy and like I was being watched. I started to become paranoid because I thought he was the prince of XXXX, following me around on my phone. 
When determining whats reasonable and fair, we should focus on the issue of liability ; common queries include, but are not limited to, the following ( i ) whether Navy Federal Credit Union did not take notice of any rule, law, or regulation, and/or possibly missed any material elements of the relevant bylaws or codes of conduct, that may have prevented them from protecting my financial safety ; ( ii ) whether by virtue of Navy Federal Credit Unions custodianship over my funds or by its control over them, they owed a fiduciary duty to the me and if so, whether that duty was breached ; ( iii ) whether Navy Federal Credit Union promoted the transaction ( s ) in question despite being aware of the nature of the transaction ( s ) in question ( iv ) whether Navy Federal Credit Union was in compliance with its own policies and procedures ; ( v ) whether Navy Federal Credit Union owed duties to myself, what the scope of those duties was, and whether Navy Federal Credit Union did not uphold those duties ; ( vi ) whether Navy Federal Credit Unions conduct was unfair ; and ( vii ) whether Navy Federal Credit Union has within its power the ability to, and should, compensate me for the harm that has befallen me. 
Upon identification of such unusual or suspicious activity, it is crucial that the relevant staff member adequately describe the factors making an activity or transaction suspicious, thoroughly depict the extent and nature of this activity and properly communicate to the customer that such activity meets the relevant criteria of fraud. 
In providing its services to a customer, a financial institution is required by law to exercise the care and skill of a diligent, prudent banker. In this case, this means that the payment service provider should not turn a blind eye to known facts pointing to a real possibility that their customer is being scammed. In other words, Navy Federal Credit Union must have had special knowledge of what was occurring or been alerted to a real possibility of fraud taking place. The financial institution must have known or reasonably ought to have known that I was dealing with a scammer. 
Granted, there is room for diversity of view insofar as reasonableness is concerned. Indeed, there is a sense in which the standard of care of the reasonable person involves in its application a subjective element. 
However, it must be remembered that the correct test is always reasonable care in all circumstances, not average care. The fact that most people behave in a certain way may be good evidence that the conduct is reasonable, but this is not necessarily the case. Although reasonableness is a very fluid concept, all of the evidence suggests that Navy Federal Credit Union did not foresee the fraud and disregarded even the most obvious dangers in this respect. 

Situations do tend to repeat themselves and it is advisable to examine previous outcomes to see how the standard of the reasonable person should be applied, and that lessons can be learnt from the errors of the past.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer fell victim to a romance scam, losing a total of XXXX USD in deposits to a fraudulent firm through their Navy Federal Credit Union account. The complaint alleges that the credit union failed to detect and prevent the suspicious transactions, potentially breaching its fiduciary duty to protect the customer's financial safety.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I initiated a transfer for {$1000.00} from my Robinhood account to my checking account at XXXX. I mistakenly chose the wrong checking account to transfer the funds to. The account I accidentally selected has been closed since XX/XX/XXXX. 

I waited several days for the transfer to be reversed and show in my Robinhood account, but it never did. I reached out to Robinhood and they claimed the transfer is complete. They directed me to go to XXXX and get information about the missing funds. 

First Robinhood asked for documentation that the account is closed. I brought them the last statement from the account that shows the account was charged off by XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ). Robinhood still claimed the transfer is complete and asked for more information from XXXX Bank. I provided them a document from XXXX showing the transfer was indeed reversed the day after it was initiated, XX/XX/XXXX. 

Robinhood still claimed the transfer was somehow completed. They then asked for the trace ID #, which was already on the document I had provided them. I provided that information again and they still claim they can not find the funds and insist that the money was transferred to XXXX. I have been to XXXX multiple times, and they have provided detailed information and documents showing that the transfer was returned to Robinhood.

I have reached out to Robinhood numerous times but they have done nothing to correct the issue and provided no more detail other than saying the transfer is complete on their end and claim there is nothing possible for them to do, despite the proof from XXXX that the funds were returned to Robinhood.
Narrative Summary: The consumer initiated a $1000 transfer from Robinhood to a closed checking account. Despite the bank confirming the transfer was reversed, Robinhood claims the transfer is complete and refuses to correct the issue, ignoring provided documentation and evidence of the reversal.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX payments to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) online bill payments. XXXX invoice was for {$11000.00} and XXXX invoice was for {$15000.00}. The total for both invoices was {$27000.00}. The next business day, XX/XX/XXXX, I cancelled both XXXX payments due to issues with the order. I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX directly at XXXX and cancelled the XXXX over the phone with XXXX of their customer service agents. The money had already been withdrawn from the bank account at this point, but the agent told me that we would be receiving the money back within XXXX - XXXX business days. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I realized the money had never been refunded. I contacted XXXX again. I ended up being connected with the same young man who initially cancelled our ACH payment on XX/XX/XXXX. I spent XXXX hours on the phone that day with him. He stated he did not even have any record in their system of the initial ACH payment, the withdrawals, or any cancellation. I showed him our bank accounts using a screen share software, gave him the XXXX information of the other company XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which is through XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to make sure they did not receive the money. We contacted XXXX XXXX on a conference call to verify that they had not received the money by mistake. They stated they had not received payment. He opened case # XXXX and I sent through their online portal copies of the bank statements that showed the withdrawals by XXXX on our account on XX/XX/XXXX. I was told he would call me back the next day at XXXX AM to give me an update, however, no one contacted me so I called XXXX again and was connected with another agent. 

At this point, I had retrieved the trace numbers of the transactions from the bank ( XXXX ). They are as follows : Debit Amount : {$15000.00} - Trace ID XXXX Debit Amount {$11000.00} - Trace ID XXXX I provided this information to the XXXX agent on the phone, and again was on the phone for another XXXX hours having to explain everything all over again because there was no record in their system of the XXXX hour conversation I had the day before. The agent did tell me that XXXX uses CHASE BANK to process all of their payments, both XXXX and check. I was given another case # XXXX and told on XX/XX/XXXX that we would be receiving a refund in XXXX - XXXX business days. 

I contacted XXXX again on XX/XX/XXXX following up and making sure that our refund was being processed, and was told that it should be back in our bank in XXXX - XXXX business days. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX, today, the XXXX day of the XXXX business days promised by XXXX, XXXX money is still not back in our account and the money has not been refunded. We need assistance in tracking the money, finding out where it went, and receiving a refund from the company. I am also requesting any information about governmental oversight of XXXX party payment providers, specifically, what federal regulations are in place for these companies, and what kind of accountability do they have to the federal government. I am absolutely flabbergasted that a company can take {$27000.00} of someone's money and have no accountability for it.
Narrative Summary: The consumer initiated two online bill payments totaling $27,000, but cancelled them the next day due to order issues. Despite being told a refund would be processed within 3-5 business days, the money was not returned, and the company claimed no record of the payment or cancellation.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
We initiated a wire transfer on XXXX XX/XX/year> for USD XXXX to a not-for-profit charitable organisation in XXXX XXXX we have been supporting for over a decade. Over the years, we have initiated and completed many wire transfers to this charity. The money left our account on XXXX XX/XX/year> and as at today ( XXXX XX/XX/year> ), it has not reached the recipient 's account. On XXXX XX/XX/year>, we received a secure message via Chase Bank saying a correspondent bank in their chain has requested information regarding the nature or vocation of the ordering customer and the purpose of the transfer. We responded to this message with the information required on XXXX XX/XX/year>. Since then, we have sent XXXX requests via the same secure messaging service for information on our wire transfer funds as it has still not been received. In addition, we spoke to someone at the wire transfer department of Chase Bank on XXXX XX/XX/year>. We are yet to have an explanation as to where our funds are, why they have not been received by the recipient, and what Chase is doing to ensure the safe delivery ( or at this stage, return ) of our funds. Chase Bank has been unforthcoming and unhelpful, their only reply and refrain being that they are making enquiries with banks in their chain. As you can imagine, given almost 1.5 months have passed since the funds left our account, this is not longer an acceptable response. A simple XXXX search has made us aware this is not an unusual thing with Chase as there are numerous examples of other customers who have had a similar struggle. This is made especially difficult as we currently live in the XXXX XXXX and getting through to Chase on the phone due to their lack of any worthwhile response to secure messages has been costly and time consuming. 

Please contact us by email in relation to this matter. Thank you.
Narrative Summary: A consumer initiated a wire transfer of USD XXXX to a charity on XXXX XX/XX/year>, but the funds have not been received by the recipient after nearly 1.5 months. Chase Bank has been unhelpful, stating only that they are making enquiries with banks in their chain.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Sub-product: Money order, traveler's check or cashier's check
Consumer complaint narrative:
-check for {$4000.00} was written on XX/XX/XXXX to me from my uncle from my grandmothers estate as he is the administrator, This check was coming from XXXX XXXX -I deposited the check on XX/XX/XXXX into Chase. I have an existing checking account. I never had any accounts at XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX I got an email about fraud from Chase so I called at XXXX XXXX  that night to see what there is that I could do there was no resolution Other than being told that the check was deposited more than once. ( Which it wasnt ) XXXX XXXX called again spoke to the company about how to resolve this and was told the only way is XXXX verification through phone number and if that didnt work that he could recant the check through XXXX -Went in person multiple times to both XXXX and Chase to figure out why the check had problems and was told by both banks that the money had left the account at XXXX and I could no longer recant The check, the funds were now at Chase XXXX XXXX XXXX Uncle took all the steps to get XXXX verified as per chases request just for all my access to my accounts to be shut down the same week -On Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX, my local branch manager called XXXX fraud department at XXXX and was told that the money left and the funds should be released in a few days to XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, this was proven not to be true as my uncle and I went to XXXX to see if the funds arrived at XXXX to find they hadnt -I was told by Chase through calling the fraud line on the same day that my money would be held indefinitely if he cant be XXXX verified over the phone -This is all after the bank manager at XXXX verified with the XXXX fraud department that the check was only deposited and withdrawn once -On XX/XX/XXXX, a worker at the XXXX branch called fraud and was told that the money cant be released even though the number they called was verifiable, but no longer in service -uncle and I both offered to provide any documentation that can get him verified i.e. Social Security card, birth certificate, New York State, drivers license and employment documentation as well as paystubs and mail all of which were denied -uncle and I also offered to go in person to a chase headquarters branch where there could possibly have autonomy over the money and was also denied that -I asked for XXXX legal number and was denied that -Before this case got to the escalations department, I asked for that number and was denied, but finally worked my way up into that system -this XXXX verification seems like An unreasonable system that is a ploy to just have funds stuck in their accounts, so that consumers can no longer receive their funds. These verification systems in place do not allow the consumer to receive their funds due to the almost impossible means of getting verified. Although we live in the 21st-century there is plenty of people that do not have cell phones or home phones, and this way a verification just seems fraudulent.
Narrative Summary: A consumer deposited a $4,000 check from their uncle, the administrator of their grandmother's estate, into their Chase account. Chase flagged the check for fraud, and despite multiple attempts to verify the uncle's identity, the funds remain frozen due to Chase's phone verification requirement.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Narrative Summary: A consumer's PayPal account was suspended due to being labeled "high risk." The account holder is requesting reconsideration, disputing the suspension and seeking resolution to regain access to their account.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a recent transaction that I did not authorize through my account. I received a notification asking if I am making the transaction, and I replied no. Since I responded no, PayPal had opened a case for me. I also had my bank block the transaction from going through, and now there is a negative balance on my account. Why was the transaction not stopped immediately I said it was not me sending the money? 

I received a case update saying that based on PayPal 's review, they found the transaction is consistent with my PayPal history. I have never sent thousands of dollars before. I do not know who the person was in my PayPal and managed to send themselves under friends and family transaction. I would like the negative balance of {$5000.00} to be removed from my account as I did not make this transaction. I requested to see the open fraud case that was opened XX/XX/year>, and did not receive it.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported an unauthorized PayPal transaction of $5,000, despite responding "no" to a verification notification. PayPal initially opened a case but later found the transaction consistent with the user's history, despite it being unusually large. The user disputes this and seeks removal of the negative balance.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is involving Copper Financial. 


I am XXXX XXXX mom ) and have an account with my XXXX daughter. We have had an account for a couple of years ; my daughter has been working and depositing paychecks lately. She had {$1500.00} in her account. I had around {$30.00} in there. 

We got an email on XX/XX/year>, that they decided to discontinue the deposit account and debit card. They said they expect the account to close the next day and will transfer money to the linked account or send an automatic check. 

I contacted their customer support check. They verified they had our right address and would receive a check in 14 days. 

We then got an email on XX/XX/year>, stating they were notified that one of their partner banks issued a freeze on account transactions and our account was affected. They said there is a delay and funds are safe. 

I went on the site today and it is a chatbot only available. It also shows a transaction from my daughter to me on XX/XX/XXXX of {$620.00}. We did not do this as we could not touch the money starting XX/XX/XXXX. 

However, this is unacceptable and my daughter needs her money to live on. 

Thanks, XXXX
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company
Narrative Summary: A consumer complaint against Copper Financial, alleging that after the company discontinued their deposit account and debit card, they failed to transfer funds as promised. An unexpected transaction of $620 was also made from the daughter's account to the mother's, despite account restrictions.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I was defrauded by unknown persons operating through the unlicensed financial brokerage platform XXXX, which solicited me to invest a substantial amount of money. All payments were made in way of crypto-transactions to wallets nominated as beneficiary wallets by the representatives of the unlicensed financial broker. Some transfers were made through my wallet hosted by www.gemini.com. I consider the beneficiary wallets to be an integral part of the fraudulent scheme behind XXXX. Based upon the understanding that www.gemini.com is acting compliant and will provide the due care towards its own walletholders, my legal representatives from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX sent a relevant request for provision of information to Gemini. Unfortunately, as of the date of this complaint, www.gemini.com has provided neither me nor my legal representatives with the requested information even though we have sent several follow-ups. By ignoring my request, www.gemini.com failed to provide the required information about the XXXXs hosting the beneficiary wallets, where I have made a series of transactions to, www.gemini.com does not refer to specific legal grounds, which justify their decision not to provide the required information. In my opinion, the lack of response from www.gemini.com represents a clear example of the mistreatment of my consumer rights as a consumer.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims they were defrauded by an unlicensed brokerage platform and made crypto-transactions through Gemini.com. They requested information about the beneficiary wallets from Gemini, but despite multiple follow-ups, Gemini failed to provide the information, allegedly violating the consumer's rights.

I have done everything you told me to do and still cant get my money.. this is XXXX ridiculous!XXXX I need my money!XXXX Its over $ XXXX its not just pocket change and when I call paypal they are so non chalant like if somebody took $ XXXX from them I bet they wouldnt be all calm like they dont give a XXXX!!!
Narrative Summary: A PayPal user is unable to withdraw over $XXXX despite being told they can. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

They told me to first get the money in terms of crypto currency but the machine closest to my location was broken. Then they had me transfer the funds through my 5/3rd account via the XXXX app XXXX I sent {$1000.00} as that was all I had. They confirmed the money was sent and disconnected the call. I then went to the actual police station as I believed I was still in trouble and in contact with actual authorities at that point where they informed me I had been scammed. I filed a police report and sent a fraud complaint to my bank. XXXX  the XXXX I got confirmation that I do not get any of my funds back.
Narrative Summary: A scammer, posing as an officer, contacted the victim claiming they missed a court date and owed a $2000 fine. The victim was instructed to transfer funds via cryptocurrency, then through their 5/3rd account via an app, ultimately losing $1000.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Through further inspection, the merchandise came not as it was advertised ( the product was tampered with ). On XX/XX/12 I requested a dispute from cashapp and was denied. I've also requested a refund from the person directly with no response. The person has also removed their listing for the product right after I've reached out to them explaining that the merchandise was already tampered with and that I'd like a refund.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024, my Moneylion account was taken over by a fraudulent criminal. Based on previous use, I would request an instant cash of {$100.00} a day and have never transferred funds to another Moneylion user. The transaction that occurred resulted in the fraudulent individual requesting {$1000.00} in instant cash and additionally requesting a XXXX XXXX  loan of an additional {$1000.00}. This would be unusual in any event, but extremely suspicious based on my normal usage. After contacting Moneylion directly, and creating a fraudulent claim, Moneylion stated the transaction was authorized by the user which is complete false. The representative who assisted me in customer service reviewed my account history going back to a year and noticed my normal usage patterns. The outcome of Moneylion 's investigation is asinine at best, and fails to protect me as a consumer of their products.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company
Narrative Summary: A Moneylion account holder claims their account was taken over by a fraudster, who made unusual transactions ($1000 instant cash and $1000 loan) that deviated from the user's normal behavior. Moneylion's investigation concluded the transactions were authorized by the user, which the account holder disputes.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On Wednesday XX/XX/XXXX, I was called by someone saying they were from Wells Fargo. They said there was suspicious activity on my checking account. This led to me being asked to make a wire transfer to help them catch the people involved. All the info they sent me was made to look like it came from Wells Fargo. I was scammed out of {$18000.00} dollars. Wells Fargo tried to put a stop to it the next day but it was too late.

Narrative Summary: A consumer was scammed out of $18,000 after receiving a call from a person claiming to be from Wells Fargo, reporting suspicious activity on their account. The scammer tricked the consumer into making a wire transfer, using fake Wells Fargo information, before the bank could intervene.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Excerpt from most recent chat : I have been patiently waiting on Cash app to " verify my identity '' since XX/XX/XXXX. I have uploaded complete sets of my id cards and pictures of myself at least XXXX  times. I have spent hours on the phone and via text with support. 

Already accomplished all of these several times, XXXX REFERENCE CASE XXXX Now, kindly complete my identity verification. 

XXXX XXXX can not tell me why they can not verify my identity. They just ask for the same steps to be completed over and over again. I comply, they do nothing, then they close my complaint. I find out they closed my case a couple weeks later when i make a follow up inquiry.
Narrative Summary: The consumer has been trying to verify their identity on Cash App since a specific date, uploading required documents and photos multiple times, but despite repeated efforts and hours of support interactions, the verification remains incomplete with no clear explanation provided by the company.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX, I was reached by individuals, acting on the behalf of and/or through the Internet-platform XXXX he individuals contacted me, explained to me and made me believe that their platform and its operator are completely licensed and qualified to trade regulated financial products and to provide financial advices for the benefit of an unlimited number of individuals. Being extremely pushy and aggressive in their approach towards me and exploiting the lack of special knowledge and skills on my side, these persons persuaded me that they are completely legitimate, which influenced also my decision to invest substantial amounts on their platform. At a later stage, my research shows that there have been published numerous warnings against said platform that clear evidence that the platform XXXX does not have a license to trade regulated financial products such as they advertise on their site. Deceiving me and promising substantial and rapid return of my investment, the unlicensed financial broker demanded from me to initiate series of payments within short period of time. I was deceived that these payments are for funding my segregated financial investment account, but no part of these transactions was ever used for financial trades. In consideration of the beneficiaries and the lack of financial brokerage license of XXXX it is impossible that the unlicensed brokers maintained segregated financial investment accounts of their clients. Therefore, we assume that all payments were laundered by the Merchant and I was put in deceit that I can really place trades and participate on regulated financial markets. For a certain period of time after an imaginary investment account, I had access to my account with XXXX After a while, my personal profile was closed without my consent, and all my attempts to get my funds back into my " investment '' account were unsuccessful. As a result of the interaction with the aggressive Merchant, I lost USD XXXX, -- ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) paid in series of transactions within a short period of time in XXXX XXXX. Part of the this amount, or USD XXXX, -- ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) were initiated through my account with WELLS FARGO. WELLS FARGO never warned me about potential risks associated with those payments. I have tried to resolve the issue with WELLS FARGO. On XXXX, a Letter of Demand claiming compensation was sent to the bank. On XXXX WELLS FARGO responded to me, but they failed to compensate me.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims they were deceived by an unlicensed online financial platform, XXXX, into investing substantial amounts under false promises of rapid returns. The platform allegedly laundered payments, and the consumer lost USD XXXX, with USD XXXX paid through their WELLS FARGO account, which failed to warn of potential risks.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a Venmo account under my infomarion that I made awhile ago and my boyfriends dad wanted to send us money for his little brothers graduation gift so my boyfriend told me to change the name on the account to his so his dad knew it was going to him. He sent {$1100.00} on XX/XX/2024 and when I tired transferring the money into my bank account I got an error saying my account was frozen. I later reached out to Venmo asking why it was deactivated and they said I violated guidelines. Ive been trying to get a hold of someone who can tell me when Im able to get the money back, if they can refund the money, and anything I need to do on my end and they keep avoiding my questions and send me the same automated message over and over again. When I call its robot and I cant get ahold of an actual employee. Im just trying to figure out when and how I can either get my money back or if they can refund it. It also said in the message they send that should the funds become available for transfer but they dont specify under what conditions they wouldnt be eligible for transfer and nobody has answered the question either.
Narrative Summary: A user's Venmo account was frozen after changing the account name to her boyfriend's, preventing her from transferring a $1,100 gift from her boyfriend's father. Venmo cited a guideline violation, but the user has been unable to get a clear explanation or assistance from the company.

Narrative Summary: The consumer paid for an item in installments through Affirm, returned the item, and the merchant refunded Affirm. However, Affirm kept the refund instead of returning it to the consumer, who has been waiting for over two months.

On Monday XX/XX/2024 I received an email from JP Morgan Chase Bank stating " We sent your wire transfer '' of USD XXXX, I called the bank on the spot to freeze my account and to inform them that it is a fraud and to stop the wire, while on the phone another wire of USD XXXX went through. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

The transaction order number is ( XXXX ), the confirmation number is ( XXXX ). Unfortunately, the money transfer was not successful, the funds were not available on the date listed ( XX/XX/2024 ) on the receipt ; the recipient was unable to retrieve the funds. Since I have an unpaid transaction I am reaching out.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Below is the synopsis that was sent to the FTC : This is an update, addition, clarification and correction to the previous submitted report. 

To begin with, I was in a stock market trading group called XXXX. XXXX is a stock market trading online instructional provider in XXXX. An individual named XXXX XXXX is/was the group leader and coordinator in XXXX. Her contact information XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ). The user ID is XXXX, channel ID is XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX this person contacted me to join in a come back community promotion for a day trading course. The individual ( hereby referred to as HER/SHE ) stated in order to join the class i would need to open an account in XXXX to use for study purposes, which I did so. I was instructed to to send the money to her partner XXXX XXXX XXXX CashApp, which I did through our personal checking account on XXXX in the amount of {$1000.00}, in total. 

During this transaction I was reluctant/suspicious, however, when CashApp verified the transaction I assumed it was legitimate due to the verification process CashApp has implemented. 

After logging back into my XXXX account I saw that she had transferred in total {$1000.00} into my XXXX which further gave me confidence in the legitimacy. 

At this point she told me that in order to start the day trading I needed to fund the account to {$5000.00}. I informed her that I did not have {$4000.00} to invest. At this point she said she would invest {$2000.00} of her own money if we could provide the other {$2000.00} to reach the total of {$5000.00}. Again the {$2000.00} 'appeared ' in the 'account ' further adding to our trust in the legitimacy. ( In hind site, we realize there was no 'account ', just coding. ) She told me that the trading class could not start until my account balance reached {$5000.00}. For the additional {$2000.00} from our side, we used a cash advance on a credit card for the balance. 

At this point, She told me to create an account in XXXX XXXX so I would be able to withdraw funds from XXXX as they came available. She 'sends {$1500.00} from CashApp XXXX XXXX XXXX. She contacted me to ask for confirmation of receipt of the {$1500.00} in XXXX XXXX. As soon as I confirm, the total {$1500.00} was withdrawn, I assume by her, and was therefore a XXXXXXXX XXXX 

At this point I go back to the XXXX site at the total funds in this 'account ' is {$9400.00}. This is a 'profit ' of {$4500.00} and a total amount deposited of {$4900.00}. I tried multiple times to withdraw differing amounts but every time the site 's message was " sorry, the minimum amount you can withdraw is {$10000.00} ''. 

At this point it became abundantly apparent that all of this was a scam, further evidenced by her completely blocking me from all messaging apps. We contacted CashApp regarding this as we assumed that CashApp would vet its users. We filed a dispute with CashApp with request for a refund, case number XXXX, however, they ultimately denied the claim. We are further pursuing CashApp for resolution, as we stated, we feel they failed to properly vet this client.
Narrative Summary: A consumer was scammed out of $4900 by a stock market trading group leader who promised a day trading course. The scammer used fake account transactions and CashApp to gain trust, then blocked the consumer after they tried to withdraw funds.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: ****FOLLOW-UP COMPLAINT TO XXXX *****NOT A DUPLICATE COMPLAINT EITHER. PLEASE RESPOND AND DO NOT CLOSE***** Once again, it seems like you are ignoring the complaint. You claim that you have read everything in depth. That is clearly not the case when youre using language like my account, indicating that I created the account and it belongs to me. I AM NOT A PAYPAL USER IN ANY WAYS. I do not have any accounts on your platform, and I dont use any similar money transfer platform either. I never provided my bank information to your company as a result. Please stop using language like that because it clearly does not depict the nature of this stiation, meaning further lies and misinformation are being expressed here. I can not believe you are saying in XX/XX/XXXX that this account presents no signs of stolen identity. Were the documents I sent you of no indication? Meaning that police reports and even your own back end team confirmed I didnt make any of these transactions, as well as create the account? If everyone is telling you something, certified parties ( including your very own even ) are going to be someone to trust in this case. It seems that when conducting your review, you conveniently chose to ignore the documents I sent to you. Furthermore, the first source of contact I had with your executive office never shared any information clarifying the nature of contact I, as XXXX, had with you. You mention that I called to add my social security number. I would never do something like that, and it is illogical to think so when I dont use PayPal or any other money transfer service. The goal here is to remove the account, not interact with it, so it doesnt make sense as to how I would call to add my SSN. I cant believe this was even sent by you. Just confirms you have no idea what youre talking about and making responses to this without considering anything that is accurately depicting the facts and nature of this situation. As far as XXXX goes, I never opened claims with you. I dont understand any of your terminology your company has at PayPal because I am not a user. Meaning I would also not open a claims, especially when you say that they are blank with no transactions. I never received any such emails from you guys either. It has been confirmed that there was unauthorized activity and account creation on this platform. You claim the opposite but dont give valid proof as to why you think it is considered as authorized. In fact, you even admitted to the fact that there is inconsistent geographical addresses used to access the account, further supporting my argument. I know I got access to this account in my location, meaning that it would be different from where the thief created and made all these transactions from. The point for you indicating that I am to provide documentation to confirm everything is XXXX. I didnt get any emails, so wrong again. Moreover, why would I ever do that if the police reports that have been sent to you directly includes that as part of review? It doesnt make sense to ask for documentation when the last thing I want to do is use PayPal ; I want to close the account because I am not a user in any way as a result. Honestly, theres way too much information here to comment on that is untruthful, and frankly, unscrupulous in what youre doing. As well as illegal where its something you can get in trouble for in assuring consumer protection, customer or not, but the opposite happens. My bank does not supersede you in any regard when on their end the merchant at question is PayPal, another type of money service. Meaning all matters have to be dealt with you, and they said they cant do anything to help. Im not sure why credit unions are suggested because they dont deal with unauthorized activity. My credit thankfully hasnt been affected by any of this ( probably because I am XXXX ). Law enforcement is already included in this with working with my police department, so once again, you have not read any information and are taking matters without considering any relevant information. You are holding funds of mine and fail to give an explanation as to why its not being refunded. Your actions were not taken in good faith, so that is false. Moreover, they are not in accordance with your XXXX. Ive been trying to reach out to your executive office since XX/XX/XXXX, but do not get any responses. Your name is shown here but no personal email address at PayPal, nor phone number, is included. Phone support is useless, and even your own back end team who verified what Im saying does not include a phone number for contact. Calling the number shown in the caller ID does not work. Obviously, Id like to speak on this more. But there is no source of contact included anywhere that works for me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims their identity was stolen and used to create a PayPal account, which was used for unauthorized transactions. Despite providing police reports and documentation, PayPal allegedly ignored the evidence and claimed the account showed no signs of stolen identity, leading to a dispute over account removal and refund.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I transferred a payment in the amount of XXXX USD from my account XXXX XXXX account company of XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, opened with XXXX. JP Morgan Chase Bank was an intermediary bank in this chain, On XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX sanctioned under the XXXX Order XXXX. Considering this, my payment must be blocked by intermediary bank according to US sanctions regulation. In order to unblock the payment, I need to apply for a specific license to OFAC However, JP Morgan Chase Bank has not still blocked the payment or has not informed originating bank about freezing measures. Thus,/ can not apply to OFACfor a license that is necessary to unblock myfunds because to do so, I must fill in some data and specifically the date when the payment was blocked. 
Chase Bank via XXXX XXXX Bank XXXX XXXX to clarify if the payment was blocked and reported to XXXX, JP Morgan Chase Bank has not responded. Thus, I can not apply to XXXX for the license required to unlock my funds.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims JP Morgan Chase Bank failed to block a payment to a sanctioned entity under US regulations. The bank's inaction prevents the consumer from applying for a license to unblock the funds, as they need to provide the date the payment was blocked, which Chase has not provided.

IMO, as result of submitting a complaint to you this week, today Venmo restricted my access further.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
A phone call from Chase fraud called me saying my funds were being wired did I try to send money to someone. I said no. He asked for my last XXXX purchases on my XXXX checking and we need to do a reversal wire before I lose all my money. I HAVE NEVER DONE A WIRE TRANSFER IN MY LIFE. Chase set it up for me to initiate. He said this would be much quicker than going to a branch or Id lose all my money. The chase XXXX department guy was XXXX XXXX. He had me do XXXX dollars to discover bank where the money was already pending wire a XXXX XXXX a fraud chase XXXX of {$50000.00} with this address XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX claiming it was XXXX doing all this for me to recover my money. 
He then had me do XXXX to XXXX. He said the funds would be held by Chase my accounts would shut down Id get new ones opened and the money would go right back. He kept insisting it was chase for XXXX hours XXXX minutes. I felt uneasy kept him on the line drove to chase and the line disconnected. Chase dragged me round and round XXXX hours with so many people NO clear answer to me. I filed with FBI and police department. XXXX devastated. I have a newborn and XXXX XXXX XXXX. No fraud alerts went off. Chase never called me nor my husband to say wait why are you emptying your account. I acted immediately. No one protected my money or me. XXXX devastated with chase for not picking this up especially when the account has been in existence for XXXX years never ever was there a wire transfer.
Narrative Summary: A Chase customer received a call from a supposed Chase fraud representative, claiming their funds were being wired and needed to be reversed. The customer was tricked into initiating a $50,000 wire transfer to a Discover Bank account, despite never having done a wire transfer before.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I requested for a XXXX transaction to be cancelled on XX/XX/2024. The XXXX transaction took place on XX/XX/2024. I was scammed into sending money to an account in exchange for concert tickets, the individual did not send the tickets and ending up taking my money. After speaking to an individual in the claims department on XX/XX/2024 ; I was told that the transaction was successfully canceled and that I would receive all of my money back by the end of the day. However, by the end of XX/XX/2024 the money was still not back in my account. I then called back and spoke to a supervisor in the claims department the following day, XX/XX/2024, who then told me that the transaction failed and I would receive all of my money back into my account in XXXX days. After having waited about a week no money was put back into my account.
