I then called back and spoke to a different supervisor in the claims department on XX/XX/2024 who then informed me that unfortunately they do not have the ability to cancel a transaction and that I was misinformed. I then spoke to the XXXX of the claims department who reiterated the fact that I was misinformed and told me there was nothing they could do. I then asked if there was any way I could be reimbursed the full amount due to the fact that I had been continuously misinformed and deceived by workers in their department, she refused and told me there was nothing that could be done.
Narrative Summary: A consumer was scammed into sending money for concert tickets that were never received. The consumer reported the issue and was initially told the transaction was cancelled and a refund would be issued, but after multiple calls and miscommunications, the company ultimately stated they couldn't cancel the transaction or provide a refund.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: the company is XXXX in that they only focused on the name of the receiver and not his bank and money they are also harsh and understanding
Narrative Summary: The consumer complained that XXXX company prioritized verifying the receiver's name over their bank details, leading to issues with the transaction. The company was also described as being harsh and un understanding in their handling of the situation.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I was contacted, via phone, by a person claiming to represent a religious charity. They asked for a donation via Western Union and I forwarded the money. I then found out they were not a real charity and it was a scam. The money has already been picked up by the scammer.
Narrative Summary: A consumer was scammed by a fake charity representative who requested a donation via Western Union. The consumer sent the money, which was then picked up by the scammer, before discovering the charity was not legitimate.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative: I received funds from my job through PayPal on Monday XX/XX/XXXX. Since that time I have not been able to use those funds because of their inability to verify my identity and even after answering their questions successfully they keep requesting more time. At first it was 72 hours and now they are asking for 48 more hours after 96 hours. I need my paycheck in order to purchase things and pay my bills and yet they can't release my funds because of their security system even though I proved that I was who I said I was.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a PayPal payment on Monday but couldn't access funds due to identity verification issues. Despite answering questions successfully, PayPal requested more time, initially 72 hours, then an additional 48 hours after 96 hours, causing delay in accessing needed paycheck funds.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative: I was not able to log into my account as the Authenticator app did not work. Reached out to Robinhood couple of times ( had to stay on the phone and wait for more than 5-6 hours every day ) and they tried all methods to fix my login issue but couldnt fix it. So I asked them to transfer the account which has XXXX cash remaining to XXXX but the transfer never went through. How can I get my money back???
Narrative Summary: A Robinhood customer's Authenticator app failed, preventing account login. After multiple 5-6 hour phone calls, the issue remained unresolved. The customer requested a transfer of their remaining balance ($XXXX) but it never went through, and they're seeking assistance to recover their funds.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: This is what happened to my husband. He met someone on XXXX who claimed herself to be a single mom doing investment in XXXX for XXXX and XXXX. And the return was 2 times. My husband went to cash advance from new opening credit cards as many as he can. And also asked his friends and family for money promising the return. The accumulated principle was {$400000.00} in total. The money was gone once one day when " she '' told him that the XXXX  crashed and " she '' even asked for more. My husband wasn't interested in anymore. He finally came to the conclusion that it was a scam. Before that, the rest of us already knew except him. But the scam was a bit tricky as " she '' returned a small amount of money when he first invested. He wired money using Wells Fargo. The bank had no way to trace the money back according to my listening and observation from him. He went to Well Fargo to claim and seek solutions. I wonder if it is true and if they are still able to refund the wire using Bank Secrecy Act or contact the other bank. Later, police in New York called him saying that they arrested someone in XXXX or XXXX that had his wire transfer information at home. There is no further news since then. I wonder if Wells Fargo can do anything about it at this point. The incident happened in 2022. And it brings a traumatic experience to me. Thank you.
Narrative Summary: A scammer on XXXX tricked the writer's husband into investing $400,000, promising a 2x return. The scammer initially returned a small amount, then claimed the investment crashed and asked for more. The husband wired the money via Wells Fargo, which couldn't be traced back.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX, I made a transfer of the total amount of XXXX COP = XXXX EUR with transaction number ID XXXX. Unfortunately, the money has not yet reached its destination due to an internal error with WorldRemit. WorldRemit informs me that they are experiencing an issue and are working on a solution, but it may take longer than expected. No one provides me with further details, and when I request cancellation, I am informed that I can not cancel it. I am left without the money and without a resolution. When I contact customer service, they ignore me, stating that they have already informed me that they are working on this issue.
Narrative Summary: A consumer made a transfer of XXXX EUR through WorldRemit on XX/XX/XXXX, but due to an internal error, the money hasn't reached its destination. Despite being informed that a solution is being worked on, the consumer is unable to cancel the transaction or get further updates.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On the XXXX XXXX we sent a wire for {$20000.00} from the US DIME bank to our XXXX XXXX. This money has since been lost despite receiving confirmation that the payment has been cleared. 

I initiated the payment using a template witch includes all the XXXX bank details. We have used this template many times and has always worked. We are unable to change any of the bank details, so this could not of been an error. 

The bank have provided me with no details of when we can expect the money back and {$20000.00} is a lot of money for a small business. 

I have tried emailing calling the deputy bank manager. hasn't responded to my email. Tried calling but the voice mail is on a loop as the bank manager is away. 

The XXXX Bank have asked for XXXX as proof of payment but they haven't provided this.
Narrative Summary: A consumer sent a $20,000 wire from US DIME bank using a trusted template, but the money was lost despite confirmation of payment clearance. The recipient bank, XXXX, has not provided details on when the money will be returned, and has requested proof of payment.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Sub-product: Money order, traveler's check or cashier's check
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a money order to pay a loan, the money order was returned by XXXX uncashed. I requested a refund online for the money order and the request was successful. Moneygram charged to get the refund within one week, this was from XX/XX/year>, it is now XXXX. I have sent multiple emails, and have submitted multiple tickets online from their website, I still have not heard back. I have called the number that their auto generated system emailed me to call, the number had no options to speak with a live person, neither did it have an option to submit any request tailored to attaining a refund that I have not already done. The refund amount is {$500.00}.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased a $500 Moneygram money order that was returned uncashed. They successfully requested a refund online, but despite multiple emails and online tickets, they haven't received the refund, which was promised within one week, and now it's been a prolonged period.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: For about a year now Ive been a member and I am enrolled in the WU Rewards program. I have yet to receive points to give me discounts as promised when I signed up. I send money to my loved ones in XXXX just about every 2 weeks so I should be compensated by now with multiple discounts that I have not received yet when sending money. I would like to have my discounts. This is misleading information when signing up if I am not receiving my discounts as promised. I would like to receive my points and use them towards my payments I send. I am owed plenty of money that I should be saving by now due to the discrepancy regarding this rewards program.
Narrative Summary: A Western Union (WU) customer claims they haven't received promised rewards points, despite frequent money transfers over the past year. They enrolled in WU Rewards, expecting discounts, but haven't received any, feeling misled by the program's promises.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024 my account received XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  in the amount of {$860000.00} at XXXX XXXX subsequently I sold XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$2800.00}, then at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2024 my account was locked for " security reasons '' as I believe was under the disguise of " planned maintenance ''. I was locked out of my account and could not log in to send a help message to the Coinbase support system and then had to direct message the support system on XXXX. The card from Coinbase was deactivated and the funds I previously received were withdrew from my account by an unknown source after my account was locked. My account was locked XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/2024, the funds XXXX XXXX XXXX  was taken from an unknown source at XXXX XXXX and the USD was taken at XXXXXXXX XXXX and no information was given as to why the funds were withdrew.
Narrative Summary: A Coinbase user's account was locked on XX/XX/2024 for "security reasons." While locked out, an unknown source withdrew $860,000 in funds that had been previously deposited. The user was unable to access their account or contact support until sending a direct message.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I used Moneygram on XX/XX/XXXX to send XXXX usd. And i git a messsage saying the money was sent with the reference number XXXX, but minutes after i got an email saying the opened a case XXXX. They lied because they said it was the receivers bank problem and i told them many times that we spoke with the branch manager ( XXXX bank ) and they are very opened to receive the money so we drove many times to the branch wasting money and time. 

Please we need our money back because we have so many things to pay for. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer sent $XXXX via Moneygram, receiving a confirmation message with a reference number. However, Moneygram later claimed the issue was with the receiver's bank, despite the consumer confirming with the bank that they were ready to receive the money, and now the consumer is seeking a refund.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
After discussing inconsistencies in previous communications with a PayPal representative, she reopened my case and sent me an email confirmation as requested. This action was essential due to varying responses from different representatives, where one would promise to reopen the case and another would deny such commitments were ever made. I was instructed to wait XXXX to XXXX days for XXXXXXXX XXXX to respond so that PayPal could proceed with the refund. 

Despite being entitled to a refund for a transaction involving an item I never received and was canceled, I faced further delays. PayPal suggested that the responsibility was now with XXXX XXXX, despite having received confirmation that the bank had closed the case in my favor. This ongoing issue reflects PayPals unclear transparency and unjustified decisions, indicating a potential disregard for consumer rights and a focus on financial gain from larger transactions. This situation raises serious concerns about PayPal 's integrity and requires a thorough review by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to ensure they adhere to proper policies for processing transactions as a financial intermediary.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported inconsistent responses from PayPal representatives regarding a refund for an item never received. Despite a reopened case and confirmation from the bank, PayPal delayed the refund, suggesting the bank was responsible, and the consumer alleged a disregard for consumer rights and prioritization of financial gain.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
A fraudster had created a fake mail id in the name of XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and sending mails to all professionals to remit the travel and accommadation charges and will give discount of XXXX XXXX and getting the money transferred to above said account. He had created mail id XXXX and says that he is XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX, The XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX. 

Later he asks us to transfer the amount to his account in Bank of America, XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX with account number XXXX. 

Once you transfer the amount that is the end. He draws the money and escapes to some other country. The Bank manager is not helping. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A scammer created a fake email ID impersonating a professional, promising discounts in exchange for travel and accommodation charges. Victims were asked to transfer funds to a Bank of America account, after which the scammer would withdraw the money and escape.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from Wells Fargo stating that they will be closing my checking and savings account by XX/XX/XXXX " because of one or more money transfers to your account reported as unauthorized. '' As the only person on the account I was not aware of any unauthorized activity so I contacted Wells Fargo assuming this could be resolved quickly. Until then, I had no access to my money and no money was allowed to leave my account, or so I was told. 

On XX/XX/XXXX a wire transfer was initiated from my checking account for {$9300.00}. I did not give consent, nor was I ever notified of this transfer. When I checked my account and saw the transfer I contacted the bank immediately and was told it was initiated from a branch in XXXX, far away from my local branch in XXXX, and that it must be identity fraud. They suggested I go to the local branch with proof of ID to sort it out. That's when things got really weird. 

The bankers I had met with before about my frozen account suddenly disappeared and the manager hid behind a locked door. I was told everyone was busy and make an appointment at another branch. This was urgent for me so I decided to wait. Eventually someone came out and dialed a phone and passed it to me - without any communication to me or the person on the phone - but somehow the person on the phone knew the issue and was very rude and accusatory. When I asked for the case number, she XXXX XXXX XXXX gave me a different number ( XXXX ) than the case number provided in my email communications with the bank ( XXXX XXXXWells Fargo claims that a wire transfer to my account on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$9500.00} was flagged as fraudulent. That account belonged to my father and I had been granted temporary guardianship, with sole control of his account, so I knew it hadn't been flagged as fraudulent. 

Unfortunately, my father passed the evening of XX/XX/XXXX and in my grief I stupidly believed Wells Fargo was speaking truthfully. I now know it was Wells Fargo that flagged my account on XX/XX/XXXX and when I went into the local branch and told them about my father passing and it was his account... they started demanded documentation they didn't really need because my father 's bank wasn't asking for the money to be returned, which I have since verified with them. 

I would greatly appreciate your help in finding out where the {$9300.00} from my account was wired to and who authorized it. I have requested this information from Wells Fargo many times and they will not provide it. They have now closed my accounts and soon I will not have access my records.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Wells Fargo customer's account was frozen due to an alleged unauthorized transfer. Despite the customer's claims of no knowledge, a $9300 wire transfer was initiated from their account without consent. The customer was met with evasive and rude responses from bank staff when seeking information about the transfer.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, Robinhood froze my account that had been open with them for around 5 years. I am unable to access the {$3100.00} in the account after I tried to transfer XXXX out of the account. Even though I had had other cryptocurrencies in this account, on this day it was frozen. They then requested that I submit a form of ID, a picture of myself with an ID, and bank statements from other accounts besides Robinhood. I asked that they close my account and send me the balance. This had not been done.
Narrative Summary: Robinhood froze a 5-year-old account with a $3,100 balance after a transfer attempt, citing a need for additional verification. Despite the request, the account remains frozen, and the user's request to close the account and return the balance has not been fulfilled.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: Tuesday XX/XX/year> I transferred by ACh {$700.00} from Cash App to my XXXX account this morning XXXX sent an email saying they rejected the ach because my cash app nick name does not match my XXXX account name. cash app insist the transaction is complete and will not return the returned funds to my account email address. It is strange how while I am steady showing them the deposit was returned all of the sudden it goes from pending to complete. This app is constantly problems and I just want my funding back and move on.
Narrative Summary: The consumer transferred $700 from Cash App to their XXXX account, but the transaction was rejected due to a mismatch in account names. Cash App claims the transaction is complete and won't return the funds, despite the consumer showing proof of the returned deposit.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Delays in the application process
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, XXXX Mortgage, which is my lender. I call to apply for refinancing with equity cash out. I to by the name of XXXX XXXX which is the mortgage consult. We did the application process, answered the questions that ask me about my race and gender. Once we went that process, he tells me that didn't meet the qualifications. I told him that my home is worth more he think and needs to appraise again. He tells me that in order to see my home is worth more that I have get an XXXX. I told that VA paise for it not me. He disagreed with me. I told him that VA paid for it before twice. He gave me his Phone and told that he was going check on and call me back. I never received a phone back. On XXXX XXXX, I can him and got another consult and told that trying to get in contact with. They said they relay the message. Never received the call back. On XX/XX/year>, I called again. They that they will relay the message. Never got a call back. I fill that when fold out that I was XXXX XXXX, he didn't want continue. I you need is call recording where i called the office.
Narrative Summary: A consumer applied for refinancing with equity cash out through XXXX Mortgage. The mortgage consultant, XXXX XXXX, claimed the consumer didn't meet qualifications, despite the consumer's insistence that their home's value was higher. The consultant refused to accept that the VA pays for appraisals, and failed to return calls.

Sub-issue: Foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: Clear Recon Corp initiated illegal nonjudicial Foreclosure against me on XX/XX/XXXX but Clear Recon Corp can not foreclose nonjudicially on a federally backed mortgage because its governed by federal law : XXXX XXXX Clear Recon Corp ( XXXX ) : A California appeals court ruled that Clear Recon Corp., as a foreclosure trustee, had no authority to conduct a nonjudicial foreclosure on a federally backed mortgage. The court found that the mortgage was governed by federal law, which preempted California 's nonjudicial foreclosure statute.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: Clear Recon Corp initiated a nonjudicial foreclosure against the complainant on a federally backed mortgage, which is governed by federal law and preempts California's nonjudicial foreclosure statute, as ruled by a California appeals court.

Sub-issue: Paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Sunday, XX/XX/2024, through the automated system, I requested a pay off for my mortgage with Bank of America. The payoff amount was good until XX/XX/XXXX for {$19000.00} Account Number On Monday, XX/XX/2024, I called the BoA contact center and said, I received my pay off letter and can I XXXX the payment, they explained XXXX was not an option, the funds needed to be certified and either a wire or mailed. I asked can I bring it into a XXXX, and the contact center representative said, yes but the check must be certified. On Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX I arrived at the XXXXXXXX XXXX Bank of America XXXX. The loan representative ( I believe XXXX XXXX was very courteous and attempted with XXXX calls to the BoA XXXX XXXX to process my payoff but since my pay off was {$9.00} more ( due to the pay off until XX/XX/XXXX ) the pay off kept rejecting. After XXXX mins, I asked is it easier for me to mail the check and he said probably. So I drove to a XXXX XXXX XXXX and paid {$30.00} some odd dollars to overnight the payment, XXXX more interest and in frustration I called the XXXX XXXX and asked why was I told to go to a Branch to pay and why wouldn't BoA accept my pay off and make me incur more interest and a fee to overnight. The representative couldn't answer the questionn and kept repeating that they are converting their systems and I could attempt another BoA branch. I said, why would XXXX XXXX around the state when I was told to go to the XXXX XXXX to make my payoff. He said the representative must not have realized the conversion occurred at the XXXX XXXX and I said, but your team not having the correct information isn't really my issue, each time the representatives options were that me, the customer, was wrong or had to be inconvenienced to pay my loan off how I was instructed. So the question comes to mind, how much more interest does BoA get by delaying pay-offs with their new converted system that won't allow a XXXX pay-off? Interest to the Bank, additional cost ( oh and the representative on Monday said, no fee if you had a BoA account to move the funds from instead of my savings bank I use ) to overnight the payment or wire it. Is this not unfair or deceptive practice? 

The pay off letter even states they have escrow they will return per the regulation - so if I overpaid my payoff they would be sending back the escrow and the extra amount would be refunded as most banks do. 

This XXXX XXXX is good to - XX/XX/2024. 

XXXX the XXXX XXXX for account number XXXX. Keep in mind, this is good to XX/XX/2024. 

How we calculated the payoff amount : Principal Balance as of XX/XX/2024 {$19000.00} Interest $ XXXX XXXX Recording Fee {$49.00} Total amount required to release XXXX As of XX/XX/2024 Total Amount Due {$19000.00} THE CURRENT ESCROW BALANCE IS {$3300.00} AND MAY NOT BE USED AS A CREDIT TOWARD PAYOFF. BANK OF AMERICA, XXXX A. AUTOMATICALLY PROCESSES ESCROW REFUNDS XXXX BUSINESS DAYS AFTER THE PAYOFF POSTS IN ORDER TO ENSURE ALL OUTSTANDING FUNDS HAVE CLEARED.
Narrative Summary: A consumer attempted to pay off their Bank of America mortgage but was told to use a certified check or wire transfer. When they tried to pay at a branch, the payment was rejected due to a $9.00 difference in the payoff amount, causing them to incur additional interest and fees.

Sub-issue: Foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: Rushmore Servicing aka Mr. Cooper aka Nationstar has continued to provide incorrect, misleading & contradicting information which has lead to them now beginning a 2nd foreclosure complaint while they continue with RESPA Violations. 1.In the XXXX Debt Validation letter reply Rushmore Servicing states that the investor is XXXX Asset Backed XXXX XXXX  XXXX. In the XXXX XXXX Foreclosure Complaint the Plaintiff names the investor is XXXX XXXX XXXX who they claim was the investor from an assignment of mortgage and was the investor in XX/XX/XXXX which clearly contradicts Rushmore Servicing reply in XXXX debt validation letter. XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX used the same exact word for word and number by number XX/XX/XXXX Foreclosure complaint as the Foreclosure complaint that was dismissed in XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX they spoke with Representative at Nationstar who has knowledge of the account yet the Servicer is Rushmore Servicing and NOT Nationstar. 5. Rushmore started this most recent XX/XX/XXXX Foreclosure complaint, while stating the incorrect account balances in question ( legal fees, maintenance, title fees, etc.. ) were still be investigated and would have answers by XX/XX/XXXX, Unless extension is needed & no foreclosure proceedings would begin before the balances were confirmed as correct/incorrect. These continued contradictions and misleading replies has caused us both financial and emotional distress due to their RESPA VIOLATIONS and need to be rectified and any foreclosure complaint to be cancelled immediately.
Narrative Summary: Rushmore Servicing (aka Mr. Cooper, Nationstar) provided contradictory information, leading to a 2nd foreclosure complaint despite ongoing RESPA violations. They claimed different investors in debt validation and foreclosure complaints, and began foreclosure proceedings before resolving disputed account balances, causing financial and emotional distress.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> attempted to login to online account but website says is does not recognize my account. I tried to reset the account but the website said I have an account already-which is true. I paid my mortgage via phone but did not get an email confirmation. 
XX/XX/year> called the number provided in voicemails asking me to call but the system will not give me an option to speak to a rep. i went through every option on and was not able to speak to rep. I emailed customer service and asked my account be unlocked and stated the issue. I revied a auto response. 
XX/XX/year> I went through the same steps as on XX/XX/year> XX/XX/year> I checked to see if my account was unlocked. It is not. I called the number but dialed XXXX first. There are different options but there is still no way to speak to a representative to discuss issues and solutions to my concerns. There is no customer service and the servicer has complete control over my communication and situation. 
The website and phone system asks you to login to your account but the servicer does not allow this. The servicer has left messages asking me to call them but will not allow me to speak to a rep. My payments are current.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's online account is locked, and they're unable to reset it or speak to a representative despite multiple attempts via phone and email. The website and phone system have contradictory instructions, and the consumer is left without a resolution, despite being current on mortgage payments.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: Please see Court filed Complaint attached, after XXXX XXXX of Mr. Cooper falsely claimed there was no error in inaccurate payment allocation.
Narrative Summary: A consumer complaint alleges Mr. Cooper falsely claimed there was no error in inaccurate payment allocation, despite the consumer's dispute. The complaint is supported by a court-filed document, suggesting a formal dispute resolution process has begun.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello. My name is XXXX XXXX. My address is XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX my phone number is XXXX and email address is XXXX. 

My XXXX  and I have a complaint about our mortgage company New Rez. In XX/XX/XXXX we received our Annual Escrow Account Disclosure Statement with Projections for the Upcoming Year. It showed our payment going up by over {$1000.00} from what we were paying - from {$1900.00} to {$2900.00}. This is mostly due to a shortage and estimated amount on our property taxes - our homeowners insurance went up a bit as well but it is mainly the property taxes. We were surprised by this as my husband is a XXXX veteran and property tax exempt in XXXX When we bought our house we filled out the exemption forms for the mortgage company and made sure they were not going to be collecting taxes for our escrow account. 

I called NewRez on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke to XXXX in Customer Service. She said they did not have any documentation that we were tax exempt and I should email the paperwork to them. She also told me someone would call to let us know what was happening with our account. I sent the documents that day. No call ever came. I called NewRez again on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke with XXXX. He said the paperwork had been received but it had then been sent to the wrong department and processed incorrectly. He resubmitted the mortgage adjustment request and said we would be contacted by someone shortly. Again, no one ever contacted us back. At this point I had no choice but to pay the grossly inflated mortgage payment of {$2900.00} for the month. It took all of our limited savings to pay this. 

I called NewRez back on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke with XXXX in the XXXX Department. He went through everything and let us know the Property Tax bill for XXXX ( XXXX work a year behind ) was not ready yet but we could call the Tax Assessor for XXXX XXXX and see what our exemption would be. We did that while on the phone with XXXX and he heard the assessors confirm that we were 100 % exempt from XXXX taxes. He said we should receive an adjusted payment soon. By XX/XX/XXXX we had not received any contact from NewRez so I called back and spoke with XXXX in the XXXX Department. He was still not able to give us an adjusted payment amount and told us that according to the XXXX XXXX we were only partially exempt. We were extremely frustrated and asked to speak to a XXXX. We spoke to XXXX in the XXXX Department and she could not help. She then transferred us to XXXX XXXX in Customer Service- she also could not help. We asked to be transferred to the XXXX XXXX Department and she said that is where she was sending us. She lied. We were actually transferred to a different XXXX in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Of course she was unable to help us either but she did get us to XXXX XXXX in Loss Mitigation. He said he did not want to start any file as he believed this situation would be resolved soon. As of today - XX/XX/XXXX - it is still not resolved nor have we heard anything from any department at NewRez. We have always had to initiate contact with them.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner, a veteran exempt from property taxes, received an annual escrow statement from NewRez showing a $1000 payment increase due to a property tax shortage. Despite providing exemption documentation, NewRez failed to adjust the payment, causing the homeowner to pay the inflated amount.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: All payments were made to company i have receipts of payments
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims to have made all payments to the company, stating they have receipts as proof, but the issue or dispute is not specified.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Loan estimate or other related disclosures
Consumer complaint narrative:
According to your ( CFPB ), a consumer should be able to get a Loan estimate three days after an application with the following information : your name, your income, your social security number ( so the lender can pull a credit report ), the property address, an estimate of the value of the property the loan amount you want to borrow. 

My Question to you ( CFPB ) is, what would define an application when I fill out a form off the lender 's website hyperlink " Apply here/now? '' Inputting the above information and anything else they require does not constitute an application. Churchill Mortgage said my actions were " an application inquiry or preapproval rather than a full application '' ( direct email quote from the XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX refer : XXXX XXXX. See XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX XXXX, 2013 ). 

Here is another lender, a direct quote from the XXXX loan XXXX : " Loan estimates are tied to property addresses and are only generated when you are actually in contract on the house and have provided the fully executed contract to the lender. To compare lenders ahead of that, a loan summary will be provided ; it discloses the same fees but is used when a loan is not locked or in contract yet. Some lenders also call this a cost or fee sheet. ''
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims lenders are not providing Loan Estimates as required by the CFPB. The issue arises when filling out online application forms, with lenders claiming it's an "inquiry" or "preapproval" rather than a full application, thus not triggering the required Loan Estimate.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
Mountain America credit union has counted 6 lates on my HELOC. 5 are not lates and I had the amounts paid. I have been current the whole time and they refuse to acknowledge on notes or with a letter that it is not late even though on the phone they explicitly tell me I am caught up and do not owe anymore. 
I have sent in disputes and screen shots. they have been horrible to work with I asked for information and call back and they ignored me and would not return any calls.

I got ahold of a manager who clearly stated I was not late for XXXX however to credit bear is showing I am late bu they say I am not and I was not late t ll. this was for XX/XX/XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX
Narrative Summary: Mountain America Credit Union incorrectly counted 6 late payments on the consumer's HELOC, despite 5 payments being made on time. The credit union acknowledges the error on phone calls but refuses to provide written confirmation, ignoring the consumer's disputes and requests for information.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been round and round with this processing company in regards to them being ill equipped to manage our mortgage in regards to our hazard insurance policies. We have carried the maximum amount of flood insurance on our house since we purchased the house in XXXX. We have never faulted on it. In fact we carry a secondary flood policy on our detttached garage and that is where their system could not handle it. We got numerous letters from FirstBank saying they were going to put Forced Hazard insurance on our loan, because their system kept only showing the secondary policy. I would speak with numerous " managers '' supposedly who claimed to have this canceled, but yet I discover a " forced hazard '' payment was taken out of our account on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$950.00} and it was never refunded to our escrow account. 
I spoke with " XXXX '' yesterday who was telling me her system shows it was refunded, I requested this proof because it did not show it in my Transactions Details page. She asked if I wanted it nailed mailed or emailed, I said emailed today. She then stated it would be a few days before that could happen. Why would it take a few days to take a screenshot to proof this was refunded?

I am really tired of dealing with this company and them forever making BIG mistakes with our loan and escrow.

We are only one family that has caught the numbers mistakes. I am sure they have done this to many others.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A mortgage processing company incorrectly applied forced hazard insurance to a customer's loan due to its system's inability to handle a secondary flood policy. Despite assurances from "managers" that the issue was resolved, the customer was charged $950, which was allegedly refunded but not reflected in their account.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Email Address : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Complaint Regarding Gregory Funding and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally file a complaint with CFPB concerning my recent interactions with Gregory Funding and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX hereinafter referred to as " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ). 

Background : I am the homeowner of the property located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I finalized a refinance process through XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which resulted in the final payment of {$520000.00} being made to XXXX, thereby fully settling the mortgage loan on my property. The lien was subsequently released to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and the mortgage loan was transferred to XXXX, who is the current and sole lienholder. 

Issue and Impact on Me : Despite having provided evidence of loan settlement and the lien release, I have been subjected to a series of unprofessional and potentially misleading communications from the XXXX XXXX XXXX and Gregory Funding. Notably, there was an attempt to collect an additional debt of {$34000.00}, which was added to the loan post-settlement and without clear origin or justification. 
Recently this has led to a pending foreclosure case initiated by Gregory Funding, causing immense stress and uncertainty about the future of my home and financial stability. 

The impact on me has been profound, causing undue XXXX  and threatening the very foundation of my financial security and peace of mind. The possibility of losing my home is a source of great concern, as it would not only displace my family but also significantly damage my credit rating and overall financial health. 

Complaint : 1. Miscommunication and Overlooked Evidence : Despite providing proof of payment, there has been a failure to acknowledge this evidence, leading to continued attempts to collect additional funds.

2. Unprofessional Conduct : The handling of my case has been fraught with unprofessional interactions and a lack of attention to detail, as evidenced by the correspondence provided. 
XXXX. Incorrect Correspondence : I have received letters not intended for me, indicating a lack of proper record-keeping and communication protocols. 

Action Requested : I request that the CFPB conduct a thorough investigation into the actions of Gregory Funding and the XXXX XXXX XXXX. I seek your assistance in ensuring that my mortgage loan records are accurate and that no further attempts to collect on this already settled debt are made. Furthermore, I request your support in resolving the pending foreclosure case and preventing any further harm to my financial and emotional well-being. 

Enclosed for your reference are the following documents : 1. Final borrower statement from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX. XXXX statement reflecting the payment to XXXX. 
XXXX. XXXX release document from XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX. Confirmation of the mortgage loan transfer to XXXX. 
XXXX. Correspondence with Gregory Funding and the XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and trust that the XXXX will take the necessary steps to address my concerns and provide relief from this distressing situation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX : Final borrower statement from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX statement as of XXXX XXXX XXXX document from XXXX XXXX Confirmation of the mortgage loan transfer to XXXX XXXX with Gregory Funding and the XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A homeowner alleges Gregory Funding and XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect an additional $34,000 on a mortgage loan that was already settled and paid in full ($520,000). This led to a pending foreclosure case, despite the homeowner providing evidence of loan settlement and lien release.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: Mortgage payment for XX/XX/2024 was made and deducted from our bank account. Carrington Mortgage sent us a late notice for our XXXX payment and stated they did not receive it. We provided proof from our bank that it was made by ACH and that it cleared our account on XX/XX/2024. After numerous talks and providing proof of payment Carrington still said they did not receive it and then proceeded to mark us late on paying and have since ruined our credit. The payment was made and as of this date, Carrington still says they do not have the XXXX payment. {$1400.00} of our money is at their office yet they still say they can not find it.
Narrative Summary: Carrington Mortgage sent a late notice for a mortgage payment despite receiving proof from the consumer's bank that the payment was made via ACH on time. The payment ($1400) was deducted from the account, but Carrington claims it was never received, damaging the consumer's credit.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
Please see the full details in the attached letter. 

Nationstar /Mr. Cooper was sending the invoice to the incorrect address and made no other attempts to contact me or leave a message. 

They have not responded to my requests to remove the single blemish from my otherwise perfect credit report.
Narrative Summary: Nationstar/Mr. Cooper sent invoices to the wrong address, failing to contact the consumer otherwise. Despite requests, they haven't removed a resulting credit report blemish, affecting the consumer's otherwise perfect credit history.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Arvest Mortgage purchased my home mortgage XXXX or 12 years ago. During that period, I was never late with my payment, never missed a payment, and always paid more than the minimum amount due. In XXXX of XXXX and XXXX of XXXX, I twice requested a payoff amount thru their phone tree system and never received a response. Twice, I paid off the balance due ( which is not the payoff amount ) of the loan and then Arvest quit sending me a statement. XXXX months later, Arvest sent me a late payment notice and reported this to the credit reporting system. I have written to Arvest asking them to remove that late payment from my account based on a pristine history. That was denied. XXXX times I have requested the payoff statements asked for thru their phone tree system and the XXXX late payment statements. None of which they have provided for me. 

The manner is which my requests have been handled indicate some kind of cover-up is happening. I would be very surprised if you do not have similar complaints against Arvest.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims Arvest Mortgage mishandled their payoff requests and reported a late payment despite a 12-year perfect payment history. They requested the payoff amount multiple times but received no response, and Arvest denied removing the late payment from their account.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: I had fallen behind on my mortgage payment due to a decrease in my monthly income. In order to prevent a foreclosure, I initially requested a loan modification with my lender, Carrington. However, due to the pandemic the loan fell back into default. Therefore, I decided to sell my property. I hired a real estate company and gave them 3rd party authorization to my mortgage account. They submitted an application for a short sale on my behalf in XXXX XXXX XXXX. Carrington contacted my representative indicating the offer for short sale had been denied, because websites like XXXX and XXXX indicated my home was worth nearly double the purchase contract offer. They also said my home was a 3-family. My real estate representative explained that my home was a 2-family. I provided the Certificate of Occupancy registered with the city. Carrington was also told that comparing my 2-family home with online resources of 3-family homes is inflating the value of my home. Additionally, it is not a legitimate way to evaluate the current condition of my home, which requires a physical inspection by an independent licensed professional. Afterwards, my real estate representative was contacted by individuals that purported themselves to be associated with Carrington and were asking questions regarding my loss mitigation application. They claimed to be from a company named XXXX XXXX. My real estate representative was concerned since this company was unknown to me as an entity associated with my mortgage loan. I thought they might have been fraudsters trying to gain access to my account information. However, Carrington stated XXXX XXXX is an authorized vendor and they had released my loss mitigation information to them without my knowledge. Carrington also stated, XXXX XXXX had the right to approve or deny any Short Sale offer and would make all final decisions. This was a surprise since I do not have a loan with them, had not authorized the release of my personal information to XXXX XXXX and was unclear regarding their role and why I would need their permission to evaluate my loss mitigation options. As time persisted XXXX XXXX only presented the option for a Deed in Lieu. They indicated a Deed in Lieu would give me compensation for relocating. Although I had never requested compensation for relocation, they used this offer to continually coerce me to accept a Deed in Lieu as my only choice for loss mitigation with Carrington. I rejected the Deed in Lieu option and asked to continue to be considered for all loss mitigation options, which XXXX XXXX refused to do. Additionally, XXXX XXXX asked to be allowed to come inside my property. I agreed as long as an independent non-affiliated professional came to evaluate my home. They refused to send a person other than someone from their own company to evaluate the value of my property. After some research, I discovered XXXX XXXX is actually a real estate company that employs agents who work for XXXX XXXX XXXX. I believe XXXX XXXX was acting on their own behalf to try and obtain my property so they could eventually sell it themselves. They had no desire to resolve my foreclosure or engage in my loss mitigation options. This creates a major conflict of interest since they are claiming to evaluate my personal loss mitigation options. XXXX XXXX  intentions are disingenuous to me as a homeowner. They stopped evaluating me for all loss mitigation options. They tried to gain access to my property under ill means when their goal is merely self-serving as opposed to resolving my foreclosure in an amicable and fair manner.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner's short sale application was denied by lender Carrington due to an inflated home value from online sources. Carrington then released the homeowner's information to vendor XXXX XXXX, which only offered a Deed in Lieu option, sparking concerns of a conflict of interest and self-serving motives.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: I previously submitted a complaint regarding my mortgage from Fifth Third Bank that was sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX. My problem is still not resolved. My mortgage was sold to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I made a payment to Fifth Third that was processed on XX/XX/XXXX. This payment of {$8000.00} was never applied to my principal balance. Fifth Third reported and closed my case stating they provided XXXX a wire transfer on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX has closed the case stating Fifth Third had already applied the balance prior to sending the mortgage to them. Please see the following documents. My principal balance on XX/XX/XXXX was XXXX with Fifth Third. My starting principal balance with XXXX was XXXX. So who really had the {$8000.00}. Both parties have in the past verbally communicated the " we found the money ''. But it was never applied to my balance. Now both parties are blaming each other essentially and I as a consumer am stuck in the middle of their lies. How can they not track where the money went or track incorrectly where the money went? This was not a cash transaction. I am very disappointed that they have been manipulating the situation for months and even after a complaint, both parties are not owning to what happened and their stories do not match. Please help me get my {$8000.00} back.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's $8,000 mortgage payment was not applied to their principal balance after Fifth Third Bank sold the mortgage to XXXX. Both companies claim the other applied the payment, but the consumer's balance doesn't reflect it, leaving them stuck in the middle of the conflicting claims.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the loan closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
Regarding the eligibility, we sent the closing statement from the seller to show they paid the VA funding fee on the assumption to VA but that didnt seem to help, we heard back from VA today, the letter received is attached. It appears the only way to get this resolved will be for Planet to contact VA to make sure they have the information they need. It looks like the assumption agreement may not have been done correctly as it released the liability but did not transfer entitlement to the new owner but Im not completely sure. I dont seem to get anywhere when contacting Planet as they wont talk to me about the loan. My suggestion is to try and contact management at Planet to push them to contact VA to get it resolved.

Resolution notes : This file should be a XXXX not an assumption. This all falls back on planet home lending. They have not filed the correct assumption. They have yet to process the funding fee. I have reached out to them with no response.to this point. We as VA can not move forward until the funding fee has been processed. It might help if your client can try to attempt to reach out to his contact at planet home lending... 

This is the first I have heard that the assumption document was not correct, earlier they said they received information from Planet but now they are saying they have not. 
When they say XXXX that means Substitution of Entitlement, which means the person that assumed your loan replaces your VA entitlement attached to the property with theirs which frees yours up to be used again. It sounds like the assumption should have stated Assumption with Substitution of Entitlement instead of Assumption with Release of Liability. I dont have access to the buyers closing statement to see if they were charged a funding fee which on assumptions the person assuming has to pay a .5 % funding fee unless they are exempt due to a XXXX and I also dont have a way to find out if he was exempt without seeing his certificate of eligibility. We may be able to contact the current owner to see if he will cooperate with trying to get this fixed as he may be able to help contact Planet as well, do you know the person that assumed your loan? 

We have reached out to Planet and the VA has multiple times As a veteran this is crazy to me that i am dealing with this going on 2 years now ... ... they also were reporting the loan against my credit report .... this has made it very difficult for me each time i apply for something i have to show that i have paid it off ... ..PLEASE HELP
Narrative Summary: The consumer's VA loan assumption was not processed correctly by Planet Home Lending, resulting in the VA not receiving the necessary information and funding fee. The incorrect assumption document released liability but did not transfer entitlement, causing a 2-year delay and credit reporting issues.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative: I called Carrington Mortgage on XX/XX/24 because I received my next month 's mortgage statement with a increase of {$300.00}. I asked what was the increase for. I was told for a wind and hail policy through Louisiana Citizens. I told them that I applied for insurance with that company in XXXX of XXXXI asked why are they just including this? No one could answer. I then contacted my insurance agent whom I applied for this policy with XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  agent XXXX XXXX XXXX I spoke with XXXX and she said this policy was canceled due to non payment. Meaning Carrington Mortgage never paid on the policy but they have added policy charges to my mortgage payment. I've spoken to so many people in the insurance department of Carrington but no one is trying to help. I purchased a policy out of pocket to have my home insured. I'm try to get them to reverse the charges and late fees and get my mortgage payment back to normal without the canceled insurance policy charges. I have called, emailed and written letters to them and they're still charging me for this non existent policy.
Narrative Summary: Carrington Mortgage added a $300 wind and hail policy to the complainant's mortgage without their knowledge. The policy was actually canceled due to non-payment by Carrington, yet they continue to charge the complainant for it, despite multiple attempts to resolve the issue.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX, which did not protect my data, and has still not provided full details on what information was stolen and why my information was on a server that could be accessed sent a letter in XXXX that then " gave '' me Identity Protection and said it was available to sign-up but when I tried to sign up the system says that it has expired, even though it was within the 90 days of their XXXX letter. Note it has taken me some time to reach out to file this complaint due to other commitments. As in my previous complaints against this company they have refused to provide information on the details of the breach or to provide lifetime protection for their negligence. In addition they say they offered identity protection but in reality their " alleged '' offer is not true as I can not even login with the information that they have provided. At this time the company has released my information, unlawfully, even though I am not a client of theirs currently, I didn't choose to be a client of theirs and when I stopped being a client I requested that they remove my information from their systems. They say they offered a short-term time of credit monitoring yet when I tried to use it, it was not valid. I would hereby request that I be provided with lifetime credit monitoring since I could be subject to a lifetime of issues due to their negligence through no fault of my own. They have also lied to the CFPB about their offering credit protection services to me.
Narrative Summary: A company failed to protect the consumer's data and offered 90-day identity protection, but when the consumer tried to sign up, the system said it had expired. The company refused to provide breach details and lifetime protection, despite the consumer's previous requests.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have financed my home since XX/XX/year>. I shifted through XXXX other mortgage companies before Freedom Mortgage Corporation. 

I am concerned about Freedom Mortgage licensing to collect mortgages in the state of XXXX and would like to check on this. 

I have been unable to pay my mortgage for close to 3 years due to domestic XXXX and XXXX. I am concerned about third-party intrusions into my lending and potential biases and conflicts of interest. Up to XXXX months ago, I would have found my account to have had a positive Escrow balance not having made any payments for XXXX years I have also suffered severe XXXX XXXX  in my community which is also experienced in the handling of my mortgage. 

I worry about identity theft and potential blackmail if not other more serious foul-play given the extensive threats that I receive daily. 

I have also noticed that the XXXX of XXXX has become increasingly involved in listing my housing information with grossly miscalculated factors. How do I have all lthis investigated?
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A homeowner financed through Freedom Mortgage Corporation raises concerns about the company's licensing to collect mortgages in their state and potential third-party intrusions, conflicts of interest, and identity theft due to three years of unpaid mortgage payments and unexplained changes in their account.

Sub-issue: Paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year> I have paid off my loan to loancare closing on the sale of the property. 2 checks were made out to Loancare ; # XXXX XXXX and # XXXX XXXX for a total amount of XXXX as per the payoff statement. These payments were suppose to cover 2 principals. The first was for loancare at the amount of XXXX. The second was for HUD XXXX with XXXX added with fees of XXXX. 
It appears Loancare did not pay HUD their amount and not a year later that amount XXXX is now part of debt collections with Department of Treasury. This has messed up my credit, and also debt is probably reaching more than XXXX with added daily interest. I have been contacting Loancare but they keep saying they are researching. This has a significant detrimental impact on me for something the Loancare should have paid off as they had the funds.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid off a loan to Loancare with two checks covering two principals, including a HUD amount with fees. However, Loancare allegedly failed to pay HUD, resulting in the debt being sent to collections and damaging the consumer's credit.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: This is in regards to the Wells Fargo victim relief fund for not allowing a mortgage modification. Needing to verify the amount of my claim. Wells Fargo sent {$200.00} check but said they are still researching if they owe me more money, which I believe they do.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer received a $200 check from Wells Fargo's victim relief fund, but claims the bank is still researching if they owe more. The consumer disputes the amount and seeks verification of their claim, believing they are entitled to additional compensation.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I would like to draw attention to the lies and misinformation that Shellpoint provides on numerous occasions. Please see the attached response from them. Some things of note : 1 ) Their timeline does not include all the details of pour interactions nor the interactions between the XXXX XXXX and Shellpoint where all the documentation and backup was provided. 

XXXX ) Shellpoint talks about losing payment through XXXX. These are their words and they are inaccurate. First, we paid by check, which they lost, yet we provided the cleared check with he stamp from their proven account. These are facts. 

XXXX XXXX Shellpoint has lost payment through TWO mechanisms. Online XXXX XXXX AND check. This is not a coincidence. 

XXXX ) XXXX XXXX from Shellpoint said our bank statements with personal information redacted was fine in writing. Now they are trying to say we didn't send them. This too is a lie on multiple fronts. We made XXXX XXXX aware in writing they had lost our information before and he said it was fine. If he had another ask, he never asked it. Further, these statements were provided by XXXX XXXX from XXXX to Shellpoint as confirmed by XXXX. So again, this is a lie. Finally, we said we're happy to send the full statements YET AGAIN, however, we want them sent to an executive, by name who has top personally sign for them. Not a low-level person or a general inbox, but an executive. I want them to personally sign given all the personal information they lost. 

XXXX ) they claim we haven't provided proof of payment but we did send the check and the statements showing the funds leaving and not coming back. We expect the check payment reversed. It's clearly stamped with the Shellpoint account.

6 ) We have asked MANY times now of XXXX that we want to be sent THEIR wires testaments for amounts on those dates. That keeps getting refused. Their letter says I have a right to " request documentation ''. I am exercising that right and they refuse. Show me all wires, from XXXX, on those dates for those amounts. If any come from XXXX on the XXXX XXXX, Shellpoint is either lying or made a massive mistake and are covering it up. It's simple, show we the XXXX wire logs.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges Shellpoint provided false information and lost payments made through check and online. They claim to have provided proof of payment, including a cleared check and bank statements, but Shellpoint denies receiving them, prompting the consumer to request documentation of Shellpoint's wire transactions.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received the first annual mortgage escrow account statement on XX/XX/XXXX of this year indicating that starting XXXX first, my payments will increase by 32 % due to insurance cost and estate taxes and a shortage of {$11000.00}. The company states that that amount will be divided by 12 and added to the monthly mortgage payments. Additionally, based on what they expect to pay in the next year, the escrow portion of the monthly mortgage payment will be {$1800.00}. 
So my monthly payment will increase by 32 %. This is outrageous since I have a fixed rate of 4 %. 
My complaints are as follow : 1.-never had a composite analysis since inception of the mortgage in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Never had one for XXXX or XXXX. 
2.- never had a escrow account analysis before seeking repayment of deficiencies, such as amount of dollars at the beginning of the year 3.-they paid {$22000.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX when at that time my taxes declined to {$15000.00} after I appeared in fron of the taxation board. 
4.- I requested too discontinue the escrow account since I paid 20 % of the sale price of the house and since purchase it increased in value, the account is more than one year old and I had no late payments I submitted the above to the company FITH THIRD BANK , they called me and I requested a written response from them since a verbal one will not satisfy me. Weeks have gone by and I do not get a written response.
Narrative Summary: The consumer received a mortgage escrow statement showing a 32% payment increase due to insurance and tax costs, with a $11,000 shortage to be divided over 12 months. The consumer disputes this, citing lack of prior escrow analyses, overpayment of taxes, and requesting escrow account discontinuation.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Fees or costs during the application process
Consumer complaint narrative: We applied for a mortgage loan with Triad Financial Services Inc., XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX, ( XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX # XXXX in XXXX of this year. We received the pre approval in XX/XX/year>. It was taken out for a land home package with a local mobile home dealer. Per the lenders requirements the land we placed an offer on had to pass a perc test and survey. Once completed the lender orders the appraisal to which we had to pay out of pocket XXXX $ to the lender. Appraisal came through good, we were moving towards closing and working with a title company. However the dealer we chose was violating RESPA laws in regard to the title company we requested to move both dealer and title companies. This entailed us having to reapply for the loan. XXXX XXXX worked directly with myself, my realtor, the dealer and title company on order to meet closing date of XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year> XXXX contacted use and stated that the original underwriter made a mistake and based off the fact that the second applicants job was held only a year, we should have been disqualified. That they are no longer able to process the loan as Triad would incur a loss because they would not be able to sell it to another servicer. We were falsely led to believe that we were qualified and the lender had us pay XXXX $ in appraisal fees, on top of the XXXX dollars paid the the first dealer for the required perc tests and survey. We have asked both XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX the regional manager who is going to reimburse us for the loss we incurred due to them falsely leading us to believe we had the loan therefore resulting in money invested into property we will lose the contract on based on Triads negligence.
Company public response: Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Triad Financial Services Inc. falsely led them to believe they qualified for a mortgage loan, despite an underwriter's mistake. The consumer paid $XXXX for appraisal fees and other costs, only to be told the loan couldn't be processed due to the second applicant's job history.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I currently have an open HELOC through XXXX. On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a request for a withdrawal of funds from the HELOC and the website stated that it would take 2-3 business days to receive the funds in my account. On XX/XX/year>, I contacted customer support ( through email only as they do not have a phone number ) as I did not receive funds. I received a reply back ( the same day ) that the designated team was looking into the delay. On XX/XX/year>, I contacted them again as the funds were not in my account and I received a response that it was being investigated with no further explanation. On XX/XX/year>, I did not receive the funds or an email response so I reached out to the company via XXXX XXXX. I received a reply back stating I would receive the funds on XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year> I sent another follow up email and a XXXX XXXX message as I did not hear back regarding the delay and funds were still not received. On XX/XX/year>, funds were received but I did not receive an explanation for the delay.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: A consumer submitted a withdrawal request from their HELOC on a specific date, expecting 2-3 business day processing. However, the funds took over a week to arrive, with multiple follow-up emails and messages sent to the company, and no clear explanation for the delay was provided.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX ) I have been attempting to recast my loan for two months. 
Around XX/XX/XXXX, I called NewRez, the servicer my loan was sold to, and received inadequate information. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted my mortgage broker, who reached out to their NewRez contact. My mortgage broker was able to provide me with this information on the recast : Newrez Recast Requirements The mortgage recast process allows a customer to make a lump sum payment on the unpaid principal balance to reduce the monthly mortgage payment. 

Below you can learn more on the recast process! 


Eligibility The following loan products are not eligible for a recast : Federal Housing Administration ( FHA ) Loans Veterans Affairs ( VA ) Loans Government National Mortgage Association ( GNMA ) Loans Bond Loans Jumbo Loans Requirements The recast fee is {$250.00} and will be subject to state guidelines. 

The fee must be paid upfront. 

The required curtailment is {$5000.00}. 

The loan must be current. 

Recast may not commence within 60 days of origination.

Recast must be requested within 60 days of the principal reduction.

Recast requests are limited to one per 12 months.

Signed recast agreement by the customer.

Process 1. Contact Newrez Customer Service at XXXX to request the mortgage recast. 

XXXX. The loan will be reviewed for eligibility. Once eligibility is confirmed, a Recast letter outlining the process and a Recast authorization form are mailed to the customer. 

XXXX. A principal reduction payment of {$5000.00} or greater must be made. 

a. This can be made via bank wire, by check, or through Newrez 's website. Please see below for additional payment instructions. 

XXXX. The fee is {$250.00} and will be subject to state guidelines. The fee must be paid upfront. 

Once Newrez has received the signed Recast authorization form, the principal reduction payment, and the {$250.00} Recast fee payment, the new principal and interest payment will be finalized, and a confirmation letter will be sent to the customer. 

According to my mortgage broker 's NewRez contact, NewRez had my contact information, my mortgage information, my eligibility, and was going to issue me a letter per the process described above. I received this information on XX/XX/XXXX. I never received further contact from NewRez. 

On XX/XX/XXXX or XXXX, I called NewRez again. Each of these phone calls take XXXX minutes due to hold time, navigating to get a live person, etc. 
On XX/XX/XXXX or XXXX, the NewRez representative gave me inaccurate inforamation. 
They told me to just make a payment over the phone, and it would be taken care of. 
They did not check my eligibility, they did not provide anything that would lead me to believe the payment wouldn't just be counted against principal. So I did not make a payment, but asked them to issue me the recast letter per their written instructions that had been provided to my mortgage broker. It is now XX/XX/XXXX, I am two months in, and have no information from NewRez to move forward on recasting my loan. 

XXXX ) On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from NewRez indicating a dramatic increase in escrow payments due to homeowner insurance rate increases. I called my insurance broker, and then attempted to call NewRez on several occassions because the information they sent to me didn't make sense : They were suggesting I make an annual payment spaced out over 48 months. That doesn't make sense to me, because insurance payments are annual, next year there will be another high annual payment. 
When I called, the NewRez rep on the phone could not answer my questions. 
I reached out over email. I conveyed this request for information to NewRez on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I reached out again via email on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. I never got through to the rep, and really just want to know how an annual payment can be spread over 4 years.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer is having trouble recasting their loan with NewRez, despite meeting eligibility requirements. After two months, they have not received the necessary recast letter or accurate information from NewRez representatives, causing delays and frustration.

Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Ameris Bank regarding their reporting of my account accurately. They reported that I was 30 days past due when I was not. I am currently in temporary modification until XX/XX/year>. After XXXX, my regular payments will be {$1600.00}, the temporary modification payment. When reporting that I am late, they say I'm 30 days late and am not behind on {$2100.00}, which is accurate. My original monthly payment is {$2000.00}, not {$2100.00}. I paid my modified payment of {$1600.00}. In XXXX, when I called, they performed a credit dispute, and it fixed the error. I called on XX/XX/year>, with the same issue, and the rep refused to perform a credit dispute and told me to email XXXX, their research team, so they can research it and fix it. I kept getting error messages when I emailed, and my email was not going through. All reps have advised me they are legal to provide information when I say it is inaccurate. Their response is we are legally supposed to report, and I respond with yeah, accurate info, they its accurate when its no. I have attached a copy of the emails that bounced back, the XXXX report showing the inaccurate reporting & showing the accurate monthly payment not in the payment plan. Loan number is XXXX
Narrative Summary: Ameris Bank inaccurately reported the consumer as 30 days past due, despite being in a temporary modification plan. The bank incorrectly listed the original monthly payment as $2100, instead of $2000, and refused to perform a credit dispute to correct the error.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: My mortgage was transferred to Mr Cooper in XXXX and I mailed a check for my mortgage payment to Mr Cooper as requested and it cleared my bank on XX/XX/year>. I called the bank on XX/XX/XXXX because my payment had not been posted to my account and was showing still due. It has still not been posted as of XXXX. On XX/XX/year> Mr Cooper made an unauthorized withdrawal from my checking account in the amount of {$240.00}. My mortgage was sold to this company and they are still allowed to be in business even after they have taken millions of unauthorized payments from customers! I dont want to do business with them and the first month they are taking money out of my account that is not owed them in any way. They have been sued in class action lawsuits for this very thing and they are still continuing to take money they arent entitled to!
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims Mr. Cooper made an unauthorized withdrawal of $240 from their checking account after their mortgage was transferred. They had previously mailed a payment that cleared their bank but was not posted to their account, leading to the alleged unauthorized withdrawal.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX payment was received by LoanDepot on XX/XX/XXXX. LoanDepot misapplied the funds to principal only, none to interest, thereby resulting in a " late payment '' notice being sent to me. Upon call to LoanDepot, found out about the misapplication and LoanDepot stated they would correct the payment but it would take several days to fix. Ordered a payoff statement on XX/XX/XXXX and the payment for XXXX was still not showing as received by Lender. This is resulting in the payoff incorrectly calculating the interest owed to payoff the account. Please note, payment was made through the LoanDepot customer portal, and would have been impossible to set up without paying the interest first, then adding the additional amount to go to principal. The interest portion of the monthly payment is hard coded into the payment fields. This is 100 % a LoanDepot error and it is still not resolved, a month later. I am being overcharged interest because LoanDepot 's system is not recognizing that the XX/XX/XXXX interest payment was received on XX/XX/XXXX.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims LoanDepot misapplied a payment, applying it only to principal and not interest, resulting in a late payment notice. Despite acknowledging the error, LoanDepot has not corrected it, causing incorrect interest calculations in the payoff statement, overcharging the consumer a month later.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: Primary Residential Mortgage Inc. has a policy if for some reason a payment does not go through as was in my case where there is an automatic payment setup and sometimes the check can bounce even for {$1.00} for which I take a full responsibility for. However, in this case they have a policy when that happens, I have to go on 6 months certified payment method, where I have to physically get a certified check pay a fee for and then mail it which is usually certified mail and adds upwards to {$25.00} in fee per check per month for the duration of 6 months. Now the understanding and communication I received at the time was you need to send us 6 certified check for 6 months starting in XXXX as they wouldn't take a regular bank check.
