I sent them total of 6 certified checks since XXXX however when I called today and asked if I can pay over the phone for XXXX mortgage, thinking that I complied with their policy by sending 6 certified checks for 6 months I was notified that the lock was in place until XXXX, which means that I have to send additional 2 months of certified checks. I found that misleading and manipulative, as the XXXX of the month is the cutoff for late fees, but the fact that I have to go physically in a branch pay the fee get the check and then go to the post office pay another fee in order to mail the check. I did my repentance and for them to extended as they see it fit is not fair, it feels like the goal post moves constantly and communication is not clear. They can have all the policies they want under thXXXX XXXX XXXX if they ask for 6 months 6 certified checks, that should put me back in black, I really don't understand why are they making things so difficult when it comes to payment, if a consumer wants to pay, take the money stop finding ways and excuses which makes things more complicated than they should be, especially when we live in a world of digital instant money transfers. Thank you
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Primary Residential Mortgage Inc. misled them about their certified payment policy. After sending 6 certified checks as instructed, they were told they needed to send 2 more months' worth, despite believing they had fulfilled the 6-month requirement, resulting in additional fees and inconvenience.

This occurred even after complying with their request to provide the Homeowners Policy Declaration page. The declaration page was provided via email on XX/XX/year> to the email they provided by them ( XXXX ) and again on XX/XX/year> via text with a photo of the declaration pages. Attached please find a photo of the declaration page and original cover letter sent to Santander. The cover letter shows the email address, date and completion of the transmission on XX/XX/year>. It also shows my notes capturing the second attempt to submit the documentation via text. The second attempt was on XX/XX/year>.

Narrative Summary: Santander failed to process the homeowner's insurance declaration page, causing the policy to lapse despite the consumer providing the document via email and text, as requested by the bank.

Sub-issue: Applying for or obtaining a modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or deed-in-lieu
Consumer complaint narrative: My husband died XXXX. I asked that my mortgage be modified with a more manageable payment due to my altered circumstances. I thought they did as my new payment was just over {$1500.00}. Pennymac indicated that I wasn't paying enough and began threatening foreclosure. Hardship led me to appeal for loan modification but Pennymac has become aggressive now. I have been paying a little over {$1500.00} faithfully and on time. They have apparently indicated some default to the credit companies that has led to hardship. I had a car accident and had to get another car when mine was totaled. I ran into a low credit rating due to Pennymac 's action.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint is about Pennymac's handling of her mortgage after her husband's death. Despite agreeing to a modified payment of over $1500, Pennymac claimed she wasn't paying enough, threatened foreclosure, and reported a default to credit companies, damaging her credit rating.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX my mortgage company add an escrow account to my mortgage. I made XXXX large payments, in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX for a total {$14000.00} stating that they should be applied to the escrow account and thinking that would cover it for the remainder of the year. No one I have spoken to will acknowledge the payments I have made. 

In addition, after I had paid my property taxes in XXXX of XXXX they sent a duplicate payment in XXXX. XXXX XXXX noted the double payment and issued a refund on XX/XX/XXXX, but the check was lost by the Morgage company. Currently the company claims I am {$32000.00} behind. They have served me with a notice of foreclosure. 
Since XXXX of XXXX I have made ; XXXX payments of {$1700.00} ( total {$32000.00} ), XXXX advanced escrow payments total of {$14000.00}, and a property tax payment of {$6700.00}. All together totaling {$54000.00}, yet they still claim I am deficient.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
We have had this same complaint before. Now we see that they have applied another fee billed to mortgager. We called and asked what the fee is for ( {$240.00} ) and again they said it was legal fees. However, they stated that we have to wait 30 days for them to provide us with an explanation. It appears that they are applying legal fees for no reason and expect us to pay the fees with no explanation. This does not make sense to me and my wife. 

When is this going to end? We have been paying the mortgage on time and also paying additional money towards the principle in order to get the house paid off faster. We just feel like they are trying to do any and everything in order to deter us from paying the house off faster. Please help us if you can. This new charge was applied on XXXX. 

The only reason that legal fees were applied before was because of a bankruptcy discharge & XXXX XXXX XXXX. However, those issues have been resolved.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I spoke to someone named XXXX from Bank of America regarding signing a payment deferral letter. 

In the letter it shows Bank of America is going to defer property taxes paid. The amount of property taxes paid is included in the total amount to be deferred. 

I reported to Bank of America on XX/XX/2024 that I had paid the taxes and any amount Bank of America paid was an overpayment. 

Per the tax office on XX/XX/2024 they refunded the overpayment of property taxes to Bank of America. 

XXXX XXXX states that she can see that Bank of America received the refund check for the taxes. 

According to XXXX XXXX I can go ahead and sign the letter with the total including taxes refunded to Bank of America. This would mean Bank if America would be paid twice for the taxes. Bank of America revived the refund for the tax overpayment and now wants the customer to pay the taxes again as its included in the total. 

She further states that if I sign the letter, I should trust Bank of America will fix it on the back end. This is dishonest and not fair to the customer. Asking a customer to sign an incorrect document seems illegal. 

I did everything right. On XX/XX/2024 XXXX BOfA notified a refund was being mailed. ( see attached ). The XX/XX/2024 notice was weeks before the XX/XX/2024 letter went out. 

Bank of America should have verified Everything prior to sending out that XX/XX/2024 letter. 

The other option to correct Bank of America mistake would be to have Bank of America will need to verify the monies were refunded with escrow and this would void the current payment deferral letter. 

And a new evaluation would need to take place prior to a new deferral payment letter being sent out. 

The process can take up to 30 days and in this reevaluation. This would be XX/XX/2024. 

She further states that the foreclosure scheduled for XX/XX/2024 will proceed even if Bank of America hasnt completed its reevaluation before XX/XX/2024. 

XXXX catamount way XXXX XXXX XXXX Reference number : XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A Bank of America customer claims the bank is asking them to sign a payment deferral letter that includes property taxes already refunded to the bank, resulting in double payment. The customer was told to trust the bank would correct the issue, but this approach is deemed dishonest and unfair.

Sub-issue: Applying for or obtaining a modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or deed-in-lieu
Consumer complaint narrative: Unemployment hardship that just ended. Ongoing Midland disregarded valid Hardship compounded with XXXX XXXX impact and still ongoing long covid recovery. We provided Midland with proof that we were supposed to be properly considered for Forbearance or Moratorium per their published procedures. Instead, at speed Midland continued to report us as though delinquent ( as they also did last year during our covid case ). Then disregarded our signed application stating homeowners wife has long covid XXXX and not working ; wasted a month asking for her wage slips. Then re-asked for income information of main wage earner supplied 2 months earlier. Homeowner provided detailed income receipts. Midland sent agent to inspect and take photos of our house while we were home. House is in good maintenance. Midland continued, against their own published policies, to report to credit bureaus losing over XXXX of joint credit scores as though delinquent without a federally-exception ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX disaster area, followed by sudden unemployment ), once new job was secured when XXXX weeks wages received, an extra unnecessary burdeo was placed when Midland insisted on seeing job offer letter. Provided immediately by fax with receipt kept. While continuing to wrongly report us to the credit bureaus - thus negaitvely impacting quicker return to to work. Homeowner rReadily supplied multiple emails and faxes to Midland between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX on their XX/XX/XXXX deadline. All were disregarded and at high speed rushed into foreclosure. Homeowner kept receipts showing delivery receipt to of emails and copies by fax as a precuation ( covid-related case mishandled last year with same provider ). Homeowners should have qualified for streamlined refinance due to ARPA fund available after covid impact case # XXXX which should have been paid by HAF until XX/XX/XXXX for 18 months. HAF mishandled but either way refinancing through FHA or other method, loan modification etc were all viable options. All the following parties in Midland are denying receiving all supporting documents proving hardship! Rushing our USDA-guaranted loan into foreclosure is non compliant with statute and their own published policies sent to them. Midland never replied to one single question in the past 3 months including when we wrote asking why they increased mortgage to add {$500.00} more, in XXXX XXXX after a massive insurance hike, when our USDA loan to value ratio does not warrant having a bond. We are outside range ( also not replied to ). How many other hardship families are MidlandMortgage decisioning without facts supplied? XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX date : XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX subject : Re : Documents Needed for Your Application - see XXXX XX/XX/XXXX with attachments
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Midland Mortgage disregarded a homeowner's valid hardship claim, despite providing proof of unemployment and long COVID recovery. They continued to report delinquency to credit bureaus, despite the homeowner's eligibility for forbearance or moratorium, and rushed into foreclosure, allegedly violating their own policies and statutes.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: as I was typing my complaints this morning to cfpb, I received what appears to be a fake foreclosure letter with XXXX 's logo on it. it didn't have my legal name on it but the first XXXX letter of my middle name and my first XXXX letters of my mom 's name. how would someone other than the lender know about my financial woes? in order for a foreclosure to take place in XXXX it has to be filed in the courts and it can't be done ' while in forbearance. when forbearance over a partial claim is supposed to be submitted to bring everything current. you can also see they didn't put my complete address XXXX XXXX name and another city I don't reside in. telling me I better vacate my property. who would know to send me something like that threatening me like that. none of the proper channels have been taken to even do a foreclosure, no proper notice no nothing... .but again can't do foreslcoure without filing in court first, and also giving legal proper notice to borrower. but how would someone know about my financial woes and email address to send me this? these are things files in court first then sent through postal mail. pls investigate who sent me this fake letter.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a suspicious foreclosure letter with an incorrect name and address, threatening eviction. The letter appears to be fake as proper foreclosure procedures (court filing and notice) were not followed, and the consumer is currently in forbearance. The consumer is concerned about how the sender obtained their financial information.

Consumer complaint narrative: MY CONDO XXXX   XXXX IS LOCATED ON THE XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX AND THE MORTGAGE COMPANY AGREED AS A ONE TIME COURTESY TO REMOVE THE {$140.00} FORCED PLACED INSURANCE PREMIUM SINCE I ALWAYS PAY MY FLOOD INSURANCE ANNUALLY AND I NEVER HAD AN ESCROW ACCOUNT SINCE I OBATAINED THIS LINE OF CREDIT FROM XXXX XXXX  XXXX AND I ALWAYS PAY MY PROPERTY TAXES ON TIME. Sub-issue: Foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: I called Planet Home Lending in XXXX to request options for payments while I tried to sell my home. My daughter XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  '. She has frequent XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  that require me to miss work. On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. He now requires XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I explained this to the representative. None of the options they gave me helped our situation. I notified them that I was in the process of listing the home with an agent and would be selling soon. I would be unable to make payments until the property sold. Forbearance wasnt an option because it had conditions where I couldnt list the home for sale. Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative: I can not believe y'all closed my case in XXXX b/c you heard from the company. The only way the company has been corresponding to my complaints is thru the NJ Dept of Banking & Insurance. I've had nothing but grief since the company- Selene Finance- started serving my loan. There not one isolated incident, but a string of them. The most recent was how they were applying XXXX payments & changing my ESCROW analysis after the state agency requested data. They continued to report my payments as late, and inadequate b/c their escrow analysis - which they only acknowledged in correspondence to the state in XX/XX/year> ( 4 months after I requested an explanation ) - exceeds the legal limits that they make collect. I have been paying my principal & interest for the last 2 months & now they've sent a letter of intent to foreclose. I documented their predatory practices & am frustrated that the state has done nothing but mediate communication. I've been in my home for 17 years ... this is the 4th loan servicer & all they've been doing is causing me grief. I didn't sign an agreement with Selene finance & should not have to deal with their unscrupulous and seemingly illegal banking practices.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint is against Selene Finance, a loan servicer, for allegedly engaging in predatory practices. Key issues include misapplied payments, inaccurate escrow analysis, and incorrect late payment reporting, despite state agency intervention, leading to a letter of intent to foreclose on their 17-year home.

Sub-issue: Private mortgage insurance (PMI)
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I sent an email to Flagstar Bank, my loan servicer, to remove private mortgage insurance on my loan number XXXX for my property located in California. On XX/XX/XXXX, Flagstar responded with a letter indicating that I needed to order a property valuation ( appraisal ) at a cost of {$550.00}. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I responded by email asking Flagstar to identify why a broker price opinion ( " XXXX '' ) was not available as an option prior to the appraisal. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX requires that the Servicer " verify the current value by a new XXXX ordered and obtained through XXXX, unless applicable law requires that an appraisal be used ... '' On or about XX/XX/XXXX, Flagstar responded with the same letter Flagstar sent me on XX/XX/XXXX, indicating that I needed to order a property valuation ( appraisal ) at a cost of {$550.00}. Flagstar did not respond to my request to identify the applicable law that required an appraisal be used. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I responded by email again, reiterating my request that Flagstar identify why a BPO is not available for a property valuation, and if not, what applicable law Flagstar is using to base this on. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, having not received any further response from Flagstar to my XX/XX/XXXX correspondence, I emailed Flagstar reiterating my request : for Flagstar to identify why a BPO is not available for a property valuation, and if not, to identify what applicable law Flagstar is using to base this on. Shortly after my last email on XX/XX/XXXX, Flagstar called me and advised that they would look into my request. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Flagstar to inquire on the status of my request and spoke with XXXX ( spelling? ), a supervisor from Flagstar 's PMI department. XXXX advised that she was not aware of the applicable law that Flagstar is relying on to deny my request for a BPO. XXXX advised that I should contact XXXX XXXX, the investor of my loan with further questions and that Flagstar did not have the answer. 

The same day, I called XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX to understand why a BPO is not available for a property valuation, and if not, to identify what applicable law Flagstar is using to base this on. XXXX XXXX advised that they do not know of a requirement for why BPOs can not be used in California. XXXX XXXX also advised that the servicer ( Flagstar ) is the interpreter of the guide. XXXX XXXX opened a case with Flagstar to better understand why Flagstar is denying the XXXX as a property valuation. The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is XXXX. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX, I have not received a responsive answer to my request.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Despite multiple requests, Flagstar failed to provide a clear explanation or applicable law supporting their decision.

On XX/XX/2024 I requested again to be considered for other relief programs and stop the foreclosure ( date XX/XX/2024 ). Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the difficulties I have encountered in obtaining an accurate payoff balance for a mortgage account managed by Fifth Third Bank. Below are the details of my situation : Successor of Interest : I have been appointed as the successor of interest following the passing of the original borrower.

Issue with Payoff Balance : I have been attempting to secure the accurate payoff balance for this account. However, the balance has inexplicably increased by approximately {$5000.00} without any itemized explanation.

Investigation Efforts : I have reviewed county records which suggest that the additional fees charged are related to an order of sale. Despite this, I have been unable to obtain clear information or justification for these charges.

Lack of Communication : I have contacted Fifth Third Bank 's mortgage servicing department multiple times, but they have been unable to provide answers regarding the fee increases.

Attorney Unresponsiveness : I was advised to reach out to Fifth Third Banks attorney, XXXX, XXXX, and Associates, who has not responded to any of my electronic or verbal requests for information. 

Duration : This issue has been ongoing for over a year. 

Title Company Involvement : The title company I am working with has also faced difficulties in obtaining the correct payoff balance, as Fifth Third Bank has refused to respond to the title company request. I then have to call to follow up on why the are not releasing the information. 

Escalation Attempts : I sent a fax to the Office of the President of Fifth Third Bank and was assured the matter would be looked into. However, I have yet to receive a satisfactory resolution. Furthermore, Fifth Third Bank will not accept any payment exceeding the original payment amount, resulting in returned payments in the deceased borrowers name making it extremely difficult to payoff the debt prior to me deciding find a new service provider. 

As a result of these ongoing issues, I have been unable to close out the balance under the deceased borrowers name and switch the account to my preferred servicer. This situation has caused significant stress and inconvenience. These issues arose after the hardship application was submitted and approved. It was brought to my attention that the hardship approval was reversed because the agent who called to get a verbal acceptance did not properly record it in the system. This error resulted in the reversal of the approval, causing the loan to go into foreclosure status due to the employees mistake. 

I kindly request the CFPB 's intervention to ensure that Fifth Third Bank provides an accurate and itemized payoff balance and addresses the lack of communication from their attorney.
Narrative Summary: The complainant, a successor of interest for a deceased borrower, has been unable to obtain an accurate payoff balance for a Fifth Third Bank mortgage account due to an unexplained $5,000 increase. Despite multiple attempts, the bank and its attorney have failed to provide clear explanations or itemized charges.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: My complaint is with my mortgage company Rocket Mortgage/Quicken Loans . I hope I get a call back so I can explain in better detail, but basically, we went behind on our mortgage and the only solution the mortgage company gave us was to pay {$4500.00} a month for six months which was supposed to correct or make us even from this debt of over {$16000.00} that was missing payments and a lot of fees. I dont know how we did it but somehow for four months we made the payment of {$4500.00} but supposedly for the last two payments, they said ( mortgage company ) that they didnt receive/declined payment because money was caught in electronic limbo land because we had to transfer from different accounts into that one to total of XXXX so they can take it. WELLL, its funny how they had no problem taking it the other four months but at the end now they didnt take. It said they tried we failed to pay and now we owe over {$11000.00}. If we owed XXXX something to start and I gave you XXXX a month for 4 months that I definitely know of. Well, we dont need a mathematician to figure out that thats {$18000.00} right there before they supposedly were supposed to take our last two payments of XXXX each. Thats definitely not all though, not even close. About seven months ago at least my wife took out XXXX from her 401 ( k ) to try to fix this debt of {$16000.00} and the mortgage company WOULD NOT TAKE THE PAYMENT. I repeat would not take XXXX so we can fix this mess and start moving forward positively in our life. No!, they said pretty much the only way to keep our house is to do that payment plan, WHICH, was absolutely setting us up for failure, and they are still in the process of setting us up for failure. PLEASE SOMEONE HELP ME AND MY FAMILY!!! I am XXXX  combat XXXX veteran who served for this country honorably and now I have a Bank who is setting me up for failure who will not take money or payments towards our obviously ever growing debt mortgage problem. Honestly, I am not being dramatic in saying that in my eyes. This is absolutely a criminal act towards not only a born here CITIZEN but an actual XXXX XXXX  veteran who fought for this country so I can hopefully make it HOME and WHAT? With the fact being said that, I truly except and are willing to deal with the consequences of missing payments due to bad life events ; BUT To come back and finally achieve a dream of owning a home in my country that I love to have the banking system set me up for failure, by not taking delinquent payments, so we can get ahead or just even. Someone please call me back and help me with this nauseating situation regarding a financial institution Rocket Mortgage quicken loans. PLEASE. THANK YOU
Narrative Summary: The consumer complaint is against Rocket Mortgage/Quicken Loans. The issue is that the mortgage company allegedly refused to accept payments, including a $XXXX withdrawal from a 401(k) and two $4500 payments, despite initially agreeing to a payment plan to settle a $16,000 debt.

I called the company to see how I can get back onto the payments and was told i am in forbearance until XXXX. Not sure why and how as trying to communicating with the account manager bore no results. He does not call back and when I get a call from them its either hang ups or threats. I had one conversation with him where I was told the outstanding balance could be added at the end of the loan. I have been filing tickets and emailing to no avail. Then I get a response from XXXX XXXX but when I talked to them they had no information on me. I have no idea what is going on, how to make payments again and resolve the outstanding balance ( needs to be added at end of loan ).

Consumer complaint narrative: I am administrator for estate of XXXX XXXX, all documents were sent to Roundpoint Mortgage in order to communicate with them. The mortgage loan for property was paid off on XX/XX/2024. I waited untile 30 days later to inquire about refund of escrow account and additional interest that was remitted to payoff loan. I was assured check was coming, and confirmed my mailing address, and capacity to receive as administrator for the estate. Subsequently, loan status is shown as paidoff, and I am unable to reach anyone via phone, nor email. I have sent emails re status of refund, no response, and when calling am hung up on. You simply can not reach a live person. Legally they are required to remit funds with 21 days after loan paid in full. It has been well over that. I need an accounting and check as the probate referree needs this information as well.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Rushmore Loan Management Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Loan No. : XXXX with original mortgagee : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Rushmore Services LLC DBA Mr. Cooper LLC DBA Nationstar Mortgage XXXX LLC Loan No. : XXXX Please Consumer Financial Protection Bureau please take this matter to task and don't let Rushmore just pay lip service again.to you and my husband and me. We are between a rock and hard place due to these matters and time is running out for us to get this done and with our health as well. 

We filed for XXXX loan mitigation with Rushmore Loan Management Services ( RLMS ) we also received XXXX funds to pay our forbearance amount owed to RLMS, they refused this payment, and told our XXXX agent they had sold the account to Rushmore Services XXXX So, we gave the just received validation of debt paperwork from Rushmore Services and gave this information to our XXXX agent. In meantime, RLMS proceeded with the foreclosure sale of our loan, even though it had been sold to Rushmore Services LLC, DBA Mr. Cooper, XXXX days previously. As Rushmore Services told us the rest of the paperwork was still being transferred to Rushmore Services LLC, DBA Mr. Cooper/Nationstar Mortgage. Per the information we were given by RLMS attorneys. We called Rushmore services per RLMS attorneys said to contact them as our loan was with them. We did, Rushmore Services told me they would not be foreclosing on our loan on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, as it was on hold. Come to find out the XXXX funds were not accepted by either company. All the while we under the impression that one of them had accepted the XXXX funds and there would not be a foreclosure on our property. Instead, neither of these companies accepted the XXXX funds, and they did indeed foreclose on our property on XX/XX/XXXX. When Rushmore Services told us they would not be foreclosing on us on the XXXX of XX/XX/XXXX, as XXXX XXXX bought the property at a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX sale, paid the balance in full, the legal notice said that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX put it up for foreclosure sale and sold it to XXXX. Now we have another owner of the loan to add to the mix. 

With all of this said, we had filed a storm damage claim with XXXX XXXX XXXX on our 5-stall garage building prior, thee iinsurance check was dated XX/XX/XXXX, check number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, made out to XXXX and XXXX XXXX and XXXXushmore Loan Management Services. We sent the insurance check out to RLMS and they deposited it on XX/XX/XXXX according to the returned insurance company check copy we received from our XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Those funds were transferred to Rushmore Services ; however, they have refused to send back the {$7.00}, XXXX insurance funds so we can pay our garage roof contractors, they require 50 % down in order-to-order trusses, roofing materials, electrical contractor, etc. We were sent their attestation paper not to hold them accountable, or not to sue them on the insurance company claim for our garage building repairs. We have jumped through their hoops, and have called several times, faxed the attestation paper, and still we have not received the insurance company funds back. There is not any money owed to Rushmore Services, XXXX XXXX XXXX paid them in full via the foreclosure sale with their attorney XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX XXXX. From the last time I sent in a complaint, nothing has been done by Rushmore Services. They pay CFPB and me lip service only. They still have not sent us our insurance money from our escrow account, and it should have been drawing 5.25 % interest for XX/XX/XXXX, as the loan balance was paid in full by XXXX XXXX. We are still waiting to have some kind of legal action for violation of Federal Consumer Financial Protection Act, Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, and more than likely other laws, I am not aware of. 

We really need to pay them the down payment in order for them to order our roofing joists, materials and electric contractors supplies for the repairs on our 5-Stall Garage Building. We have NOT received any of these funds to get this done, and it has caused more damage to our garage and contents due to Rushmore 's failure to pay these funds to us, not to mention the XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Building Inspectors want these repairs done or started by XX/XX/XXXX, as time is running out. 

Sincerely, XXXX and XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint is about Rushmore Loan Management Services and Rushmore Services LLC's handling of their loan and insurance funds. The companies allegedly refused a payment, proceeded with foreclosure despite claiming the loan was sold, and failed to return $7,000 in insurance funds for garage repairs, causing additional damage.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
When initially engaging with Cardinal Financial, I was introduced to an agent named XXXX who provided detailed information about my loan and the process involved. Unexpectedly, I was later transitioned to XXXX, who contradicted XXXX 's information and could not locate any of my information and files that I had sent in previously, resulting in discrepancies in numbers and procedures. This led to unexpected expenses on my part. The underwriting process became problematic, with her delays in requesting necessary documents and re-requesting documentation that had already been sent in but waiting until the end of business days to request such items, leading to setbacks in the build process and additional stress. Despite attempts to address concerns with XXXX, communication ceased, and subsequent interactions with his XXXX, XXXX, offered limited resolution, despite acknowledgment of mishandling and misinformation. 

When attempting to make my first payment, Cardinal Financial initially couldn't locate my account, attributing it to my temporary CO status and pending fund disbursement. Following further investigation, they confirmed the correct payment amount. However, I later received a notice of non-payment for XXXX ( although paid the amount they stated ), with explanations for the discrepancy varying. Subsequent inquiries yielded inconsistent information about the required payment, with fluctuating amounts and confusion regarding fund availability. 

Attempts to clarify matters with a supervisor were met with unhelpful responses, including abrupt disconnection during calls. Consequently, I remain uncertain about the correct payment amount to avoid credit reporting issues. Online payment attempts have been unsuccessful, with the system only accepting an incorrect amount, exacerbating the confusion and frustration.
Narrative Summary: Cardinal Financial mishandled the consumer's loan process, causing discrepancies and unexpected expenses. Issues included lost documents, delayed requests, and inconsistent information. Later, the company couldn't locate the account, and provided fluctuating payment amounts, leaving the consumer uncertain about the correct payment amount to avoid credit issues.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
THE LOAN SERVICER PUT ME ( UNVOLUNTARILY ) ONTO AN IMPOUND PROGRAM AFTER I INVOKED THE CARES ACT TO GO INTO FORBEARANCE. AFTER FORBEARANCE, THEY FORCED ME TO HAVE AN ESCROW ACCOUNT. 

THE ESCROW ACCOUNT CALCULATED THE PROPERTY TAXES WRONG. ALMOST DOUBLE. THEY CLAIMED TO HAVE MADE A PAYMENT IN XX/XX/year> TO THE XXXX XXXX XXXX TAX ASSESSOR ON MY BEHALF BUT UPON CONTACTING XXXX XXXX, THEY NEVER RECEIVED ANY PAYMENTS. 

ALL THE TIME, I HAVE BEEN PAYING MY PROPERTY TAXES ON MY OWN. I NOTIFIED THE LOAN SERVICER OF THIS MISTAKE AND THAT IT IS CAUSING ME UNDUE HARDSHIP BUT THEY DONT CARE. THEY HAVE NOT DONE ANYTHING DESPITE OVERCHARGING ME ALMOST DOUBLE ( MY TAXES ARE ROUGHLY XXXX EVERY SIX MONTH ; THEY ARE CHARGING XXXX EVERY SIX MONTHS ). 

THIS IS A BLATANT DISREGARD FOR ANY LENDING RULES. ALL THE PAYMENTS FROM XXXX XXXX XXXX FOR MY PROPERTY TAXES WERE MADE BY ME. NOT MY LOAN SERVICER.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A loan servicer incorrectly calculated property taxes for an escrow account, nearly doubling the actual amount, and claimed to have made a payment that was never received by the tax assessor. Despite notification, the servicer has taken no action to correct the error.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Re : Account number : XXXX I was advised to write to you by your customer service department concerning my credit rating with your company. I have enjoyed a credit account with your company for many years. During the course of our business association, I have honored and respected my account agreement to the fullest. I appreciate how wonderful your service has always been.

Unfortunately, 2 years ago, I was in a financial dilemma due to job loss and multiple health issues. As a result some of my payments to you were delayed. Because your account with me is extremely important I managed to borrow the money to cover the late payments. I paid those payments 30 days late on three occasions over a nine-month period but I made sure to fulfill my obligation to ensure that your company suffered no loss.

I am thankful and appreciative for the years of positive credit history that I have obtained through your company but now those 3 late marks on my credit reports are causing me tremendous stress. I am trying to move up to a better paid position at my work, but the negative remarks are hurting my efforts.

This is where my " Goodwill Request '' comes in. I desperately need this promotion and I would be extremely appreciative if you would please complete a UDF - Universal Data Form and fax it to the credit bureaus to remove those entries.

The credit bureaus have advised me that they will report anything as instructed to by you, but they need to have that instruction in writing. I beg that you may help me and take into consideration how good of a customer I have been and how long I have had an account with you.

Thank you for your consideration, and I hope youll approve my request. 

Best, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A customer with a long-standing credit account is requesting a "goodwill deletion" of three late payment marks on their credit report, citing temporary financial hardship due to job loss and health issues, and the negative impact on their job promotion prospects.

Sub-issue: Applying for or obtaining a modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or deed-in-lieu
Consumer complaint narrative: I am XXXX and I am in XXXX XXXX with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I got behind on my payments due to medication cost, but I still kept paying my mortgage, I tried to bring current but was unable to, I am not asking for a modification which they are trying to give me but I have been denied several times, I want a temporary suspension of payments, I can bring my acct current with help. I have the paychecks to do this, I just cant do all at one time. Please I am asking for help and I have begged and begged, I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have sent proof of this to SLS, but they refuse to help me. I didnt ask to be XXXX and XXXX XXXX, but I am proof sent, I have a family a wife and daughters who will inherit my house XXXX XXXX XXXX. My wife will also get XXXX dollar life insurance policy to help with any problems, please I am asking SLS / XXXX XXXX to help me please stop foreclosure let me start making my payments again and get this behind me before XXXX XXXX. Please help me, please stop foreclosure, please help me bring my account current. I am a XXXX year old XXXX veteran. I am asking for help, please please

Despite having proof of income and a life insurance policy, the lender (SLS) has denied multiple requests for a temporary payment suspension, instead offering a modification, which the homeowner does not want.

The attached documents show a payment returned, along with a note inside stating something about a check taken. It's not my loan number but was in my letter attached. 

I'm not sure what you want me to call it since I've tried for almost a year to get you to stop this nonsense. so the all is yours. It's criminal. Fraudulent. what more do you need to open the other door to fix it.

Consumer complaint narrative: Mr. Cooper changed my XXXX XXXX policy without permission, forcing my payment to change. They received documentation from another insurance company related to another property. They stopped paying policy in XXXX Then choose another policy at a higher rate. All dine without my permission. XXXX XXXX  canceled policy for non payment from Mr. Cooper. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXAs a result, I am struggling to pay my mortgage.
