Sub-issue: Private mortgage insurance (PMI)
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been emailing and calling the mortgage company since XXXX for the removal of my PMI. I followed all of the steps called out by the company including filling out their required form and submitting a list of improvements with dates, amounts, and what work was completed. In XXXX, after submitting all of the forms, I received a letter stating that they were closing my request without saying anything else to me. I then called the company to inquire on why, and on that call they stated that it was because I didn't submit the required information ( even though I did ). I was then informed that the only thing I can do is to start over the request by resending in all of the forms again. I asked for the process to be expedited since they closed my request without reaching out or my consent and they agreed. But when I resubmitted the forms to the email I was given, and was told I would receive a response within three business days, I still hadn't heard back for over two weeks. I then called the company again to figure out why I am not hearing back and was put on hold for over an hour waiting to speak to someone to expedite the request. I was then told they had all of the papers and someone would review and call me back within five to seven business days instead of being able to speak to someone at that time. I insisted that I wanted to speak to someone at that time and was then again put on hold for over an hour. 
I has now been three months of requesting the PMI to be removed from my mortgage and I have done everything by their standards and requests and I am still not getting anything back from them. This feels like a forced way to ensure I keep paying the PMI every month they drag their feet, close out my requests for untrue reasons, and keep me in a run around for months. I just want this request completed as they are required by law to do and have the matter closed.
Narrative Summary: The consumer is complaining about a mortgage company's failure to remove private mortgage insurance (PMI) despite following the required steps and submitting necessary forms. The company has repeatedly closed the request without explanation, forcing the consumer to resubmit and wait, resulting in a three-month delay.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Our mortgage was sold shortly after we closed on it in XXXX of XXXX. It was sold to XXXX, which is serviced by Volunteer Mortgage. We have had ongoing issues with them, beginning with them purchasing forced placed insurance using our escrow account, which made it short of funds. We did not need them to force place insurance. We had insurance that was up to date and had not expired ; and when it did expire, it was renewable at about XXXX of what the forced placed insurance premium was. 

In the meantime, they kept sending notices indicating the escrow account was short of funds by over {$1300.00}. We didn't understand what was happening and why, at first. We began making additional payments every month to make up the difference, which created a nightmare with some of our other creditors because we were on a tight budget, due to the changed economy. 

When my wife discovered what had happened -- the mortgage servicer failed to realize they had done anything wrong- it took a XXXX XXXXXXXX to try to explain it to them. In the meantime, they reported our delinquent payments to the credit agencies and, they still fail to understand that they aren't even supposed to buy forced placed insurance, because we have an escrow account. If for some reason, there isn't enough money to cover the premium, they are supposed to cover it and bill us for the deficiency. Unless our insurance was cancelled for something other than non payment, they can't do that. They still fail to realize it. 

In the meantime, due to extra payments going to them, our credit is back in the XXXX. It was horrible from about XXXX, due to the untimely death of our XXXX XXXX XXXX daughter in a XXXX XXXX  that took a toll on us, the judicial portion took forever and we just didn't care. We never thought wed be able to buy a home again and now that we have, we are regretting it due, in large part, to the servicing. 

We have come to the conclusion that they send us convoluted information on purpose so that we don't understand where our money is going. They give us advice and then all of a sudden we are in a loan modification situation. Our trust has gone out the window. We have owned several other homes and have never had this issue with a servicer. 

They charged us {$200.00} for an attorney fee. When I asked what that was for, back in XXXX, they told us it was " in case you want to do a loan modification. " We were also told at that time that we didn't qualify for a loan modification. 

We have also been continually charged {$20.00} per month, evidently for some guy to come by to make sure we live here. Really? Where else would we live? Junk fee? 

Also, the statements show all money going in and out of escrow in ways we do not understand. What in the world is " walk in cash ''? I know we aren't walking it in and if someone else is... who is it and why? 

They sent us an annual escrow accounting with anticipated, actual and difference and it made zero sense. Nothing added up correctly. Its like they have someone who knows nothing about mortgages or accounting and just willy nilly plugging in numbers. And why is all money running through escrow? That is for insurance and taxes only -- there should be separate accounts for held payments ( if it is a partial payment or whatever ) Our dog could do a more clear accounting of our mortgage. It is scary that they are still doing the same things and we still do not understand nor trust them.
Narrative Summary: The consumer complaint is about issues with mortgage servicer Volunteer Mortgage. The key issue is that the servicer force-placed insurance on the consumer's mortgage using their escrow account, despite the consumer already having up-to-date insurance, resulting in a short escrow account and incorrect delinquency reports to credit agencies.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi, I want to complain about the Newrez LLC mortgage company. I have called them to try to fix the issue on my account since XX/XX/XXXX. The mortgage company charged an insurance amount of {$420.00} to my monthly mortgage while I provided the insurance policy from XXXX to their insurance department ( see attached ). On XX/XX/XXXX, their insurance dept emailed to confirm that they received the policy and will adjust my account within 2-3 business days. On XX/XX/XXXX, the amount was still on my account, so I called the customer service rep ; the person said it was under escrow analysis and would take 7 business days. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called again to see the status of my account. They said it would be corrected on XX/XX/XXXX. By XX/XX/XXXX, my account remains unchanged. I called the reps, and they said it is still pending. I asked for a supervisor of the department. The supervisor said it could take a month. At this point, I am so upset. I asked why and how I could process the payment for XXXX without a late fee. He didn't help. He said to call back in XXXX to see if the account was corrected. Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I want to make my monthly payment without the {$420.00} insurance, and I am trying to process it online. They do not allow me to adjust the amount to my monthly mortgage without the {$420.00}. I called the customer service rep again, and he said that the account is still pending for XXXX analysis and will take 7 business days. It is so stressful, and it is affecting my health since I can't sleep. I don't want to end up paying late payments, and I don't want to pay {$420.00} when I don't owe them. It is a lot of money, and I am unemployed now. It is not fair, and there is nothing I can do. Either I pay them the full amount of {$420.00} in XXXX or wait until it is fixed. How long, no one knows since every time I called. It said 7 business days or 1 month ... why? 
Please help. I feel this mortgage company is not doing its job, and I asked for the complaint department, but they refused to give it to me. I am sure there are customers out there like me ; I want to speak out to the public and hopefully CFPB can help us.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer is disputing a $420 insurance charge added to their Newrez LLC mortgage despite providing proof of insurance. After multiple calls and promises of correction, the issue remains unresolved, causing stress and potential late payment fees.

Sub-issue: Applying for or obtaining a modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or deed-in-lieu
Consumer complaint narrative:
This 2nd mortgage was opened in XXXX for {$30000.00} from XXXXXXXX XXXX 
It was paid up until XXXX when I requested a modification. I was told that the first was modified and the 2nd was rolled into the first and I only had one mortgage. 
I kept paying my first mortgage and am up to date and in good standing. Now almost 10 years later a loan servicer from CA ( West Coast XXXX  ) sent me paperwork requesting XXXX or they will foreclose on my home. I have since hired a lawyer to help me work through this process. I have a conciliation hearing on XX/XX/XXXX. But since I never received any statements, notices, nothing I think this is unfair or predatory. When I asked them for a modification, they offered a XXXX loan at {$500.00} per month, with a balloon payment after 10 years of {$67000.00}. I am XXXX XXXX XXXX ; my wife is XXXX and a XXXXXXXX XXXXt. I am her sole caregiver. We live on Social Security only. This is why I have hired a lawyer to protect the home from XXXX.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims a 2nd mortgage was rolled into their 1st mortgage after a modification request, but nearly 10 years later, a new servicer demanded payment, threatening foreclosure. The homeowner never received statements or notices, and the proposed modification includes a large balloon payment.

Sub-issue: Paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
The complainant applied for credit, and subsequently entered a debt finance contract with XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  for the purchase of real property in XXXX XXXX, Georgia on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  claims to have sold the mortgage to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX claims to have hired XXXX XXXX XXXX ( dba XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to service the loan. XXXX XXXX XXXX then involved McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce LLC in their attempt to foreclose the property. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the complainant endured undue influence from the Notary Public during the closing procedures when she prevented the complainant from restricting her indorsement on the mortgage chattels. The complainant, being the true owner and holder of the chattels including the promissory note, never intended to gift the note or any of the chattels to XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, or McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce LLC and only intended for them to hold the chattels on special deposit. She intended to deposit the promissory note into her own account, and never authorized the defendants to deposit the note into their account. The promissory note was the property that the complainant intended to pledge as collateral for the mortgage, not her real estate property. The complainant only granted the alleged owner and servicer a security interest in the promissory note in exchange for valuable consideration, which has still not been given to the complainant as of the filing of this complaint. The complainant never intended to grant legal title in any of her property to any of the parties previously mentioned, including McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce LLC. The Purchase Money Security Deed was solely intended to secure the complainants repayment of the mortgage, which she tendered on XX/XX/XXXX. Section 27 of the Security Deed titled Release clearly states that : Upon payment of all sums secured by this Security Instrument, Lender will cancel this Security Instrument. The complainant has asked all involved opposing parties to provide a full accounting for her account multiple times via written request, the initial request sent via United States Postal Service Certified Mail on XX/XX/XXXX, and every time they have either refused the request or only provided partial accounting. On XX/XX/XXXX, all involved opposing parties were served a Deed of Dissolution of Trust discharging them of their Trustee capacity via United States Postal Service Registered Mail to dissolve the trust that was created by the complainant when she indorsed the Security Deed. The complainant also served a Revocation of Power of Attorney and Security Interest to all involved opposing parties on XX/XX/XXXX, which stripped them of their Power of Attorney and agent-in fact authorities and removed their right to a Power of Sale of the real property of subject. The complainant tendered three ( 3 ) special deposits with Notice of Equitable Redemption via United States Postal Service Registered Mail to settle her account, first to the Chief Financial Officer of XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, and twice to the Indenture Trustee of XXXX XXXX XXXX, which is XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. on XX/XX/XXXX. These three special deposits along with the promissory note deposited on XX/XX/XXXX, prove that the complainant has tendered XXXX ( XXXX ) different payments to the defendants to settle the alleged debt. The complainant obtained a Forensic Mortgage Securitization Audit which provided XXXX XXXX data proving that not only was her mortgage account already settled and repaid to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, but that they have also converted and securitized the complainants mortgage chattels and are currently trading them on stock exchange markets and retaining all the profits. The records of accounting provided by the defendants in no way match the Forensic Mortgage Securitization Audit data. The complainant received a copy of the promissory note with the allonge from McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce LLC on XX/XX/XXXX, and the note does not contain a special indorsement signifying the assignment of the mortgage from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. As of the filing of this complaint, neither McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce LLC or any other party previously mentioned in this complaint has provided the complainant with a copy of the promissory note that identifies them as title holders with any valid claim, right or interest in the promissory note or the real property of subject. 
OFFENSES XXXX. All involved opposing parties trespassed the complainants mortgage chattels when they wrongfully took possession without her consent and deprived her of her property. XXXX. All involved opposing parties materially altered the complainants mortgage chattels by applying their own indorsements without her consent. 3. All involved opposing parties converted the mortgage chattels for their own use without the consent of the complainant. 4. All involved opposing parties have committed multiple acts of breach of trust, including : A. Breach of contract when they failed to provide valuable consideration to the complainant after she granted them a security interest in her promissory note. B. Dereliction of fiduciary duties to apply the payments tendered by the complainant to settle their ledger and cancel the security instrument after receiving notice to do so. C. Refusal to vacate Trustee office after trust was dissolved and complainant relieved them of their responsibility. D. Refusal to provide a full accounting for the complainant 's account to show what disposition they have made of the trust funds, money, and other property in their possession. E. Clogging the complainants right to redeem the mortgage on several different occasions. 5. All involved opposing parties retain wrongful possession of the land, rights, titles, interests, and property after receiving full payment from the complainant to settle the account. 6. All involved opposing parties are violating the complainants order revoking their security interest and Power of Attorney/Power of Sale privileges . 7. All involved opposing parties have not proven their authority to foreclose on the complainants property by way of Power of Attorney granted by either the alleged owner or servicer of the mortgage, which displays they also do not have any de jure authority to foreclose on the complainants property. 8. All involved opposing parties have provided no proof that they have a right, title, or interest in the complainant 's real property by way of an assignment of the note to them from the alleged originator of the note. The complainant is already pursuing legal action against XXXX XXXX XXXX and McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce LLC, and demands they provide the documents requested in this complaint immediately and cancel the auction sale of the complainant 's property scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX, before they cause irreparable harm to the complainant 's estate and commit fraudulent and injurious acts against the complainant.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims that during the mortgage closing process, the notary public pressured them into not restricting the endorsement on the mortgage, leading to the lender misinterpreting the intent and using the promissory note as collateral instead of the intended security interest.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: He came to my attention that Wells Fargo was no longer to hold it in the course over my account also it came to my attention that money 's were not applied to the account properly so I asked for the full accounting of the account I also asked for the person or the company that was the holder in the course of the account I also asked for all security instruments to be known to me forfeit account and everybody that was involved in or with this account I also ask Wells Fargo to show me that I owed the debt that they were saying that I owed I also asked Wells Fargo to settle this dead and close it to XXXX by sending in the promissory no sign sending in the instruments and Wells Fargo took all of the instruments now that I sent them to pay the account said they only take cash but kept the instruments and never responded anything but saying that they only take XXXX currency as far as cash is concerned to settle the debt on the account but it came to my attention that they also filed cancellations with the XXXX XXXXXXXX a bc and oid I sent then back the paperwork and the note and coupon accepted for value they keep but did not set the account for XXXX the in the mist the put it in action with out notice and sent the notice weeks after.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer complained that Wells Fargo mishandled their account, failing to properly apply payments and refusing to provide a full accounting. The consumer also alleged that Wells Fargo kept submitted payment instruments, but claimed only cash was accepted, and filed cancellations without notice.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary : Planet Home Lending , LLC ( PHL ) has reported I have an escrow shortage two years in a row ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX due to a failure on their part to make accurate predictions in local property tax annual growth, both of which resulted in grossly increased minimum monthly payments despite my VA home loan being on a fixed rate loan. After paying off the escrow shortages for both years and requesting that my escrow account be deleted so that I may pay for local property taxes and homeowner 's insurance myself, Planet Home Lending has failed to respond in a timely manner ( total of 44 days since initial signed letter request to delete escrow account after satisfying the escrow shortage ) and has maintained my minimum payment increase due to this escrow shortage. 
-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - XXXX Payments : - PHL Reported Escrow Shortage - {$4900.00} - Prior Minimum Monthly Payment ( w/o Shortage ) - {$1500.00} - New Minimum Monthly Payment ( w/ Shortage ) - {$2100.00} ( + {$560.00}, or XXXX XXXX  increase in monthly payments ) -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - XXXX Payments : - PHL Reported Escrow Shortage - {$3900.00} - Prior Minimum Monthly Payment ( w/o Shortage ) - {$1300.00} ( after new state tax exemptions ) - New Minimum Monthly Payment ( w/ Shortage ) - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, or XXXX % increase in monthly payments ) -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - Timeline** : XX/XX/XXXX - PLH Notifies Homeowner of XXXX Escrow Shortage XX/XX/XXXX - PLH Reduces Minimum Monthly Payment ( due to new state tax exemptions ) XX/XX/XXXX - PLH Notifies Homeowner of XXXX Escrow Shortage XX/XX/XXXX - Homeowner XXXX Request for Escrow Account Deletion XX/XX/XXXX - PLH Provides Instructions for Escrow Account Deletion, Demands Escrow Shortage Be Paid XX/XX/XXXX - Homeowner XXXX Request for Escrow Account Deletion, Pays off Escrow Shortage XX/XX/XXXX - Homeowner XXXX Request for Escrow Account Deletion XX/XX/XXXX - Homeowner XXXX Request for Escrow Account Deletion XX/XX/XXXX - PLH Acknowledges Request and Promises Response by XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - Homeowner XXXX Request for Escrow Account Deletion, No Response from PLH ( as of XXXX XXXX ) -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - **minimum payment not reduced to remove escrow shortage despite being paid off throughout this timeline
Narrative Summary: Planet Home Lending (PHL) reported two consecutive escrow shortages due to inaccurate property tax growth predictions, resulting in increased monthly payments for a fixed-rate VA home loan. Despite paying off the shortages and requesting escrow account deletion, PHL failed to respond and reduce the increased payments.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/XXXX, I was unable to set up a payment through on-line account to catch my mortgage payments up ; we had been on an informal payment plan since XX/XX/XXXX. At that time, my single-point of contact person, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I do a formal repayment plan to help me regain my footing, having advised me of additional options for repayment not available through informal means, up to and including deferral of missed payments at the end of the loan. 

Through a very rigorous process, fraught with delays, I provided all documents requested of me in Fay 's request for documents including hardship letters, monthly household expenses, profit and loss statements for XXXX ( given the option of providing these in lieu of tax returns which are still being prepared ). On several occasions, I called my single-point-of contact person, XXXX XXXX, to obtain account updates or clarification of requests for supplemental information, without response to telephonic and email contacts. I was advised of having missing information, even though email transmissions were sent with all documents attached. I would then be asked to provide some different form of the same information already provided. I provided detailed profit and loss statements via XXXX that interfaces with my XXXX banking institutions, for business and personal use ; these were reportedly too confusing ; XXXX XXXX indicated the preference would have been for handwritten information which can not be verified, whereas XXXX provides detailed transactions that coincide with bank accounts. Each time I submitted the information requested, there would be yet another hoop to jump through. 

XXXX XXXX uncharacteristically began ignoring my calls and emails ; in fact he had a history of emailing me to discuss my account. Suddenly, this was no longer an option for communication. This seemed to be a means to prolong the process of establishing a repayment plan and become further delinquent. I called, left messages and/or emailed XXXX XXXX and XXXX at Fay on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ( x XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX ( I have emails and call log ). I have a SINGLE letter from Fay dated XX/XX/XXXX indicating they attempted to contact me by mail and at least XXXX attempts by phone. There were ZERO calls from Fay and no voice messages left by Fay and its agents. I resorted to speaking with XXXX customer service representatives when unable to reach XXXX XXXX, including " XXXX '' and a " XXXX '' or " XXXX. '' I understand very well this is my responsibility to be responsive and remain in communication with my mortgage servicer. 

A manager, XXXX XXXX sent a letter on XX/XX/XXXX advising my request for repayment plan was not approved. That same communication provided outdated resource information XXXX XXXX XXXX foXXXX XXXXrelated assistance. XXXX no longer assists XXXX  homeowners, yet this information still appears in written communications. XXXX XXXX provided her email address in the same letter. I emailed XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to provide detailed account information, without response to date ( XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX ).
Narrative Summary: The consumer was unable to set up a payment plan through their online account and had to go through a lengthy process with their mortgage servicer, Fay. Despite providing all requested documents, the consumer experienced delays and unreturned calls and emails from their single-point-of-contact person, ultimately resulting in their repayment plan being denied.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have had issues with poor and inadequate communication from U.S. Bank Home Mortgage ever since my chosen lender sold the mortgage. 

In approximately XX/XX/XXXX, I did not receive a monthly statement. I called the bank to ask for the payment amount, which I paid at a branch. The following month, my statement did not reflect that the payment had been made, but did not explain why. I later learned that the bank had given me the incorrect payment amount, and their policy is that in this event, the payment is " held in suspense '' and nothing is credited until the full payment has been made. However, the bank never explained this in writing ; the only way I found out was with the help of a U.S. Bank branch manager who called U.S. Bank Home Mortgage on my behalf. 

I later called the mortgage company to ask how much the shortage was, so I could pay it and be restored. Customer service told me that would resolve things, so I made the payment. However, it was still not credited. When I called to ask for explanation, the representative told me I had been misinformed by the prior rep, and " that's not how it works '' - but with no explanation or instructions on how to resolve it. 

U.S. Bank also revoked my online access to my own mortgage account, without notice or explanation. I assumed it was a login error, but when I called to correct it, they told me that they'd revoked my access, but would reinstate it once my bankruptcy was over. This made it more difficult for me to make monthly payments, particularly during the pandemic- and they've never given me any explanation as to why they did this. 

In XXXX the bankruptcy was over, so I called to request reinstatement of online access. U.S. Bank Home Mortgage told me they would still not reinstate my access, but declined to explain why, referring me to my bankruptcy attorney. I asked about hundreds of dollars in supposed fees which I've never received notice of, but which the phone automated system says I owe. I was promised written documentation by XX/XX/XXXX, but have never received anything. 

I made my XX/XX/XXXX mortgage payment on XX/XX/XXXX, through the U.S. Bank Home Mortgage online system, in the amount reflected on my XX/XX/XXXX statement, by requesting to pay " the monthly amount. '' I received a receipt dated that date ; however, the XX/XX/XXXX statement reflects that, while the monthly amount was received, it was again " held in suspense '', not applied to the mortgage as per my request- but with no explanation. 

I have since received threatening emails from U.S. Bank Home Mortgage, threatening adverse impact if I do not make the payment I already made. I twice tried to reply, but the address would not accept incoming messages. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified letter to U.S. Bank Home Mortgage, requesting 1 ) that they apply my XXXX mortgage payment to the account ; 2 ) reinstatement of online account access ; and 3 ) detailed written documentation of any supposed fees I owe, none of which I have ever received notice of, including amounts, dates, and what they are for. US. Bank signed for the letter on XX/XX/XXXX, but they have not responded. 

This has been the worst experience I have ever had with any company, by far. Multiple times I've asked U.S. Bank Home Mortgage customer service what to do to resolve their errors, and have followed their instructions, only to be told that my efforts were unsuccessful, but never with any explanation. 

Thank you for listening, and I appreciate any help you can provide. 

I will attach the letter I sent the bank in XXXX, and will happily provide the bank 's own documentation as needed, to support that my mortgage statements do not reflect any fees, that they have received my monthly mortgage payments in the exact amount they said I owe, and that they have failed to apply my XXXX and likely now my XXXX mortgage payments, without explanation.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer complaint is against U.S. Bank Home Mortgage for poor communication and errors in mortgage account management. Key issues include: incorrect payment amounts, payments being "held in suspense" without explanation, revoked online access without notice, and unexplained fees, resulting in threatening emails despite payments made.

Sub-issue: Loan sold or transferred to another company
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was interested in a {$100000.00} loan, and my loan officer at the time told me it would have to be at least {$170000.00}. I was concerned about my monthly payment being too high, considering that it was a 9 % interest rate. He said I could just pay down a larger amount of the principal that way, the monthly payment would become lower. 
In XX/XX/XXXX, the loan was funded by Champions Funding and I was told the same thing by the loan representatives. So, I paid {$30000.00} of the principal in XXXX, but my monthly statement showed the same amount. I called the company, and was told that it " needed a little time to recalculate in the system ( the so-called recast ) and that the monthly amount will then be adjusted automatically ''. 
Before this could happen, however, Champions Funding sold my loan in XXXX XXXX to another bank, called XXXX  XXXX now refuses to do a recast. They want written confirmation of this recast, which Champions Funding can not provide, as everything was done verbally. Champions Funding should have done the recast before selling my loan. It was the sole and only purpose of paying the {$30000.00} to reduce my monthly payment. That did not happen. I am therefore requesting a return of my {$30000.00} from Champions Funding in collaboration with XXXX
Narrative Summary: A borrower paid $30,000 towards a $170,000 loan to lower monthly payments, expecting a recast. However, the lender, Champions Funding, sold the loan before the recast was processed, and the new lender refuses to adjust the payments without written confirmation, which Champions Funding cannot provide.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
PHH Mortgage # XXXX Services is our current Servicer. They aqcuired our mortgage on XX/XX/XXXX from Ocwen Financial Corporation mortgage account # XXXX, who was our prior mortgage Servicer. The following occurred : 1 ) We were unsuccessful in acquiring our Ocwen mortgage transaction history for Ocwen. After PHH Mortgage Services became our Servicer, we requested our Ocwen mortgage transaction history. 
2 ) on XX/XX/XXXX we sent email to PHH Mortgage Services requesting Ocwen mortgage transaction history. 
3 ) On XX/XX/XXXX, I received Ocwens ' mortgage transaction history document from PHH Mortgage Services. 
4 ) Following a detailed review of the Ocwen mortgage history document, we discoverd that there were possible serious mortgage regarding our mortgage, such as, Mis-applied payments, incorrect forbearance applications, where the Ocwen report showed that from the period XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, Ocwen applied alll of our mortgage payments as forbearance payments, negative increases to our mortgage principal balance, etc.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint is about PHH Mortgage Services' handling of their mortgage transaction history from previous servicer Ocwen Financial Corporation. After requesting the history, they received it and discovered possible errors, including mis-applied payments, incorrect forbearance applications, and negative increases to their mortgage principal balance.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
As of today Wells Fargo still hasnt granted my loan modification after submitting all paperwork, check stubs, and bank statements. They came back and said I have no income! 

I filed a complaint in XX/XX/XXXX Complaint No. XXXX regarding Wells Fargo not allowing me to do a loan modification after they allowed me to do the loan forbearance/deferment during COVID. This is a follow up to that complaint. Original Complaint : My ex husband, XXXX and I obtained a mortgage loan with Wells Fargo in XX/XX/XXXX. The mortgage was in XXXXXXXX XXXX name alone however I was listed on the deed. In XXXX we did a loan modification due to a financial hardship and it the listed XXXX and I both as borrowers. In XX/XX/XXXX XXXX and I separated and he moved out of the home. I continued making the payments on time. XXXX XXXX, XXXX I log into my Wells Fargo account to make my mortgage payment and something about forbearance immediately popped up. There was no wording about having to do a loan modification if I opted into the program. The information read like they would put payments at the end of the loan. I decided to do it with this understanding. I thought could payoff some other debts during that forbearance period. XX/XX/XXXX the forbearance ended and I had to start making the payments again. Then Wells Fargo called us saying we had to do a loan modification for the forbearance time period even ifwe continued to make the payment after the forbearance. I would have never opted into that program if it had said anything about a loan modification. Then we were told we were not eligible for the loan modification because XXXX no longer lived in the home. We were served with Foreclosure paperwork on Saturday XX/XX/XXXX. They will not allow me to do a loan modification by myself because they say I am not a borrower however the XXXX modification clearly list XXXX and I both as borrowers and we both signed as well and it is filed with the circuit clerks office as such on XX/XX/XXXX. The foreclosure paperwork includes interest, late fees and attorney fees as if Inever did the forbearance ( cares act stated they are not allowed to charge these fees during that time of forbearance ) Please advise. Thank you! XXXX XXXX XXXX. After this complaint they said we had to submit paperwork about filing our Quit Claim deed and I would be listed as a successor of the loan and then I could do the loan modification in two steps. The first step ( 1st modification ) being me listed as the successor of the loan then doing the financial loan modification. XXXX and I submitted all required paperwork and now they are denying the loan modification saying I have no income! Please help!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Wells Fargo denied a loan modification to a homeowner, claiming she has no income, despite her submitting required paperwork. This decision came after she was initially told she couldn't modify the loan as a non-borrower, despite being listed on a previous modification and the deed.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the application process
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau due to the inadequate and misleading communication regarding the change in my ARM mortgage interest rate held by First Tech Federal Credit Union. 

The following notes should assist you in reviewing the events that have caused me to file this complaint. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, a Fixed Adjustable Rate Note contract was completed with First Tech Federal Credit Union. 

Section XXXX of the loan contract states that. The Note Holder will deliver or mail to me a notice of any changes in my initial fixed interest rate to an adjustable interest rate and of any changes in my adjustable interest rate before the effective date of any change. 

Based on Sections XXXX of the loan note I was expecting an email or letter prior to the initial ARM term completion to indicate the amount of the new monthly payment. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received an email from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that looks like XXXX is getting ready to adjust. Please feel free to call or email with any questions. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I responded thanking XXXX XXXX for reaching out and asking if he can please let me know the interest rate and monthly payment once the initial loan period expires. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I had a phone meeting with XXXX XXXX. No specifics were communicated regarding the new interest rate and monthly payment once the initial loan period expires. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received an email from XXXX XXXX stating. I was able to do a little research. I am estimating that your rate will adjust to XXXX or XXXX. The index it is tied to has been moving quite a bit though. He also provided some refinance options. 

XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX. I emailed XXXX XXXX to request exact details about the new interest rate and monthly payment once the initial loan period expires. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received an email from XXXX giving me several options for refinancing and adjusting the loan and attaching some example documents. Apparently, he seemed to think I was requesting information on a refinance loan. He did not respond to my original request for the new interest rate and monthly payment once the current loan period expires. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted the First Tech Federal Bay Area Mortgage Manager, XXXX XXXX to request specifics on the new interest rate and monthly payment once the initial loan period expires. XXXX XXXX said she did not have information regarding existing loans but will put me in touch with someone at First Tech who does. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received an email from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that Good afternoon, we received an inquiry regarding the rate change on your mortgage account ending in XXXX. After review, your rate will not change until XX/XX/XXXX. You will receive a 90-day notice of the change. Please let us know if you have any further questions. My complete and full interpretation of his email was that the current interest rate and monthly payment would not change until XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, a letter was mailed to my home address via USPS and an email sent to my email account requesting an updated home insurance policy. I responded providing my updated home insurance coverage policy. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received an email from First Tech stating that that an additional {$1100.00} is due for the XX/XX/XXXX payment in addition to the payment of {$2100.00} that was received on XX/XX/XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I emailed XXXX XXXX XXXX to inquire why there was an additional amount due for the XXXX XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received a response from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that buried in the statements section of the First Tech online portal is a letter that was sent on XX/XX/XXXX, indicating a rate increase but not addressing his email of XX/XX/XXXX indicating that the next rate change will take effect on XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I mailed a certified letter to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX noting the correspondence taken place since XX/XX/XXXX, and requesting he review the issues. No response to my letter has been received to date. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from I with XXXX XXXX XXXX, requesting I call her. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I spoke with XXXX XXXX who said she can not do anything to rectify the situation noted in my letter to XXXX XXXX. 

If you wish to have a copy of all emails and letters referenced in this letter, please let me know and I will email or mail the copies to your office. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was forced into a very unfortunate situation in having to find an additional {$1100.00} to be able to pay the XXXX mortgage payment and to do this every month thereafter because XXXX XXXX XXXX could not take the time to notify of me the new monthly payment appropriately. 

Why on XX/XX/XXXX did a representative from XXXX XXXX email me to indicate that my monthly mortgage payment would not adjust until XX/XX/XXXX. Why was XXXX XXXX not able to mail out a letter or send an email 30 days prior to the effective date of the new monthly payment. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX can mail and email a letter when it concerns protecting its loan but when it concerns an increase in interest expense of XXXX per month, they were unable to do the same. 

The loan document and certified letter sent to the XXXX of First Tech Federal Credit Union are included with this complaint filing. 

Please let me know if you require copies of the emails referenced above and any additional information you require.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer filed a complaint against First Tech Federal Credit Union for inadequate communication regarding a change in their Adjustable Rate Mortgage (ARM) interest rate. Despite contractual obligations to provide notice, the consumer received unclear and misleading information, resulting in an unexpected $1,100 increase in their monthly payment.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
I requested an appraisal on my home through mortgage company as part of the process to remove PMI. I contacted the lender ( PennyMac Mortgage ) on XX/XX/XXXX and they advised I must receive an appraisal from their approved appraisal company to remove company to remove PMI. The agent advised there was a fee for the appraisal of {$250.00} I believe. I called back on XX/XX/XXXX and completed the process to begin the appraisal, agreed to pay the appraisal fee answered the question from the lender and one of the questions was have I done in significant updates on the home, which I had. I had a completely unfinished XXXX sq. ft. basement that I turned in XXXX bedroom, XXXX bathroom, full kitchen, living room, dining room, and separate HVAC system. In addition, I added a tankless water heater, had a concrete path added to the backyard, added a steel fence, and screened-in XXXX outdoor areas. This all came to about XXXX worth of updates. The lender advised that I qualified for the appraisal and scheduled an appraiser ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to come out XX/XX/XXXX. I received the completed appraisal from PennyMac in late XXXX. However, I had concerns. The appraisal which was completed on XX/XX/XXXX came in at {$610000.00} which I thought was odd because when I purchased the home XX/XX/XXXX and the appraisal price was {$610000.00}. Although, I had done around XXXX worth of work and added over XXXX sq ft of finished space to my home, the new appraisal I received was only {$2000.00} more than the appraisal when I purchased the home. I contacted PennyMac and advised them of concerns on XX/XX/XXXX. They advised me to submit a dispute by showing comparable homes in the area. I sent them the dispute via their " Messaging Center '', those messages have since been deleted from my view on the website. The agent that communicated with said they had received the documents and after much back and forth and escalation agreed to raise my appraisal value to around {$640000.00}. Which is still disputed and asked for an updated appraisal report with the changed value. I never received an updated appraisal report, nor did they follow up on my further dispute and told me that they could not send out another appraisal company and I couldnt use my own. The original message that I sent though the PennyMac Secure Messaging on XX/XX/XXXX is below and attached in the documents under Appraisal Comparison XXXX document. What prompted my complaint now after giving up due to the frustration of dealing with PennyMac is that I received my annual tax assessment for my home from the county for XXXX and the Fair Market Value of my home according to the tax assessors office as of XX/XX/XXXX is {$680000.00}. 

***Original Message to PennyMac via Message Center on XX/XX/XXXX : Hello, I requested PMI deletion on my loan. I paid the fee and the appraiser came out. I reviewed the appraisal report and I'm disputing the appraised value on the report. I spoke with a representative from PMI Deletion Dept. today who advised that I should send 3-5 comparable homes over to have them reviewed to dispute the appraisal. I have an attached an XXXX file which shows the 5 comparables and how they compare to the appraisal I received from your appraiser. 
As noted in the attached spreadsheet the subject home ( my home ) was not valued fairly compared to the comparable homes. Although the subject home is bigger and has more bedrooms and bathrooms than the comparables the price per sq. ft. and suggested sale price by your appraiser is significantly lower than the comparables. 
The subject home was originally XXXX with XXXX bedroom and XXXX bath. Summary of improvements done in home : Basement Finished in XXXX for additional XXXX of finished space for a total of XXXX sq. ft. The basement is a fully functional separate unit with private entrance, separate HVAC, XXXX beds, XXXX baths, full kitchen, living room and dining room. My home was originally valued at $ XXXX. XXXX when it sold but with the appraisal done by your appraiser it is now valued at $ XXXX. XXXX which a decrease of about $ XXXX. XXXX even though I completed major renovations and added over XXXX sq ft of living space to the home. In addition to the basement renovation, the water heater was switched to tankless water heater for the whole. A concrete path was built to go from the front of the home to the back, the patio and deck were screened in, and the backyard was fenced in. 
On your appraisers ' appraisal report it is noted that XXXX of work was completed on the home but none of that is factored into the value. The appraiser gave no credit for the extensive renovations completed and valued my house nearly the same as the XXXX appraisal when it was purchased in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Please review my dispute request and provide an update. I appreciate your time. *** ***Description of Documents Attached Below 1. PennyMac Appraisal XXXX Is the original appraisal I received from PennyMac which was done by XXXX XXXX XXXX 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX Is the appraisal I received when I originally purchased my home on XX/XX/XXXX. 
3. XXXX XXXX XXXX Tax Assessment Is the tax assessment from XXXX XXXX, GA showing a fair market value for my home of {$680000.00}. 
4. Appraisal Comparison XXXX Is the comparison I completed and sent to PennyMac at their request to show that my original appraisal from them and the comps used did reflect an accurate value of my home. 

1. PennyMac Appraisal XXXX Is the original appraisal I received from PennyMac which was done by XXXX XXXX XXXX 2. XXXX Appraisal XXXX Is the appraisal I received when I originally purchased my home on XX/XX/XXXX. 
3. XXXX XXXX XXXX Tax Assessment Is the tax assessment from XXXX XXXX, GA showing a fair market value for my home of {$680000.00}. 
4. Appraisal Comparison XXXX Is the comparison I completed and sent to PennyMac at their request to show that my original appraisal from them and the comps used did reflect an accurate value of my home. ***
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes the appraisal value of their home provided by PennyMac Mortgage, which was required to remove PMI. The initial appraisal valued the home at $610,000, despite $70,000 in renovations and added living space, which was only $2,000 more than the original purchase price.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo sent me a letter stating that my mortgage had an escrow shortage. I paid it for a specific amount. Wells Fargo applied that amount to my principal instead of my escrow shortage. XXXX XXXX is the customer service agent. She stated that I did not provide any instructions with my escrow shortage payment. 
I have made all of the payments through my own personal bank for several years, including escrow shortages. Wells sent the letter with no instruction to me that I had to provide instructions for the payment. I never have needed instructions before. This letter does not say that I have to provide instructions. Instructions how exactly? I have never provided instructions before. 
XXXX told me that I did not provide instructions with my escrow payment. The letter did not state that I needed to provide instructions. XXXX stated that it is in the mortgage when I closed. Well, I did not close with Wells Fargo. I closed with another provider and Wells Fargo bought the mortgage. Now Wells Fargo has sold the mortgage to XXXX XXXX and I have to call XXXX XXXX. 
The Escow payment was applied wrong by Wells Fargo and now my mortgage payment has risen to where I am now paying off the shortage- which I paid and Wells Fargo messed up. 
XXXX stated that this they did not make the error because I did not provide instructions ... to paying money that they asked for ... and not telling me that I needed to provide instructions. Wells Fargo is terrible, unethical, and crooked thieves.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Wells Fargo applied a customer's escrow shortage payment to their principal instead of the escrow account, despite no instructions being provided in the notification letter. The customer claims this is a first-time requirement and blames Wells Fargo for the error, which has resulted in an increased mortgage payment.

Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I closed on a XXXX XXXX  in XXXX, CA on XX/XX/2024. Throughout the purchase process, over a year, I was told by XXXX XXXX I have the option to lease or buy my solar panels for {$15000.00}. Buying was always my choice. XXXX XXXX reps consistently told me they will send wiring instructions a few days before I close. They never did. As I was signing my closing documents on XX/XX/2024, a Saturday, I notice the solar panel cost was included. I pointed this out to the notary. I mentioned it again to the builder and lender reps on XX/XX/2024 before I picked up my keys. 

Later that week, I explained the situation to XXXX XXXX of Clear Mortgage Capital. He told me he would amend the loan and send wiring instructions so I can purchase the solar panels and not have them included in my mortgage. Then he told me, XXXX can not take the solar panels out, it's included in the purchase price. All solar panels for new construction in CA must be included in the purchase price. 

I asked him, what California law states the cost of solar panels for new construction must be included in the purchase price of the home? He did not provide the California law. 

If a buyer choose to lease, they have to lease through XXXX for 20 years, if you choose to buy it must be included in the purchase price. Financing solar panels for 30 years. That does not make sense.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims they were misled by XXXX XXXX about the option to lease or buy solar panels for $15,000. Despite choosing to buy, the cost was included in their mortgage. The lender stated it's a California law, but failed to provide the specific law.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have my mortgage with Caliber Home Loan since XXXX. My loan got transferred to XXXX Mortgage in XX/XX/XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX, my bank account was compromised, leading to fraudulent activity that resulted in my card and account being temporarily locked. Unaware of this, I attempted to submit the payment to Caliber home loan, not realizing the transaction had failed to process. Upon discovering the issue in XX/XX/XXXX, I promptly contacted Caliber to rectify the situation. 

However in XX/XX/XXXX, I found in my credit report showing the 30 day late payment from Caliber. This is confusing, since XXXX is reporting theyve been servicing my loan since XX/XX/XXXX and thats the same month Caliber is saying my payment were late. It seems like Caliber should not have had my mortgage that month, which makes me wonder if this was a mistake. 

my mortgage was transferred to XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. I kindly ask for Caliber 's understanding and patience during this transition period. It is important to note that this incident was an anomaly, as I have maintained a consistent record of timely payments over the past five years.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's mortgage payment was missed due to a compromised bank account. Caliber Home Loans reported a 30-day late payment, despite the loan being transferred to XXXX Mortgage the same month, suggesting a possible mistake during the transition.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Select Portfolio Services , Inc. grossly mishandled management of our mortgage account and escrow funds. On XX/XX/year>, we contacted Select Portfolio Services to address a significant issue concerning the mismanagement of our impounded taxes on our residential property. Despite repeated attempts to rectify the situation, we have encountered negligence and incompetence on the part of Select Portfolio Services , Inc., which has resulted in unpaid property taxes. 

The crux of the issue stems from Select Portfolio Services ' failure to properly update our impounded taxes to reflect the assessed taxes on our residential property. They have been paying our property taxes based on the pre-sale classification of our property as a vacant lot rather than basing it on the closing documentation provided to them as a residential property. This erroneous assessment persisted for XXXX months until an internal audit prompted a sudden reduction in the monthly amount due. However, despite biannual escrow analyses, Select Portfolio Services failed to correct the tax discrepancy, leading to an outstanding tax liability of {$36000.00}. 

Upon contacting Select Portfolio Services , Inc., by phone and subsequently via email on XX/XX/year>, we were assured by a representative that the matter would be promptly addressed and remedied. Specifically, we were informed that our escrow account would be credited {$40000.00}, the outstanding taxes would be paid, and the property tax records would be updated accordingly. However, no such action was taken. Furthermore, subsequent escrow analyses continued to reflect the incorrect property tax amount, exacerbating the situation. 

Despite multiple conversations with representatives, supervisors, and managers, it was only after an extended period of over an hour and a half that we were able to speak to a manager named " XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' While she acknowledged the errors and expressed a willingness to rectify the situation, no remedy has been achieved to date. Instead, we were requested to provide Select Portfolio Services with additional time to communicate with their escrow department and oversee the necessary actions. However, there has been no communication or progress since this assurance. 

As a result of Select Portfolio Services ' negligence and incompetence, we have unpaid property taxes, uncredited funds to our escrow account and a loss of confidence in their ability to manage our mortgage account competently. Therefore, we are requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to intervene and investigate this matter promptly. Specifically, we request that Select Portfolio Services, IncXXXX be compelled to : 1. Credit our escrow account with the {$45000.00} in Property taxes collected to date. 
2. Pay the outstanding property taxes amounting to {$36000.00}.

3. Ensure that our account is properly updated to reflect the accurate amount of property taxes moving forward.

We also request that Select Portfolio Services, Inc. be held accountable for their negligence and incompetence and implement measures to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. We look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this egregious situation.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer's mortgage account and escrow funds were grossly mishandled by Select Portfolio Services, resulting in unpaid property taxes. The company failed to update the impounded taxes from a vacant lot to a residential property, leading to a $36,000 outstanding tax liability despite repeated attempts to rectify the issue.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX XXXX XXXX, I began the process to apply for a loan modification with PHH mortgage servicing. In order to be eligible for modification, I was required to make 6 loan payments of the total loan amount. In XXXX, I received the modification agreement to be notarized. I submitted that agreement but it was denied due to an error made by the notary. I resubmitted in XXXX ; however, the notary made another error so PHH sent one of their contracted notary servicers. 

On XX/XX/XXXX the notary came to my home and completed the process. My relationship manager, contacted me by email and stated the modification documents were received, approved, and the only thing remaining was the final payment amount. For two weeks I called the relationship manager since the payment could only be made by phone ( or mail - I do not like mailing checks or money orders ). In XXXX, I attempted to contact him again, was unable to reach him. He emailed me and I responded that I was waiting to be connected by phone to make the payment. 

On XX/XX/XXXX he contacted me by phone to take the payment. At this time, he informed me that my loan was being sold and I would have a new servicer. I asked would the approval and modification be completed in time. He assured me multiple times that he would, and said he was confirming the approval as we were on the phone. He stated that there was nothing more to do, but began making my mortgage payments in XXXX. He did state that the payment would be due XX/XX/XXXX, but I would have to wait on documents from the new servicers, which would take about 2 weeks. 

Between XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX, I received information from the new servicer. When I read the paperwork, I realized that the modification was not transferred to the new servicer because several things were wrong. The modification default amount was nearly {$10000.00} more than what it should have been, and the default was transferred rather than the modified agreement. I called the company immediately. They stated that PHH sent nothing, but they would request the updates. I also contacted PHH to try to reach the relationship manager, but I could only get his voicemail. I spoke to someone else, but they were not able to assist either because they said my loan could no longer be accessed. I was so stressed and worried. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, she was healthy. So as soon as I was released from the hospital, I began trying to contact the relationship manager again. I spoke to many representatives at PHH, some did not know what to do while others were very rude and refused my help. After nearly a month of trying to reach the relationship manager and ombudsman, he finally called me back. The ombudsman department on the other hand, never contacted me - although they sent several emails stating they tried to call me and could not reach me. I questioned them on this, and asked them by email to leave a voicemail the next time they called as proof of missed phone call since my call log was not recording their calls. They never did this either. 

In speaking with the relationship manager, he was very rude and extremely dismissive. He stated that the loan had been transferred, he could not longer access it and there was nothing that he could do. When I asked about the inflated interest amount, he laughed and mocked me stating that I knew nothing about finance and how the mortgage interests rates work. He refused to help me in anyway ; even when I asked if he could simply provide the documents as proof. 

I felt overwhelmed and defeated, so I reached out to the new service agents at XXXX mortgage servicer to see what they could do. They asked me to try their modification process so I began that at the end of XXXX. I sent all of the documents they requested over the next 12 weeks. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a denial letter. They gave me the options of short sale or deed in lieu of foreclosure. I called them to ask for more assistance, and they stated they could not help me because I had a variable interest rate. This was quite shocking to me because I have never had a variable interest rate, only a fixed. So, they stated, they received documentation from PHH that I had a variable interest rate and there was nothing they could do to change it. Unlike times before, this agent was helpful and did allow me to provide her proof of the modification and fixed interest rate. However, she stated unless they sent it there would be nothing they could to honor it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I luckily was able to find the notary who signed the documents for me. She provided the mailing confirmation of the mod agreement. So, I contacted a rep at PHH. She was friendly and helpful. I asked her could she look for the signed notary agreement in my file and she found it! I was relieved, but also saddened that this information had been there all along. She said the modification was received by mail and uploaded in the system on XX/XX/XXXX. 

To date, I am still in limbo with my loan because both companies are refusing to acknowledge the modification agreement that was supposed to be in place. It was only never confirmed because my relationship for the manager did not submit and complete my file when we spoke on XX/XX/XXXX. Now the mistake of one person and their refusal to try to correct their error has my family at risk of losing our home. It is devastating, emotionally stressful, and causing my husband and I much psychological pain.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A homeowner claims PHH Mortgage Servicing failed to transfer a loan modification agreement to a new servicer, resulting in a nearly $10,000 error in the default amount. Despite finding the signed agreement, both companies refuse to acknowledge it, putting the homeowner at risk of losing their home.

Sub-issue: Delays with the closing process
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complainant is the seller of a house under a VA loan and is attempting to sell the house to a buyer via assumption of the existing VA loan ; the buyer is an eligible XXXX XXXX member of the U.S. armed forces. Complainant has repeatedly contacted lender for updated estimates of assumption approval timeline, but lender refuses to respond to complainant despite assumption review time exceeding 105 days as of the date of this complaint. Excessive assumption review time is causing financial detriment to buyer and preventing seller from obtaining new VA loan, and refusal of lender to communicate with seller is causing repeated contract revisions for sale of home with associated financial uncertainty. Complainant and buyer have exemplary credit scores with no known factors causing or suggesting ineligibility for transfer of a VA loan. 

Complainant initially submitted a request for VA loan transfer to lender on XX/XX/year>, completed submission of all requested information to lender by XX/XX/year>, and received confirmation that all required documents were received on XX/XX/year> from lender " XXXX XXXX '' representative. The buyer contacted lender on or around XX/XX/year> to discuss particulars of loan assumption, but no further indication of progress toward approval was given. Complainant contacted the lender via phone on XX/XX/year> to request an update on the status of the loan review and was told that the loan XXXX was still reviewing information, and that the average approval timeline was 90 days from the date of request. Complainant again contacted the lender via phone on XX/XX/year> to request an update on the status of the loan review and was told that a loan XXXX had contacted the buyer on or around XX/XX/year> ( THIS IS NOT A FACTUAL STATEMENT ), and complainant was again told that the loan XXXX was still reviewing information, although approval was expected within XXXX week and a callback should be expected within that timeframe. Complainant contacted the lender via phone on XX/XX/year> after no callback or notification of approval was received, and lender again advised that no update was available ; a request for callback was placed on this date with the lender advising that a callback should be expected within XXXX business days. Complainant contacted lender via phone on XXXX XXXX, XXXX  after no callback was received, and lender again advised that the average approval timeline was within 90 days of the assumption request, and that the callback request had been received. Realty agents for complainant and buyer have been authorized as XXXX parties for access to assumption and loan information, but have also been unable to speak with any member of lender 's " XXXX XXXX '' despite repeated calls to lender. No further contact or updates from lender have been received by complainant, buyer, or the realty agents for complainant or buyer.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The complainant, a seller, is experiencing delays in the VA loan assumption process, exceeding 105 days. The lender has refused to provide updates despite repeated requests, causing financial uncertainty and preventing the seller from obtaining a new VA loan.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
Its come to my attention I was passed over in the Wells Fargo Mortgage denials remuneration program. Ive never received any info and I really should have. The fact I didnt allow my house to be stolen from me so they could steal my equity doesnt negate the fact they ultimately forced me out of my handicapped-accessible home and caused me massive hardships by denying loan modifications twice. 

I was unfairly denied the mortgagemodification offered to me by Wells Fargo in XXXX, and I was unfairly denied XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX program in XXXX, causing me to give up the home that was suited to my XXXX andinto a much harder situation. 

Wells Fargo forced me to continue to pay a higher mortgage rather than helping me do better, as was offered to me. The government paid forth for mortgage companies like Wells Fargo to help people like me. Wells Fargo decided that I wasnt worthy of paying {$600.00} per month, so they forced me to continue to pay {$1000.00} per month, and by effect, forced me out of the home I could have stayed in had I been helped as was offered to me. 

Despite a credit score of XXXX, flawlessly never missing a payment to WF or any creditor my entire life and to date, I was denied. Despite the fact I kept paying even in hardship, I was denied- twice. I had already spent XXXX  years showing I had been responsible with my mortgage despite fluctuating income - I just needed a modification to help for the time being, and it was being offered to me! The mortgage still would have been paid in full in the end. In fact, it probably would have been paid off to date - I should be mortgage-free now. 

It came to my attention that those with equity were targeted for denial because Wells Fargo would rather squeeze the homeowner out and take back the house to cash in on the equity by reselling the house to someone else. At the time I had around $ XXXX in equity. 

The modification would have afforded me the ability to stay in my modified home for the past XXXX years, as well as continue to grow my equity. Wells Fargo set me up to fail when they could have helped me. The repercussions were steep and continue to be so. I experienced further losses and hardship in moving, in living in a non-modified home, and they robbed me of what would have been my continued equity in the process, as well as a life in a far better neighborhood. 

As a single, XXXX mom Wells Fargo effectively forcedme out of my home and disrupted everything mydaughter everknew. It forced me into a house that, to thisday, I can not reach theone bathroom within due to my XXXX. If you'd like to know what that entails, you better be prepared for that answer. 

It also forced my daughter to change schools andlose her friends for her XXXX year. To add insult to injury, it leftme living in a drug and gunfire-filled neighborhood. Thankyou. We could have stayed in our good home with the modification and my daughter could have graduated with her class and I would be living in a safe, accessible home right now. Wells Fargo deeply affected my life and my daughter 's life.My life matters. My daughters life matters. Today that house is worth approximately {$350000.00}, representing a lost equity value to me of {$160000.00}. I could have stayed and paid the mortgage off over time with a modification and been holding that equity. 

As a result, I'm asking for {$160000.00} in the lost equity I would have gained had mortgage modification been allowed as offered. Im not looking to punish Wells Fargo further despite it being warranted. I want my lost equity, and I want to cap it at this time and place. 

I was a good customer. Wells Fargo took advantage and hurt me on multiple counts. I have never recovered financially or physically from having to rehome myself to a lesser-quality home, and my daughter has never forgiven me for ruining her XXXX year.In fact, she doesnt speak to me anymore. As she is my only remaining family member I can not begin to tell you the sadness I live with every day, how much I love and miss her, and my family, and now in a house that causes me pain and barriers every day as well. Have I suffered enough? 

My relief ask is {$160.00}, XXXX in my mortgage case. This will allow me to make the necessary changes to move on with my life as much as possible. Both denials were under my former last name. 

FYI I also experienced Wells Fargos embezzlement fraud, and somehow they seem to think that {$180.00} covers all that. It doesnt. I would have been in jail for felony embezzlement for a long time and paid stiff fines had I stolen from Wells Fargo. 

Please show me that Wells Fargo is committed to fixing these mistakes swiftly and to improving the lives, faith, and trust of those who were harmed.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges Wells Fargo unfairly denied them a mortgage modification, forcing them to give up their handicapped-accessible home and causing financial hardship. They claim the bank prioritized taking back homes with equity, resulting in a loss of $160,000 in potential equity.
