Narrative Summary: A consumer paid off a loan, but due to a transfer of ownership to Specialized Loan Services (SLS), the payoff was not processed, resulting in potential additional interest charges. The consumer seeks help to resolve the issue and avoid extra interest.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Narrative Summary: A homeowner received a $710 check from Roundpoint for leftover escrow funds, but it was misplaced and expired. Roundpoint claimed to have sent the funds to the county, but the county denied receiving them, and Roundpoint has failed to provide written proof despite multiple requests.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative: After further review from a previous complaint it looks like the mortgage company has placed a stop payment on a check to a company I did not authorize. Now they have been returned that check and have decided to find another company to send the check too which, again, I have not authorized payment too. Im not sure what the mortgage companies malfunctions are or why they are continuing to find random insurance companies to send my money to but my next step is going to be to get a lawyer involved because this is ridiculous.
Narrative Summary: The mortgage company placed a stop payment on a check sent to an unauthorized insurance company, then sent the check to another unauthorized company. The consumer did not authorize either payment and is considering seeking a lawyer due to the company's repeated errors.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: There is a pending underwriting review for a new mortgage assistance application that has been assigned underwriting review since XX/XX/year>. We have yet to receive any communication and have made multiple attempts to call XXXX to speak with the mortgage assistance team. Each phone call forwards to a voicemail for an agent named XXXX. Although a voicemail has been left by both myself and the primary borrower we do have not received a call back to be able to obtain information about the status of our review. I attempted calling to reach a customer service agent but was transferred to the same line that went to voicemail. We have been struggling to to get in contact with PHH to get information about the current review and I am not sure if it is retaliation for filing the previous complaint.
Narrative Summary: A mortgage assistance application has been under review since a specified date, but the consumer has received no communication despite multiple calls to PHH. Calls are forwarded to a voicemail with no callback, leaving the consumer uncertain about the review's status.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the application process
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX owns properties. We wanted to refinance XXXX. Property XXXX ( XXXX ) initiated the process with my bank ( US BANK ) whom I have a XXXX relationship with. Approximately XX/XX/year> I began correspondence with individuals at US BANK regarding refinancing XXXX of our buildings. All correspondence was done via email and their portal. Before initiating the entire process I asked if email correspondence would be sufficient due to my mother being elderly. I was assured this would not be a problem. If and when closing time arose we agreed, individuals would visit the house where mom lives, to close..sign docs ... etc. Over XXXX documents were submitted via their portalFast forward to the end of XX/XX/year>, we decided the rate they were presenting was not favorable. Refinancing into a higher rate was not going to happen. Owner said no. We pulled out of the refinance and decided not to continue. US BANK became aggressive and wanted to bypass me to talk to her. US BANK started calling and emailing daily. I inquired why? US BANK stated they just wanted to talk to her. All correspondence was relayed to the owner. Final conversation with US BANK person now heading the loan became impassioned. XXXX weeks later the SHERIFF visited our residence consecutive days investigating a criminal complaint regarding elderly abuse. Upon speaking with the owner they determined the the allegations had no merit. 
Someone at US BANK intentionally forwarded this attempted loan to XXXX XXXX XXXX citing Elderly Abuse. They never spoke with her to commence the loan and only called when we decided to back out. There are emails during the duration of the loan stating how we did not want to go through with the loan due to the high rates. I cooperated with every aspect of the loan they required. Mom does not communicate much over the phone but had no problem with them coming out upon closing if necessary. Which it would be necessary. I feel it was vindictive because we backed out. I have reached out to US BANK and they stated that there is no proof they were they ones who called. I did not attempt to refinance with anyone else. US BANK members filed a false police report. At no other time during the duration of the loan did they feel any elder was being abused until no monies was taken and the loan attempt was concluded.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleged that US Bank filed a false police report of elderly abuse after they backed out of a refinancing deal due to unfavorable rates. The bank had previously assured the consumer that email correspondence was sufficient and that they would visit the elderly owner's home for closing.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Application denials
Consumer complaint narrative: Navy Federal has discriminated against veterans by denying VA loan applications without sending explanation.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: Navy Federal allegedly discriminated against veterans by denying VA loan applications without providing explanations, sparking concerns about unfair treatment and lack of transparency in the loan review process.

Sub-issue: Applying for or obtaining a modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or deed-in-lieu
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX Freedom Mortgage has generally been a reliable partner, so I found it surprising to encounter issues during recent phone calls. 

During the week of XX/XX/XXXX, I reached out to inquire about our options since we had fallen XXXX months behind on payments. During the call, I was informed that I could either spread the missed payments over the next XXXX months or add them to the back half of the loan, and possibly even add a third missed payment, to the latter portion of the loan. The representative mentioned that a packet containing further details would be sent. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called again to inquire about the status of the packet. The lady I spoke with informed me that I had been approved for a loan XXXX, which involved adding XXXX months of missed payments to the end of the mortgage. However, due to the outstanding balance exceeding XXXX XXXX of the principal, which was around {$450000.00}, adding a third missed payment would result in an increase in the interest rate from XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX for the duration of the loan. 

My concern arises from the discrepancy between what the first representative mentionedadding XXXX or XXXX paymentsand the terms presented during the second call. If we were to add XXXX payments to the end of the loan, we would remain at the XXXX XXXX interest rate with a monthly payment of {$3200.00}. However, according to Freedom 's calculations, opting for the XXXX loan XXXX would escalate the interest rate to XXXX XXXX, resulting in a {$1000.00} increase in monthly payments. 

Furthermore, I sought clarification on the current amount added to the outstanding balance within the XXXX XXXX threshold. Despite previously undergoing a loan modification during the XXXX pandemic, a monthly payment of {$3200.00} for XXXX months totals {$76000.00}, suggesting that there should still be sufficient room within the XXXX XXXX limit. 

In summary, it appears that the terms presented by XXXX Freedom Mortgage are advantageous for them. We require all three missed payments to be added to the end of the mortgage or, alternatively, the XXXX and XXXX payments added to enable us to make the XXXX payment.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer is disputing the terms presented by Freedom Mortgage for adding missed payments to their loan. The initial representative offered two options, but the second representative revealed a third option would increase the interest rate, contradicting the initial offer, resulting in a $1000 monthly payment increase.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the loan closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
The loan was paid off in full on XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX. After not receiving escrow funds remaining as a refund after 20 business days I have repeatedly emailed and called mortgage company to request those funds be returned to me. The mortgage company made claims of having sent a check with no tracking number or ability to ensure delivery. On XX/XX/XXXX representatives of the mortgage company claimed they were issuing an ACH transferred to my bank account. That money was never received. I have documentation as proof of my repeated requests and their delays or vague answers on when the money would be returned to me. 

As of the state, I still have not received my refund which totals {$3500.00}. Not a small amount for a retiree on Social Security.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid off a mortgage in full and has not received a refund of $3500 in escrow funds. Despite repeated emails and calls, the mortgage company claims to have sent a check and then an ACH transfer, but the consumer has not received the refund.

Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
During the process of securing to refinance my property I negotiated a cash to closing amount of {$11000.00} which was agreed upon with Rapid Mortgage. I have in hand a Closing Disclosure document with that figure clearly stated. The Closing disclosure document is dated XX/XX/XXXX. The closing date is XX/XX/XXXX and the disbursement date on the document is XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I met with a Notary to finalize our agreement, however, the closing document she presented had {$9900.00} as the Cash to Close amount. I immediately called Rapid Mortgage and spoke to a person who identified himself as the owner and said his name was XXXX. When told of the discrepancy between what we agreed and what was on the final document, XXXX XXXX said that there is a mistake on this document and that the Notary charges have been overstated by the difference. He then assured me that prior to my having to make my first mortgage payment ( due XX/XX/XXXX ) that he would send me a check and/or transfer the {$1000.00} difference to my account. 

I have placed several phone calls to XXXX XXXX and he has repeatedly promise that the check is in the mail. To date I have not received the difference. 

I feel that I have been lied to and cheated. This company has actually stolen {$1000.00} from me.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner refinanced with Rapid Mortgage, agreeing to a $11,000 cash-to-close amount. However, the final document showed $9,900, a $1,000 discrepancy. The owner promised to send the difference, but despite multiple assurances, the homeowner has not received the $1,000.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Delays in the application process
Consumer complaint narrative: I started a loan assumption with Wells Fargo in XX/XX/year>, in XXXX I started sending information to XXXX XXXX to be sent to underwriting. I was given a closing date of XX/XX/year> at the beginning of XXXX. I am still being requested to send documents to be sent to underwriting. Recently I was asked for pay stubs from XXXX!!! Why wasn't that asked for months ago? In general, they just keep asking for more bank statements, then more checks, I keep providing the information and they just keep asking. This is getting very frustrating for me and the seller who is stuck in the hospital and can't afford hospital bill and to keep paying the current mortgage.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer is frustrated with Wells Fargo's loan assumption process, which started in XXXX. Despite providing numerous documents, the bank continues to request more information, including pay stubs from months prior, delaying the closing and causing financial strain for the seller.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, We closed on our property on XX/XX/XXXX. Our loan was transferred to Fay Servicing soon after. Somehow, we did not receive a tax bill for the year. Upon visiting our county website, we found that Fay had covered our property tax bill of {$7000.00}. We contacted Fay Servicing and were provided the option to pay the bill online. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, on the Fay website, we selected to make a payment to escrow to cover our property taxes bill which Fay paid. On the Fay servicing website, we selected the option to apply the payment of {$7000.00} to our escrow account in order to repay the tax bill. There was an option to apply the payment to principal - WE DID NOT SELECT THIS OPTION. My husband and I are tech-savvy and were careful not to make that selection. 

In early XXXX, We received notification from Fay that our mortgage payment was going to be increased due to now having been placed in escrow. Given we made a payment to avoid this, we contacted Fay. We were then informed that the payment we made to escrow was applied to the principal, not the escrow as we selected. In addition, they are now going to add an escrow account and increase our mortgage payment from {$5400.00} to {$7000.00}. We did not sign off on this. We asked Fay to reverse the principal payment as that was not our error or what it was intended for. The team informed us they were unable to reverse the principal application because the funds had already been disbursed to investors. Theres been an error in how Fay Servicing applied our payment. We have contacted Fay Servicing several times in the past few weeks to resolve this issue to no avail. We called and were asked to call back on XX/XX/XXXX, then when we call to follow-up, were asked to call back on XX/XX/XXXX, then we followed-up and were asked to call back on XX/XX/XXXX. Again on XX/XX/XXXX and was told they had put in a request and to call back on XX/XX/XXXX. It seems they have no intention of resolving this issue and instead are attempting to force us into escrow. 

We have informed Fay of a Notice of Error and have asked Fay to have the payment we made ( {$7000.00} ) applied to the initial tax payment as intended and have the escrow removed. We would appreciate your attention on this issue, thank you.
Narrative Summary: A homeowner made a $7,000 payment to Fay Servicing's website, selecting the option to apply it to their escrow account for property taxes. However, Fay applied the payment to the principal instead, and now refuses to reverse the error, citing that the funds have been disbursed to investors.

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: The insurance payment for the mortgage increased and it wasnt communicated in a timely or efficient manner. They held 2 payments and returned a third payment. I didnt learn that the payment was short until my other bank informed me that my credit score dropped XXXX XXXX due to a late payment. I supposed have a platinum account and they robo-called me instead of directly contacting me or leaving a message to return the call for an important message regarding the account.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's insurance payment for their mortgage increased without timely notification, resulting in a short payment. The bank held two payments, returned a third, and didn't directly contact the consumer, leading to a late payment and a drop in their credit score.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative: NewRez keeps asserting that there is no Flood Coverage since XXXX This year they sent the escrow into a negative balance, falsified amount paid and has refused to correct their mistake
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: NewRez allegedly falsified escrow payments, resulting in a negative balance, and refused to correct the error. The issue is also linked to a dispute over flood coverage, which NewRez claims was not in effect since a certain date (XXXX).

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had fraud on my bank account in XXXX of XXXX and my account was blocked and payments did not clear. I asked Oportun for some sort of arrangement. 
they said we have a hardship/deferment program. I was on this program for 3 monthsXXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. I was then told that I owe over {$650.00} and had to pay back the entire 3 months worth. There were no terms given regarding this program. I have also had several emails offering payment reduction, postponed payment and hardship program and when I call, I am told that I do not qualify for any. while I was in the program, I received constant collection calls from Oportun. 

I have several times for a copy of the original loan/terms copy of the hardship/deferment  terms and a complete account history/ledger of when payment are made, what portion is towards principal etc. 
I have not received anything and can not access it online either. 
Lastly, the interest rate is higher than 36 %. 

Oportun has not disclosed pertinent information about my loan and placed me on a program with not terms and they refuse to send me any information list above and lastly have mis advertised.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Oportun misled them about a hardship program, which they joined for 3 months, only to be told they owed $650. No terms were provided, and despite promises of payment reductions, they received collection calls. The consumer also alleges high interest rates and lack of transparency.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: Companies marketing materials were incomplete and inaccurate. They advertised that my first payment was XX/XX/24 but failed to make it clear that ALL previous interest on the loan would be charged on XX/XX/24. They intentionlly obfuscated important information about interest charges.
Narrative Summary: A consumer complained that a company's marketing materials were incomplete and inaccurate, failing to clearly disclose that all previous interest on a loan would be charged on a specific date (XX/XX/24), intentionally hiding important information about interest charges.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2024 in an attempt to get help with my tax file. XXXX XXXX XXXX charged me roughly {$4200.00} and referred me to agents of XXXX XXXXSpecial Financing CoXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  for setup of an installment loan for this amount. On XX/XX/2024 I paid {$270.00} and subsequently received a statement of denial from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2024. I was charged {$270.00} again XX/XX/2024 and on XX/XX/2024. I should not have paid and subsequently be charged for payments on a denied installment loan that does not exist. I am seeking a refund of {$820.00} reflecting all monies paid to date and would like removal of adverse remarks and inquiries on my credit file.
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid $270 three times ($820 total) for an installment loan setup by XXXX Special Financing Co after being referred by XXXX XXXX XXXX for a $4200 tax file service. The loan was denied, yet the consumer was charged. The consumer seeks a $820 refund and removal of adverse credit marks.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
NetCredit has been erroneously charging me 26 statements/fees a year, instead of 24. Their agreement states that if you are paid bi-weekly, you get charged 26/year, and 24/year. I am paid bi-weekly and I have that in my profile so I should charged 24/statements ( FEES ) a year, not 26. I asked them numerous times to update this, as recently as filing a formal compliant on XX/XX/XXXX, and they've failed to do so. I've also asked that they refund me the fees for the extra billing cycles they've charged me, and they've failed to do so. 

This is my last step to try to resolve this before I go on XXXX and other social media sites and post my experience, and then refer this to my attorney to file a lawsuit against NetCredit.
Narrative Summary: NetCredit is charging the consumer 26 statements/fees per year, despite their bi-weekly pay schedule, which should be 24/year according to the agreement. The consumer has repeatedly requested correction and refund for extra fees, but NetCredit has failed to comply.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I took out a loan for solar installation with goodleap. The loan was structured to pay down to a target balance after 16 months, to keep the monthly payment the same or ; if it was not paid down to the target balance it would increase to a higher monthly payment amount. 

I contacted the company back in XXXX to determine the exact amount I needed to pay to reach the target amount and was told I would receive a letter closer to the due date XX/XX/XXXX. I waited and never received the letter. I called back and was told the amount I needed to pay XX/XX/XXXX to keep my monthly payment the same. I paid the company on XX/XX/XXXX, the exact amount requested, which they confirmed they received and has cleared my bank. 

I then received notification, late XXXX, that my monthly amount due was increasing and on XX/XX/XXXX and they would draft the higher amount. I contacted the company immediately, provided all information requested, and was told that the information was sent to the accounting department and someone would call me back after investigating. Since then I have called back and been told the exact same thing several times. 

Today, I checked my bank and noticed that the higher amount was drafted. I contacted GoodLeap and again was told that the Accounting Dept. was investigating. I asked to speak to someone in the Accounting Department and was told that I can not be transferred. I believe that this company may be taking advantage of unsuspecting consumers. They need to be investigated.
Narrative Summary: A consumer took out a GoodLeap loan for solar installation with a target balance to be paid after 16 months to maintain the same monthly payment. Despite paying the exact amount requested by the company, the monthly payment increased, and the consumer has been unable to resolve the issue with GoodLeap's accounting department.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: This company went out of business in XXXX but expects customers to keep paying though they did not complete service. I have contacted them and sent a Demand Letter stating they are in breach of contract for not fulfilling sales agreement. They stated a guarantee that if they could not complete service you will not have to complete payment. The company has been taken over my Healthcare Finance Direct. I put a stop payment through my bank for XXXX XXXX, a couple months later Healthcare Finance Direct withdrew the XXXX months from my account. I contacted my bank to find out who the service was to find out it's the company trying to continue collection. I have spoken and written to them and they say continue paying or you will go to credit. I asked my bank to stop payment to Healthcare Finance Direct then I sent a Letter of Demand. The day they responded to my Demand Letter they billed my account for XXXX transactions. I have written them again stating please no longer bill my account and send me to collections. I am not certain what to do but there are many people who they have done this to. I did not complete treatment and I now have to go to a XXXX  to fix an issue with my bite that wasn't there before.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims a company, now taken over by Healthcare Finance Direct, breached contract by not completing service despite a guarantee of no payment if service wasn't fulfilled. The company continues to bill and threaten credit damage, despite the consumer's stop payment requests and demand letters.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I was in a position that I had to take a loan with Spotloan due to unseen circumstances regarding my employment and I could not get a loan anywhere else. They were great for that, however I lost my employment over a period of 18 months without financial assistance from anyone else or unemployment benefits ( due a 2020 over payment ) as they denied my claim. I got cut off from everyone in my life due to my lifestyle as a XXXX XXXX and my unfortunate circumstances regarding employment as they felt it was the same pattern over and over. In addition, I lost my car and my home. I explained to them that I was unable to pay anything back even {$5.00}, they still did not care, I gave them several chances to make this right and forgive the debt as I do not have $ XXXX to pay towards anything and that my future income as well my current income which {$0.00} would not allow any further debt repayment to them. THIS THEIR LAST CHANCE BEFORE COURT!!!
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: A consumer took a loan from Spotloan due to employment issues, but lost their job, car, and home. Despite explaining their inability to pay, even $5, Spotloan refused to forgive the debt, prompting the consumer to threaten court action if the issue isn't resolved.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I reached out to OneMain Financial to see what we could do to work out to clear up my past payments. i was advised that I needed to make a XXXX payment for the current month ( XXXX ) and a full payment in XXXX ( paid XX/XX/2024 ). I received a call on the XXXX stating that I was still a month behind. When I advised that this wasn't what we we agreed upon and the calls were recorded it was stated that they would call me back. I received a call on XX/XX/2024 stating that I would either need to refinance my loan or pay another payment. When asked about the recordings, it was never acknowledged or they didn't want to discuss it.
Narrative Summary: The consumer complained about OneMain Financial's inconsistent payment instructions. After agreeing on a payment plan, the consumer was told they were still behind, despite making the agreed-upon payments. The company refused to acknowledge or discuss recorded calls that supported the consumer's claims.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/24 I informed Netcredit that I was being represented by an attorney regarding this debt. I gave them the name and address of the attorney via phone and email. I was told by Netcredit that I needed to get power of attorney for them to speak with my attorney regarding this debt. My attorney informed me that according to FDCPA 15 USC 1692 c 804 ( 6 ) and 805 ( 2 ) and Florida Statute 559.72 ( 18 ) that all I need to do is provide them the attorney information. This is not a bankruptcy attorney nor a debt consolidation attorney. This is a personal consumer rights attorney. They must direct further collections to him.
Narrative Summary: Complainant informed Netcredit they're represented by a consumer rights attorney, but Netcredit demanded power of attorney to communicate with the attorney, despite the complainant's attorney citing FDCPA and Florida statutes stating only attorney information is required.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024 my bank ( XXXX ) sent a payoff check to SoFi in the amount of {$17000.00} ( see payoff letter, attached ). The check was sent on XX/XX/2024 via XXXX XXXX and received by SoFi on XX/XX/2024 and signed by XXXX XXXX ( see proof of delivery, attached ). The check was lost and the bank had to send a second check which Sofi received on XX/XX/XXXX. They are now charging me another {$100.00} because they could not find check.
Narrative Summary: A bank sent a $17,000 payoff check to SoFi, which was lost. After resending the check, SoFi received it but charged the customer an additional $100 for their inability to locate the original check.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I am writing to report a case of identity theft and fraud that has significantly impacted my financial well-being. The company " Koalafi '' opened a fraudulent account in my name on XX/XX/year>. I did not authorize or initiate this account, and I am seeking your assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring it is removed from my credit report. 

Details of the Fraudulent Account : Account Name : Koalafi Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Nature of Fraud : Unauthorized account opening Impact : Adverse effect on my credit report and financial reputation Amount : {$2400.00}
Narrative Summary: A consumer reports identity theft and fraud by Koalafi, which opened a $2,400 unauthorized account in their name on a specific date, negatively impacting their credit report and financial reputation.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Good morning, This complaint is concerning Affirm and took place on XX/XX/year>. I wish I had known about this sooner but I just saw the story regarding the court ruling. Is this retroactive to a filing date? Please include my email or any information in the public comment currently being collected. I am happy to discuss this further or even provide comments in person should it help in any way. 

My wife and I booked a XXXX stay for our XXXX anniversary in Florida with our kids. A little over one week prior to check in my wife and I contracted XXXX. We contacted the XXXX host and advised them of our situation. We were advised that we could reschedule for a future stay by the hose. Based on our documented comment from the XXXX hose we cancelled with XXXX online. We then recontacted the XXXX host regarding rescheduling and never heard from the host again. Since the XXXX host offered the future stay but was obviously avoiding us we contacted XXXX to continue with our scheduled reservation for our adult children. This was well before the scheduled check in. XXXX directed us to the host who has never replied to us since the documented offer of a future stay. 

On XX/XX/year> we filed a dispute with Affirm for load ID # XXXX since the service was never delivered and the host quit communicating with us prior to our scheduled check in date. We were still charged cleaning fees and Florida resort taxes even though we were never there. After providing documentation, timelines and several communications with Affirm we were still required to pay {$5700.00} for a service we had never received. Affirm denied our dispute on XX/XX/year>. 


Thank you so much, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer booked a stay in Florida through a host but had to cancel due to illness. Despite the host offering a future stay, they stopped communicating. The consumer disputed the $5,700 charge with Affirm, citing undelivered service, but was still required to pay after providing documentation and multiple communications.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Money was taken from your bank account on the wrong day or for the wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative: Speedy Cash has issued some sort of garnishment on any funds in any account with my name on it. I contacted the person XXXX XXXXwho withdrew the funds, since its under an individuals name and not under speedy cash. They couldnt provide any information and couldnt validate the reason for withdrawing over {$4700.00} from my account. This if the second attempt, XXXX XXXX returned the funds to my account. XXXX XXXX released the funds to this person. And now funds I had in XXXX XXXX have been blocked.
Narrative Summary: Speedy Cash issued a garnishment on the consumer's accounts, allowing an individual to withdraw over $4,700 without providing a valid reason. The funds were initially returned, but then blocked again, with the individual unable to validate the withdrawal.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Facts : I applied online for a PERSONAL LOAN of {$10000.00} XX/XX/XXXX. 

Facts : I received an ADVERSE ACTION LETTER ON XX/XX/XXXX saying I was denied {$10000.00} credit. 

Facts : I looked into my credit report to discover that SOFI BANK, XXXX. had an INQUIRY request funds from my application from the Federal Reserve. 

I, XXXX XXXX XXXX. a natural person applied for extension of my own credit to SOFI BANK, XXXX I was denied an extension of my own credit Adverse actions against a consumer is AGAINST THE LAW according to the Equal Credit Opportunity Act which is codified in the 15 U.S.C. 1691c and is pursuant to civil liability under 15 U.S.C. 1691k You are subject to criminal liability for violating 15 U.S.C. 1691 as I have proof that I was discriminated against by SOFI BANK, N.A. due to the response I received.

SOFI BANK, N.A. is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1642, U.S.C. 1681m and 12 CFR 1002 because I, the consumer, made an application in good faith, but credit was not issued.

Furthermore, because my social security number ( credit card ) or Social Security XXXX XXXX XXXX was used but did not receive equal consideration. I looked at my Credit Report when I notice that SOFI BANK, N.A. had cashed in the my application with one of the Federal Reserve Banks but did not give me the {$10000.00} PERSONAL LOAN I requested. I know that this is true because I received INQUIRY NOTE SOFI BANK, N.A.. Again, I received NO benefit this is proof of fraudulent activity ( unauthorized use of credit card ) on behalf of SOFI BANK , N.A .

If SOFI BANK, N.A. fails to make any reasonable procedures to resolve this matter and compensate me for the use of my credit card, please demand SOFI BANK, N.A. to send a notice of dishonor accompanied with any applicable law, code, policy or provision that states you and your agency have no capacity to deny credit to the applicant or I will indeed make SOFI BANK, N.A. criminally and civilly liable for all actual damages pursuant to 15 USC 1681n and USC 1681o.

Facts : I have sent SOFI BANK, N.A. a Non-Negotiable Adverse Action of Credit letter to open up the communication to solve this matter on XX/XX/XXXX via email to XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BANK, N.A. and Certified letter with return receipt, with was received on XX/XX/XXXX Facts : I am sent the second email Non- Negotiable Notice of Adverse Action Opportunity to Cure to SOFI BANK , N.A XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and will Certified mail the Second letter today XX/XX/XXXX. 

I hope that we can resolve the matter as soon as possible. Thank you for your time. 

XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer applied for a $10,000 personal loan from SoFi Bank, was denied, and received an adverse action letter. They claim the denial was discriminatory, violating the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, and that SoFi Bank used their credit application for unauthorized purposes.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
" When we closed your account per your request, we followed all applicable procedures. Regretfully, these did not include a disclosure about the possibility of opening future accounts. " They are still refusing me credit, and want me to be accountable for their own employee, not disclosing to me at the time of my request to close or pause my credit line, that any closure will result in blacklist of any future account? I wonder how this legal and not injustice to myself and my business... This is ironic and disrespectful. At least, for once, they are admitting that their employee did disclose to me that I will not be eligible to open any future account. How come this is my fault, and not their fault.??? I am pretty sure, that they are doing this to more people. 


" When we perform an evaluation of an application for credit, we consider many economic factors as well as individual account information. Unfortunately, this means that not all applications are approved to manage our risk. " I have been a customer of American Express since XXXX ... Tell me, when I never paid my credit and if I ever abused of the credit card line extended to myself or my business.. I am actually under using them and my credit score and my agency credit score are above average... Which risk are you guys monitoring, other than personal vendetta for asking to speak to a supervisor to get my right respected ....

I want this situation to be investigated by a 3rd party and to have this company respect my right to a fair credit application process without personal and emotional discrimination against me or my family. I want them to review my business file for a credit line increase consideration based on my company data. I want my original credit line reopened to me ... as it was not closed properly. The person that handle my account did not follow all the disclosure while closing my account. I was not informed, if I closed or paused the account. I could never reapply for any future accounts. I will share this response with my lawyer where for once, it is not verbal, but written admission, that the company did not disclose to me at the time, of my request to close or pause my {$2000.00} credit line... that I could not be eligible for any future account, " while the same company gave me a XXXX credit card at higher rates .... using the same business data and information ", since 2 supervisors already confirmed that the call was not recorded ... but they trust their employee should have done a better job... 

This is not my fault and I am not responsible for the incomplete information. My decision to continue with the pause or closure of my then, credit line, was based on false information. I formally request that my credit line get restored my business and I am also asking for a credit reconsideration since the {$2000.00} approval did not follow proper procedures ... .. some business that was worth a fraction of my business were approved for more than XXXX at that time, while I only got {$2000.00} and this was the original complaint that led to my incomplete account closure I want the law to be respected and I want my application to be given fair and due process. Please and Thank you.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims American Express refused to approve a new credit application due to a prior account closure. They allege the employee didn't disclose that closing the account would prevent future approvals, and now they're being penalized for the company's mistake.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: When I checked my credit report, a list of lenders was presented as " outstanding approval odds '' The message read as follows through XXXX XXXX  : " You have Outstanding Approval Odds for {$32000.00} Many members use loans to pay off debt, which often helps their score '' I thought this was my opportunity to pay off a few small debts I have, and stay with one small monthly payment, so I was confident that it was going to be a smooth transaction process. Therefore, the company that I felt familiarized with was One Main Financial ; so, I requested a loan of only {$4500.00} from them. Unfortunately, the process took various days ( approximately XXXX days ) ; representatives would constantly call me to request documents, such as check stubs, student loan screen shots of my balance, payment status, etc., which I immediately submitted. Then, today, I received their last call, and I was notified that unfortunately I do not qualify for the requested loan due to my " outstanding '' student loans ( which I am not paying back yet, and I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ). According to them, even if I was " pre-approved '' I am now disqualified for the requested loan, and this has now created a new dent on my credit line due to being a hard inquiry. Where are the good news at being " pre-approved '' for a personal loan? Being pre-approved made me believe I just needed to present basic documents, sign, date and bam ( either a deposit or a check to cash or deposit ). I strongly believe customers are being misled with One Main Financial via XXXX XXXX. I have a job of XXXX years, I possess a XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am still a XXXX trying to pursue my XXXX XXXX XXXX, plus I make my payments on time, which is reflected on my credit report as XXXX % on time. However, these individuals are lying, and causing for people to lower their self-esteem, waste their time, lower their credit score, among other emerging issues related to misled information and broken promises. I would like to submit this complaint since I am sure I am not their only victim.
Narrative Summary: The consumer was "pre-approved" for a $32,000 loan, but after applying for a $4,500 loan with One Main Financial, they were denied due to outstanding student loans. The denial resulted in a hard credit inquiry, damaging their credit score, despite being initially led to believe they were likely to be approved.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a loan with One Main Financial and I borrowed money from my local bank to pay off the One Main loan. They received the check on XX/XX/2024 and the check clearly stated not to convert the check to an ACH. They converted it anyway and failed to endorse the check correctly causing my bank to return the check for proper endorsement. While this was happening they assured me they would short pay the loan back to XX/XX/XXXX and refund the {$25.00} fee they charged me. I paid interest to XXXX banks on the same money on a situation that was not my fault. They sent a check for {$470.00} and they owe me {$750.00}. They didn't give me credit for the add on GAP protection either. The statement clearly says that should be deducted off balance owed.. XXXX and XXXX are the ones I mostly talked to, XXXX XXXX finally got a supervisor to send it to another department. They said 24 to 48 hours and it's been a week.
Narrative Summary: One Main Financial incorrectly converted a check to ACH, despite clear instructions not to, and failed to endorse it properly. This led to the check being returned, causing the consumer to pay unnecessary interest and fees. A refund of $470 was issued, but $750 is still owed.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: This in regards to financing I took out with Service Finance Company , LLC. On XX/XX/XXXX I sent a check for the balance of the loan, {$7600.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX I received notice from my bank the check had been cashed. ON XX/XX/XXXX I received a debt collection notice stating my account was 31 days past due and that I owed {$450.00} by XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately called and was transferred to a person named XXXX who explained I still owned approx. {$350.00} because of interest. I curtly informed him that was not true as my check was in the mail on XX/XX/XXXX. He said he would see what he could do. After a few minutes, he came back and let me know that they would forgo the {$350.00} and I would just have to pay a late fee of {$10.00}. I very directly refused to pay them a XXXX more and told them I know what they are doing and demanded them send me a receipt that shows this loan payed in full. I also told them I will be filing a complaint with the CFBP and if I threatened legal action if I receive any more debt notices or if any late fees or collection shows up on my credit report.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid off a $7,600 loan with Service Finance Company via check on one date, but received a debt collection notice 31 days later stating they owed $450 due to interest. The consumer disputed the claim and refused to pay a late fee after being told the interest would be waived.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Servicing of my XXXX XXXX loan was transferred to Sofi via XXXX acquisition of XXXX XXXX. I followed the instructions sent to me by XXXX and Sofi to establish my account through their XXXX portal. XXXX  and functionality of Sofi 's XXXX system is extremely limited and information is obscure and difficult to find. I contacted Sofi 's phone customer service and spoke with a representative who informed me that users couldn't update accounts or set up autopay themselves through the site due to limited functionality. The representative informed me verbally that my new checking account details had been updated ( from XXXX XXXX XXXX to XXXXXXXX XXXX  ) and that autopay had been established. Autopay failed to draft the minimum required payment as I was expecting and I'm now showing as late in their system. It's unclear if I've been charged a late fee, however the system is showing that I'm due to make a payment to Sofi for some amount that isn't my normal monthly payment amount. The system also does show that I'm 2 days late as of XX/XX/2024. 

The transition from XXXX to XXXX to Sofi has been clunky at best, and because Sofi 's XXXXXXXX XXXX  is limited in functionality and doesn't present data in an intuitive or clear/transparent manner, it's difficult to ascertain what is happening with my account. Furthermore, calling their customer service team doesn't seem to help as I tried but they've since failed to perform.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's loan servicing was transferred to Sofi after an acquisition. Despite following instructions, the consumer found Sofi's online system limited and unclear. After speaking with a representative, autopay was supposedly set up, but it failed, resulting in a late payment and unclear fees.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan

I have already settled multiple WiFi accounts that were compromised by the scammer who continues to cause damage. The scammer has managed to manipulate our account by adding over 120 days and extending it beyond the usual 30 days, with full access to all three credit bureaus. It is imperative that Star Furniture takes necessary measures to address this security breach urgently.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: I have had several of these XXXX XXXX  short term loans with possible in the past, and this one I had an emergency come up and was running low on cash, possible always has a popup in the app that says " need to reschedule your payment? '' So I decided to try it. It said this won't affect your credit and gave me several different dates to choose from in the current month And as far as XXXX months out. I rescheduled for XXXX weeks later. That payment date came around and I paid it, the next payment I decided to reschedule just to try and get everything caught back up. I chose a date that was more than XXXX  days out and The disclaimer came on the screen and said this won't affect your credit but might affect future loans with possible. I decided to take the risk, since it wouldn't hurt my credit and these loans are very expensive. Fast forward to XXXX  days before my last XXXX payments are due all the sudden possible  has reported my account XXXX days late to the credit agencies so I emailed them. They said well if its past XXXX  days your late. This is a XXXX XXXX app, why would a ) they allow me to post pone a payment so far in the future it would show late on my reports, and b ) why would I post pone for that same reason. I have worked very hard to get my credit to where it is again. Now, they have reported me delinquent even tho I payed the whole thing off the day I found out about the late reporting. I paid it XXXX  days ago and I keep getting emails saying its in default its reporting late, delinquent and deragatory on the credit reports. and the customer service will not respond and if they do its a cookie cutter response that has nothing to do with my situation.
Company public response: Company disputes the facts presented in the complaint
Narrative Summary: The consumer used Possible's loan rescheduling feature, which claimed not to affect credit scores, but the lender reported the account as late to credit agencies despite on-time payments. The consumer paid off the loan, yet Possible continues to send delinquency emails and report negative marks on their credit.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I lost my debit card and had to cancel and order another card. I contacted Solo Funds and let them know that once I received my new card I would add the card to my portal and repay the loan. I remained in contact with them when they reached out to me. When the card arrived I attempted to add the card to my portal but I kept getting error messages. I called Solo left several voicemails no one returned my calls. I sent several emails and no one responded for several days. When they finally emailed me back they sent me a XXXX invoice asking me to to repay. I told them I would not pay through XXXX because I have had fraudulent charges from them in the past. I asked them could XXXX setup a payment plan and no one responded. I sent them a email three or four times with no response. I reviewed several complaints from other borrowers on the XXXX website stating that they had issue when they attempted to add a new debit card. I am not trying to get out of paying this but I need to make payments until it is paid in full
Company public response: Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error
Narrative Summary: The consumer lost their debit card, ordered a new one, and tried to update their payment method with Solo Funds. However, they encountered error messages and were unable to get assistance from Solo Funds, despite multiple calls and emails, hindering their ability to make loan payments.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, Balance Credit added more hidden interest on my account without my knowledge. Payments were taken from my checking account. No additional information was given to me. However on XX/XX/XXXX I received threaten e-mail from XXXX XXXX XXXX on behalf of Blance Credit in which I do not understand! Balance Credit has shared my information without my permission!
Narrative Summary: Balance Credit added hidden interest to the consumer's account without notification, then shared their information with a third party, resulting in a threatening email. The consumer claims they had no knowledge of the interest or the information sharing.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a loan that was made by one of the child companies. It is called service finance. 

They have been very unresponsive. 

I've been paying extra on this loan for quite some time now. Full year. 

The initial loan was for {$20000.00}. And the interest rate was 12.99 % per annum. 

So far, I have made 12 payments, totaling {$5100.00}. 

{$2000.00} has come off of the loan. 

That leaves a balance of {$17000.00}. 

That means that in the first 12 months, {$3000.00} was interest. 

That does not make any sense, because I have paid more than the minimum almost every single month. Sometimes I've made double payments. 

It is also an effective interest rate of 15.28 %. 

Something is not right here. 

12.99 % should have been {$2500.00} of interest in that year.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims their loan with Service Finance has an excessive interest rate. Despite making extra payments totaling $5,100, only $2,000 was applied to the principal, leaving a balance of $17,000. The consumer alleges the effective interest rate is 15.28%, not the stated 12.99%.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX I went to a shop to buy a puppy, The lady that was helping me told me that I should apply to my easy pay finance to to pay in installments. so I did and got approved. she told me that I should pay it off in 90 days because if I don't I will get charged in 40 % of interest fees. so I payed all I could which was {$24000.00} and then I only had {$100.00} to pay left. I get called from easy pay and they told me that my card didn't go through and that the 90 days are over and they will now pay me interest and daily it'll go up to {$3.00} daily until its payed off. I tried my hardest to talk to someone higher than them and tried to see what I could do because I was on day 91 and they told me that they couldn't do anything about it. this all happened in the beginning of XXXX and my balanced went from {$100.00} to {$880.00} and as of today my balance is {$920.00}. My interest fee is 179 % and I'm pretty sure that's illegal because if I would've known I would have NEVER continued with easy pay.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Easy Pay Finance charged them an excessive 179% interest fee after missing a 90-day payment deadline by one day. The initial balance of $100 grew to $920 due to daily $3 interest charges, despite the consumer's efforts to resolve the issue with the company.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan

Consumer complaint narrative:
I'm a victim of identity theft, scam and fraudulent activities that resulted in financial theft during the time period of XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX after looking at my credit report I've found out that {$44000.00} loan was fraudulently taken in my name using stolen identity from Upstart. In order to resolve the fraud claim with Upstart, Upstart has requested a letter from the XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that fraudulent activity took place on my bank account. However, XXXX  XXXX XXXX refuses to generate such letter. XXXX XXXX XXXX states that it is internal bank business. Without this latter Upstart refuses to further investigate the case to come up with a resolution. 
Police reports, FTC reports, IC3 ( FBI ) and identity theft reports have been provided to Upstart.

Upstart has information such as phone number and email of the person who opened the account. This information does not belong to me.
Narrative Summary: A victim of identity theft claims a $44,000 loan was taken in their name from Upstart. To resolve the claim, Upstart requires a letter from the victim's bank confirming fraudulent activity, but the bank refuses, citing internal business.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan

They ended up charging me 700 % interest and making me pay 20 payments of {$110.00} totaling to {$2300.00}. I had no idea that they it was going to be that crazy high and it is said to be illegal in both my state and the state the online company resides in. They say in the agreement that they are a sovereign company and they can't be sued for their rate they are charging me in the loan agreement. I am struggling to make ends meet to the point I might be XXXX. I am in desperate need of help.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I gave Bestegg permission to report to the XXXX party agency but In regards to reporting negative items, According to 12 CFR 1016 and 15 USC 6802-6805. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am exercising my right to opting out. Any consent I have given whether implied spoken, unspoken, written, unwritten or otherwise is revoked and rescinded immediately and indefinitely. 

Removal of all derogatory items. 
Bestegg Shall remove all late payments past, present and futurefrom my credit report.15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) It is illegal to report transaction history. XXXX ) All inaccuracy gives reason to delete late payments past present and future. XXXX ) No permissible purpose FCRA 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ). 4 ) Privacy Act 1974 Violation. XXXX ) 15 USC 1666b Can not be reported late under an open end consumer credit plan for any purpose. Truth in lending defines open end consumer credit plan as payable in more than XXXX installments. consumer credit reporting companies can not report income on the credit report. 
BestEgg Late Payment Status I maintain that this information is solely related to transactions or experiences between myself and the reporting entity. It should be excluded from my consumer report in accordance with the FCRA 's Section 1681a, Exclusion ( A ) ( i ). I kindly request that you investigate this matter promptly in accordance with the FCRA 's provisions. Please remove the disputed information from my consumer report or update the disputed information to Paid on time /never late and provide me with a revised copy of my credit report that accurately reflects the exclusion.
Narrative Summary: The consumer is disputing Bestegg's reporting of late payments to credit agencies, citing federal laws (12 CFR 1016, 15 USC 6802-6805) that allow them to opt out of negative reporting. They demand removal of all late payments and dispute the legitimacy of the reports.

This is my verbal complaint stating the denial of funds that WERE NOT involving XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Complaint Against Executive XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for Misrepresentation of Services Dear CFPB I am writing to file a formal complaint against Executive XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX due to significant discrepancies between the services promised and those delivered, which clearly violate the terms we agreed upon at the time of enrollment. 

Despite assurances of personalized career coaching and a guaranteed job placement within a specific timeframe, the program predominantly offered generic group sessions with minimal one-on-one coaching. This substantial deviation from the promised personalized service not only adversely impacted my career progression but also led to financial losses without achieving the outlined objectives. Furthermore, XXXX failed to disclose the interest rates attached to the financing of these services, which was a crucial aspect of my financial agreement with them. 

As part of my commitment based on their assurances, I have already made significant financial outlays totaling {$4100.00}, which includes XXXX payments of {$450.00} to Special Financing LLC and an initial payment of {$500.00} directly to XXXX. These payments were made under the belief that XXXX  would deliver the personalized services as contracted. 

Given the substantial non-compliance with the agreed-upon service delivery and the lack of transparency regarding the financing terms, I request the CFPB 's assistance in investigating these practices and facilitating an appropriate resolution. I believe this investigation is crucial not only for my case but also to prevent potential future consumer harm. 

Enclosed are all relevant communications, contracts, and other documentation pertaining to my interactions with XXXX. I am seeking a fair adjustment of the financial charges based on the actual services delivered and a formal acknowledgment of the issues from XXXX 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer filed a complaint against Executive XXXX for misrepresenting services. Despite promises of personalized career coaching and job placement, the program offered mostly generic group sessions. The company also failed to disclose financing interest rates, leading to financial losses. The consumer seeks a fair adjustment of charges.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a vehicle in XX/XX/XXXX, and financing is through Toyota financial services. My payment was fixed at {$660.00}.
