This bank is committing a felony by embezzling my money. I've reported them to the AG, but there's no promise my stolen money will be returned. This isn't a private lawsuit. They're committing a crime.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Toyota Financial Services misapplied their extra payments, with most going towards interest instead of principal, despite a fixed monthly payment of $660.00 and extra payments of $700.00 via auto pay for 23 months. The consumer alleges embezzlement and has reported it to the AG.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: SOLO Funds- platform crashed after update making all information vulnerable - loans are not being debited, credited, or paid back - now I can't log in - SOLO is definitely stealing customers money and one day will be MIA - this company needs to be shut down before a lot of peoples information is either sold or stolen and their money is never to be recovered - customer service is not approachable and answers with generic falsity 's - shut down SOLO!!!!!!
Company public response: Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported that after a SOLO Funds platform update, the system crashed, leaving loan information vulnerable. Transactions were disrupted, and login access was lost. The customer accused SOLO of potential theft and mishandling customer data, citing unresponsive and dishonest customer service.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I called in to first heritage and requested a loan for XXXX. They called me back a few hours later with an approval stating they could pay off XXXX of my other accounts and give me the XXXX. I told them absolutely not I only wanted the XXXX. She agreed to my terms. Fast forward me and my fiance go in to sign the documents. It's all on a very small tablet. No details except our payment amounts are told to us. Using an arrow button the loan officer would say okay now click your signature here. No actual signing was done. Just a couple clicks of a button. Nothing was explained. Nothing was optional. And at the end we didn't get a copy of any contract. Fast forward XXXX weeks later when I call to pay my other loan. I was told it was refinanced. So I speak to the manager tell her my issue she says she can't do anything. It hasn't even been a full 30 days since I called the first time. She gets with her district manager. District manager says she can't do anything because it's out of the month I made the loan in which is XXXX. They only had a few days left to that month and I didnt get a contract so I didnt realize until the end of month was over. I told district manager I wanted someone higher because they have recorded conversations of me NOT AGREEING to anything other than the XXXX. Also an employee of theirs who took my application remembers I didn't want it. She said she would send it to home office. Fast forward to Monday XX/XX/XXXX I finally hear back from my local branch profusely apologized saying there's nothing she can do and it was her mistake. So I told her I'm not dealing with them I will have someone buy out my account. My first note isn't due until XX/XX/XXXX. I call today XX/XX/XXXX for a payoff amount and a copy of my contract to be emailed because the company that is buying my account out is confused as to where all these charges are coming from. I get my contract and notice we had all these optional charges which were not ever offered to us in our contract. But our signatures are there because again it was all electronic. I'm so mad. We will be charged XXXX dollars extra on a XXXX dollar loan. And there isn't anything they can do about it according to them.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claimed First Heritage added unwanted optional charges to their loan, despite the consumer explicitly stating they only wanted a specific amount. The charges were not disclosed during the electronic signing process, and the consumer only discovered them after receiving the contract weeks later.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted an associate at Upstart XXXX regarding a late payment that was reported 45 days late. The associate assured me that if I paid the outstanding amount of {$23.00} immediately, the late payment would be removed from my credit history. Following this advice, I paid the bill on the same day. 

However, on XX/XX/XXXX, the late payment was still reported as 45 days late on my credit report. When I reached out to Upstart again to address this issue, I requested to speak with a supervisor. The supervisor incorrectly claimed that I had placed a " do not contact '' instruction on my email address, which I had not. Furthermore, I did not receive any letters, emails, or phone calls informing me that this late payment would be reported to the credit agencies. 

I have been consistently paying this loan for the past two years. Due to Upstart 's internal errors and a mere {$23.00} late payment, my credit score has dropped by XXXX XXXX. This has caused significant financial distress and is unacceptable. 

I urge Upstart XXXX to correct this erroneous late payment report and restore my credit score to its previous level. Their misleading practices and failure to communicate properly have resulted in unjust harm to my credit rating. 

Loan Summary : Loan Amount : {$1000.00} Outstanding Principal : {$590.00} Unpaid Accrued Interest : {$0.00} Loan Number : XXXX Interest Rate : 15.35 % Origination Date : XX/XX/XXXX 2021
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid a $23 late payment to Upstart after being assured it would be removed from their credit history. However, the late payment was still reported, and the consumer's credit score dropped significantly due to Upstart's alleged internal errors and lack of communication.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I took a online loan out on XXXX XXXX, XXXX from a flyer I received in the mail, I was preapproved. A. Credit limit of {$900.00}, according to information I gave when applying ( XXXX income ), I acknowledge reading contract involved for the loan. The problem comes when each month the repayment fee is different and higher for a set loan of $ XXXX I was not aware of the scheduled repayment fee changing each month. The repayment fee went from XXXX to XXXX and for the last several months to {$160.00}. As a XXXX old XXXX XXXX I am unable to meet this obligation and would never have even considered a loan with this type of repayment the reschedule fees were not with the contract I read. I I live on a set income and when the payment reached this amount {$160.00} I called Money Key ( XXXX in XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX to see why the payment was so high and could I pay less monthly payments. As the bill showed I will never get out of my bill being over XXXX every month with all the different fees they add on each month. I will be paying this amount every month and the bill would not be reduced at all. I was told if not paying for 60 days then they could set up another arrangement, I feel this is some kind of illegitimate business I am unwittingly involved in and submit my complaint for investigation.
Narrative Summary: A consumer took out a $900 online loan with a preapproved credit limit, but claims the monthly repayment fee changed without notice, increasing from an undisclosed amount to $160. The consumer alleges the rescheduling fees were not disclosed in the contract and is seeking investigation.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
15 U.S. code 1681e. requires that a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report shall follow procedures in order to assure maximum accuracy for whom it is reporting.

Upgrade has been grossly negligent to this responsibility and as a result I have been denied housing and additional credit occurred. Grossly lowering my credit score.

Currently there are inconsistency on my credit reporting across the three Bureaus. 1 bureau has me 120 days past due and another 180 days past due. Upgrades person records on my account has me 312 days past due. 

This gross and inaccurate reporting has affected my lively hood in a negative way.
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges Upgrade is negligent in maintaining accurate credit reports, violating 15 U.S. Code 1681e. Inconsistencies across three bureaus show varying past-due days (120, 180, and 312 days), resulting in a lowered credit score, denied housing, and limited credit opportunities.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I TOOK OUT A LOAN WITH THIS COMPANY IN XXXX DUE TO FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, I HAD THE INTENTION OF PAYING THIS LOAN BACK, HOWEVER I WAS TERMINATED FROM MULTIPLE EMPLOYERS LOSING EVERYTHING I OWNED LEAVING ME HOMELESS AND UNEMPLOYED IN WHICH I HAVE BEEN SINCE XXXX ALONG WITH XXXX SUPPORT FROM ANYONE ALONG WITH XXXX UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS, I HAVE ASKED FOR THIS DEBT TO BE FORGIVEN MULTIPLE TIMES ALONG WITH PROVIDING HARDSHIP DOCS AND I EXPLAINED THAT I HAVE NO MONEY OR ANY RESOURCES. I WANT THIS DEBT FORGIVEN ALONG WITH {$25000.00} FOR LOST WAGES AND FINANCIAL DURESS BEFORE I SUE THEM!!!
Narrative Summary: A consumer took out a loan due to financial hardship, but after losing multiple jobs and becoming homeless, they claim they're unable to repay. Despite providing hardship documents, the company has not forgiven the debt, prompting the consumer to request debt forgiveness and $25,000 in compensation.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with additional add-on products or services
Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX called and has auto draft discontinued on loan. Got confirmation email. XX/XX/XXXX, they took at direct draft out of my account. I called them and confronted them about it. They put a stop payment on the payment on XX/XX/XXXX. Will not send me a copy of a electronic signature that they claim to have
Narrative Summary: A consumer had auto draft discontinued on a loan, received confirmation, but the lender still took a direct draft from their account. A stop payment was later put on the draft, but the lender refuses to provide a copy of the electronic signature they claim to have.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a loan from netcredit.com for the amount of {$4200.00} XXXX to help pay off another loan from XXXX for the amount {$2900.00} on XXXX. The amount was fine but I was not told that I would being paying these statement change over fees which are simply interest to get around state law. It was oversight on my part. I'm a XXXX XXXX  living in florida and XXXX XXXX XXXX So my income I get is what I get.
Narrative Summary: The consumer received a $4200 loan from NetCredit.com to pay off another loan. They claim they weren't informed about "statement change over fees" (allegedly disguised interest) and feel misled, as this wasn't transparent in the loan agreement, potentially circumventing Florida state law.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
It has been over 3 months since I initially contacted Cash App XXXX regarding the deduction of {$52.00} on a loan payment that I owed only {$26.00}. This occurred on XX/XX/2024. Although I sent multiple messages through the app and called them by phone three times about this occurrence, I never heard back from Cash App XXXX. On or about XXXX XXXX XXXX, Cash App XXXX deducted XXXX payments of {$26.00}, although I owed one payment of XXXX. I have called 5 times about the XXXX issue. Customer service always stated that a representative would get back to me. 

Not only has Cash App XXXX attempted to charge me twice on XXXX transactions, but they have also charged me interest on a loan that was paid back the same day ( this loan was taken out by error ). Another major issue is that I looked throughout my account on the Activity for the loan payments for XXXX but can not locate the transactions. 

As of this date, XX/XX/2024, Cash App XXXX has not responded to me or tried to resolve my issues. I refuse to pay back money that I do not owe.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Cash App deducted $52 for a $26 loan payment, then made duplicate $26 deductions. Despite multiple calls and messages, the issue remains unresolved. The consumer also reports being charged interest on a same-day paid loan and missing transaction records in their account.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I was charged {$160.00} by EnerBank USA even though I did not authorize the payment. The payment was authorized by the co-signee on the account who is not authorized to use my bank account, to which enerbank did not call me to ask wether the co-signee was authorized to use my account and pushed the payment through anyways.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer was charged $160 by EnerBank USA without authorization. A co-signee, not authorized to use the consumer's bank account, initiated the payment, and EnerBank processed it without verifying the co-signee's authority with the consumer.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I used Moneylions instacash services starting in XXXX and stopped in XXXX after I lost my purse during a night out which contained my debit card, ID, phone, and some other items. I was able to recover my ID and applied for a new debit card which I activated on XX/XX/year>. I had an outstanding balance of {$100.00} on Moneylion which I paid back on XX/XX/year> after receiving my check. I deleted the Moneylion app and removed my banking and card information, except for my old debit card since the app doesnt let you remove all forms of payment in case you have an outstanding balance ( I did not have a balance ) and so I thought that was the end of the situation. Fast forward to XX/XX/year> and I am charged {$220.00} for a Moneylion instacash repayment the day after I got paid when I havent used the service since XXXX. Im not sure if someone used my stolen phone to request funds in the app or what. I immediately called Moneylions customer service and explained the situation and they said that they were sorry but that they couldnt refund me since the money was already taken out of my account ( it was not, the charge is still pending ). After a lot of back and forth with them she just said that she would block my banking information so that I wouldnt get charged again and to dispute through my bank. I then called my bank, XXXX, to dispute the charge and put a stop payment on my account for Moneylion instacash services and was told that the token on my bank account was probably still saved by this predatory company despite me removing my current banking and card information and that that was how they were able to charge me. They then told me I would be provided a credit on my bank account once the charge was done pending while they investigated the issue. I redownloaded the app and can see multiple requests to borrow money after I stopped using their services. I am not sure if my money will be fully refunded.
Company public response: Company disputes the facts presented in the complaint
Narrative Summary: The consumer used MoneyLion's InstaCash service until 2019, then stopped and deleted the app. However, in a later year, they were unexpectedly charged $220 for a pending InstaCash repayment despite not using the service since 2019. The issue may be due to a saved token on their bank account.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Can't stop withdrawals from your bank account
Consumer complaint narrative: I revoked access to my bank account and debit card XX/XX/XXXX. The company has continued to try to access my bank account and remove funds. I stopped payment to them, and they used another account number to take {$10.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. I again reached out to them to revoke access, they refuse to do so. I have emailed them every day this week and I keep getting the runaround. I live in fear that I'll get my direct deposit income, and they will take funds that will prevent me from paying my bills.
Narrative Summary: A consumer revoked access to their bank account and debit card, but the company continued to attempt withdrawals, even using an alternate account number to take $10. Despite repeated requests to stop, the company refuses to revoke access, causing the consumer financial distress and fear of future unauthorized withdrawals.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: Charged interest and had optional services added to my account as a requirement for the loans that I received from OneMain Financial. I no longer had this long as I have paid it off already and it is now closed.
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges OneMain Financial added optional services and charged interest as a loan requirement, which they felt was unnecessary. They've since paid off the loan and closed the account, but are still disputing the added services and interest charges.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Overview : In XX/XX/XXXX, I took out a deferred interest loan for {$16000.00} with XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) for XXXX XXXX installation. The loan had an XXXX " With Pay Deferred Interest '' ( WPDI ) promotion, which allowed for deferred interest if payments were made timely. 

Promotional Terms : Promotion Duration : 18 months, ending XX/XX/XXXX. 
Grace Period : Payments could not be more than 30 days late, or the promotional offer would terminate early. 
Events Leading to the Complaint : XXXX XXXX : In XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX payment was made 36 days late, exceeding the XXXX grace period, allegedly causing the promotion to terminate. 
Lack of Notification : Despite the promotional offer being terminated, the subsequent billing statements from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX continued to reflect a " Promotional Expiry Date '' of XX/XX/XXXX, and showed the deferred interest charges as {$0.00}. 
The loan overview document from XX/XX/XXXX also showed a promotion expiry date of XX/XX/XXXX, and deferred interest not included in the total balance. 
XXXX of Accrued Interest : In XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted XXXX to get a loan payoff amount, but there was no mention of my promotional period having been terminated. 
In XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted XXXX again for a loan payoff amount, only to learn that the deferred interest promotion had ended over a year ago due to the late payment, and all deferred interest charges were now being included in the payoff balance. 
Had I been notified of the termination of the promotional offer at the time of the late payment, I would have paid off the loan to avoid accruing interest at 17.99 %. 
Impact of Lack of Notification : The lack of notification resulted in a significant increase in my loan balance due to the retroactive interest charges. 
The billing statements misled me into believing that the promotional offer was still active. 
Resolution Requested : Reinstatement of Promotion : Re-instate the deferred interest promotion and waive the accrued interest charges. 
Correction of Statements : Adjust my account to reflect accurate statements based on the original promotion. 
Supporting Documentation : Loan Overview Document ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : Shows a promotion expiry date of XX/XX/XXXX, despite the promotion being voided. 

Billing Statements ( XX/XX/XXXX- XX/XX/XXXX ) : Each statement reflects a promotion expiry date of XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX deferred interest charges. 

Conclusion : The misleading billing statements and lack of proper notification caused significant financial harm. I am seeking fair resolution by reinstating the original promotional terms and correcting the accrued interest charges.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer took out a $16,000 deferred interest loan with an 18-month promotional period. After a 36-day late payment, the promotion terminated, but the lender failed to notify the consumer and continued to send misleading billing statements. This resulted in significant accrued interest charges.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I needed to get my car fixed and couldn't get a bank loan. Got approved with Crane finance for {$500.00} not realizing they charge an APR of XXXX. I'm paying {$1500.00} in charges. That's XXXX x my loan amount. Should have read my loan agreement better.
Narrative Summary: A consumer borrowed $500 from Crane Finance, but was unaware of the high APR, resulting in $1500 in charges, triple the loan amount. They acknowledge not reading the loan agreement thoroughly, but express dissatisfaction with the excessive charges.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with additional add-on products or services
Consumer complaint narrative: I am contesting this loan with XXXX as I am dissatisfied with the outcome of being denied a re-negogiation of the contract I have with them. I received a loan ( {$30000.00} with {$13000.00} extra as paid interest ) in XXXX of this year where on a recorded line, XXXX XXXX, a sales rep went over the contract with me. Once we went over the contract, he stated that once I got approved for the loan, I would be able to apply for a business line of credit ( XXXX XXXX within a month. My plan, which I share with XXXX was to transfer the initial loan to the XXXX  for a better payment rate. I decided to go with this contract with that in mind and it being a major part of my acceptance to sign off on the contract. I waited 2 months and paid about {$10000.00} back on the loan to apply for a XXXX  with XXXX XXXX, my account manager. After applying, XXXX informed me that my application was denied because of overall exposure limit based on the term loan as the primary reason ( please see attached email receipt ). After I spoke to XXXX on the phone not long after the initial notification, she further explained that I was denied because of the very loan I had just received from XXXX. What is misleading is that I was informed by XXXX, a sales rep, that after I took the loan, I would be able to apply for a XXXX  within a month. After I waited 2 months, paid about {$10000.00} back and applied for a XXXX I was denied because of the initial loan. Furthermore, this insinuates that I was never eligible to apply for a XXXX  with XXXX within a month because the new loan dis-qualified my application according to XXXXXXXX XXXX requirements. This is crucial information that should have been disclosures to me as it heavily affected my decision to take this loan. XXXX was aware of my intentions as we had in-depth conversations about strategies and business goals. I was mislead to thinking that I would be able to apply for a XXXX within a month after I signed off on the loan. This is misleading, deceptive and not operating with clean hands. This is fraud in the inducement. I am left to pay over {$3000.00} monthly on this loan, told to wait a few months to re-apply for a XXXX  and have been provided remedies that only further leave me in a bind and ruin my credit. After voicing my concerns to XXXX, XXXX manager, on a recorded line, he agreed and stated that he understood how I could have felt mislead and said he would share some feedback with XXXX. After that conversation, XXXX has not been helpful in solving this matter. I have lost all trust for XXXX as I do not believe the team is operating in good faith. Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) - Codified at 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq., TILA requires lenders, including banks, to provide consumers with clear and conspicuous disclosure of the terms of credit before they are bound to any credit agreement. This includes interest rates, fees, the amount financed, and the total cost of the loan. I have attempted on several occasions to resolve this matter with XXXX but they refuse to take any responsibility for the matter. I have been trying to negotiate this for the past 2 months and I have been getting no help and the XXXX team have stopped responding to me. I am looking to re-negotiate the contract with a lower payout amount so I can do an early payout and be done with this loan because of the deception and miscommunication of a representative of XXXX. Account : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX # XXXX )
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims they were misled by a sales rep who stated they could apply for a business line of credit within a month after receiving a $30,000 loan. However, after paying $10,000 and applying, they were denied due to the initial loan.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I paid a loan off before with Covington credit so I was able to get another loan to pay my car insurance in full. I am now in between jobs and got two months behind. I ask could be on a payment plan and if interest could stop accruing but they said no. I ask for hardship and she said I would still have to be {$190.00} right now and they will push the other amount to the back of the loan. They are refusing to work with me and are threatening to garnish my wages.
Narrative Summary: A consumer fell behind on a Covington Credit loan and requested a payment plan and interest stoppage due to job loss. The lender refused, offering only a hardship plan requiring a $190 payment, and is now threatening wage garnishment.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: My ex spouse was contacted and given information about my debt
Narrative Summary: A consumer's ex-spouse was contacted and given information about their debt, raising concerns about unauthorized disclosure of personal financial information and potential breach of confidentiality.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: In hardship due to my income cut. Can't make ends meet. More has been put on me. Need debt total forgiveness.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer is struggling financially due to an income cut and increased expenses, making it difficult to pay debts. They are seeking total debt forgiveness to alleviate their hardship.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: The amount of interest on the loan is predatory and way over the usury value in NC
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges that the interest on their loan is excessively high, exceeding North Carolina's usury limit, and considers it predatory lending.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  loan, {$2700.00} loan, half is given up front, the rest is financed and put in a savings and when loan is paid off you recieve the other half. The amount of {$1300.00} has not been transferred to me. XXXX transferred this loan to SST technology to service. Their customer service has continually lied to me. I paid loan in full on XX/XX/XXXX, they continue t0 not tell me where my money is. Allegedly its in an savings account thru XXXX XXXX XXXX, however they refuse to tell me the full account #, they customer service has put me on hold for hours, being tossed around, hung up on, told different excuses. Delay XXXX to XXXX holiday, delay because I paid loan off to soon, delay because they dont know why, delay because they are manually entering transfer. Ive been told so many lies. No one has been able to tell me when I will receive my money. Per the contract I should have received my money no later than XX/XX/2024. Ive called everyday, and its a different story. I was harassed by 2 customer service agents, one laughing about the situation.
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid off a $2700 loan in full, but $1300 held in a savings account has not been transferred. The loan servicer, SST Technology, has given conflicting excuses and refused to provide the full account number, despite the contract stating the funds should have been released by a certain date.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address the recent denial of credit that I received from your institution. I was notified of this decision on [ Date of Denial Notification ], yet I find that the explanation provided for this denial was insufficient or unclear. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to a specific reason for such adverse actions. 

According to TD Bank they were unable to verify my identity to which, at THEIR direction I went into a branch to provide my identity information and complete the form THEY told me to complete. 

TD 's response to my complete does not address any of this. Their long and meaningnless response outlines the prior applications I discussed for absoutely no reason. I am specifically complaining about the application fromXXXX XXXX XXXX that were denied because my identity could not be verified. PER THEIR INSTRUCTION I WENT INTO A BRANCH AND COMPLETED WHAT THEY CALLED A " BID FORM '' AND PROVIDED MY IDENTIFICATIONS AND WAS TOLD THE APPLICATION WOULD REOPEN ON MY DASHBOARD TO SUBMIT. INSTEAD I GOT THE SAME DENIAL WHICH MEANS TD BANK 'S REPRESENTATIVES EITHER GAVE ME MISINFORMATION OR THE FORM WAS NOT PROPERLY SUBMITTED BY THEIR REPRESENTATIVE. TD HAS NOT ADDRESSED WHAT HAPPENED TO THAT FORM! IF I DO NOT RECEIVE A COMPREHENSIVE EXPLANATION I WILL REMOVE ALL OF MY FUNDS IN EXCESS OF XXXX XXXX FROM THEIR INSTITUTION AND FILE SUIT.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's credit application was denied by TD Bank due to unverified identity. Despite following the bank's instructions to provide identification in-branch, the consumer received the same denial, suggesting misinformation or misprocessing by the bank's representative.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with additional add-on products or services
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/24, I noticed a couple of small transactions I did not recognize in my account history. I contacted my bank and was told they were made on XXXX using my paypal account. 
I called the customer service number for XXXX and ended up being transferred and speaking with a gentleman that stated he worked for Paypal customer service. He stated it was an error and processed a credit transfer of {$880.00} into my account, he said it was to confirm it was valid. He then transferred that money back out and sent me another credit for {$5.00}. 
I unlinked my bank account from Paypal and a few days later realized my account was now linked to a credit line and that {$880.00} had been charged to it. I contacted Paypal customer service again and opened a case, and told them that I did not make any transactions, that this was fraudulent. I also requested that the Paypal credit line be closed. 
I got an email from Paypal customer service today stating that my case was closed and i was not going to be reimbursed the {$880.00} ( or have it credited back to the credit line that was opened ) I called Paypal immediately and they told me it was closed not in my favor because I had closed the credit account, so they could not help me. Which is terrible and against all consumer financial protection laws. They also said it was closed because it was a person to person transfer. The money was transferred to a person, but not by me! Someone at Paypal or a hacker fraudulently hacked into my account and sent money somewhere. 
This is incredibly frustrating and Paypal needs to take responsibility for fraudulent charges that happen on their customers accounts. They have an email address and a transaction ID of where this money was sent, why is that account not being held responsible for this money? 
This is an unfair and fraudulent business practice and I am not paying that huge sum of money to a scammer because Paypal wont take responsibility.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported unauthorized transactions from their PayPal account, totaling $880. PayPal initially processed a credit transfer but later denied reimbursement, citing the account closure and a "person-to-person transfer" policy, despite the consumer claiming the transaction was fraudulent.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a payment of {$72.00} due on XX/XX/2024. I made a payment of {$150.00} that was processed by the company on XX/XX/2024, but the company is claiming that my account is past due. I tried to talk with the to find out what was happening and the agents refused to discuss my account unless I verified my social security number. I offered to provide various other options to verify my identity and they refused. The only way I could discuss my account was to give my social security number.
Narrative Summary: A consumer made a payment of $150, exceeding the $72 due, but the company claims the account is past due. When trying to resolve the issue, customer service agents refused to discuss the account without verifying the consumer's social security number, despite alternative verification options offered.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Vehicle was repossessed or sold the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative: My original loan was taken out in XX/XX/XXXX for {$10000.00}. I made monthly payments from {$900.00} that decreased to {$650.00} without issues for two years. In XXXX of 2022 after losing my job I received another XXXX XXXXXXXX. My paymentss went back up to {$860.00}. One month after receiving the additional amount, my payment was late 21 days and they repossessed my vehicle. Keep I mind my payments had been later than that, 30-45 days sometimes, and they never repossessed my car. But because the additional XXXX XXXX somehow made it a new loan, that also made me a new customer? And they did this without warning or explanation that I was somehow a new customer. So they repoed at 21 days. Every month since then, when my account reaches more than 21 days past due I start getting threats of repossession. Theyve put out repo orders at least 6 times in the last year. The emails are nonsensical from their less than incompetent employees, constantly claiming I broke my promise. And after all this, I still somehow owe over XXXX XXXXXXXX. To call this predatory is an understatement.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's vehicle was repossessed 21 days after a late payment, despite previous late payments (30-45 days) not triggering repossession. This change occurred after the consumer received additional funds, which the lender treated as a new loan, increasing the payment amount without warning.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I was in between jobs and tried to stop the automatic payments, but they don't allow the customer to change any settings on the website. Last month, 2 payments came out of my account. My account is overdrawn and trying to catch up. They call my phone and hang up like weekly. It's stressful.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's issue is with a company's inflexible automatic payment system. Despite being between jobs, they couldn't stop or adjust payments on the website, resulting in two unauthorized payments, an overdrawn account, and frequent, stressful hang-up calls.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I took out a {$500.00} installment loan. I paid {$200.00} of it off and was diagnosed with XXXX XXXX. I was no longer able to pay. I had been fighting for my life and was taken to court. A judgment of {$2500.00} was given against me on the {$500.00} loan. I also have a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and have relayed all of this to them trying to work out some type of payment plan. They have shot down everything. They now say I owe over XXXX and are absolutely not willing to work on a payment plan with them. I have offered XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and now XXXX and they would rather garnish my bank account that is negative. They are ruining my life over a {$500.00} loan. I believe they are not upfront with the interest charges as no where did it ever say I could end up owing XXXX XXXX dollars on a {$500.00} loan. I lost my mother to XXXX XXXX and have been fighting for my life and this company has no humanity at all. I just want them to be reasonable and work with me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer took a $500 installment loan, paid $200, but fell behind due to a serious illness. Despite attempts to negotiate, the lender obtained a $2500 judgment and now claims the consumer owes over an undisclosed amount, refusing a payment plan and threatening bank garnishment.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I have been using the XXXX application for over XXXX  years. It is a peer to peer lending site that portrays itself as looking out for its customers, being low apr etc. 
When you request a loan you go through a few step process where you select your loan amount. It then asks you how much you would like to tip the lender which can be any amount. 
It THEN asks you how much you want to give as a XXXX donation being a donation you are giving to the company for the service. The lowest amount shown on this screen is 7 % - you are not able to select XXXX or a lower amount. It makes it seem like it is a mandatory part of the loan. 
Therefore I expected it was and always selected the lowest option being 7 %. 
I have taken XXXX loans with this company since 2020. 
I have just realized within the past few weeks that you can go and toggle donations to off within settings so that it does not force you to give a donation during the process I feel like this is highly deceptive- I would have never give donations if I knew this was an options. 
I have ended up giving thousands of dollars of donations to this company. 
Obviously I wish I didnt have to resort to those loans but I feel like this company is taking advantage of those in poor financial situations. 
I see now on their website that they try to make it more clear that the donations are optional because people have complained but I joined in 2020 and I feel certain back then they did not make this clear. 
I see multiple states have forced them to return the tips and donations to its customers and now your organization has filed a lawsuit. 
I am requesting XXXX be forced to refund me all donations that I have given to the company. This is totaling in the thousands. 
I sent a request to them yesterday and have not heard back. 
I wanted to provide my complaint to you and also hopefully you are able to assist me In this matter.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges that a peer-to-peer lending site deceived them into making thousands of dollars in "donations" (7% of loan amounts) by making it seem mandatory during the loan process. They claim the option to toggle donations off was hidden in settings, and are seeking a refund.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I took out a loan from Dakota Funding Group to pay off a debt that needed to be paid, I lost my job shortly after obtaining the loan, I explained to them that I am destitute and have been for awhile. I am currently homeless, unemployed without ANY financial support or assistance. I have no car, no home and THEY STILL WANT {$570.00} that I DO NOT HAVE!!!! I HAVE ASKED FOR THE DEBT TO BE WIPED OUT AND THEY REFUSED!!
Narrative Summary: The consumer took a loan from Dakota Funding Group, but lost their job and became homeless. Despite being destitute, the lender refuses to wipe out the $570 debt, insisting on payment despite the consumer's inability to pay.

This Company reported I that I have Paid in full {$4200.00} But I have been Charged me {$6200.00} This makes my heart broken since I am struggle to.survive they were cheating on me. I felt that they robbed me. They were Keep telling me to pay more until I report this on here. 
Please see the Attached statements I really need Justice for this.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
***ADVANCE FINANCIAL*** Whenever I ask for my remaining interest that is owed to me they always write it down in pen as opposed to showing it to me on a printout. So when I ask for an explanation as to how the interest is calculated Im not given that amount on the print out.

If I owe back interest based on the previous months activity I expect that to be detailed on the printout when I make a payment.

When they write it down the number appears arbitrary and leads me to believe there is something wrong happening.

Also it was never explained to me that I have two billing cycles per month.
Narrative Summary: The consumer is disputing Advance Financial's interest calculation process, as the remaining interest owed is handwritten instead of printed, making it appear arbitrary. The consumer also claims they were not informed about having two billing cycles per month, leading to confusion and mistrust.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with additional add-on products or services
Consumer complaint narrative:
A company, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, said they would help settle some IRS debt and told me it would start day 1. They told me to use their business partner UCFS- United Consumer Financial Services . I did. This is who this complaint is against. A year later literally nothing done. Always had an excuse as to why. They strung me along to get every monthly payment they could. Yes, XXXX may have received the full amount from the loan I took out with their referred partner, with UCFS -United Consumer Financial Services . I dont know. These 2 companies clearly do this often. I have XXXX paid into them so far. If I dont pay they kill my credit. Which has already begun, dropping my score by over XXXX points already for 1 missed payment. I cant reach either company. They don't respond. They want me to take all the loss and accept it. XXXX XXXX XXXX has gone dark and does not call me back. UCFS same deal. They got paid. My credit is now compromised. I feel XXXX is enough money for services I did not receive. Am I supposed to keep paying for services I did not receive? I lost XXXX regardless and I get a bonus of my credit going from nearly XXXX to under XXXX so far. This is the ultimate scam and they use the credit bureaus to do their dirty work as well. I am really sorry I fell for it. Doesn't seem as though there is any justice here because they have literally perfected their fraud, Or Scam. 
***Both UCFS and XXXX XXXX XXXX should be investigated. They don't blink an eye about XXXX. They accept it as part of their business model to have complaints. They are taking advantage of a very vulnerable population that has no recourse as they are typically are without funds to do anything.
Narrative Summary: The consumer paid for debt settlement services from UCFS, referred by XXXX XXXX XXXX, but after a year, no progress was made, and the companies stopped responding. The consumer's credit score dropped due to missed payments, and they feel scammed into paying for unfulfilled services.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Vehicle was damaged or destroyed the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative:
Late XXXX XXXX Contacted One Main Loan company after several attempts to sell the XXXX XXXX and being told more than once that the XXXX  was not sellable because the amount owed was way to much. XXXX was not safe to operate on the roads and our XXXX would no longer allow it to just sit and leak fluids on the property. 

Late XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  of the XXXX XXXX XXXX order to remove it from property to prevent eviction status. 

XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX auto XXXX from XXXX  account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX debited from checking account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX debited from XXXX  account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX debited from checking account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX debited from XXXX account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX debited from checking account of {$320.00}. Heard nothing from company XXXX XXXX We started the process of buying a home. Learned that our One Main Loan account was reflecting no payments made since XX/XX/2023. Was informed that we needed to address this. Contacted One Main Branch in XXXX, XXXX where the loan originated from. Was told that we would need to contact the main office and their credit department. Contacted their credit department and was told that it was being reported correctly because we Voluntarily surrendered the vehicle. I disagreed because payments were made. Was then told that there was nothing I could do because that was their business practice since we were in default of the contract. 

XXXX XXXX Disputed credit reports XXXX XXXX received responses from credit reports. XXXX was corrected to reflect payments made and no longer over 90 days of late payments. XXXX XXXX XXXX were not corrected. Contacted One Main Loan company again. Was sent to several different people and told that we were late on payments and that's the reason for the XXXX  which is incorrect. 

Late XXXX XXXX Contacted BBB and made a complaint because I couldn't get credit reports to be fixed and reported accurately. 

XXXX XXXX Payment of loan for XXXX XXXX XXXX debited from XXXX account of {$320.00}. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX received response from One Main Loan Company stating that they have reported everything correctly and this issue was fixed. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX are still stating no payments made since XX/XX/2023. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Received a priority mail letter from One Main Loan company stating that they have closed and charged off our account. They started the balance off at {$9300.00} and " their accounting '' of what we owe minus the fees and so forth. Our balance no due in full is {$5700.00}. 
May 4, 2024- I called the number on the priority mail sent and asked where the starting balance of {$9300.00} began at. I spoke with a lady and she could not find it. Said she would forward this up to her supervisor. I asked at this time " How do you not have a break down of the {$9300.00} because we have not owed {$9300.00} since XX/XX/2023. XXXX months before the XXXX XXXX '' She could not answer XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX Called the number again because I still have no response. Spoke with XXXX XXXX XXXX asked the exact same questions. She also could not find the answers in the system. I asked " If your company is going to charge me then you should have a break down of the charges '' I had no luck. XXXX forwarded me to the supervisor XXXX XXXX. I once again repeated my questions about the issues on this account and once again couldn't get answers. So XXXX said she would send me up to the " XXXX Department '' and that they would call me. 

Today XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX called my husband and said she's from the XXXX department and asked if she could help him. He passed me the phone and I proceeded to ask where the {$9300.00} began at. She pulls the letter sent to us so she could follow along. Once again she doesn't know. I was informed that she's not a computer and that she can't process what all I'm asking about and so forth. I'm beyond angry and frustrated at this point. Why call me if you have not researched the account, read the notes and have answers to my questions? This has been on going, on the phone trying to figure out why. 

We are hard working people trying to do the right thing. Never once have we refused to make our payments. Never once have we denied our debt. We deserve the right to understand why One Main Loan company has made the business choices that they have made. We have paid on this account as the contract states. We understand that we broke the contract with the voluntary surrender. However, no other viable option was given to us to help solve the beginning issue of the XXXX is not safe and can't remain in the yard as a yard ornament. We have to have a roof over our heads. 

It has taken this company XXXX months to charge off this account and hurt our credit even worse. I feel like this was done because I disputed our credit reports and contacted the BBB. If I would have kept my mouth shut they would still be taking their payments from our XXXX account. This is unfXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I wouldn't recommend anyone to use this company
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims One Main Loan incorrectly reported no payments made since a certain date, despite regular $320 payments. After disputing the credit reports, the company sent a letter stating the account was closed and charged off with a balance of $5700, but couldn't provide a breakdown of the charges.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan

I purchased Solar panels and Battery last year and the vendor recommended Mosaic as their preferred lender. I was told my monthly payment was going to be {$340.00} and after 18 months it would be XXXX if I do not apply the rebate for Solar from the federal government.

I started paying {$440.00} with hopes of applying {$100.00} every cycle towards principal. Original loan was {$51000.00} and interest rate is 9.59 % loan term states XXXX payments remaining regardless of how many payments I have made so far. Last year they changed interest {$1000.00} and so far this year they have charged {$1800.00} in interest. I still owe {$51000.00} and remaining payment is XXXX. I do not know when this loan will be paid off. i have reached out to Mosaic but they are not providing any understandable answers. 

There are no statements for me to see what is going on. HELP! 

Address Information Please mail payments to : Mosaic XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Az XXXX Overnight Mailing Address : MOSAIC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, AZ XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased solar panels and a battery with a $51,000 loan from Mosaic at 9.59% interest. Despite making payments, the balance remains $51,000, with $1,000 in interest charged last year and $1,800 this year, and the consumer is unclear on the loan payoff timeline.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, Im writing this letter to formally inform you why I have not made payments on my XXXX XXXX XXXX payment plan, and why I refuse to do so going forward. I will discuss the lead up until XXXX XXXX XXXX went out of business, along with what has transpired since. While I have no issue honoring my contract with XXXX XXXX XXXX, they not only didnt honor their contract, but tried to charge me for services not rendered. In addition to this Im still forced with the fact that I must seek out another provider to fix the original issue that I went to XXXX XXXX XXXX to have fixed. I have retained all communications with XXXX XXXX XXXX from initial contact, until the company filed for bankruptcy. 
I sent out my impressions, photos, and payment information to XXXX  XXXX at the end of XXXX last year and was informed that they received them on XX/XX/XXXX of 2023. I attempted to contact them by phone multiple times in XXXX and was finally able to get a response in early XXXX. I was finally able to speak with XXXX, a resolution XXXX with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX of last year. The issue was my account status was changed for reasons they never explained other than to say it was an error on their end. I asked her if the delay from submitting my impressions until I received them would cause any issues with my aligners fitting and she said it wouldnt be an issue. 
I didnt receive the aligner package until XX/XX/2023, a full 3 months after I sent in everything requested. Upon receiving the aligner package, I thought the aligners fit very tightly, but assumed it was normally part of the process of moving my teeth into proper positioning. I started wearing them exactly how I was informed to and switching them as the plan advised, but I noticed that they were getting tighter as I switched them. At the beginning of XXXX, it was time to switch to my XXXX aligner, but I was unable to get them to stay on my teeth due to them not fitting properly. 
I called the XXXX  customer support to inform them of my issue and was told that I should wear the current aligner until my teeth moved enough that the next retainer would fit. I had to wear the XXXX aligner until the beginning of XXXX, when it was only supposed to be a XXXX wear. I was finally able to get the XXXX aligner to stay on my teeth, but it was extremely uncomfortable. The fourth aligner was supposed to be a XXXX wear but towards the middle of XXXX I was still unable to switch to my XXXX aligner. This coupled with the fact that I received an email stating XXXX  was filing for XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy, made me nervous about XXXX ability to complete my treatment plan. 
I called XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to tell them that I was not satisfied with the progress due to my aligners not fitting properly, and that if we couldnt find a solution, I would be formally requesting a refund. XXXX informed me that I didnt need to worry, because they would just need me to take additional photos, gather some additional information after reviewing said photos, and then send out further aligners to continue correcting my teeth until they met the Smile Prescription. I uploaded the additional photos requested to the XXXX XXXX sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX when I returned home from my XXXX vacation. I attempted to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to get an update regarding what additional information they might need but was unable to reach the customer support staff. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I read in the news that XXXX XXXX XXXX is going out of business and will not honor any commitments or guarantees. I started looking through my credit card charges and noticed that they charged me {$120.00} for the final retainer that they never sent me, and I obviously never requested. I contacted my credit card company to dispute the charge and to close out the account so no other fraudulent charges could be made. 
Towards the middle of XXXX of this year I received a bill from XXXX basically stating that I owe them the balance of my account with XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was sent a contract that was electronically signed with my name, but I have no record of them sending me such a contract to sign, nor signing such a contract. The only contract I signed was in my original submission of my teeth impressions there was a XXXX card that asked how you would like to pay, and for payment information. There wasnt any information about a XXXX party company, and I received no charges related to this third-party company, until after XXXX XXXXXXXX  XXXX XXXX for bankruptcy. When I asked for proof that I signed the contract, XXXX stated they must go by the contract that was provided by the provider. 
As I stated when I spoke with the gentleman when I called XXXX, you cant charge someone for services that werent completed. If a doctor says he is going to need to do XXXX operations, but dies after performing XXXX, you cant be charged for the XXXX he didnt perform unless they find another doctor to finish the operation. If you go to physical therapy and go on a payment plan for XXXX treatments, but the company goes out of business after XXXX treatments, you cant be liable for the XXXX treatments you didnt get. There are federal consumer protections against companies doing exactly these types of things.
Narrative Summary: The consumer is refusing to pay a debt owed to a company that went out of business, citing that the company failed to deliver services and attempted to charge for services not rendered. The company, XXXX XXXX XXXX, had provided a payment plan for orthodontic treatment but the aligners provided did not fit properly, and the company filed for bankruptcy before completing the treatment.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan

Consumer complaint narrative: I originated this loan in XXXX XXXX XXXX, in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX I noticed that not XXXX XXXX of XXXX in payments has went to principle, I even called in XXXX to get account paid to avoid any future interest payments only and was given an incorrect amount so the interest only payments continued, the company never explained all of their fees abd daily interest therefor keeping all my payments as interest only which is worse then a pay day loan. I talked to the branch and employee XXXX degraded me saying Ive never made one on time payment and every payment was over 30 days late or more since loan origination which is a lie, I called corporate and they had district manager XXXX call me and he did absolutely nothing and had no empathy for the situation nor did he offer any assistance so I turned to you for help

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX of XXXX  I got a loan of the original amount of {$570.00}. I was having difficulties financially and many other areas in life. I was going to pay weekly for about 52 weeks, with the promise if I pay 8-12 weeks Ill be able to payoff the loan with low interest and low amount. 

After about XXXX months, my financial worsened but I was able to make about 9 payments on my loan. During the month of XXXX I wasnt charged for about 3-4 weeks a single payment, also I missed some others. Then I was being charged twice Friday, and new charges started came out on Mondays ( as previous missed payments ). I would be charged duplicates payments Friday then duplicates payments Monday, and then Friday and Monday again. 

When I called to ask for a payoff amount to see if I could end the madness, they told me I had to pay {$1200.00} on top of about {$800.00} I already paid. I only borrowed {$570.00}. And now they are threatening to go to my employer to charge me interest and some other fees for I dont know how long. 
I dont think its legal. But I need help, I cant do it alone.
Narrative Summary: A consumer borrowed $570 with a promise of low interest and payoff after 8-12 weeks of weekly payments. However, after 9 payments, the lender began charging duplicate payments, resulting in a payoff amount of $2,000 ($1,200 + $800 already paid), sparking concerns about the lender's practices.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Vehicle was repossessed or sold the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Re : Complaint Against TMX Finance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX InstaLoan Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint against TMX Finance XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX InstaLoan XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, for what I believe to be a violation of my consumer rights under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

On XX/XX/2023, I applied for credit with InstaLoan. I received a notice of action taken, indicating that my application was denied due to the company 's inability to confirm that I am not a XXXX covered borrower. The stated reasons were either a system outage, an issue with the application, or a credit freeze. 

I believe this denial is unwarranted and constitutes a violation of my rights for the following reasons : 1. **Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violation** : The ECOA prohibits discrimination against credit applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, age, or because an applicant receives income from a public assistance program. The inability to confirm my status as a XXXX XXXX  borrower should not be grounds for credit denial if it was due to a system error or technical issue on the part of the creditor. This denial may indicate discriminatory practices or negligence in processing my application. 

2. **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violation** : The FCRA requires that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and privacy of information included in consumer reports. If the denial was based on a credit freeze or inaccurate information, InstaLoan may have failed to uphold the accuracy and privacy standards mandated by the FCRA.

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure that InstaLoan complies with the XXXX and FCRA and that my consumer rights are protected. Please find attached the notice of action taken and any other relevant documents supporting my complaint. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I mailed a letter requesting verification of accounts reporting on my credit report that your bureau maintains based on my most recent my dispute results/re-investigation, I received a response stating that the account ( s ) were verified. 

I was formally requesting a description of the procedure your bureau used in providing all information to the original creditor in processing my dispute under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). 

To be clear, per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( b ), your agency is required to forward all relevant information to the original creditor to ensure proper investigation of my dispute. I am requesting you provide me ALL information used for your investigation, as required by FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). 
1.

2.

3.

4. 

Per the FCRA you are required to provide this information within 15 calendar days or delete the negative items from my credit report. 

The following accounts are repeatedly listed incorrectly as charge offs and in violation of the Internal Revenue Services federal guidelines.

In relation to the accounts listed incorrectly based on the following Department of Treasury Publication 4681 : Cancelled Debts, Foreclosures, Repossessions and Abandonments Forms 1099-A and 1099-C. A lender who ac-quires an interest in your property in a foreclosure or repossession should send you Form 1099-A, Acquisition or Abandonment of Se-cured Property, showing information you need to figure your gain or loss. However, if the lender also cancels part of your debt and must file Form 1099-C, the lender can include the information about the foreclosure or repossession on that form instead of on Form 1099-A. The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union XXXX federal government agency, or other applicable entity, as discussed earlier in chapter 1. For foreclosures or repossessions occurring in XXXX, these forms should be sent to you by XXXX XXXX XXXX. Real property ( such as a home ) Intangible property, or Tangible personal property held ( wholly or partly ) for use in a trade or business or for investment that secures a loan and the lender knows the property has been abandoned, the lender should send you Form 1099-A showing information you need to figure your gain or loss from the abandonment. Also, if your debt is canceled and the lender must file Form 1099-C, the lender can include the information about the abandonment on that form instead of on Form 1099-A. The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial in-situation, credit union, federal government agency, or other applicable entity, as discussed earlier in chapter 1. For abandonments of property and debt cancellations occurring in XXXX, these forms should be sent to you by XXXX XXXX XXXX. This has been requested several times since the inception of this debt based on the numerous disputes requested outlying this information listed as cancelled debt, but denying my right to remain compliant with federal taxes as the information is never furnished for the 1099-C for legal purposes is in direct violation of FCRA guidelines : As this was a request to reinvestigate the following Accounts violates FCRA Rule 15 US Code 1681i-Procedure in case of Disputed accuracy has been violated as my many attempts for disputing the listed accounts are not being properly investigated as stated above 1099-C have not been provided for these accounts after several attempts to request the information for legal purposes that align with my staying compliant with federal taxes, are listed below and I am requesting the information be deleted due to non-compliance of FCRA Rule 15 US Code 1681i Procedure In case Of Disputed Accuracy Rule 12 ( b ) ( 6 ) permitting motion to dismiss for failure of the complaint to state a claim on which relief can be granted. 

I am demanding the following accounts be deleted based on the continued violation of FDCPA and FCRA guidelines based on several requests not properly handled XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX TX XXXX Acct # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX
Narrative Summary: The consumer's credit report lists accounts as charge-offs, violating Internal Revenue Service guidelines. The consumer disputes this and requests information used in the investigation, as required by FCRA 611(a)(7). The credit bureau failed to provide this information within 15 days, violating FCRA guidelines.

I contacted XXXX several times and on 2 ocasions he promised to try and help me with a new air conditioner. So far, that did not happen. Once I realized that GoodLeap Financial was charging interest only, I questioned why they also did not go over the lease with me. i did not know I had three days to cancel. Both XXXX XXXX and GoodLeap told me that I am qualified for a 26 % or {$11000.00} credit. They both told me to get the {$11000.00} and do what I want with it or put it towards the loan and I I do not put it towards the loan then my payment would increase from {$70.00} per month in 18 months to {$180.00} per month. So far, the retired IRS agent who filed my XXXX taxes asked me " Who lied to you ''. I complained to both XXXX XXXX and Good Leap and they said I have 5 years to file. When I filed my XXXX taxes I used a paid service and they told me that the government does not give money back. They use it as a credit towards my total income and lower my taxable amount. We are still not qualified due to our income. Both XXXX XXXX and Good Leap are aware. Our monthly payment is $ 189 monthly. Our electric bill last month was XXXX plus dollars. Our lives are now miserable. We are begging GoodLeap to lower our payments or come and take their panels which are of no use to us anyway. In XXXX, I begged them to let me pay {$76.00}, they received {$76.00}. I am no longer able to access my account with GoodLeap. This month we paid {$110.00} or so. They said we will be paying {$180.00} after this month. We are not able to make that payment. This is due to the lies and tricks of XXXX XXXX and Goodleap. Neither GoodLeap nor XXXX XXXX has reviewed their leases with us. My husband did not even sign their electronic stuff and I am not sure if XXXX XXXX electronically signed the contract on their own.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Solo Funds app went through an update on XX/XX/2024 before my loan was due for repayment on XX/XX/2024. The update was to be completed within XXXX hours, however, it has now been officially a month and I along with other users are just now able to log in to the app. 

We were told that borrowers would not be assessed late fees or synapse fees for non-payment, and lenders would not be issued a recovery fee. 

However, I am getting messages that my loan was assessed a late fee and synapse fee, even after I was told via email I would not be assessed one. 

I did research on the company while it was down to see if other users were having the same issues, and apparently multiple lenders and borrowers have not even received funds that were loaned to them or repaid to them. 

It has made me not trust the platform with any further transactions. How will I know that the lender I received the loan from will receive the repayment if people can't even withdraw the money from their SoLo account? 

Not only this, but after reading through the lawsuit that CFPB has filed against them on XX/XX/2024, I have found that they aren't licensed to offer loans in my state, and the loan I received through them is void. 

After further reading through the lawsuit, I read of SoLo 's donation and tipping. When I first started using SoLo, I thought the " donation '' was mandatory and gave a donation to SoLo until one day I went into settings and found that you are able to turn it off. SoLo does not tell you that you can turn it off when you go through the loan screen. 

I also did not know that the tips I gave to lenders may not have even been given to them. I gave the highest tip 15 % of the loan to the lender on a majority of my requests so I'd have a higher likelihood of receiving it, otherwise, my request was never fulfilled. 

As a consumer, I thought I could trust this platform because over XXXX XXXX people use it and it is available for free in the XXXX XXXX app store. I assumed that meant it was legitimate in my state, but it is not.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reports issues with the Solo Funds app after an update, including being charged late fees despite assurances they wouldn't be, and discovering the company isn't licensed to offer loans in their state, rendering their loan void.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:

When XXXX sales representatives came to my home in XXXX of XXXX  and offered to reduce my utility bills by installing Solar panels, I thought it was a good opportunity. I agreed and signed XXXX time online after serving them dinner with their families and believing everything they said.

My electric and gas bill at that point totaled over {$350.00}. They said they would replace my hot water heater and furnace and include that in the monthly payment. When I finally got to view the contract ( after trusting the contractors ) it made no mention of my Gas bill, i.e., heater replacement or furnace. When I questioned them, they said they went off contract, but they would get that done on their own. I have text messages from them supporting this, but have been unable to reach them for five months. The Finance Company XXXX XXXX did not send me a loan contract until after the Solar panels were installed, but it was totally different to what I agreed to pay. 
My payments would increase by {$100.00} after 15 months. My payments have doubled because I'm still paying XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. I saw XXXX complaints about other people having the same issues. I am struggling to pay XXXX XXXX additional {$200.00} in addition to my electric and Gas bill. Also there's now alien on my home for {$82000.00} which is twice the amount of my mortgage. 
I would never have agreed to this transaction had I seen this prior to Solar panel installation and all the lies I was told by the contractors. I have spoken and emailed XXXX ( that's the only contact I could get ) There's so much to tell, including the signatures on the contract were NOT mine but this is the main complaint that I have made to XXXX. I have waited for months for a reply. Thank you, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A consumer, a retired senior on a fixed income, claims they were misled by solar panel sales representatives. The representatives allegedly promised a lower monthly payment, including replacement of a hot water heater and furnace, but the contract didn't include these items, and the actual loan terms were different, resulting in higher payments.

I followed ALL the steps the vanilla gift representative gave me and after enumerable attempts to contact them for replacement and reinstatement, the card is still valueless. Vanilla Gift is a SCAM and they intentionally attempt to XXXX people around until they just give up and stop attempting to remedy the situation.

Despite contacting Vanilla Gift and following their steps, the issue remains unresolved after nearly a year, with the consumer claiming they've been given the runaround.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX I received a {$250.00} XXXXXX/XX/XXXX from the management office in the XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I had won the gift card in their recent social media giveaway. The card was activated on site.

The order was declined and I received an error message saying there was a problem authorizing the purchase. I tried once more, with the same result. 

I logged onto the website listed on the back on the card to confirm the balance. I saw that for each time I tried to complete my XXXX order, XXXX cents had been taken off the card. So now my balance is {$240.00}. 

I saw a message saying that if I was having trouble using the card online, I should try to to register it with my name and zip code. I tried to do that with no success. I got an error message that said I had to register by phone. I called the number given and was connected to American Express. I explained the situation to the representative who told me that her department only registered cards that were issued before XXXX. She transferred me to another department. She did not offer any alternative solutions to help me use the gift card.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I charged my prepaid card in the amount of {$150.00} to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I stayed one night and checked out with no further incidentals. The room charges and fees came out to about {$40.00}, which I anticipated that coming out of the {$150.00}. The final refund should be {$110.00}.

I contacted Cashapp 1 week after checking out to inquire about the hold still pending and they stated there is nothing they can do before 31 days has passed do if the merchant doesnt resolve it. They advised me to reach out to the merchant because once the merchant releases the funds, the funds will be back in my account. 

I called the merchant ( XXXX ) on XX/XX/XXXX and they emailed me a copy of my XXXX  that shows they released the funds on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX. They advised I contact cashapp because they no longer had the funds. 

I contacted cashapp again to ask where my funds were, because the merchant confirmed they released them. I sent them a copy of the XXXX  with this inquiry. Since then, I have been told that it take 10-14 days, or it takes 31 days, but one thing consistently stated is that there is nothing more I can do.

I called one last time and advised I would be filing a complaint due to these practices, and I was placed on a long hold and then subsequently hung up on.

I think this is unacceptable because Cashapp has no reason or justifiable cause to hold these funds when the merchant has released them. This is not a credit company. The funds were my own cash that I am entitled to, and they have given no reason why they are holding it and no estimated time I can expect my funds back outside of a 31-day window.
Narrative Summary: A consumer prepaid $150 for a hotel stay, but after checking out with only $40 in charges, they're still waiting for a $110 refund. The merchant claims to have released the funds, but Cashapp continues to hold them, citing varying wait times with no clear resolution.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have two American Express pre-paid gift cards totaling {$5000.00}. Both cards are active and valid as confirmed when I called customer service on a number of occasions. On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, I tried to pay for an order at XXXX XXXX but both cards were declined. First I tried in the store, swiping the card, then when that was declined I tried to enter the card numbers manually online with XXXX XXXX and again both cards were declined. Customer service said there was nothing wrong with the cards and maybe I should just keep trying other merchants. They also offered to send two new cards but, as I explained, it wasn't an issue with the magnetic strip as both were declined when I tried to enter the gift card numbers manually. 

I should be able to use these cards where and when I want and said that to them. They couldn't care less. I ended up having to pay for the order on my personal credit card as it was going to be cancelled unless the charge was paid for on that date.
Narrative Summary: American Express prepaid gift cards totaling $5000 were declined at a merchant despite being confirmed active by customer service. The cards were declined both in-store and online, with customer service suggesting to try other merchants or issuing new cards, forcing the customer to use their personal credit card instead.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
