On XX/XX/2024 I purchased a prepaid gift card via the online store vanillagift.com in the amount of {$200.00} as a gift for my girlfriend. As a XXXX supported prepaid gift card, I assumed its use would be widely accepted and that seemed true based on the cardholder agreement. 

This assumption was wrong. As she attempted to use the card it was frequently getting denied. We attempted several different vendors and received the same result. A call to customer service by her yielded no assistance. As I looked for answers online, it seems to be a common trend that vanilla gift cards are not working as promised in the cardholder agreement and calls to customer service go unanswered.

Customer service calls were unhelpful, and online research revealed a common trend of similar issues with Vanilla gift cards not working as promised.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank of America recently sent me a letter end of 2023 stating my claim was approved in my favor but going to check for the funds they were not there. 

We came to the conclusion that My funds were stolen, my id ( was left sitting at my doorstep a week later ). Birth certificate and debit card, along with other gov items were stolen. Like my social security card. And never returned I sent Bank of America police reports and identity theft paper works to let them know this really happend. 

I think because its such a big amount they dont want to pay out. Which seems illegal. 

Ive given proof. 

This company ( BofA is affecting my life. 

This was my unemployment money to help me get on my feet and its being played with. 

Please help me fix this, I will be contacting other legal regulators as well
Narrative Summary: Bank of America approved a claim in the consumer's favor but failed to disburse funds, citing they were not available. The consumer claims their identity was stolen, including a debit card, and provided police reports and identity theft paperwork to the bank, but still hasn't received the approved funds.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently in XX/XX/2023, I became unemployed as a result of a mass layoff at my former employer. This resulted in me having to collect unemployment benefits while I seek new employment. The State of Arizona contracts with Way2Go Card/Conduent Corporation , which provides a barely functioning application/website that unemployment benefits are deposited onto. The application for the XXXX ( XXXX ) operating system is extremely glitchy, slow and unresponsive. I almost never used the app other than to transfer funds into my checking account, which worked just fine up until approximately three weeks ago. Out of nowhere, after the application redirected me to a confirmation page indicating that my transfer was successful, I noticed that the intended transfer never made it to my bank account. 

I was suspicious as to why, so I attempted to transfer again. The same exact event occurred where the funds were acknowledged to have been " transferred '', yet the transfer never took place and it was sent back to the prepaid card again. I called and spoke to a representative whom assured me that I could use any certain types of ATM machines listed on their online portal where I would not incur a surcharge. I visited the ATM in which the representative told me I could use free of charge ; this turned out to be not true, as the same ATM we discussed charged me a fee. Rather than drive all around town and try to find others, I simply accepted the fee and withdrew the funds. 

I called back later that day to speak to another agent and find out why I was being charged an ATM fee when I shouldn't have. That agent I spoke to advised me that their software application flagged my transfers as fraudulent, despite the transfers working like clockwork for the past XXXX months. Her thought process behind this ( as she was explaining it to me ) was that it " could be fraud even though its been going to my account the whole time ''. This is very illogical and I should have been notified either via the application that fraudulent activity was suspected, or someone should have attempted to contact me ; neither happened. 

Furthermore, that agent I spoke to advised me that " only some of the ATMs '' were free of charge, and that if I wanted to remove the block on my account ( that I was never properly notified about ), I would have to manually take pictures of personal information that had to match their requirements exactly. XXXX of these requirements happened to be a drivers license with my physical address matching ; which I can not provide. 

In summary, this is a very poorly designed application that is causing its unemployed users to incur unnecessary fees. In addition to this, they are a predatory organization that is not fit to serve the needs of the public. The state government needs to end its contract with this company ; it is unbelievable that they were able to enter into a partnership when they can not even provide basic transactional support.
Narrative Summary: The complaint is about issues with the Way2Go Card/Conduent Corporation application for Arizona unemployment benefits. The app suddenly flagged the user's transfers as fraudulent, causing them to fail, and also incorrectly indicated free ATM usage. The user was not notified of the issue and incurred fees.

Issue: Problem getting a card or closing an account

This dispute relates to two XXXX XXXX accounts held by me and two accounts held by my wife. 

On XX/XX/2024 I was unable to load funds to these cards and an email was sent to me and my wife that the cards were temporarily locked. We were also unable to log into those accounts. I called XXXX  on XX/XX/2024 and was told these accounts were permanently closed due to a returned charge ( I believe from a XXXX load of funds ). XXXX  customer service refused to provide any details -- such as the nature of the returned charge or the balances in the accounts. I was informed that the only way I could contact them to receive any information was by mail. 

I sent a letter on XX/XX/2024 requesting final statements on these accounts as well as funds from each account, which should be {$1000.00} per account. As of this date, XX/XX/2024, I have received no communications. 

Accordingly, I again called the XXXX  customer care number and was told to resubmit a request for this information by mail. I was refused, on multiple occasions, any direct telephone number to contact the company directly about the funds being held. 

I note as well that XXXX XXXX refusal to provide me with access to my account records has prevented me from seeking a chargeback or other resolution ( such as complaint with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) from XXXX  who created the falsely disputed charges in the first place.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's four XXXX XXXX accounts were permanently closed due to a returned charge, with no details provided by the company. Despite multiple requests by mail and phone, the consumer has not received account statements or the $4000 balance, and was refused direct contact information.

Consumer complaint narrative: I filed a prior complaint with CFPB, and contact was made with Incomm on XX/XX/year> with XXXX. They agreed to provide the refund on the prepaid cards, along with the activation fees, since the cards can not be used. They were awaiting documentation from me, which took a while, since I was traveling. All documentation, which was excessive, but I complied, and sent in on XX/XX/year>. Stated check would be received within 10 business days. No check has been received. They are now stating they do not refund activation fees, despite promising refunding them, and saying checks were issued on XX/XX/year>, which is not the case. Additionally, I request to speak with a US Based representative, and have a direct line of contact going forward for all issues with Incomm and Vanilla Visa, as I want a refund of all my cards purchased from them. They are constantly rejected for no reason. While I understand security measures to protect funds, they need to implement different and better security measures.
Narrative Summary: Incomm agreed to refund prepaid card balances and activation fees due to unusable cards. After submitting required documentation, the complainant was told to expect a check within 10 business days, but it never arrived. Incomm now denies refunding activation fees, contradicting their initial agreement.

Consumer complaint narrative:
There was an unauthorized charge on my vanilla gift card. 

purchase date : XX/XX/year> Amount : {$200.00}

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/2024 a total of {$820.00} dollars was taken from my account without my approval or knowledge. I call Bluebird by American Express on XXXX XXXX to inform them of this. They confirmed the transactions I was referencing and they issued me a new debit card and said they would be investigating these charges and would get back to me with further information. On XX/XX/2024, I received an email from bluebird requesting that I fill out and return a declaration of fraud form which I returned via email on XX/XX/2024. I did not hear anything further from them until XX/XX/2024 in which I was informed by email that my dispute had been declined.

After reporting the issue, a new debit card was issued and an investigation was initiated. However, the dispute was later declined despite the consumer submitting a declaration of fraud form.

Consumer complaint narrative: This is a follow up to to a previous complaint about direct express ( cfpb complaint number XXXX XXXX ). I was reassured that if I turned in the dispute forms before the due date I would be reimbursed for the transactions. So I turned in the dispute forms and a letter from my XXXX ( which shows XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  when the transactions happened ) before the due date. I was given a provisional credit for the disputed amount however on XX/XX/year> that provisional credit was reversed. This credit was reversed without any notice to me ( no email, no letter, no phone call ) and now i am facing disconnection of my utilities because I was not given any time to prepare for the lack of funds. Even though I DID NOT make or authorize the charges that I disputed. While at the XXXX  my purse was stolen and I filed a police report. I called Direct express on Friday XX/XX/year> to discuss the reversal and the women was cruel and unkind and made me feel stupid. I firmly believe that Direct Express is using my XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXXXXXX to their advantage. They are bullies and thieves! I demand immediate action and the refund of {$290.00} that direct express has stolen from me!
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes unauthorized transactions on their Direct Express account, submits required forms on time, and receives a provisional credit. However, the credit is reversed without notice, leaving the consumer facing utility disconnection and financial hardship, despite not making or authorizing the disputed charges.

Consumer complaint narrative: Called two different times XXXX pm XX/XX/year> and at XXXX am XX/XX/year> and received different transactions made and different amounts. The account information given to me changed each time I called. The account does not provide a beginning balance and the ending balance for the month. It's a rollover. It shows the amount deposited and the transaction amounts do not add. The name XXXX XXXX appears on statement, I don't have a XXXX XXXX account.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received inconsistent account information when calling twice, with different transactions and amounts. The account statement lacks a beginning balance, and transaction amounts don't add up. Additionally, an unknown name "XXXX XXXX" appears on the statement, suggesting an error or unauthorized account activity.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative: I paid for a hotel stay, including a {$71.00} deposit on XX/XX/year>. The hotel released the hold and credited the funds back to me on XX/XX/year>. Cash app never released those funds back to me. I reached out to an advocate and was told if I provided the folio from the hotel with a zero ( XXXX ) balance, they would credit my account. I supplied them with the folio and they are still refusing to give me my money back. On another incident, I placed an online order with XXXX for the amount of {$120.00}. The order was cancelled as the item wasnt available. XXXX says they have credited my account but cash app still has a hold on my funds and will not release them. This is {$200.00} of my money that they are holding for no reason.
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges that Cash App is holding $200 of their funds without reason. Two incidents: a $71 hotel deposit was refunded by the hotel but not released by Cash App, and a $120 online order was cancelled but Cash App still holds the funds despite the merchant's refund.

I spoke to the manager at XXXX XXXX  who reported that the card numbers of gift cards are frequently being stolen before customers can use them. I have been contacting the XXXX XXXX XXXX customer service representatives for months with no results. I have faxed and emailed information they requested in order to be refunded the {$200.00} but each time I follow their guidelines, they make excuses as to why they are not sending me a refund.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: I was given this card as a gift last year, I have tried to use it but my purchases keep being declined. I previously called the number on the back of the card and the representative told me I must go online to register the card. I did that and there is an error message telling me please try again. I called again today and spoke to XXXX different representatives who keep telling me the same thing. The first one told me the only way to register the card was on the website or through the phone, he told me he would transfer me but hung up instead. I called again and the second person told me the same thing, she transferred me and sent me to the same system asking me for my card number and sending me to another representative, this is going on a loop. I talk to the third person and this one tells me the same thing, I am explaining to her what has happened, and mid-sentence she hangs up. This is a scam.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a gift card that keeps getting declined. Despite multiple calls to the card's customer service, representatives repeatedly instructed them to register the card online, but the website yields an error message, and phone transfers result in a loop of unhelpful or disconnected calls.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online

Everyone at my office is having the same issues, and based on a XXXXXXXX XXXX, the CFPB appears to be the only option.
Narrative Summary: American Express gift cards with balances of $50-$500 are not working at various merchants or online, despite previous successful use. Multiple office employees are experiencing the same issue, prompting the complaint to the CFPB.

I I contacted the number on the back of the card on XX/XX/year> and spoke to a representative who opened a case and told me to email a copy of card front and back, send proof of residence and receipt. I told him I no longer have the receipt. I sent on a copy of the XXXX card, proof of residence and filed a lost/stolen report. I still have not heard back as Ive sent in several emails, faxes, calls and mailed a letter. I was under the impression that they would send me a money order or check for the amount of the card within 90 days. The case # XXXX with Vanilla visa contact Imcomm Resolution is Email to XXXX Fax to XXXX Mail to : XXXX, XXXX. 
Attn : Resolution Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Case Resolution XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Fax : XXXX Email : XXXX Please help me get a resolution with this business. This is very frustrating just trying to receive the money that was given to me to spend on my XXXX treatment. Please help expedite this if you can

After contacting Vanilla, the consumer was asked to provide documentation, which they sent, but despite multiple follow-ups, they have not received a refund or replacement, contrary to their expectation of a 90-day resolution.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to pay a bill
Consumer complaint narrative:
The online account assess system will no longer accept login names that contain special characters. My login I've used for many years has a character in it. For 6 weeks I have been calling to get the issue resolved. They keep saying that others are having the issue and IT is working on it. I asked that they request to have my login information deleted so I can create a new one since doing so now prompts the system to state that there is already login information on file for the account. I need to get online so I can access XXXX. The payee I have does not accept debit card payments. 

All of the calls I have made has never prompted anyone from US Bank to call or email me. I just keep calling back, to no avail. 

Thank you.

Sub-issue: Changes in terms from what was offered or advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re-submission of same claim as documented under XXXX, which, alas, has still produced no actual proof in support of the company 's claims that any terms and conditions documents were ever provided with the initial cards. To date, this has gone unproven, and I will continue to dispute what is undoubtedly a lie, until satisfaction is given! 

What proof will you provide that supports the allegations made? Please advise accordingly. Thank you. 

P.S., it would be in your company 's best interest to comply, so that I will put an auspicious end to this wholly disappointing course of conduct that your organization is so willing to perpetuate. I will not accept any outcome other than equitable indemnification of the misappropriated funds, and I have no intention of departing from that righteous path. As such, it would behoove you to alert your supervisors of this steadfast dedication to what is right, and simply return the wrongfully stolen funds.
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes a claim, alleging the company never provided terms and conditions documents with the initial cards. Despite previous complaints, no proof has been provided, and the consumer demands evidence to support the company's claims and seeks reimbursement for misappropriated funds.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
My XXXX XXXX XXXX mother buys gift cards for our family at XXXX, all must be registered through prepaidgiftbalance.com before they can be used. 
When I went to activate the cards on line an error is reflected. I then tried to get help on line. The company for assistance on line makes customers provide the below information : XXXX barcode on the back of the card, the XXXX card number and XXXX security code ; Front and back photo of gift card ; Receipt of gift card purchase ; Valid Photo Identification ; Cardholder name ; Cardholder address. 
We wanted to use the cards that day so I called the number provided on the website, XXXX. The customer representative told me the cards had been locked out and to XXXX my Social Security XXXX and ID to them with a picture of the card. 
We now have XXXX gift cards in the amounts of {$50.00}, {$100.00}, {$150.00} and an unknown amount that an XXXX XXXX XXXX spent her limited income on that are worthless! Disgusting! 
All cards purchased at XXXX 's, XXXX XXXX, XXXX CA.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Trouble getting information about the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, serviced by XXXX, XXXX. Upon trying to use my card, XXXX 's fraud prevention system locked my card. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted customer service, and they started case XXXX. As requested, I sent the front and back of the card, and the receipt to XXXX. 

I've since contacted their customer service again on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. I don't even think that they're opening the emails because the case is " Closed '' according to the customer service agent. The agent has no way to reopen the ticket, but can only suggest I resend the documents.
Narrative Summary: A customer's credit card was locked by the bank's fraud prevention system after a purchase. Despite submitting required documents and multiple follow-ups, the customer service case was closed without resolution, and the customer is unable to get the case reopened or assistance.

Issue: Problem getting a card or closing an account
Sub-issue: Trouble closing card
Consumer complaint narrative: I bought a card XXXX from XXXX on or around XX/XX/year> for {$500.00}. It was supposed to work, but it stopped working with {$450.00} balance on it. I tried to get a replacement. I got a replacement very late around XX/XX/year> or so but the company refused to activate the card. " XXXX '' said he could not activate it. I want my money back since the product is defective.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased a $500 card that stopped working with a $450 balance. After a delayed replacement, the company refused to activate the new card, citing inability to do so. The consumer seeks a refund, claiming the product is defective.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Charged for a purchase or transfer you did not make with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: There was an unauthorized charge made on my XXXX  card that was linked to an XXXX account. I contacted XXXX and they suggested I report it to my financial institution. After two months, my claim was denied.
Narrative Summary: A consumer reported an unauthorized charge on their card linked to an account. They contacted the account provider, who advised reporting to their financial institution. After a two-month wait, the claim was denied, leaving the consumer with an unresolved issue.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: I am unable to use an AMEX GIFT CARD. The value is {$100.00}. Amex says the card is active and also is able to be used on online or in physical stores. Anytime I try to use it it is always declined,
Narrative Summary: A consumer reports a $100 Amex gift card is being declined despite Amex confirming it's active and usable online or in-store.

Sub-issue: Trouble getting information about the card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024 I purchased XXXX {$200.00} XXXX virtual gift cards from XXXX ( Blackhawk Network ). I activated these cards in my online account at myprepaidcenter.com using my usual profile/account under my email address ( XXXX ). Shortly thereafter, my account was locked and I have since been unable to access the account in order to view the card details in order to make purchases with the cards. This effectively means that {$2400.00} in funds have been locked for over 2 months. I request that my account is unlocked, all cards are unlocked and all card numbers are presented to me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased $2400 in virtual gift cards from Blackhawk Network, but after activating them, their account was locked, preventing access to card details and use of the funds for over 2 months. They request account and card unlocking to access the funds.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> a merchant ask for a pre-authorization for a transaction. They never followed through with the processing of the transaction and it fell out of pending. Out of nowhere it came back and charged to the card which caused the prepaid card to be overdrawn. When I called about the transaction I was told that my account was permanently suspended and closed. I asked them why they did that to me and the response was I can write a letter and get a response within XXXX to XXXX days as to why they closed my account on me. I explained to them I have had this account for over XXXX  years in my direct deposit goes to this account and there is not enough time to change my direct deposit. I was told right the letter and you'll get an answer within XXXX to XXXX days that is not giving me any information at all
Narrative Summary: A merchant's pre-authorization from a previous year unexpectedly processed, overdrawing a prepaid card. When the consumer inquired, they were told their account was permanently suspended and were advised to write a letter for a response, which would take too long to resolve the issue before their direct deposit.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased XXXX prepaid, Visa gift cards. Each time I attempted to use the cards my transaction was rejected by the issuer. The issuer is XXXX XXXX, the cards are serviced by Incomm Financial Services. 

Pathward/Incomm routinely blocks legitimate transactions under the guise of " consumer protection ''. They do so in the hopes that delaying the spend down on the cards will lead to windfall and unmerited profits for the issuer. How? By frustrating users and rejecting consumer purchases, chances increase that users will simply give up and not use the cards. By frustrating users and delaying spend down chances increase that users will misplace their cards. This is unethical behavior. 

I have been forced to endure lengthy delays, lost submissions and poor customer service on the numerous occassions on which I have forced to seek refunds and card replacements from XXXX/Incomm. That is why I now appeal directly to CFPB in the hopes of not only receiving a refund for these XXXX cards, but some action on the part of CFPB to sanction XXXX/Incomm so that the entities stop this eggregious behavior.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims that Pathward/Incomm, the issuer and servicer of prepaid Visa gift cards, repeatedly blocks legitimate transactions under the guise of "consumer protection", leading to frustration and potential abandonment of the cards, resulting in unmerited profits for the issuer.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a card from XXXX, it was a NetSpend prepaid card I loaded the card at XXXX for {$40.00} on the same day, I got home called to activate the card and it wouldn't allow me to activate it it said to call customer service, I called customer service sat on hold for XXXX hours to be told I can't activate the card due to them not allowing me to have account with them, even though I have had a regular card through them for years now with no problems from my end nor there's, they told me they couldn't activate it due to problem an they would be sending me my {$40.00} to my address an almost a month has went by no sign of my {$40.00} in the mail I have called several times keep getting the run around, I really needed this XXXX dollars I know it's only XXXX dollars but I'm on a fixed income I need everything I have, please help me
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased a NetSpend prepaid card, loaded $40, but couldn't activate it due to a supposed account issue. Customer service promised a refund, but after nearly a month, the consumer hasn't received the $40, despite multiple follow-up calls.

Issue: Problem getting a card or closing an account
Sub-issue: Trouble getting, activating, or registering a card
Consumer complaint narrative: Okay this is my second complaint regarding this matter, I disputed my account with bank of America prepaid debit card service who provided a card to a individual who used my stolen information to collect my benefits, I first notified the bank of the dispute in XXXX, I then suffered a medical accident that cause me to be placed into a coma, after recovery I call in about my claim and after they put me through the ringer in regards to verifying my identity, ( witch to me shows proof that fraud occured ) they have me come into a branch of bank of america to show valid id and call from the branch to voice my concerns. finding out that my dispute was not properly documented rendering the whole dispute non existence, furious I then re submitted my claim. Witch was now made into 2 separate claim. Now over my personal phone I was magically verified. That was my first set of issues. Now waiting on any information on the status of my claim I to this day have not received any documentation on the matter. Seventeen ( 17 ) days into my claim I first get a denial on the second claim number on the 11th day, no documents on why or how they reached that decision, as well as the factors I requested to know. The first claim of non archived transactions.is still ln pending status. This is not making sense to me so I look into the matter, it is to my understanding that my claim of the archived transactions was denied solely on the possibility of the bank not being able to go after the merchant for funds I disputed. I don't think that's complaint with EFTA mainly in regard to regulation E. The have not handled my dispute in any way shape or form compliant to the specific rules that are laid out in the law under regulation E. Further more, the time fram is past the 10 days required by the law in the EFTA under regulation E 1005.11, from the time I disputed the transactions, to statement plus 60 days I should be extended provisional credit. That's just the EFTA. Not only that fact XXXX requires them to provide provisional credits after 5DAYS! Being that these people ( BOA ) has gone on record stating they let XXXX XXXX dollars into the hands of criminals, I'm not understanding why they think they can keep my benefits from me. Regulation E also states that if they are to provide me with provisional credit, they can request I put this in writing. Witch they have not requested at this time. They have requested I send in my drivers licence and medical documents, witch is a violation of the privacy act of 1947, as well as HIPPA. So I comply, they give me a fax number to send it to. I call later on to check the status and they don't have them and even state that I was given the wrong fax number, now due to the mis information given to me by the rep of bank of america some random fax machine has my medical documentation, as well as a copy of my drivers license information. I tell they this and they say all they can do is submit a complaint, witch I doubt they did.and they give me a new fax number to now haven't to find a way to get out and send out again. This a huge violation of my rights and I'm furious about the whole thing. Being that I'm trying to get the benefits I need witch are necessary to my survival at this point I do it again and send them out and when I call in 3 business days later the documents are still not attached and the customer service rep tells me " well everyone shares a fax so ANYTHING COULD HAVE HAPPENED ''. Please refer to all the recorded phone conversations to see what I'm saying is true. How is it that a bank is letting everyone have access to a consumers private information. I will be shocked to learn that up to this day they still havet submitted my documents. When I ask to speak to a supervisor they simply say they will tell you the same thing and that they don't have back office access to further look into my concerns, so in a nut shell I'm still with out payment while they are taking more then ten ( 10 ) Business days to investigate the matter but they have requested my personal medical information then had me send it to the wrong fax number, and when I asked they said '' well its not mandatory, we ask if your willing to submit them under your own interest of getting a verdict on your dispute. THATS NOT HOW THEY WORDED IT WHEN THE REQUSTED THAT I SEND IN THOSE MEDICAL DOCUMENTS. This is criminal to say the least and I'm submitting a second complaint because after the first one I got one email from XXXX XXXX stating I would hear back in 48 hrs and I haven't received anything since that email was sent to me six days ago. I called in today and REQUSTED to be connected with a supervisor and the lady said well they wont tell you anything different then me and I replied on since my status is showing pending and I have concerns on regulation E compliance. Why isn't there anyone I can speak to and she then stated that they don't have anyone that can give me any more information on the matter that I have to wait for a decision. Being that these people are most likely not properly trained on how to handle these disputed while remaining in compliance with regulation is is no one fault but the company in my opinion so I thanked her for her help gave her a good score on their survey as I always do and came back to the cfpb to submit this second complaint.im in serious need or my earned benefits as a consumer and they being with held from me using sneaking tactics will not be tolerated, i have asked on multiple occasions on where i would submitted paperwork regarding litigation on the matter since they cant seem to remain in honor when handling consum er information and concerns and again got the same generated answer that states they don't have any further information on the matter. This is unacceptable and I'm ready to sue for much more then my disputed claim.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer disputes a Bank of America prepaid debit card transaction, claiming their stolen information was used to collect benefits. Despite multiple attempts to resolve the issue, the bank has not provided documentation or provisional credit as required by Regulation E, and has mishandled sensitive personal and medical information.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online

Sub-issue: Overdraft charges
Consumer complaint narrative:
I want to start off by saying that I have official brought these concerns to XXXX XXXX XXXX 's attention and I recieved a letter back on letterhead saying I was wasting their time that should be used for other customers the geniually need XXXX 

XXXX XXXX XXXX is a pre-paid debit payroll card. When meeting the requirements of deposits and teir level in the XXXX app they allow you to take an advance or whatever they want to call it. These advances aren't not allowed to be negotiated. You have to take the whole amount and nothing more or nothing less. All that is fine. But what happens after is the questionable conduct. After recieving the money, ALL DEPOSITS are taken until payment is paid. Which is from my understand a compulsary use of XXXX. The period of wait until payments are to be made is not given. Also, I was also under the impression that a finaincail company can only take XXXX forced payment a month from an account. Not EVERY deposit. Also, until money is repaid XXXX and XXXX XXXX prohibit you from changing your cash out method in the app. Which violates even more laws from federal and state forcing you to use a finiancial institution. 

In my situation, the amount I had to take was {$150.00} dollars. I needed the entire amount to pay a bill. So all work afterwards deliverying with XXXX XXXX is taken. Mind you XXXX percent of the offers you get on XXXX Eats are under {$4.00} dollars with tip. So over XXXX delivery 's until I can use that money to put gas in the car or anything. It won't and hasn't happend and I still owe then entire XXXX because I can't afford to sit there and work without pay for XXXX delivery 's.
Narrative Summary: The consumer complains about XXXX XXXX XXXX's pre-paid debit payroll card, specifically the advance repayment process. After taking an advance, all deposits are withheld until repayment, with no specified repayment period. This practice allegedly violates laws, forcing users to use a specific financial institution.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently purchased two ( 2 ) " XXXX '' brand Prepaid VISA cards. These cards were are distributed and serviced by InComm Financial Services Inc.

Both cards in this complaint were defective and could not be used to make a single purchase. When I tried to make a purchase with these cards, payment terminals always responded with the message " Not Authorized ''.

I asked InComm Financial Services for the refund of the total amount paid ( {$1000.00} ) and opened their Case # XXXX. 
I also submitted all requested materials on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
However the company didn't act in good faith, and kept asking to repeat the same submission multiple times without issuing the refund.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased two prepaid VISA cards, but both were defective and unusable. Despite submitting required materials multiple times, InComm Financial Services failed to issue a refund of $1000, instead repeatedly requesting resubmission of the same information.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received an Amex XXXX XXXX. It arrived in an email from XXXX. When I follow the link in the email, the card number, expiration date, and CVV appear, and it initially showed a balance of {$500.00}. When using these details at XXXX, no field for CVV appears, but the card appears to work. When checking back a few days later, the payment has not gone through. On the amexgiftcard.com page, there are some confusing transactions. One is a {$.00} charge used to verify the card. The other says " Declined - Missing security code - XXXXXXXX XXXX ... ''. So far, there is no error message on XXXX ; it looks the same as if it's still waiting for the payment to go through. 

I also tried using the card at XXXX. In this case, there was a field for CVV, and filling out the details appeared to work. However, I quickly received an email from XXXX saying the payment was declined. The page for the card then showed many more transactions that say " Declined - Missing XXXXecurity code - XXXX XXXX  NC INTERNET FULFILLMENT ... ''. The order total was separated into XXXX amounts, and each amount appears 2 or 3 times. To reiterate, the CVV was supplied for the XXXX order. 

This has happened with previous AmEx XXXX cards like this as well, but I just dealt with it. Hopefully this detailed report will be helpful in correcting this issue.
Narrative Summary: The consumer received an American Express gift card via email, but encountered issues when trying to use it. Despite entering the correct CVV, the card was declined due to a "missing security code" error, resulting in multiple failed transactions and confusing records on the Amex website.

Sub-issue: Trouble getting information about the card
Consumer complaint narrative: This is a lot of lying about my benefits by bank of America employees and they tell me last few months that there is money on this card XXXX and XXXX including mailing me XXXX twice recently so there is money there so why are they concealing my benefits from me You must open up my card XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.

They received mail confirming funds, but the bank is allegedly concealing their benefits, and they're requesting their card be unlocked to access the funds.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative: I never received my stimulus payments from XX/XX/XXXX ( {$1200.00} ) and XX/XX/XXXX ( {$1400.00} ) so I contacted DIRECT EXPRESS/COMERICA BANK and asked for an investigation along with the bank statements to conduct my own investigation..once I filled out the paperwork sent from DIRECT EXPRESS I waited several months only to be told they couldn't do anything because " I exceeded the time frame '' ..after complaining for several months i was told to contact the IRS..I sent the IRS several tax forms and other information and spoke to several agents over 8 months and was told by a higher up that a XXXX XXXX was done and DIRECT EXPRESS/COMERICA BANK were holding the money so long IT EXPIRED..I was sent XXXX letters from the IRS showing that DIRECT EXPRESS/COMERICA said they received the money but never deposited it into my account on XX/XX/XXXX like they said they did..for the record DIRECT EXPRESS/COMERICA BANK is already in a class action lawsuit for withholding other people 's stimulus payments as well
Narrative Summary: The consumer never received two stimulus payments ($1200 and $1400) and after contacting Direct Express/Comerica Bank, was told they couldn't help due to a time frame issue. The IRS later confirmed the bank held the funds too long, causing them to expire, despite claiming to have deposited them.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online

I have tried to contact VanillaGift.com. 
I am unable to get in touch with a human to talk about my issue. 
Just an automated option list that does not offer any problem solving Catagory. 

My gift card started.out with {$500.00} on it. 
I was able to use it without any issues until I had a balance of {$85.00} left on it. Then it was denied. This card started being denied in XX/XX/year>2024 and still gets denied today. 
I call and get my balance, The recording says I have {$85.00} balance and my card is active I would be grateful for any help you could give me. 

Thank you

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I reached out to PayPal customer service in reference to my online account being locked. The account was verified and the female agent informed me the reason my account and card were locked. She inquired if I had made a purchase on Friday XX/XX/XXXX that flagged the account. I told her I did not manually make the charge but it could be a monthly draft. I reiterated I just wanted my account unlocked to have online access. During the back and forth exchange she made reference to my card being already blocked. I shouted to her, " I never authorized you to do that. This is the same {$39.00} charged monthly! '' While going back to look through my billing. PayPal should have never sent a " fraud alert '' for a charge that has been billed monthly since XXXX of 2023 ( See attached ). Agent stated based on my response that is why it was blocked. I asked her if she knew what the word manually meant and repeated again angrily, " I did not give you permission to block my card. I never said my card was lost or stolen. I never stated the charge was fraud. '' I told her she illegally blocked my card. This card still had a remaining balance from my social security benefits. I also told her this card is the card account that my benefits are deposited on and that I would be contacting a government agency in reference to the deceptive behavior. I requested to speak to a supervisor. The agent then transferred me back into the initial que with the main menu options. I called back a second time and spoke with an agent by the name of XXXX. I rehashed the entire situation. I asked for a supervisor. I was put on hold for XXXX minutes before XXXX then disconnected my call. A XXXX call was placed, speaking to agent XXXX, then explaining the same situation. I requested a supervisor once again, however XXXX stated that he would need to transfer me to another line, customer service in order to get my card unblocked. I asked him to confirm that customer service would be able to unblock my card and he answered in the affirmative, " Yes they will. '' After being transferred to a customer service agent I was informed that in no way could my card be unblocked. PayPal does not unblock cards once they have been reported lost or stolen. My question to the agent, " When exactly was the card reported lost or stolen? '' He replied, " It was reported today XX/XX/XXXX. '' Supposedly I verified the transactions as fraud through either text message or via email. ( see email attached confirming I never responded to the fraud alert and phone logs confirming fraud alert text was never sent to me ) I explained to the agent that no one ever sent me a text to confirm, AND that I never responded to the email. The call was then disconnected. 
What's more troubling, outside of the fact that I never authorized the block, I should have never received a fraud alert for a charge that has been billed to me monthly since XX/XX/2023. PayPal has done this on numerous occasions by obstructing my use of my government benefits. This practice of " randomly '' locking and or blocking cards/accounts w/o justification is an illegal business practice. There was no reason for PayPal NetSpend to send out a fraud alert and then have a customer service agent state the reason for the fraud alert was due to a charge that is unfamiliar to their system. This statement is completely false, and charge has been " familiar '' to their system at least for the last 14 months. Another concern and or a deceptive practice are the dates my online account indicates the card in question was reported lost/ stolen. I noticed after gaining access, my account illustrates my card was reported los/stolen yesterday, Sunday, XX/XX/XXXX. With a second card on the account listed as being lost /stolen Thursday XX/XX/XXXX. On either date did I contact Paypal. So then how were my cards reported lost /stolen, when there was no contact with PayPal in any form. In other words, PayPal listed these cards as reported lost/ stolen prior to me reaching them. Agents attempted to convince me I responded to either a text message or an email confirming the charge was fraud. To reiterate, I did neither. I never responded to a fraud alert email and fraud alert text message was never sent. ( see attached cell phone log ). Disturbing is the fact that the first agent, being a female, sent XXXX separate texts. First one, that my card was lost, and the XXXX it was stolen. So then, why does the system indicate that my card was reported lost/stolen yesterday XX/XX/XXXX.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer's PayPal account and card were locked due to a flagged monthly draft of $39.00, despite being a recurring charge since 2023. The consumer claims they never authorized the block and did not report the card lost or stolen, yet PayPal agents stated it was reported as such.

A week after that it shows XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) than a week later it did not show I had that XXXX transaction XXXX XXXX XXXX I call to complain, A case XXXX XXXX XXXX is given & am told They will call me in 7 days. I did not get a call. XXXX Today I called XXXX different times. Once I was transferred & put on hold 40 minutes & disconnected by them. The other two times I am told no record of that exists. It is the second time this has happened & I plan to quit them after this is resolved. I learned U must take screenshots of transactions right away as proof becuz they will deny it existed.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I originally purchased two XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX in two separate transactions on XX/XX/year>. Each card was loaded with {$500.00} with a fee of {$5.00} per card. Cost of each card as a result of fees was {$500.00}, so total cost of the two cards was {$1000.00}. 

I tried using both cards at multiple retailers including XXXX XXXX and XXXX and never had success ; they would all decline. I reached out to XXXX customer service and complained that I was unable to use the cards. They shared that the cards were faulty and would issue two replacement cards for me. I did receive the two replacement cards shortly after this. I tried to use the replacement cards at multiple retailers and had no success due to declines as well. 

I reached out to customer service on XX/XX/year> and shared my frustration that both replacement cards were still not working. They shared that they can send me a refund check as I have had no success in using the cards at multiple retailers. They shared that I needed to submit pictures of the front and back of the cards, receipts for purchases of the cards, and note requesting refund with my mailing address to XXXX They opened two cases, one case per card. Case numbers was XXXX & XXXX. I submitted the requested information to them in two separate emails with the respective case numbers in the subject line on XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I received an automated response that they received my messages and would be back in touch soon. 

I hadn't heard back from them so I called numerous times and they shared that they show that they don't have the documents and need me to resubmit it. I forwarded the previously sent emails on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and they shared on the phone that someone should get back to me in 24 to 48 hours. I waited and never heard back from them and called again. They shared that since both cards are for me, they closed one case and put both cards under case number XXXX. They shared that I need to resubmit the documents with all documents in one email with the case number XXXX in the subject and I would hear back in 24 to 48 hours. I resubmitted the information in one email as they asked on XX/XX/year> at XXXXXXXX XXXX I waited and as usual with this company, I never heard back other than the automated messages that they received my email and would be back in touch. 

I called them again on XX/XX/year> and shared my frustration that they kept making promises that they have escalated the case and would contact me and I never got a response. The guy apologized and wrote all the details of my case down in the file and shared someone would be in touch with me in 48 to 72 hours. I'm writing this complain on XX/XX/year> and still have not heard back from them on the status of my refund. I'm asking for a refund for the total cost of both cards of {$1000.00}. This company is a disgrace with making broken promises and taking people 's money and not returning it or allowing you to spend it on the card. Please investigate and pursue getting this corrected for me and all other consumers that this is likely happening to. I'm including copies of the images that I have shared in email with them that shows the receipt for the respective card, the original card, and the replacement card that they sent me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased two prepaid cards with $500 each and a $5 fee. Despite multiple attempts, the cards and their replacements were declined at retailers. The company offered a refund, but after multiple submissions of required documents and numerous phone calls, the consumer still hasn't received a refund for the $1000 total cost.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: The American Express gift card was given to me as a gift on XX/XX/XXXX. I attempted to use it the next day, XX/XX/XXXX, online at an online apparel store, but the card was declined. The card 's transaction description says the card was declined due to " Missing Security Code, '' despite the fact I entered the correct security code. Additionally, my card was charged a {$0.00} fee for each declined attempt. I attempted to use it the next day, XX/XX/XXXX, only to incur an additional {$0.00} of fees on declined charges. The next day, XX/XX/XXXX, angered and frustrated, I attempted to use it with a different store, only to be declined twice, but have the transaction go through on the third try. I did not change card or shipping information, but the card apparently magically worked one time. Encouraged by this, I then returned to the initial apparel vendor, only to have the card once again declined. I then called the American Express gift card helpline only to be met by a man with XXXX phone connection so I could not understand most of what he said to me. However, when I asked him whether this was a merchant issue or an American Express issue, the man clearly replied, " There is no issue, the card just can not be used with this vendor. ''
Narrative Summary: American Express gift card declined multiple times despite correct security code entry. Card incurred fees for each declined attempt. After a single successful transaction, the card was declined again at the initial vendor. Customer service attributed the issue to incompatibility with the vendor.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a physical American Express XXXX XXXX for {$500.00}. I have tried to use it at multiple online stores and it has been declined at all of them. For some of the transactions there has even been a {$0.00} charge to the card even though the transaction was declined. There are sufficient funds on the card to cover the transactions and I entered all the info as directed by the American Express XXXX XXXX site - there is an FAQ on how to use the card at online stores and I followed all the directions. The directions state to enter it as a credit card ( not gift card ) and enter the card number, the expiration date and the security code. If it requires a billing address, the American Express XXXX XXXX XXXX says to enter my name and billing address. I did all of that and they card was still declined. I then called American Express XXXX XXXX customer service and they told me I can not use it at online locations that require a billing address, even though the American Express XXXX XXXX FAQ online said to enter my own info if that is requested. The customer support representative just suggested I use it at a physical location that takes the card, which is not particularly helpful.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a $500 American Express card, but it was declined at multiple online stores despite sufficient funds. The card's FAQ instructed to enter personal info if a billing address was required, but customer service contradicted this, stating the card can't be used online with a billing address.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Charged for a purchase or transfer you did not make with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: My cash app card was stolen on XX/XX/year>. XXXX charges were made the morning of the XXXX before I was aware that it was missing. One at a XXXX and the other a few minutes later was made at a XXXX. I filed a dispute with cash app about the XXXX charges. Cash app approved the dispute and refunded the {$10.00} from the XXXX transaction. However the dispute from the {$160.00} XXXX transaction made just an hour or so apart was denied. A police report was also submitted on the XXXX unauthorized transactions. I also had my card charged from XXXX XXXX for XXXX $ and when I tried filing a dispute for that charge my card was deactivated and when I asked them why they declined to give me any reason. Ive been a loyal customer and have done a lot of business with cash app and thought they were an honest company. My opinion has since changed. Please advise them to return the funds that were fraudulently taken from my account and return my cash app card privileges. Thank you
Narrative Summary: A consumer's Cash App card was stolen, resulting in unauthorized charges of $10 and $160. Cash App refunded the $10 charge but denied the $160 dispute, despite a police report. The consumer's card was later deactivated when they tried to dispute another charge.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Charged for a purchase or transfer you did not make with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX was filed here and to date no response has been given. BofA has had close to 4 years to investigate the fraud on my account. How much more time does the bank need? They are given two billing cycles and no more than 90 days to repair this mess and 4 years later here we are. While disputing these fraudulent charges I was never issued any type of provisional credit. My account was not closed nor was the card closed by the bank and a new card issued. This continued to pose huge problems as my number was being used both Internationally and here in the states. The fraud continued due to the lack of any security protection on the XXXX cards. This was a criminals heaven. I would wait on 6 hour hold times just to hear that the bank felt the charges were mine. Knowing they werent I began to become very proactive and with my due diligence began getting some of the money back. I knew something was off with the bank when they said to me that I could be going to a XXXX based dentist be on a XXXX XXXX shopping spree and be standing at an ATM in XXXX all within moments of one another. I gave them names of ATM owners I gave them names of store owners and they never filed any type of dispute charges on my behalf. How do I know this?? Three days ago I was on the phone with BofA claims and I was told that the XXXX XXXX shopping spree was still on my statement. When I found out that it was a gentleman who swiped the card numeorus times and was denied. The last time he swiped time XXXX or XXXX the bank approved the transaction. The manager said the moment your bank disputes the charge we would be happy to help you get your funds but the bank must initiate the claim. Now here is a bank who swears that the charges are mine and the people, places and things I have shown are not. Covid was in full swing there was no travel allowed. No crossing broders of other countries. But BofA said the charges are yours and that was that. Now I am owed XXXX and that is what I expect back. This has gone XXXX XXXX XXXX of absurd and to keep me waiting on top of the 4 I have waited is not right. If you had done your investigation when I called this would have been a closed deal. Why? Because you would have seen that the dentists, shopping sprees, wix, and all other items disputed are not mine. 

You have had more than ample time to do this right. The letters I received XX/XX/year> saying you're done with your investigation and the charges are still mine is false. 

Having my money stolen from me is wrong having a bank where the cards they issued had no security on them is negligent. Bank of America you need to be held accountable for this. You allowed my money to be stolen while you sit back and say " the charges are XXXX 's '' is false. 

How much time do you still need to try and make this fit into your narrative? You handled the XXXX accounts poorly you have been fined and the accounts taken away from your bank. If I need to hire an attorney to get my money back for me I will. I have now filled out complaints with the California Attorney General 's office, the Comp Controllers, the XXXX, the FTC and here on the CFPB. A police report was filled out years ago online during the closure due to COVID. I would like my money please send me a check for the XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges Bank of America failed to properly investigate and resolve a 4-year-old case of account fraud, despite being given two billing cycles and 90 days to resolve the issue. The bank never issued provisional credit, and the consumer claims they were forced to take proactive steps to recover some of the stolen funds.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a XXXXXXXX XXXX prepaid American Express Giftcard for winning a XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXl The first day I was able to use my card at a store, restaurant, and XXXX online vendors ( XXXX and XXXX ), absolutely no problems For the past 3 days I can use my card for anything, Ive been declined online, in stores, at gas stations, pharmacies, restaurants, corner stores etc When I check the Amex website it says that its missing a security code and thus is declined every time This is weird as I put in the security code every time to have the card linked in the first place When I tried to contact Amex there customer service has to be based offshore, so its hard to communicate my issues and also hard to understand them In addition no matter what the only 2 answers I ever got no matter who or for how long I spoke to them, was that a ) my card is active and should be ready to use, wait a day if your having issues ( Im now on day 3 ) and b ) weve enhanced our security features for our cards so this could also be the reason for declined ( but then they NEVER tell you what those security features are or how to avoid them etc, etc ) This is just absolutely ridiculous that I cant spend the money off a giftcard, Ive NEVER had this problem with a visa giftcard but my first ( and last ) Amex card is giving me all types of issues I want a full refund of the XXXX $ sent to me via check, Im sick Amex and dont want to deal with the company of the gift card anymore
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a prepaid American Express Giftcard, which initially worked but was declined everywhere after 3 days. The Amex website cited a missing security code as the issue, despite the consumer entering it. Poor customer service and unclear security features exacerbated the problem.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: I have two American Express prepaid gift cards, each with {$50.00} on them. I have tried using the cards multiple times, online and in person, and the transactions are always declined. I have verified that the cards are valid, and that they both have {$50.00} available on them, both through their online balance check option, as well as by calling their customer service number. The customer service representative confirmed that the cards were valid and both had {$50.00} available on them, too, but offered little to no assistance in figuring out how I could get them to work. I have tried using them as split transactions along with a credit card, using them for a purchase of significantly less than the available amount, adding them to my XXXX account, adding them to my XXXX wallet, and adding them to my XXXX wallet. Nothing works, yet American Express will do nothing to help me recover the {$100.00} I have sitting there between the two cards.
Narrative Summary: The consumer has two American Express prepaid gift cards with $50 each, but transactions are consistently declined despite verified balances and validity. The customer service representative confirmed the cards' validity but offered little assistance in resolving the issue, leaving $100 unrecoverable.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative: This complaint is in regards to XXXX XXXX XXXX emergency transfers totalling over {$22000.00}. All of the transactions were made via XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX within days of each other. Note, this was during the height of the pandemic and prior to me ever receiving or activating my prepaid XXXX account/debit card. I filed the claim in XX/XX/XXXX and my account was frozen due to suspected fraud. I never requested or received any of these funds. The first reason I was given for my claim being denied was that it hadn't been filed in a timely fashion. I requested a reconsideration which was also denied, and despite being legally obligated to do so, Bank of America refused to provide me with any information/documentation that was used in making their decision. In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from B of A informing me that I could request that my previously denied claims could be re opened as they may have been subject to being unfairly and or prematurely denied in error. I decided to re-open my claim and faxed several documents, including a police report and documentation from CA XXXX to support my claim. Unfortunately, all of my efforts have been in vain as this, and several other claims I've submitted still remain unresolved. My only point of contact, the B of A prepaid claims dept. have been kind but are entirely incapable of assisting me which has been incredibly frustrating. Finally, I would like to note that I contacted XXXX XXXX on numerous occasions and finally received some relevant feedback from a supervisor named XXXX. He stated that no funds could have been collected at the XXXX XXXX XXXX branch in XX/XX/XXXX because they were not open to the public at that time due to the Pandemic. As a single parent of XXXX ( widower ) I had hoped that this matter would be taken care of in a more expedited fashion, alas it has not, in fact I have only had access to my account from XX/XX/XXXX and have spent hours seeking a resolution. I have been very patient and only request the funds which were stolen. Funds which my family truly need. I would like to thank whomever handles this matter in advance for any assistance which you may be able provide.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims Bank of America denied their claim for over $22,000 in unauthorized emergency transfers made via XXXX XXXX during the pandemic, before they received or activated their prepaid account/debit card. Despite multiple attempts to resolve the issue, the claim remains unresolved.

Consumer complaint narrative: Re-submission of same claim as documented under XXXX, which, alas, has still produced no actual proof in support of the company 's claims that any terms and conditions documents were ever provided with the initial cards. To date, this has gone unproven, and I will continue to dispute what is undoubtedly a lie, until satisfaction is given! What proof will you provide that supports the allegations made? Please advise accordingly. Thank you. P.S., it would be in your company 's best interest to comply, so that I will put an auspicious end to this wholly disappointing course of conduct that your organization is so willing to perpetuate. I will not accept any outcome other than equitable indemnification of the misappropriated funds, and I have no intention of departing from that righteous path. Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
We received a Vanilla Card for a birthday gift in XX/XX/XXXX XXXX. The value of the card was {$50.00}. This card balance was {$0.00} when I used for the first time on XX/XX/XXXX. I emailed them on XX/XX/XXXX copy of the front and back of the gift card, legible photo of the receipt, as their online website details to contact them when you have an issue with a card with no funds. I received an email stating the following : Your documents have been received. Please allow up to 24 business hours for documents to be processed to your ticket. In most cases, you will hear back from us within 3-5 business days after the required documents are received. However, it can take up to 30 days. If you need updates on your ticket, please reach out to the XXXX number on your card or visit our website. This inbox is not monitored for inquires. 

I never received any type of call back, no correspondence, nothing. However, I still waited to hear back in case, there was any type of delay due to the holidays. I called their XXXX number on XX/XX/XXXX and I was told that my case was escalated and they issued me a case number. I told them my scenario of trying to use a card which had a {$0.00} balance. It was opened for the first time in the restaurant. I waited and waited to hear from a supervisor and no one called me. 
I called again on XX/XX/XXXX. Again, I spoke to a supervisor named XXXX and complained again for the same thing. I told them I had emailed them everything they needed and yet I still have not received my replacement card in the mail like I was promised two months back. I was told to wait to hear back. 
I called again on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke to XXXX. She stated she will accelerate my case and will send a card after talking to investigation team. I was promised the same with this phone call as with all the others and I was extremely upset. 
Again, after couple months later, I decided to try again to see what the hold up was since I never received any correspondence nor any phone calls to receive any type of resolution to my issue. I called again on XX/XX/XXXX. I was issued another complain log #. I was asked for my date of birth and my address again. They should have had all this information, yet I was asked again. I refused to give any more information as this should be documented with the many times I had called. She did not offer me any resolution except I could speak with the XXXX and again I would have to wait 24-48 hours to receive a phone call. I explained that I never receive a phone call and she went on to say that it could be due to a wrong number documented. At this time, I am again furious and frustrated that this is a scam. 
I have decided to make a formal complaint to receive the funds from this gift card. 
I am attaching the receipt used for the purchased in XXXX and the cover that the card was given to me.
Narrative Summary: A consumer received a $50 Vanilla Card as a gift, but found it had a $0 balance when first used. After emailing the company and providing required documents, the consumer did not receive a replacement card despite multiple phone calls and promises of resolution over several months.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative: I filed a police report # XXXX regarding the school misconduct and how they committed student loan fraud. The school I attended has been in court for school misconduct and as a result I had a borrower defense claim automatically filed by the Dept. of Education that closed my federal loans without further damage or loss to myself. I challenged Navient when they sent a debt collection after me and they only provided to me forged documents. I am still waiting on law enforcement to complete their investigation. The police report was filed XX/XX/year>2024 with the local police department. I have been accepted to the XXXX XXXX XXXX for the XXXX XXXX bankruptcy case. I have been harmed by the schools misconduct and the federal government closed those federal accounts stating there was school misconduct. I understand the holder rule requires Navient to react accordingly on my private loans. I am aware they are doing so for other students in my similar predicament. Navient ( previously SallieMae ) was aware of the tactics being used but has done everything in their power to avoid consequences. They settle out of court but manage to limit their losses by setting terms that favor the few leaving the majority up the creek in a bad way. No lawyer in my state wants to take them on directly and are just telling me " call us when they sue you. '' This is totally unfair to those in my position and I need help.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges Navient sent forged documents for debt collection on private student loans despite the Dept. of Education closing federal loans due to the school's misconduct. The consumer has a pending police report and bankruptcy case, but struggles to find a lawyer willing to take on Navient.

I XXXX  the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX - XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I signed up for whatever loans the XXXX XXXX told me to sign up for. It was a struggle, but I have since paid off all of my onerous loans ( selling my house to do so ).

However, I'm now being told that I will not get any help based on the type of loan I had signed when I was just XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Please help. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative: I attempted several times to get ahold of a representative in order to better understand what l needed to do in regards to the one time payment count adjustment.l needed to understand if l needed to consolidate all of my loans into one direct consolidation loan to potentially receive credit for loan forgiveness or to possibly get my loans cancelled. The rules were extremely confusing. I attempted to call studentaid.gov and an automated machine stated, '' we're sorry, we're experiencing very heavy call volume, please call back. ". Then it disconnected. Next l attempted to contact Mohela, my loan service provider and was on hold for several hours and never got through. I work full time and therefore don't have a great deal of time to wait on hold several hours for several days of the week. I attempted to call studentaid.gov and mohela before XX/XX/year>, which was the deadline for the opportunity to cancel student loan debt. I was never able to get a representative for assistance. Very frustrating and a disservice to folks like myself that have these loans to pay off.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer was unable to contact representatives from studentaid.gov and Mohela, their loan service provider, to clarify loan forgiveness and cancellation requirements due to heavy call volumes and long hold times, missing the deadline for potential debt cancellation.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
MOHELA put me into a pay-ahead status without giving me notice. MOHELA does not listen and will not remove me from the pay-ahead status. I am in a dilemma because now some of my payments will not begin until XX/XX/XXXX and others in XXXX. This change will force me to not benefit from the SAVE program as I need a specific minimum amount per loan to qualify for the SAVE program. However, MOHELA refuses to tell me the minimum amount. Now, because I am in a pay-ahead status I can not pay the unknown minimum amount and am stuck appreciating interest until XXXX. 

Furthermore, due to my transfer, my previous payment history has been removed. Therefore, I can not make manual payments to qualify for the SAVE.
Narrative Summary: MOHELA placed the consumer in a pay-ahead status without notice, preventing them from making payments to qualify for the SAVE program. This status change also removed their previous payment history, and MOHELA refuses to disclose the minimum payment required for the SAVE program.
