A discrepancy in payoff amount also exists, over $1,000 different from previous records.

Sub-issue: Loan opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative: Did not authorize company to run credit.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges that the company ran a credit check without their authorization, raising concerns about unauthorized access to their financial information and potential harm to their credit score.

Sub-issue: Denied request to lower payments
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been trying to get relief assistance with my loan company for over a year due to no avail. I informed them that after being sick with XXXX  which affected me for almost a year I wanted to apply for a wellness program to assist with my payments. I emailed documents and nothing ever happened. I was then told I was denied. No specific reasons after payments were made as well as I had met the threshold of default. I was then told that it was too late to apply for the assistants. I was then told to pay XXXX dollars In XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and I would be submitted for assistance and that did not happen either. I applied for the wellness program In early XX/XX/XXXX and again in XX/XX/XXXX to no avail. even after making loan payments.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A borrower with a loan company was denied relief assistance through a wellness program despite submitting required documents and making payments. They were initially told it was too late to apply, then promised assistance if they paid a certain amount, but neither solution was fulfilled.

Sub-issue: Account reinstatement or redemption after repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I moved to XXXX, XXXX. Unlike every other company in the USA, Honda did not bother to process my change of address form registered with the Post Office. Since I didnt get a bill from them, I didnt pay it. In XXXX of XXXX, they designed to notice my change of address form and sent me letter to that effect. 

Subsequently, I got a catchup bill from them and a threat to reposess. I was able to catch them up, but since they would no longer take electronic payment, I was forced to go to XXXX and pay {$60.00} for a XXXX, in addition to late fees. 
Their IT department incompetence in processing the change of address notifications from the US Postal Service is not my fault, and I should not be liable for late fees. 

On the evening of XX/XX/XXXX, I got out of the hospital after 40 days to discover that my car had been repossessed by Honda. 

Since I had spent 40 days in the hospital I immediately reviewed the month of mail. In that mail, I discovered a letter from Honda stating that I had 10 days extension available before they sold it, and that they would reinstate my loan for {$3300.00}. They said I had to request the extension in writing, and provided an address by XX/XX/XXXX, but they did not provide a fax number. They also said they were going to notify my wife, as a cosigner on the loan, which I know they did not do, because my wife went into the local XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Since it was more than 7 days, and I knew that it would take more than 7 days for the letter to reach them, and I didnt have the funds readily available and it would take time to pull the money out of my retirement accounts, I started trying to find legal help. Unfortunately, lawyers are too specialized so I wasnt able to find a lawyer in time. 

As a XXXX XXXXXXXX, I called them on XX/XX/XXXX anyways, and they provided a fax number. At the time, my phone options werent very good, but I was able to take a picture of their form, and send it to them. Unfortunately, they couldnt read the fax ... Much XXXX ensued over the next XXXX days, and finally, they accepted my extension after I told them they were acting in bad faith, but they were only going to give me 2 days, not XXXX. 

In the meantime, I had tried to get the repossession company to hold the car while I worked out things with Honda to discover that Honda had sent the car to XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX, two days prior to the extension deadline Honda refused to tell me where the auction was going to be held, a violation of Federal Law, but a lady at the local auction house was nice enough to track down the car for me ( why I moved to XXXX  ). 

After some back and forth, Honda agreed to reinstate the loan, but now the fee had increased to {$5000.00} and change. The XXXX statement showed 12 monthly late fees all charged on the same day. Also, there were now additional repo fees of {$400.00}. 

I called Honda and asked them to explain, and they sent me a payment history which made no sense, and had no explanation of the XXXX XXXX Bills or the additional late fees. 
So heres the thing. Theres this principle of XXXX law called just notification which applies in my case, because I had an uXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. So Hondas claim of requiring notification to exercise XXXX in my contract is void, and bad law. XXXX XXXXXXXX are just as valid as physical XXXX Also, Honda has yet to explain how my reinstatement went from {$4000.00} to $ XXXX. Finally, jumping the XXXX on the extension by 2 days before the notification deadline, puts any Honda expenses during that period as irrelevant as they had no legal rights to the car yet. Plus they still havent notified my wife Redeeming the car wasnt enough, I had to pay {$300.00} to have the car towed back to my house since I was XXXX XXXX XXXX at the time. 
Also, Honda is responsible for any/all damage to my vehicle while in their possession. While physically the car is ok, theres a subtle issue in that they re-keyed the car while it was on the repo lot. Unfortunately, when you do that on a XXXX XXXX XXXX, it invalidates all the other key fobs. 
So now I have XXXX key fobs. The repo key fob has an incorrectly cut physical key inside it, so it cant be used to unlock the car manually. The other XXXX key fobs are invalid, though the physical key works, and the battery is dead workaround of holding the key against the start button works with the old keys but not the repo key. Recently, the repo key fob stopped working to start and stop the car. I opened it up to check and discovered it was using a XXXX battery instead of a XXXX. Replacing the battery in all XXXX key fobs, Ive been able to work around this, but I need to visit an automotive locksmith to resolve this issue, which is an additional expense. 
The XXXX says that its the love of money that is the root of all evil, and while Im sure Honda Financial feels justified in their treatment of me based on them playing the percentages across all their customers, their rigidity and rules have caused me hardship and XXXX, and XXXX XXXX are still XXXX. I understand that Im an exception, but as a user interface engineer I know that humans are messy creatures. I am 100 % of me, even if Im only a small percentage of their total customer base, and I need to be treated as such.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint is about Honda Financial's mishandling of their loan after a change of address, leading to repossession and additional fees. The issue started when Honda failed to process the change of address, resulting in missed payments and late fees.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
i contacted the Santander in reference to my account in XXXX, XXXX and XXXX because my maturity date kept changing. The company sent me a right to cure which was never received. i know this because i called the company and the representative mentioned this to me. the notice states that i was late on my loan payments. Reviewing the attached, sent tome by the company, Santander USA, it clearly shows i made all monthly payments. This is not a true reflection of my payment history for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. the attached information shows the dates of payments for said months, sent to me by the Santander USA. In XX/XX/XXXX, the loan was paid off with an overage. i was told that Santander XXXX was sending me a $ XXXX check for this overage but this was never received. This is clearly a problem with accounting as i should have been contacted by phone or XXXX mail at the correct address on the legal and binding agreement i signed at the dealership in XX/XX/XXXX. 
My correct address is on the legal and binding contract signed on XX/XX/XXXX. during the time of the loan Santander USA changed my address by not typing the correct address on any correspondence. 
I also asked why i was not part of the XXXX Lawsuit. " Santander has agreed to pay {$65.00} XXXX in restitution to the XXXX states participating in the investigation. This restitution will compensate certain subprime borrowers who defaulted on Santander auto loans between XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX. ''
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Santander incorrectly stated they were late on loan payments, despite proof of timely payments. They also allege Santander failed to send a refund for an overpayment and changed their address on correspondence, despite the correct address being on the original contract.

Sub-issue: Problem with fees charged
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/2024 I called ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX. 
Due to extenuating circumstances resulting in a financial hardship I contacted Mercedes Benz to ask for a payment deferral. I called on two occasions and spoke to two agents. Each agent gathered my information and the circumstances that led up to the hardship ; thus, requiring that I requests for a deferment. But neither provided an overview of the deferment program benefits, requirements and fees. I specifically asked on two occasions to be provided the information, the ladder occasion I asked to be provided the information before the request to defer the payments were processed. Mercedes Benz financial charged a {$600.00} fee to defer lease payments ; essentially the fee includes less than {$50.00} in taxes to put the payment on the back end of the contract. The other cost is the administrative cost for the deferment. Which led me to ask the question, How does this benefit the me, the owner, during financial hardship. Specifically, if I am required to pay {$600.00} that I dont have due to extenuating circumstances ; and that has led to financial hardship? The representative then said, '' the least I can accept today is {$300.00}. '' I explained to the agent that I did not have the {$300.00} and that the deferral program was at best - predatory and didnt offer a tangible benefit for persons who were experiencing a financial hardship but was a means for Mercedes Benz to either make money off consumers during periods of hardship or block utilization of the deferment program. Or possibly both. To date, all payments have been made on time and I attempted to
Narrative Summary: A Mercedes Benz lease holder requested a payment deferral due to financial hardship. Despite asking, the representative didn't explain the deferment program's benefits, requirements, and fees, which included a $600 fee, until after processing the request. The fee was deemed predatory and not beneficial to those in hardship.

Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative: I requested the 1099C form as stated on my credit report the creditor has charge off the debt. The creditor is responsible for providing a paper copy of the IRS Form 1099-C to the Borrower ( copy B ) by XX/XX/XXXX of the year following the calendar year in which the cancellation of debt occurred. I have contacted them multiple times with no response. By law & According to the IRS, a charge-off is considered a loss, not income, and is not taxable income. However, if a debt is canceled, forgiven, or discharged, it becomes taxable income. If taxable, the canceled debt must be reported on the tax return for the year of the cancellation. The lender is usually required to report the amount of the canceled debt to the IRS and the debtor on a Form 1099-C, " Cancellation of Debt ''. This form should be used to prepare and file the income tax return. If the debt is taxable nonbusiness debt, it can be reported on Schedule 1 of Form 1040 as other income & im not able to do that as they are not in compliance with sending the 1099c form.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims a creditor failed to provide a 1099-C form after charging off a debt, despite multiple requests. The creditor is required by law to send this form, which is necessary for the consumer to accurately report the debt cancellation on their tax return.

Sub-issue: Notice to repossess
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Description : I am filing this complaint against Navy Federal Credit Union XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding the repeated and illegal repossession of my vehicle. The incidents occurred on XXXX separate occasions, with the last repossession happening on XX/XX/2024. Each of these actions was executed without adherence to legal requirements, such as providing proper notice and conducting the repossession in a manner that respects consumer rights. 

The repeated illegal repossessions have caused significant emotional distress and embarrassment, particularly due to the public manner in which Navy Federal Credit Union has conducted these actions. The distress is compounded by the fact that these incidents have happened multiple times, indicating a pattern of behavior that disregards consumer protection laws. 

Specific Allegations : Lack of Proper Notice : On each occasion, Navy Federal did not provide the legally required notice before repossessing the vehicle.

Public Embarrassment : The repossessions were conducted in a highly visible and embarrassing manner, contributing to emotional distress. 

Repeated Illegal Actions : The fact that this has occurred XXXX times demonstrates a disregard for legal procedures and my rights as a consumer.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: Complainant alleges Navy Federal Credit Union repossessed their vehicle multiple times without proper notice and in a publicly embarrassing manner, violating consumer protection laws and causing emotional distress.

Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative: The co-owner had took the car from me. I havent had a car in two years and she had text me and said they took the car and I had called the people and it was XXXX. Something dollars on the car that was backed up and the only way I got my car back was to pay that money and before I had called the people she was like you can have the car back so you can have transportation get to work, but you have to pay that money back to get it back so thats messing up my credit for me to get another car to have transportation to get to work and work more hours and take my kids to appointments only way for me to get another car is to pay {$5000.00} on it because of that and its hard to save that kind of money with XXXX kids and other bills. Ive been trying to find a way to get another car and pay XXXX down on it and just pay my payments cause I can forward my payments, but its hard so Im just trying to get that car off my credit and start over
Narrative Summary: A co-owner repossessed the complainant's car due to an outstanding balance of several dollars. To retrieve the car, the complainant had to pay the balance, which negatively impacted their credit, making it difficult to obtain another car and now they're seeking to remove the debt from their credit.

Sub-issue: Lender trying to repossess or disable the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative: Account # Ending in XXXX XXXX Days Past Due : XXXX Amount Past Due : {$800.00} To whom it may concern, I am writing in reference to my auto lender Global Lending Services. I reached out to the lender several times explaining Im currently unemployed since XX/XX/year>. I further explained that its been hard to find work, provide shelter for my daughter, and supply food for us. I sent a hardship letter explaining this as well. This same company has wrongly repossessed this same vehicle in the past when payments were being made on time. I only have 4 payments left. They have tried using scare tactics to fear me of a repo, and have also hassled family members as well. Im sick of the harassment and everyone explains they understand inflation because theyre experiencing it themselves. Ive explained that I wont allow the car payment to be 3 months behind if they allow me more time to get caught up, while working odd jobs here in there. Please let me know if you can assist with this issues. Its embarrassing enough and my family members are tired of the harassment as well.
Narrative Summary: A consumer complains about harassment from Global Lending Services over an $800 past-due auto loan balance. Despite explaining unemployment and hardship, the lender uses scare tactics and contacts family members, although the consumer has only 4 payments left and is willing to catch up with temporary payment adjustments.

Sub-issue: Problem with additional products or services purchased with the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: My car once again is undrivable. It is leaking coolant, and the indicator light on a vehicle saying is saying that there is some type of faulty in the coolant system. This car was purchased at the end of XXXX and now this is the second issue Im having with the vehicle.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A car purchased at the end of XXXX is undrivable due to a coolant leak and faulty coolant system indicator. This is the second issue with the vehicle, raising concerns about its reliability and quality.

Sub-issue: Problem with the interest rate
Consumer complaint narrative:
contacted exeter finance about the SCRA act of Louisiana and was never contacted back. The SCRA act of Louisiana states that XXXX XXXX military can not be charged over 6 % interests fees and my interest fees are still at XXXX. Section C of the below law 2011 Louisiana Laws Revised Statutes TITLE 29 Military, XXXX, and veteran 's affairs RS XXXX Limits on creditor interest rates Universal Citation : LA Rev XXXX XXXX XXXX. Limits on creditor interest rates A. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, no creditor in connection with an obligation entered into on or after XX/XX/XXXX, shall charge or collect from a person, or spouse of a person, who is on XXXX XXXX interest or finance charges exceeding six percent per annum during the period that the person is XXXX on XXXX XXXX. 

B. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, interest or finance charges in excess of six percent per annum that otherwise would be incurred but for the prohibition in XXXX XXXX of this Section are forgiven. 

C. The amount of any periodic payment due from a person, or spouse of a person, who is on XXXX XXXX under the terms of the obligation shall be reduced by the amount of the interest and finance charges forgiven under Subsection B of this Section that is allocable to the period for which the periodic payment is made. 

D. In order for an obligation to be subject to the interest and finance charges limitation of this Section, the person, or spouse of the person on XXXX XXXX, shall provide the creditor with written notice and a copy of the military or gubernatorial orders calling the person to XXXX XXXX and of any orders further extending XXXX XXXX, not later than XXXX XXXX XXXX days after the date of the person 's termination of or release from XXXX XXXX. 

E. Upon receipt of the written notice and a copy of the orders referred to in Subsection D of this Section, the creditor shall treat the obligation in accordance with Subsection A of this Section, effective as of the date on which the person is on XXXX XXXX. 

F. A court may grant a creditor relief from the interest and finance charges limitation of this Section, if, in the opinion of the court, the ability of the person, or spouse of the person, on XXXX XXXX to pay interest or finance charges with respect to the obligation at a rate in excess of six percent per annum is not materially affected by reason of the person 's service on XXXX XXXX. 

Acts XXXX, No. XXXX, XXXX, eff. XX/XX/XXXX.
Narrative Summary: The consumer contacted Exeter Finance about the SCRA Act of Louisiana, which limits interest rates to 6% for military personnel. Despite this, their interest fees remain higher, and Exeter Finance failed to respond or adjust the rates accordingly.

Sub-issue: Denied request to lower payments
Consumer complaint narrative: I want to be clear I am not disputing accuracy of late payments. I am simple requesting that it be removed from my credit report because it is hurting my ability to obtain credit. I have recently been in and out of jail for the past few years and was struggling financially due to the reason. I have no intentions on not keeping up with the payments in the future and staying in good standing with bank and the loan account. This will never happen again. Please just have the late payments removed immediately and I will be ready to start over on monthly payments.

Narrative Summary: The consumer is requesting removal of late payment marks from their credit report, citing past financial struggles due to jail time. They acknowledge the accuracy of the late payments, but claim they've learned from their mistakes and want to start fresh with regular payments.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: Ally Financial INC currently has an outstanding balance on my consumer reports listed at XXXX as of XX/XX/2024. My car note should have been paid off already, but they are insisting that I had numerous payment extensions along with a repossession fee of XXXX dollars. I can agree with the repossession fee of XXXX dollars because my car was repossessed, but I don't agree with the payment extensions. I requested twice for them to send me documentation supporting their claim, which they have failed to do both times. They are also reporting this account as ( CLOSED ) PAYS_AS_AGREES to XXXX, however the account remains open.

The consumer disputes payment extension fees, but not the repossession fee, and has requested supporting documentation twice, which Ally Financial has failed to provide.

Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I went into a dealership ( CarMAx in XXXX Alabama and a Sales Representative ( XXXX XXXX assisted me with my interest of buying a car. He Assisted me with a XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Odometer reading was XXXX ) Vin Number XXXX. This process was Fraudulent. They first failed to disclosed the Right to Rescind they is a violation with the FCRA Consumers Rights. ( 2 ) They also Illegally requested and received a down payment of {$2900.00} in which according to 15 U.S Code 1605 a finance charge is a sum of ALL charges. You can not mix cash in a credit transaction. Determination of Finance Charge ( a ) ( b ) and ( c ). Co-mingling cash with finance charges is illegal. The finance Charge doe not included charge of a type payable in a comparable cash transacrion.3. Insurance by law is included in Finance Charges, Sum of all money. I was also forced to get outside inurance.15 U.S Code 1638 ( A ). I was also a victim of Tactic Sales.

15 U.S. Code 1605 - Determination of finance charge U.S. Code Notes prev | next ( a ) Finance charge defined Except as otherwise provided in this section, the amount of the finance charge in connection with any consumer credit transaction shall be determined as the sum of all charges, payable directly or indirectly by the person to whom the credit is extended, and imposed directly or indirectly by the creditor as an incident to the extension of credit. The finance charge does not include charges of a type payable in a comparable cash transaction. The finance charge shall not include fees and amounts imposed by third party closing agents ( including settlement agents, attorneys, and escrow and title companies ) if the creditor does not require the imposition of the charges or the services provided and does not retain the charges. Examples of charges which are included in the finance charge include any of the following types of charges which are applicable : ( 1 ) Interest, time price differential, and any amount payable under a point, discount, or other system or additional charges.

( 2 ) Service or carrying charge.

( 3 ) Loan fee, finders fee, or similar charge.

( 4 ) Fee for an investigation or credit report.

( 5 ) Premium or other charge for any guarantee or insurance protecting the creditor against the obligors default or other credit loss.

( 6 ) Borrower-paid mortgage broker fees, including fees paid directly to the broker or the lender ( for delivery to the broker ) whether such fees are paid in cash or financed. 
( b ) Life, accident, or health insurance premiums included in finance charge Charges or premiums for credit life, accident, or health insurance written in connection with any consumer credit transaction shall be included in the finance charges unless ( 1 ) the coverage of the debtor by the insurance is not a factor in the approval by the creditor of the extension of credit, and this fact is clearly disclosed in writing to the person applying for or obtaining the extension of credit ; and ( 2 ) in order to obtain the insurance in connection with the extension of credit, the person to whom the credit is extended must give specific affirmative written indication of his desire to do so after written disclosure to him of the cost thereof. 
( c ) Property damage and liability insurance premiums included in finance charge Charges or premiums for insurance, written in connection with any consumer credit transaction, against loss of or damage to property or against liability arising out of the ownership or use of property, shall be included in the finance charge unless a clear and specific statement in writing is furnished by the creditor to the person to whom the credit is extended, setting forth the cost of the insurance if obtained from or through the creditor, and stating that the person to whom the credit is extended may choose the person through which the insurance is to be obtained. 

( d ) Items exempted from computation of finance charge in all credit transactions If any of the following items is itemized and disclosed in accordance with the regulations of the Bureau in connection with any transaction, then the creditor need not include that item in the computation of the finance charge with respect to that transaction : ( 1 ) Fees and charges prescribed by law which actually are or will be paid to public officials for determining the existence of or for perfecting or releasing or satisfying any security related to the credit transaction.

( 2 ) The premium payable for any insurance in lieu of perfecting any security interest otherwise required by the creditor in connection with the transaction, if the premium does not exceed the fees and charges described in paragraph ( 1 ) which would otherwise be payable.

( 3 ) Any tax levied on security instruments or on documents evidencing indebtedness if the payment of such taxes is a precondition for recording the instrument securing the evidence of indebtedness.

( e ) Items exempted from computation of finance charge in extensions of credit secured by an interest in real property The following items, when charged in connection with any extension of credit secured by an interest in real property, shall not be included in the computation of the finance charge with respect to that transaction : ( 1 ) Fees or premiums for title examination, title insurance, or similar purposes.

( 2 ) Fees for preparation of loan-related documents.

( 3 ) Escrows for future payments of taxes and insurance.

( 4 ) Fees for notarizing deeds and other documents.

( 5 ) Appraisal fees, including fees related to any pest infestation or flood hazard inspections conducted prior to closing.

( 6 ) Credit reports.

( f ) Tolerances for accuracy In connection with credit transactions not under an open end credit plan that are secured by real property or a dwelling, the disclosure of the finance charge and other disclosures affected by any finance charge ( 1 ) shall be treated as being accurate for purposes of this subchapter if the amount disclosed as the finance charge ( A ) does not vary from the actual finance charge by more than {$100.00} ; or ( B ) is greater than the amount required to be disclosed under this subchapter ; and ( 2 ) shall be treated as being accurate for purposes of section 1635 of this title if ( A ) except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), the amount disclosed as the finance charge does not vary from the actual finance charge by more than an amount equal to one-half of one percent of the total amount of credit extended; or ( B ) in the case of a transaction, other than a mortgage referred to in section 1602 ( aa ) [ 1 ] of this title, which ( i ) is a refinancing of the principal balance then due and any accrued and unpaid finance charges of a residential mortgage transaction as defined in section 1602 ( w ) 1 of this title, or is any subsequent refinancing of such a transaction ; and ( ii ) does not provide any new consolidation or new advance ; if the amount disclosed as the finance charge does not vary from the actual finance charge by more than an amount equal to one percent of the total amount of credit extended.

15 U.S. Code 1638 - Transactions other than under an open end credit plan U.S. Code Notes prev | next ( a ) Required disclosures by creditor For each consumer credit transaction other than under an open end credit plan, the creditor shall disclose each of the following items, to the extent applicable : ( 1 ) The identity of the creditor required to make disclosure.

( 2 ) ( A ) The amount financed, using that term, which shall be the amount of credit of which the consumer has actual use. This amount shall be computed as follows, but the computations need not be disclosed and shall not be disclosed with the disclosures conspicuously segregated in accordance with subsection ( b ) ( 1 ) : ( i ) take the principal amount of the loan or the cash price less downpayment and trade-in; ( ii ) add any charges which are not part of the finance charge or of the principal amount of the loan and which are financed by the consumer, including the cost of any items excluded from the finance charge pursuant to section 1605 of this title; and ( iii ) subtract any charges which are part of the finance charge but which will be paid by the consumer before or at the time of the consummation of the transaction, or have been withheld from the proceeds of the credit.
Narrative Summary: The consumer alleges that CarMax in Alabama committed fraud by failing to disclose the Right to Rescind, requesting a down payment of $2900 in a credit transaction, and forcing them to purchase outside insurance, violating the FCRA and 15 U.S. Code 1605 and 1638.

Sub-issue: Voluntary repossession
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing this request because of how many stress this specific item on my credit created I ask the company CREDIT ACCEPTANCE MOTOR to delete this information on my credit because its creating damage to everything I have. This repossession was voluntary sent back to the bank because of illegal act they backed up the mileage on the car and sell the car so right when my mechanic was viewing the car he told me I should send it back to the bank and let them sell it because it is very illegal and they were involved in a lawsuit couple years back I started to drive the car car and the mileage just started to move fast. I started to make reports to the police station while I was in XXXX and then I moved to XXXX  I called the credit bureau and they said I have to make a report to consumer complaints, so now Im here. Im not sure whats gon na happen, but I am requesting a deletion from all three credit bureau because they are really hurting my credit and I really want to buy a house in the future and its really stopping me from growing as a young person, they have the car in their possession, they sold it and they still recording an accurate amount on my credit report all three credit bureau and they are giving me different numbers of the company. Im currently sending in some letters to see what they would do but I come here to report it or deletion, and with the law, it says any inaccurate on authorization inquiry that I did not authorize should be automatically deleted from my Credit Report. I wanted for you guys to put Credit Acceptance motor out there in public because they are hurting peoples credit and they are stopping peoples life from living and theyre causing a lot of damage within the homes by stressing individuals.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
