The repossession was voluntary, as the car had tampered mileage and the consumer reported it to the police. The consumer claims Credit Acceptance Motor still reports inaccurate information to all three credit bureaus.

Sub-issue: Billing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Around the third week of XXXX, I reached out to Ally and explained that I was having concerns about making on time payments at the current due date on the loan. The agent on the phone went through the traditional questionnaire only to tell me that the due date could not be changed, and gave no explanation. 

Frustrated, I sent a secure message on Ally 's website, hoping that would reach a different department. I received a reply XXXX hours later, asking me that " due to the nature of the request '' to call back. Frustrated by my non-answer, I did, and was told that my request would be " escalated '' and instructed me to call back for a follow up XXXX days later. 

I call back in to follow up and am told once again that the due date can not be changed, even due to a financial hardship, because of the amount of days the due date had been changed by. ( I changed the due date at the very beginning of the loan, which I remember being told I was allowed to change the due date XXXX more times during the life of loan ) Now, Ally is calling me XXXX day after the due date of the auto loan payment stating I'm " delinquent '' or " past due '' and need to pay on my account now. I am not behind on payments and the only amount they are referring to is the currently due installment. I have a XXXX day grace period in my contract, so why am I being bullied about my payment right after being told that even with concerns of financial hardship and they won't change my due date? Completely unacceptable.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer complained about Ally's refusal to change their auto loan due date despite financial hardship concerns. Ally initially denied the request, then escalated it, only to deny it again, citing a previous due date change. The consumer was later contacted about a "delinquent" payment within the 15-day grace period.

Sub-issue: Problem after you declared or threatened to declare bankruptcy
Consumer complaint narrative: took out a car loan with American Credit Acceptance in XXXX. I have gotten my car repossessed a few times without notice. American Credit acceptance have not given me notices and statements about my account. They are overcharging me in fees and with the entire loan. I went into bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX and again in XX/XX/XXXX after my car was repossessed. I later had the bankruptcy dismissed and went back into a regular account, which at that point the car went into repossession again with a past due balance of around XXXX. I never received any statements nor documents from American credit acceptance. They claimed my account was written off and I never received a statement. I requested documents that they do not have because they claim since my balance is over XXXX days past due they dont have to send me anything. While I was in bankruptcy they never sent anything to my attorney. They canceled the XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX and claimed I received credit for that, and when I asked for that I still have not received it yet. They keep saying since my account is 60 days past due I cant get it. From XXXX until XXXX my car was not registered due to American Credit Acceptance registering the title in South Carolina leaving me getting ticket for non registration of vehicle, and driving while not registered. XXXXmerican Credit Acceptance sent Wisconsin the title and paid the title fee for me to re register the vehicle. American Credit acceptance told me to pay my monthly payment every XXXX weeks to bring the past due balance down, per policy. I asked them for a copy of that policy. I was told that its an internal policy and that it is not in writing. I expressed that I feel singled out and that I feel that they are picking and choosing who they are putting this type of policy in and it is not fair, and that I will be contacting equal right division. I started paying the XXXX every XXXX weeks only to call on XX/XX/XXXX when I was about to make a payment and noticed that my balance is still over XXXX. I called and was told that my payments is going to interest, but that is not what I was told. I was told that the XXXX every XXXX weeks would go towards the past due balance not the overall balance. I asked when will I go to monthly payments and they said and they said that I will never gi back I will pay every XXXX weeks until the car is paid off. This is a violation of contract and they lied to me. They do not have documentation that they have been keeping in tune with my account and is treating me different. There is something they are hiding with my account. They are also overcharging me. I need someone to look into this issue.
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims American Credit Acceptance overcharged them in fees and loan amounts, failed to provide account statements and notices, and misrepresented payment policies. The consumer was told to make bi-weekly payments to reduce the past due balance, but found that payments were being applied to interest instead.

Sub-issue: Billing problem
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to a rep named XXXX about a double payment of {$350.00} taken for my car loan on XX/XX/XXXX, had her check that there weren't any more payments since they weren't on my portal, and she said I only had XXXX for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, and refunded the extra payment. On XX/XX/XXXX, a double payment of {$350.00} was withdrawn again. I spoke to XXXX again, who told me I had to wait until XX/XX/XXXX to submit the request, and an additional XXXX business days to receive the funds. I asked why she told me I had no more duplicates, but a second still withdrew. She told me " The payments received on XX/XX/XXXX were scheduled on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. We apologize for the information previously provided. We do not show a future dated payment for XXXX. '' and told me to set up autopay. I told her I needed the issue fixed first and asked her where my XXXX payment went. I was transferred to XXXX who told me that scheduling payments can confuse the system and she didn't see any more set up, so if there was a duplicate, the system canceled it. I said " So, just to confirm, the XX/XX/XXXX payment I scheduled a couple of months ago, that XXXX told me was still scheduled when we spoke on XX/XX/XXXX would have been automatically canceled by the system as a mistake since I was not the XXXX to cancel it? '' She said " Our system would have notated the attempt to duplicate the payment at the time. Thus, causing the cancellation, yes. This is correct. I show no pending, future-dated, or pre-scheduled payments on our end for your account. ". So I set up autopay. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX payments were taken again. I spoke to XXXX, who told me I had payments scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, & XX/XX/XXXX. I told her about the previous conversations and that I couldn't afford to wait for the refund again. She apologized and said I have XXXX more payments for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, & XX/XX/XXXX, and offered to cancel those and report the previous conversations, but said that they still require payments to be posted for 4 days before a reversal can be submitted and can not expedite it.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's car loan account experienced repeated double payments of $350, despite assurances from multiple representatives that no future payments were scheduled. The issue persisted even after the consumer set up autopay, resulting in further overpayments and delayed refunds.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Unable to receive car title or other problem after the loan is paid off
Consumer complaint narrative:
We were nearing the end of our Loan with Flagship credit and we called started talking to them about settling the outstanding amount. Around XX/XX/XXXX, we were approved to pay off the settlement of {$2000.00}. We tried to process the payment on XX/XX/XXXX but it didn't go through. We had to call back and they said they had the wrong banking information. So we had to call again on the XXXX and they were able to pay off our settlement offer. Since then, they have been calling us constantly trying to collect the past due amount even though we have already settled. They call multiple times a day 6 days a week. Weve also tried calling to get information on why we havent been able to get a resolution because they said they need to sign an offer letter but neither my wife or I have received it. Most recently, I called on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX. I was told we would receive the letter but we didnt so I called back again and they said that in their records, they still havent even sent it out. Theyve confirmed our emails multiple times and we still havent received them. Ive told them they need to get this resolved but in the meantime my and my wifes credit is getting penalized because they havent sent us anything. 

We were told when we settled that they would send us our titles within 30 days of paying off the amount. We have not received it and we cant get a straight answer of why the letter hasnt been sent to us.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer settled a loan with Flagship Credit for $2000, but despite payment, the company continues to call for the original amount. The consumer has not received a required offer letter, and their credit is being penalized due to the unresolved issue and lack of title receipt.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am reaching out to express concerns and reasons that I have to believe that XXXX, XXXX, Bridgecrest, and all of its affiliates are committing a plethora of financial crimes and nefarious business practices that are in direct violation/ breach of but not limited to their prospectus, trust indenture agreement, codes of federal regulation, United States codes, New Jersey Administrative Codes , Truth in Lending Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, Privacy Act of 1974 and various Securities Exchange Commission violations.

Pursuant to 15 U.S. code 1602 ( i ), Ientered into a consumer credit transaction with CARVANA and NOT BRIDGECREST, to purchase a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX via XXXX online platform/ website on XX/XX/XXXX. I rendered a downpayment of {$500.00} which is a direct violation of 15 U.S. Code 1605 which clearly states that the finance charge does not include charges of a type payable in a comparable cash transaction.

Upon receiving the car via CARVANAs delivery methods, I received a blue folder which only contained one ( the first ) page of the contract. As a result of my curiosity over the last couple of weeks, I actually went through the folder and noticed I only had the first page of the contract after all this time. This folder was never opened, added to or subtracted from as it sat in a home safe from the time I got the car until now. 
Shortly after realizing this, I began to contact BRIDGECREST for a copy of the contract being that they were the ones I was making payments to. They told me that I had to reach out to XXXX XXXX because they were the dealer. 

I then contacted XXXX XXXX for a full contract for me to review and I was questioned about what I needed it for on all recorded calls. I was finally able to get them to tell me that they will email a copy in a few days. Expecting to get an email from XXXX XXXX, I received an email from BRIDGECREST customer care containing the contract. I never signed any contracts or agreements with BRIDGECREST to make payments to them. I also had them send me an arbitration agreement that I never received or even signed from XXXX, XXXX. 

Shortly before receiving a copy view of the full contract from BRIDGECREST, I was told by XXXX via email on XX/XX/XXXX that they had NO RECORDS of my contract due to the age of the information in the system. I was also informed on a recorded line that I was not able to receive a physical billing statement via postal mail because they were a paperless company and I was unable to opt out of paperless billing that I never opted into. 
In the contract, it also says that this transaction took place at the dealers licensed location and that is not true. I had to wait weeks after XX/XX/XXXX to receive my contract from BRIDGECREST, not XXXX, XXXX. 

After being told that I could not receive a paper bill in the mail, I was sent a XXXX page physical printed document of all the payments made throughout the life of the loan/ contract thus far via certified mail. That doesnt sound like something a paperless company would do for no reason. Interestingly enough, I was also sent a very different contract titled : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that looks like it was signed with my electronic signature that I had never seen before. It is a lot shorter and very different from the one that I had in my possession ( XXXX pages ) since XXXX. It stated at the top right hand corners of each page that it was the Authoritative copy. Why was this never given to me to be signed? This new document looks as if I was physically in Georgia buying the vehicle. There is no evidence of any active or inactive UCC filings/ perfected liens on the vehicle to date in the state of Georgia on the XXXX website, or New Jersey XXXX my residence state ). How is there a security interest without a perfected lien? 

Furthermore, If I saw in this new contract that I received around XX/XX/XXXX, and it clearly stated verbatim : We agree to transfer to you and you agree to accept title and ownership of the vehicle in the state of the dealership address listed above. When we transfer title and the ownership of the vehicle to you, you may take delivery of the vehicle from us at our licensed dealership location shown above or you may make arrangements with us to have the vehicle transported to another usually agreed- upon location for your pickup. 
I would have immediately asked for my title and other ownership documents. 
I made sure to highlight this for your further viewing ( enclosed ). 


Where are titles and ownership documents that should have been transferred to me over 5 years ago? 

Why do I have two different purchase agreements in two different states for one vehicle? 

Is there some kind of fraudulent activity going on here? 

This is a direct violation of N.J.A.C. 13:21-15.6, which, in pertinent part, prohibits a licensee that is, " any natural person or entity that is licensed to buy, sell, or deal in, or lease motor vehicles pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:10 -19 & N.J.A.C. 13:21-15.1, from selling " any motor vehicle unaccompanied by, or in the absence of, a valid title at the time of the transaction. '' This is a notice of rescission of this retail installment contract and security agreement and arbitration provision as XXXX XXXX failed to : clearly & conspicuously disclose my right to rescind within 3 days provide me with a full copy of the contract as it clearly stated that I would receive. I was also provided with a non authoritative copy of the contract that was missing information and also contained inconsistent information with the contract I had in my possession. I also never received my title or ownership documents for the vehicle as it states in the authoritative copy deliver two copies of the notice of the right to rescind which are direct VIOLATIONS of 12 CFR 1026.15 ( b ), 15 USC 1635 ( a ), Regulation Z, 12 CFR 226.15 ( b ), 226.17 and 226. 23.

Attach arbitration agreement to contract. It was singed with my electronic signature It is a FACT that Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1611 ( 1 ) ( 3 ) CARVANA can be fined up to {$5000.00} for giving false, inaccurate information and failing to provide information which is required to disclose and in this case, XXXX XXXX knowingly and willfully did when they failed to disclose and clearly provide all information to me as a consumer. 

Pursuant to 15 U.S Code 1602 ( v ) you, XXXX XXXX did not provide Material Disclosures as to how XXXX XXXX came up with the method of determining the finance charge. 
Pursuant to TILA, FCRA, & U.S Code 1681 ( a ) you, XXXX XXXX and affiliates are continuing to willfully and knowingly report this consumer credit transaction to the credit agencies which is a direct violation of the abovementioned United States codes, the privacy act of 1974 and codes of federal regulation. 

Ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, respecting the equitable principles of our agreement, and fulfilling your fiduciary duties are imperative steps to maintain the integrity of our relationship and to rectify the current situation. 
In advance, I appreciate your prompt attention to these matters and look forward to a resolution that honors your commitment to fairness, transparency, and regulatory compliance.
Narrative Summary: A consumer alleges that Carvana and its affiliates, including Bridgecrest, engaged in financial crimes and deceptive business practices. The consumer claims they were not provided a full contract, title, or ownership documents for their vehicle, and were misled about the terms of their loan.

Sub-issue: Credit denial
Consumer complaint narrative:
My vehicle was stolen from me on the third month of buying my car by the dealership helpers. I put {$2700.00} down and made 4 payments towards my loan. After my vehicle was stolen I filed a insurance claim and purchased a new XXXX  XXXX XXXX pickup from Texas. That's was never delivered to me. He then contacted the police department and said that the report was false. I was arrested for making a false report. 


I was XXXX shot at behind XXXX XXXX and my vehicle was stolen by these XXXX XXXX XXXX working with the police department in the form of corruption. 

Conducting illegal activity 's within the line of law enforcement. 

My brother was XXXX XXXX killed yesterday I called XXXX and no one showed up.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims their vehicle was stolen by dealership employees after making a down payment and 4 loan payments. They filed an insurance claim and purchased a new vehicle, but it was never delivered. The dealership then falsely accused them of making a false police report, leading to their arrest.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Termination fees or other problem when ending the lease early
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my deep concern and frustration regarding a lease agreement I have with American Honda Financial Corp. for a XXXX Honda XXXX. As a long-standing and loyal customer of Honda vehicles , I have always valued the quality of their products and services. However, I find myself in an unprecedented and untenable situation that requires urgent attention and resolution. 

In late XXXX, my parked vehicle, the XXXX Honda XXXX, was unfortunately side-swiped, resulting in significant damage to the passenger side-view mirror and its assembly. Despite my diligent efforts to procure the necessary replacement part, I have been informed that it is currently backordered with no definite timeline for availability. This has left my vehicle with an expired safety inspection sticker, as I am unable to pass the inspection due to the broken mirror, posing a significant safety concern. 

I have reached out to Honda Corporate Office in an attempt to expedite the procurement process for the replacement part. However, after placing an order, which was subsequently canceled without my knowledge, I was informed that the part may not be available until midXXXX, with no guarantee of timely delivery. 

In light of these circumstances, I contacted XXXXmerican Honda Financial Corp. to explore the possibility of returning the leased vehicle and having the remainder of my lease payments waived, considering that I can not safely drive the vehicle due to the unresolved issue. Regrettably, I was only offered a two-month deferment on my lease payments, which does not address the fundamental issue at hand. 

I am deeply troubled by the prospect of being penalized for a situation that is beyond my control. The suggestion of an early lease termination fee of nearly {$4000.00}, in addition to the balance of the lease agreement, is both unjust and unreasonable. As a responsible consumer, I believe it is imperative to seek a fair and equitable resolution to this matter. 

I implore you to intervene on my behalf and advocate for a solution that allows for the timely return of the vehicle without incurring undue financial burdens. I trust that your agency will prioritize consumer protection and ensure that my rights as a customer are upheld. 

I've attached email documentation with my attempts to resolve the matter and proof of the ordered part. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I eagerly await your prompt response and assistance in resolving this issue.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's leased Honda vehicle was damaged in a side-swipe, requiring a replacement part that's currently backordered with no definite timeline. The consumer is unable to pass safety inspection and is seeking a fair resolution from American Honda Financial Corp. to return the vehicle without incurring a large early termination fee.

Sub-issue: Billing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
This company seems to have the innate ability whereby some months, payments are never applied correctly. Case in point : XX/XX/XXXX Statement from XX/XX/XXXX shows an amount of {$480.00} which includes the XXXX due for the month plus {$85.00} in fees which this institution give absolutely no way of paying them without the added inconvience of calling their offshore very rude disrespectful customer service ( or lack there of ) and having a form filed to re-allocate in XXXX business days. 
But i digress .... On XX/XX/XXXX a payment in the amount of {$120.00} was made towards the balance of {$480.00} which after it took XXXX business days to process ( which most banks process transactions in a single day ) should've left my balance at XXXX ( meaning {$270.00} due for XXXX 's payment plus the fees ) ; However, it shows i owe my normal amount of XXXX even though the payment was applied toward principal and interest. So, how is it your organization can update all facets yet not show a correct amount due for the month? 
This is starting to become concerning as it feels I am being misled, which i don't think any organization wants its members to feel as if they constantly have to monitor their account to make sure nothing unethical is going on. 
Oh, and on a separate note, Supervisor XXXX I spoke with started the call acting like her namesake until i cordially reminded her that i had all my facts and this was not the first time i had to complain about the misallocation of my payments ( XX/XX/XXXX i had to complain thru this medium about the same issue ) that XXXX lost her entitledness toward me ....
Narrative Summary: The consumer's payment of $120 was not applied correctly, resulting in an incorrect balance of $480 instead of $360. The payment was processed in multiple business days, and the company failed to update the correct amount due, causing concern about potential mismanagement of the account.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, New York XXXX JPMCB - AUTO FINANCE XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Re : Account number : XXXX I was advised to write to you by your customer service department concerning my credit rating with your company. I have enjoyed a credit account with JPMCB - AUTO FINANCE for many years. 
During the course of our business association, I have honored and respected my account agreement to the fullest. I appreciate how wonderful your service has always been. 
Unfortunately, 2 years ago, I was in a financial dilemma due to job loss and multiple health issues. As a result some of my payments to you were delayed. Because your account with me is extremely important I managed to borrow the money to cover the late payments. I paid those payments 30 days late on three occasions over a nine-month period but I made sure to fulfill my obligation to ensure that your company suffered no loss. 
I am thankful and appreciative for the years of positive credit history that I have obtained through your company but now those 3 late marks on my credit reports are causing me tremendous stress. I am trying to move up to a better paid position at my work, but the negative remarks are hurting my efforts. 
This is where my " Goodwill Request '' comes in. I desperately need this promotion and I would be extremely appreciative if you would please complete a UDF - Universal Data Form and fax it to the credit bureaus to remove those entries. 
The credit bureaus have advised me that they will report anything as instructed to by you, but they need to have that instruction in writing. I beg that you may help me and take into consideration how good of a customer I have been and how long I have had an account with you. 
Thank you for your consideration, and I hope youll approve my request. 

Best, XXXX XXXX
Narrative Summary: A customer with a long-standing account with JPMCB - AUTO FINANCE is requesting a goodwill deletion of three late payment marks on their credit report. The customer experienced financial difficulties due to job loss and health issues, but made late payments within 30 days and fulfilled their obligations.

Sub-issue: Denied request to lower payments
Consumer complaint narrative: flagship denied my request for a LOAN MOD AND EXTENSION OR DEFFERAL OF PAYMENTS AND WAS DENIED. I LOST MY JOB AND NEED CAR TO LOOK FOR OTHER JOBS.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer's loan modification and payment deferral request was denied by Flagship, despite losing their job and needing the car to search for new employment.

Sub-issue: Deficiency balance after repossession
Consumer complaint narrative: Credit Acceptance refuse to take the repossession off my account when the remaining balance of around XXXX has been paid/charged off.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: Consumer claims Credit Acceptance refuses to remove a repossession from their account after paying/charging off the remaining balance of around $XXXX.

Sub-issue: Loan opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative: I bought a car from XXXX XXXX XXXX  and I was unaware that my information was given to Credit Acceptance! I did not give them my signature nor did I give them my social security number. They are reporting late payments on my credit report when I never did business with them in the first place.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims that a car dealer, XXXX XXXX XXXX, shared their information with Credit Acceptance without consent, resulting in incorrect late payment reports on their credit report, despite never doing business with Credit Acceptance.

Sub-issue: Deficiency balance after repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
My XXXX XXXX vehicle was repossessed by a unknown towing company. 

15 USC 6802 Financial institution may not disclose non public personal information to a non affiliated 3rd party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that non disclosure option.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's vehicle was repossessed by an unknown towing company, raising concerns about the disclosure of non-public personal information to a non-affiliated third party, potentially violating 15 USC 6802.

Sub-issue: Changes in terms mid-deal or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative: I drove down to this dealership to test drive a car, following an appointment set with XXXX. After saying I was interested in it, XXXX and I went into the financing office and started paperwork on the car. I stated I would be paying {$5000.00} down in check, and would be signing the electric vehicle tax credit over to the dealership to add an additional {$4000.00} to the down payment for a total of {$9000.00}. The agreed sale price on the Buyer 's Order is {$13000.00}, minus {$9000.00} as a down payment, leaving a balance due of {$6100.00}, once taxes and dealer fees were accounted for. I filled out and was approved for a loan with Huntington bank for {$6300.00}. XXXXXXXX XXXX manager ( do not recall his name ) had to come in to process the form XXXX for the IRS tax credit and reviewed that for the same {$13000.00} price to submit to the IRS. After finishing all the paper work, I accepted delivery of the car and drove it back home. On the XXXX, XXXX called and said the price of the car was actually {$17000.00} and that I needed to sign new paperwork/loan application to accept this new price, which also has a higher interest rate. Having read about Yo-Yo scams , I asked for more clarification on the situation but only got a response from XXXX of the price being wrong and wanting me to sign the new paperwork, without any of my questions answered. I had previously checked and confirmed the loan balance, but called in again today to ask for a copy of the bank 's paperwork to find that the loan had been cancelled without my approval, but the Huntington bank representative could see any indication of a reason. Huntington bank provided me with a copy of the approved loan paperwork that the dealership submitted to them.
Narrative Summary: A car buyer claims a dealership changed the agreed-upon sale price from $13,000 to $17,000 after they accepted delivery of the vehicle. The buyer had already secured a loan for $6,300 and had signed paperwork for the original price, but the dealership now wants them to sign new paperwork with a higher interest rate.

Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was unaware of this debt until it appeared on my credit report. I didn't have the opportunity to assess or dispute this debt. 

I am to be notified by certified mail or mail with a tracking number advising me of the debt prior to the debt being placed on my credit report. It is my right to be in the position to dispute the debt prior to this debt being placed on my credit report.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims a debt was reported to their credit without prior notification, violating their right to dispute the debt before it was reported. They state they should have received certified mail or tracked mail notification before the debt's credit report placement.

Sub-issue: Loan sold or transferred to another company
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased. vehicle from a used dealership in XXXXXXXX XXXX in XXXX and with contract details stating I must repay the delaership for the loan amounts. Santander Consumer USA however states that payments should be made to them but they are not listed anywhere within contract. I contacted Santander consumer USA and they insist that the contract is valid although they are not listed anywhere on it. I requested a copy of the contract the bank has in their possession and they ate not listed on that version either.
Narrative Summary: A consumer purchased a used vehicle with a contract stating payments should be made to the dealership, but Santander Consumer USA claims payments are due to them, despite not being listed on the contract or their own copy of the contract.

Sub-issue: Company communicating payment assistance or payment extension options
Consumer complaint narrative: Are they still duplicating my complaint? Your response does not meet my needs, I request that you send me the contract since you finance the vehicle. I request the right of access to my documentation since you are not sending it to me
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Narrative Summary: The consumer is requesting a copy of their vehicle contract, citing the company's financing of the vehicle as grounds for access. Despite previous requests, the company has not provided the documentation, prompting the consumer to reiterate their request for the contract.

Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been making my payments to Flagship credit on time, I've even made extra payments to lower my balance. The last time that Flagship has reported my balance was on XX/XX/XXXX of {$11000.00} it is now XX/XX/XXXX and my correct balance is {$8700.00} I have called multiple times to get this corrected. I called in XX/XX/XXXX and was told by one of their employees that I need to file a dispute with the credit agencies. I did that and the dispute results came back with nothing changed. I called again, and they finally opened up a ticket on XX/XX/XXXX. I since then filed another dispute with the credit agencies and received the results on XX/XX/XXXX with nothing changed. I called flagship credit today XX/XX/XXXX and spoke to an agent and stressed to them how urgent this is and how it's been a year since they have reported the correct information. The agent I spoke to said that I need to wait 30 business days from the date they opened the ticket on XX/XX/XXXX which will make it XX/XX/XXXX when I find out if they updated my information to the correct amount. They reason why they said is because they had a system change back in XX/XX/XXXX.
Narrative Summary: The consumer's complaint is about Flagship Credit's failure to update their credit balance, which has been incorrect since XX/XX/XXXX, showing $11,000 instead of the correct $8,700. Despite multiple calls and disputes, the issue remains unresolved, with the company citing a system change and a 30-day wait period.

Sub-issue: Loan sold or transferred to another company
Consumer complaint narrative: Have been put on hold numerous times, transferred to different departments multiple times. The vehicle has been paid off for 2 months, am making payments to my credit union, and on their website they say that the title or lean release paperwork would be mailed within 10 business days, but has yet to be sent to me. Have called many times, same modus operandi, transfer, the next person says they're not the correct department. This also happened when I first called to purchase vehicle. There was a verbal agreement that was not fulfilled, and a repossession letter was sent out to us, so we reclaimed the vehicle and started the process to purchase it out right, which was completed. But subsequent paperwork was never sent to us so a license plate and title could be acquired.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer paid off their vehicle two months ago but has yet to receive the title or lien release paperwork, despite the lender's website stating it would be mailed within 10 business days. Repeated calls resulted in transfers to incorrect departments and unfulfilled promises.

Sub-issue: Billing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX I made a payment on my auto loan account for {$1300.00} dollars and according to my records that payment should of been my last final payment. I then called global lending and spoke with XXXX different agents to verify my account way in fact paid in full.. they did verify that it was paid but that it would take 10 days for the payment to process and show on my account paid in full. So I waited until XX/XX/XXXX I logged on to the online portal and it showed what appeared to me a negative balance in the amount of ( = {$5800.00} ) so because it said negative I figured something was wrong with the payment I made XX/XX/XXXX so I made another payment for {$1500.00} and a few days later logged on again and it still had a negative balance so again I was trying to get this paid off asap I made XXXX more payments XXXX in amount of {$2000.00} and XXXX for {$5000.00} to bring that negative to a positive and to cover any fees for it being late and in negative. After I made these payments I called and spoke with an agent 2 days after I made the {$5000.00} dollar payment to ask questions about my account. They verified it was showing paid in full since XX/XX/XXXX I explained to them I was on their online portal payment center and it wasn't showing paid off and I explained to them it actually showed I owed a negative balance of ( - {$5800.00} ) dollars when it never showed that before I made the payment on XX/XX/XXXX they told me that they couldn't see that on their end and that my account was paid so I asked them to send me a payoff letter and they did. Then I asked about the XXXX overpayments I made after the final payment on XX/XX/XXXX. The agent said let him contact the payment processing department and see what's going on. After being on hold for XXXX min he gets back on the phone and tells me he's transferring me. Then a lady gets on phone and I explained to her I made XXXX over payments after my account was paid in full thinking that my final payment didn't go through because when I go on their online portal it shows me that I'm in negative and it doesn't show me that it's payed off the lady said that it's just their system updating and that I can call my bank. I explained to them I already did but they said I had to wait for the payment to processed before disputing payments. And that my auto financial company will issue me a refund after payments been posted. And the agent from global lending said very rudly that she dont know why I made those payments that they can't issue a refund until 45 days and that my payments won't get to me until after the 45 days I asked the lady about my title when I should receive that she said 45 days after my account being closed. A few days later I received my title in mail and a check for {$9.00} which was the difference from the payment I made XX/XX/XXXX that paid off my account. So I called globel lending again and told them I received my title and a overheat for {$9.00} but what about the overpayments they said they couldn't see any overpayment if I had confirmation number so I gave it to them and they checked with payment department and they said that I had to wait 10 days until payment was fully processed and that after its processed on their end they would have 45 days to send out my over payment. Everything everyone from global lending is telling me is different. So I called back XX/XX/XXXX spoke with an agent and before speaking with him the last time I called I did tell them that it's still not showing online my account is paid off when I go on their portal it's still showing negative and it shows the last payments I made which were the over payments. So this agent tells me he can see the over payments that I made and he'll put in a request for refund. He then transfer my call to payment processing or some other department that is when I spoke again with this rude lady that explained to me that my account is closed and paid in full I told her about their online portal how it's showing negative when I log on as a guest. She said that it's hasn't been fully updated but that pretty soon I won't beable to even log on because account is closed and I won't beable to do anything on there once it updates. I said really I just want my refund it was a clear mistake made on my part for misunderstanding their portal not being updated and it showing negative she said I had to wait 10 days I explained to her it's been since the XXXX and that we'll over 10 days and online it shows the last payment on my account was now XX/XX/XXXX and for the amount of XXXX that was updated but wasn't showing at all in the history the over payments could it be cause they refunded them she said no she dont know why it's showing that.so at this point I'm really concerned and scared that it's not showing anything about my overpayments to account on-line where and why was it showing the day before and not that day but I had already screen shot all the payments and overpayments because of how they were acting with me and my concerns then I asked when im getting my money back. And how I was concerned because it wasn't showing online anymore like it did before. She told me very rudly she dont know why I made those payments basically it's my fault. Their system wasn't updated correctly. But there's a request for refund but that I have to wait to see if its approved so XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I call and get totally different information them telling me that I should receive my first overpayment today which was XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX and then XX/XX/XXXX the other XXXX payments will arrive I said ok well I didn't receive the check yesterday. So today XX/XX/XXXX I call again and this time being told yesterday 's agent lied to me that she dont know where he got that information from. That she'll call me back by next week I don't understand how they can all tell me something different where do they get their information from. 
I just want my money back. And I'm so worried that their not gon na pay me my money back. The agent today said they can't issue refunds over {$1000.00} and I asked previous agents if the amount of refund was able to be refunded and he said yes the amount wasn't a problem but I had to wait the 10 days days for it to process which it's been over 10 days but now today I'm being told they can't refund that amount and that she dont know when I'll get my over payments back.
Narrative Summary: A consumer made a final auto loan payment of $1300 but due to an online portal error showing a negative balance, they made additional payments totaling $7500. Global Lending verified the account was paid in full, but the consumer is having trouble getting a refund for the overpayments due to inconsistent information from agents.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem while selling or giving up the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was in a lease with Ally bank for a XXXXXXXX XXXX The trade in value exceeded my buy out amount, so elected to have the dealer purchase the vehicle on my behalf and pay me the XXXX 

After the process completed, I verified my online statement showed a XXXX balance ( see attached ). About two weeks later I received a bill for a lease return fee of {$420.00}. I called Ally on several occasions to discuss. They admitted that this fee is meant to cover fees associated with preparing the vehicle for sale after it is turned in. My argument was that I did not turn the vehicle in, I had my dealer purchase it. Therefore there is no cost associated with Ally for preparation and by the contract I did not return the vehicle. They claimed that because I ultimately did not take delivery that I still had to pay the fee. I was in the process of still disputing the charge when I received an offer in my portal to pay ~ {$250.00}. I assumed this may be a negotiation to meet in the middle and figured it would be better to just pay than deal with trying to keep fighting them. They also threatened that not paying would affect my credit. I confirmed again that no balance or other notes were shown on my account, and it showed paid in full. I recently viewed my free credit report and they reported that payment as being a settlement payment for less than what was owed.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer disputes a $420 lease return fee from Ally Bank, arguing the fee is unnecessary since the dealer purchased the vehicle on their behalf, not requiring Ally to prepare it for sale. Ally reported the subsequent $250 payment as a settlement for less than the owed amount.

Sub-issue: Loan opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative:
This Auto Loan from XXXX XXXX Kia auto loan for a XXXX Kia is inaccurate and incomplete because I had no knowledge or should be held liable for the balance displayed. XXXX XXXX had inadequate credit and was denied an auto loan and requested that I co-sign a loan for her to get a new car ( a XXXX XXXX XXXX ). There are inconsistencies with the loan attached that make the terms fraudulent in nature and me unaware to account. The first issue is that I was submitted and listed as the primary loan applicant when I was supposed to be the secondary ( co-applicant ) for the car. The terms of the loan on file breach the terms I agreed to with Kia Motors Finance. The vehicle was being sold for around XXXX USD and as I stated I was to be added to the loan as an additional party to be held responsible for the price of the vehicle leaving the lot that day and that alone. I already had my own car and was not in need to take out a loan for another primary car when I already had a XXXX XXXX XXXX financed through XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Not long into owning the car, while I was XXXX, XXXX XXXX totaled said XXXX XXXX XXXX and I as the policy holder ( her as the authorized driver ) for the car paid out a total of XXXX USD to Kia Motor Finance on XX/XX/XXXX. According to Kia Finance XXXX XXXX had a previous outstanding loan for a XXXX Kia that she owned prior to this XXXX and combined the money she owed to Kia finance under my name as the primary applicant without my consent. Not only are the terms of the loan fraudulent in nature, but I also paid the balance of the loss of vehicle in question. 
I am requesting that this item be removed from my credit report and social security number as I am not the one responsible for the principal being sought after. I never agreed or signed to be a part of this erroneous principal being reported to the credit bureaus as an auto loan charge off. The vehicle in question, that I co-signed for, was paid in full by my insurance company under my policy at the XXXX that vehicle is listed for and reported by Kia Motors as the sale price. I was not even physically present at the time of this loan as I was XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at the time the loan was requested. XXXX XXXX used my information without my permission I believe to have me assume a previous loan outside the terms of the loan agreed upon for the XXXX XXXX XXXX the collection account is against. Please assist, I paid the portion I was responsible ( the original loan agreed upon ) in good faith and am a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This derogatory account has made it difficult for me to achieve financial stability and has caused me additional hardship. XXXX XXXX should be solely responsible for this charge off amount and not me.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims a Kia auto loan is inaccurate and incomplete. They co-signed for a friend's loan, but were listed as the primary applicant, and the loan terms were allegedly altered to include a previous outstanding loan without their consent.

Sub-issue: Voluntary repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
I wish I had a paper trail to back this up. I do not. 

I took out a loan for a XXXX XXXX with Credit Acceptance. The car ended up being a lemon ( the day I got it the XXXX smoked in my driveway and it has been a night mare since. 

I had enough and asked them to get the car- voluntary repossession. I was clear from the start. 
The company asked many times if I wanted to take it back I say no. The repossession is even on my credit report as Voluntary repossession. 

There was a note in my online correspondence and I spoke with a representative- they said the auction will be held XX/XX/XXXX. Again I remember hearing this and seeing this in their correspondence. 

Credit acceptance also took out the money for the repossession fee autimaticallly ( I believe I can get the payment for that- if they havent deleted that ) The letter correspondence was deleted. No where to be found. I called yesterday to get a update on the auction- ( XXXXXXXX XXXX EST on XX/XX/XXXX ) This particular representative said let me get you the info to get the car out I said no I do not want it back, it was supposed to be auctioned off They said it has not been sold, even been to an auction and XX/XX/XXXX was never a thing. 

I am paying a insane amount of interest ( bad credit, people like me get screwed over ) and I just wanted a new balance.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: The consumer claims Credit Acceptance failed to auction off a repossessed vehicle as agreed upon, despite taking a repossession fee and listing the repossession as voluntary on their credit report. The company now denies the auction date and claims the vehicle remains unsold.

Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Other problem getting your report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX do not report my payments to XXXX XXXX, due to changes of owner 's banks accounts acquired since XXXX. 

A complained was submitted on XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to the bank and they resolved the issue indicating that I had requested directly not report my payments. I already contacted XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and they confirmed that any person can not request the agency doesn't sent payments reports to the XXXX XXXX. 

It was requested present evidence of any letter from my part. The bank didn't present any evidence. 

At this moment the loan is already fully paid, and the bank did not report to XXXX.
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims their bank failed to report loan payments to a credit agency, citing a change in the bank's ownership. The bank initially blamed the consumer, but no evidence supported this claim. The loan is now paid, but the bank still hasn't reported the payments.

Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative: I leased an auto with u s auto sales. And I was not behind on payment. In XX/XX/XXXX my car was repossessed by west lake management group now they are trying to get me to give them XXXX for a car that that repossessed but us auto sales apparently went out of business and did not inform customers. And shared no payment information. I wake up and car was gone out of my driveway now they are harassing me by email and mail coming to my home demanding payment but they have the car. I just want them to do what they choose with a XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX and we call it even. But they have added bad debit to my credit and I never even had any arrangements with them. And had no idea they are taking over in house financing that us auto sales gave their customers. It was totally unfair. And we as the customers should have been offered an apology for the harsh way they have treated us because we were unknowingly put in this position.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's leased car was repossessed by West Lake Management Group, despite being up-to-date on payments. The original lessor, US Auto Sales, went out of business without notice, and the consumer is now being harassed for payment by West Lake, who added bad debt to their credit.

Sub-issue: Problem with the interest rate
Consumer complaint narrative: Credit acceptance high interest rate
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Narrative Summary: A consumer complained about Credit Acceptance's high interest rate, stating that the company charged an excessively high rate, making it difficult to pay off the debt. The consumer felt misled and overcharged, seeking a more reasonable interest rate or assistance with debt repayment.

Sub-issue: Denied request to lower payments
Consumer complaint narrative: I am going through a hardship at this time. I specifically ask Bridgecrest for help in putting my delinquent payments to the back of the loan. I was trying to be proactive in requesting help and they still failed me. I was never late with car payments for over 10 years until recently having a separation from my spouse and working through as a single mother getting through some hurdles to get back on my feet with no help. I requested help fr Bridgecrest, but they did not want to provide a hardship plan for me that will help my financial situation at the moment. I attempted to be proactive however they dont work with you the way you really need it. I really needed the help more than ever. The purpose was to retain my vehicle, instead they didnt help me, they just repossess my car with a payment already processing prior to repossession and they still took the vehicle away anyway. I am now in a much worse predicament. Ive asked for help before and now I know certain they wont work with me with my car is repossessed as they will expect full past due payments. Something I cant afford in one lump sum which Ive again attempted to seek help for.
Narrative Summary: A single mother, experiencing financial hardship after a separation, requested a hardship plan from Bridgecrest to temporarily restructure her delinquent car loan payments. Despite her proactive efforts, Bridgecrest denied her request and repossessed her vehicle, even with a payment processing, exacerbating her financial situation.

Sub-issue: Account reinstatement or redemption after repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
I bought a car through enterprise car sales, and was approved for financing through westlake financial. 

The car has to have major repairs several times which unfortunately has led to being repossessed 2x. 

The first time I paid my money, got the release and went and got my vehicle. 

This time has been the complete run around. I called in to see how much I would have to pay. They said it would have to be approved by a manager before they could do since it is 2nd repo. Said it will take 48 hours.

Call back in 48 hours, they tell me the amount, I make a {$150.00} payment. 
I tell them I will not be able to pay until the XXXX as I am a veteran and receive XXXX. They say ok. I call on the XXXX and discuss them with them. They told me they put a hold on the car so it won't be sent to the repo lot. At this point it was 45 minutes from my house. 
I continue to keep in contact with them The XXXX I call to pay and the girl tells me that the request to pay and reinstate the loan has not been approved.i explain I've been telling them the date for 3 weeks. She's extremely rude. I hang up. I call and the guys says he can request to reinstate it. Puts me on hold says a manager approved it. Takes my payment. After making the payment he tells me it will be 48-72 hours before I get the release. I ask why this isn't told to me before I make the payment? I mention the fact that the auction is scheduled on the XXXX. He says nothing i.can do. I hang up and realize I have never received a receipt for the payment I had made. I made several calls requesting a copy of my receipt they repeatedly told me that they sent it and it's my problem if I don't have it and they can't another copy! That night, westlake calls MY EX BOYFRIEND who is not listed as a reference or any type of contact on my account at all. So someone needs to explain how someone got his information or how he was contacted. I have a copy of the voicemail. The next morning I get the release and I call the tow yard where they tell me my vehicle was. That tow yard informs me that on the XXXX the vehicle was towed to XXXX AL. 5 hours away. I call XXXX and they inform me they have the vehicle but my tag and personal belongings are at the previous tow yard. I call the previous tow yard to make an appointment to get personal items, they tell me they don't have a release. I call west lake they said you don't get a release for your personal property. I explain they won't release my stuff until I get it. They said not our problem. When I called the auction yard they told me how shady westlake is. When I arrived to get my vehicle they told me how shady westlake is. And when the guy handed me the keys to my car, he told me he has never seen a finance company as shady as Westlake. 

They pry on people with less than perfect credit and then offer you financing on a newer car that has major mechanical issues. The car is overpriced and the interest rate is so that you will always be upside down in the vehicle. My balance has went up on {$4000.00} while paying on this vehicle. Went up. Never down! 
There are many many many consumers all over the US who is being ripped off by the deceptive practices of Westlake financial services. 

They also illegally activate XXXX in my car at random times. I get a loud auto notice in my car that " limited services have been activated '' then suddenly my backup camera stops working when I receive this notice. 

I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX veteran, 100 % XXXX and a single mom. I do my best to pay my bills on time but when I'm having to constantly spend $ XXXX to repair a car, its hard to keep paying almost {$600.00} a month. 
In addition to the repo charge you already pay. They tack on another repo fee after you have picked up the vehicle. This place needs shut down. Not sold to another company, they need to stop ripping off hard working Americans.
Narrative Summary: A consumer's car, financed through Westlake Financial, was repossessed twice due to needed repairs. After paying to reinstate the loan, the consumer was given conflicting information, and their vehicle was towed to a different location. Westlake Financial allegedly engages in deceptive practices, including high interest rates and repossession fees.

Sub-issue: Problem with signing the paperwork
Consumer complaint narrative: Basically there are two different signatures on the contract that I signed and the contract that the loan company provided! Thats not my signature on the agreement that XXXX XXXX XXXX provided
Narrative Summary: A consumer claims the loan company provided a contract with a forged signature, which does not match the one on the contract they signed, indicating a potential case of identity theft or contract tampering.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Unable to receive car title or other problem after the loan is paid off
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a vehicle through United Auto Acceptance on I believe XX/XX/XXXX and my final payment on the vehicle was made on XX/XX/XXXX. Ever since then though I have tried to reach out to UAA to obtain my title on this vehicle but as of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I have yet to receive the title or even a response at all. So far Ive called every number I was provided with as well as every number listed on the UAA webpage. I know Ive called well over a dozen times over the last XXXX years and Ive yet to speak with anyone. Each call is always the same, its an automated message that instructs me to leave a voicemail, which I do, but I never receive a call back. There was only one time that an actual real person answered and I explained to her all the trouble I have had trying to get my title and I asked her if she could help me. The representative was polite but she said that a different department handled title inquiries and that she would need to transfer me and before I could object she transferred me over and it went straight to a voicemail inbox. So I left a voicemail but quickly hung up and called back hoping someone would answer again but they never did. Ive also tried emailing the company many times. The email addresses I had were from past emails I had received from UAA representatives throughout my loan for things such as payment verifications and insurance status on the vehicle. But I never received a response from any of the emails either. Eventually I reached out to the dealership I had purchased the vehicle from in the hopes that they could help me with this. But they just informed that only my lender United Auto Acceptance would be able to help me with obtaining my title and they provided the contact information they had on file for UAA, which of course was the same information I already had. Finally I contacted my local county tag office to ask about the title process and to see if there was anything else I should be doing. The tag office informed me that once a vehicle is paid off then the lender automatically issues a new title in the buyers name and it is sent by mail to the new owner usually within 30 days. And since I have had the same address since I first purchased the vehicle Im sure the title was not sent. But of course there is no way of knowing what steps have been taken on this unless Im able to speak to someone regarding this issue. My hopes in submitting this is that someone at United Auto Acceptance will see this and help me resolve this issue or at the very least respond and inform me of what I can do to resolve this.
Narrative Summary: The consumer paid off their vehicle loan through United Auto Acceptance but has been unable to obtain the title despite numerous calls and emails over several years. The lender has not responded, and the consumer is seeking assistance to resolve the issue.
